It will also prepare the Board of Directors’ meeting materials and support the development and execution of strategic and business plans. This position is committed to the success of the organization and its Executive Team requiring a flexible and get it done mentality. Pro-active planner, committed to ensuring the Executive Team has the information and preparedness required to be successful each day. This position requires a positive individual that is approachable, flexible and can manage multiple projects, as well as be a team player. This position needs to be reliable, professional, with a high level of urgency and confidentiality. Absolute alignment with the core values of Bob Barker Company in every interaction.

Compile and analyze data and reports. Analyze data and provide recommendations for actions that will improve results. Curious mind, exploring and making recommendations for improvements while using analytics to support recommendations.

Compile and manage communication with the Board of Directors, including quarterly board reports.
Assist with tracking, management and communication of critical projects on business and strategic planning
Represent and support Executive Team as an expert in Bob Barker Company data and how to compile and run reports.
Creating and preparing presentations.
Assist with and represent the company with community involvement initiatives.
Assist with Business Planning and Strategic Planning

Exceptional example of BBC Values

A proactive mindset to anticipate needs.
Speed - a sense of urgency and bias to action.
Decisiveness born out of insight, judgment and decision-making skills.
Technical prowess with mobile apps, Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, OneNote, Power BI.
Resourcefulness& persistence to accomplish seemingly impossible missions.
Diplomacy and confidentiality born out of emotional intelligence& integrity.

Excellent analytical and decision making skills

Solution generator to challenges and opportunities.

At Dominion Energy we love our jobs. That’s right. Love. Every day we go to work filled with passion to be excellent, to creatively problem solve and to innovate. Job Summary
This position provides entry level analytical expertise to the assigned business unit to include researching, identifying and utilizing existing data sources to conduct various statistical and mathematical analysis to identify and resolve missing/incomplete information, inconsistencies and anomalies in routine research/data analysis with increasing level of independence. Interprets and evaluates routine data analysis results to review with management leading to successful resolution. Participates in conducting surveys, studies, and special project analysis requiring knowledge of analytical practices, problem-solving, and critical thinking. Using spreadsheets and other computer software, generates graphs, charts, reports, and other materials used to convey analysis results to various audiences. Responsible for planning, implementing and maintaining small size and/or participates in medium to large size programs from design to inception. Participates in the collaboration with management and staff to determine analysis scope, data sources, and review results.

0-2 years analytical or related experience.

Must be able to work independently and as a team member.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills utilizing various communication styles is a must.
Must have basic computer knowledge and skills in Microsoft Office Products.
Must be able to build strong business relationships and collaborate effectively with a variety of employees.

Overview


Great software requires hard work by incredibly smart people. Esri Support Services has developed an identity by making sure that we're helpful whenever there is a need. As a Support Analyst, you will connect with people to understand their goals and support their quest to impact the world around them positively. Being proactive and resourceful, you will be able to innovate new and creative solutions to solve our most challenging issues internally and externally while working in a dynamic and high performing environment. Be part of a team that provides world-class technical support, ensuring our customers achieve success and make effective, smart geospatial decisions all around the globe.

Responsibilities:
Provide high-quality technical support and customer service to Esri end users through effective communication and efficient troubleshooting
Resolve technical issues related to enterprise GIS servers using Esri tools and other related technologies
Work well in high energy, fast-paced, enthusiastic, positive, and collaborative culture
Maintain comprehensive case documentation in customer relationship management (CRM) system
As a subject matter expert, author and edit knowledge articles available to internal and external users
Identify issues and log defects for software improvements
Work in other technical areas of software support as customer and business needs require
Requirements
Ability to provide outstanding customer service through troubleshooting and analytical skills
Identify, understand, and articulate solutions for customer issues including installation, configuration, and performance of ArcGIS Enterprise and related ArcGIS Enterprise technologies
Aptitude to gain an understanding of systems administration and troubleshooting of multiple operating systems
Ability to patiently communicate technical information clearly and concisely
Ability to learn new concepts quickly, retain large amounts of information, and adapt to a changing work environment
Proficient written and verbal communication abilities with a strong grasp of the English language including grammar, punctuation, and consistency
Strong prioritization skills including managing time and workload efficiently
Bachelor’s in GIS, geography, environmental science, computer science, management information systems, or other relevant fields, depending on position level (master’s preferred)
Recommended Qualifications:
Background in software support or technical customer service with the direct end-user contact
A clear understanding of ArcGIS Enterprise architecture, applications, and functionality, including caching, geoprocessing, and geocoding
Working knowledge of Esri products to include: ArcGIS Pro, Web AppBuilder for ArcGIS, Collector for ArcGIS, ArcGIS GeoEvent Server, ArcGIS Image Server, ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Business Analyst, and mobile device/applications usage related to GIS
The Company


Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.

SUMMARY: Business Analyst will leverage their technical and business analysis skills to design, develop, and implement advanced analytics solutions. Will work with operations and IT to understand objectives, integrate data through multiple sources, and develop automated reports/dashboards that support business needs.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES include the following; other duties may be assigned:
Collaborate with various stakeholders to integrate data from multiple source systems and streamline the delivery of information across the organization

Work with structured, semi-structured and unstructured data sets, perform ad-hoc queries using programming languages (SQL, Python, R, C/C++), to generate reports with actionable business insights

Constellis protects critical priorities safely and efficiently around the world. Investment Analyst - Charlotte

At Cortland, you map the story of your success. We don't adhere to the status quo, we love outside industry perspective, and we thrive on exploring possibilities and reimagining solutions. As an innovative leader in multifamily, our high performance continues to drive exponential growth – and we invite you to join us on our journey towards real estate excellence. With tools and guidance to sharpen your skills, you can forge your own career path, love what you do, and let it show.

Role Overview

As an Investment Analyst, you support the development and acquisition of multimillion dollar, multifamily apartment home communities through quantitative analysis, modeling, and reporting. Here are the roles you'll play:

The Model Builder
•Create abstract representations of real-world financial environments and behaviors
•Use financial projection models to monitor performance of investments relative to market conditions and specific business plans
•Help forecast sales and underwrite for the development, acquisition, and disposition of various real estate investments

The Reports Guru
•Methodically arrange remarkable amounts of detailed information into super-organized reports – it’s your superpower!
•Prepare investment briefs, committee materials, investor reports, and so much more
•Clearly communicate property and portfolio results, including valuations of real estate assets based on the latest debt and equity sources
•Double-check your work so team members are confident that your numbers are always spot on

The Number Cruncher
•Manipulate and organize numerical data so that astute inferences can be drawn from it
•Conduct market research that will allow you to analyze supply/demand and rent/sales comparables, including estimated replacement cost
•Review operating and capital budgets for the Operations group and execute the business plan for the Investments team

The Impact You Can Make
•The Director of Investments looks forward to seeing your well-developed models, insightful reports, and in-depth analyzations.
•Investors have a crystal-clear picture of how their assets are performing thanks to your continuous and clear communication.
•You’re so effective in collaborating with a wide variety of roles – not to mention a wide range of personalities – that there’s talk of nominating you for office mayor!

Your Building Blocks of Success
•Bachelor’s degree in finance, real estate, business, or related field
•Great interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
•Excellent quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills – able to create comprehensive financial models
•Extraordinary organizational and strategic planning skills

APEX bridges the gap between sensor and analyst in the evolving field of intelligence analysis. APEX tightly couples analysts, operators, and engineers to produce an unmatched level of problem-solving capacity for any situation.

Spanning various disciplines, including geospatial intelligence (GEOINT), signals intelligence (SIGINT), and human intelligence (HUMINT) analysis, APEX analysts, operators, and engineers work with operational mission partners to deliver novel technology, tactics, techniques, and procedures (T3P), relevant and modern training, and innovative technology solutions.

If you are a motivated individual willing to tackle challenging, and interesting problems, come be a part of our dynamic team!

APEX Expert Solutions is seeking a Geospatial Intelligence Analyst to join their team at the customer site in Fort Bragg, NC. This is a great opportunity for someone that wants to make a difference in the defense of the nation by applying their talents and experience in a fast-paced dynamic environment in support of US Special Operations Command. The opportunity is limited to those that have the operational and technical experience, and skills to effectively apply geospatial practices in support of real-world operations. You will be an integral part of a selective professional geospatial team that is directly part of the operational planning cycle to support mission success.

You will perform full spectrum geospatial analysis in support of complex geospatial, topographic, and imagery problem sets in support of global real-world operations. You will be required to communicate analytical assessments clearly and succinctly both written and orally, and present analysis products from creative analytical techniques in an operational environment. You will use their technical expertise and experience of Processing, Exploitation, and Dissemination (PED) of ground feature data and remotely sensed data such as Multi-Spectral Imagery (MSI), Light Detection and Ranging (LiDAR), and Electro-Optical Imagery to support the operational customer. You will be required to work in dynamic fast paced environments that requires both team interaction and individual efforts. You must be experienced in interfacing with both internal and external leadership.

Specifically, the Geospatial Intelligence Analyst will be responsible to fuse mutli-discipline intelligence sources to provide accurate and timely geospatial analysis in direct support of multiple geographically dispersed DoD organizations. You are the interface to the operational elements to ensure the operational commander's goals are accomplished through the synchronization of the geospatial enterprise. You will use your knowledge and intelligence acumen to provide critical recommendations to operational decision makers. You will work the full spectrum of the problem set utilizing advanced geospatial capabilities and techniques to complete the mission.You will be challenged daily to expand your knowledge and understanding of operational application of geospatial practices with multiple disciplines.

Required:

• Minimum of six years of analytical experience within DOD or relevant non-DOD employers, with four out of the previous six years of actual hands on experience
• Experience directly supporting military operations in both garrison and deployed environments
• Experience and ability to interact professionally with senior leaders of internal and external organizations
• Experience and working knowledge of geospatial and intelligence data management within a variety of OGC compliant applications and databases
• Experience and proficiency utilizing GIS applications and intelligence related automation to support analytical efforts and product development
• Experience with imagery analysis and production to include a broad understanding of collection processes and management
• Experience with geospatial processing and development of new methodologies to solve complex tactical intelligence problems.

Desired:
• Experience in the production of fused multi-discipline geospatial assessments
• Experience and knowledge of geospatial techniques in the Find Fix Finish Exploit Analyze (F3EA) cycle
• Working knowledge of computer scripting languages such as Python, Java Script, HTML, R, or SAS

Clearance Level:
Active TS SCI clearance

About the Role


The Sales Rebate/Commercial Analyst will support the Commercial Excellence team with various tasks including distributor rebate processing and reconciliation, data entry, generating reports, communicating with our distributor partners, and collaborate with internal teams including Revenue Management and the Sales organization.

We’re looking for people who embody our values, aren’t afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We’re always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we’d love to talk.

What You Will Do
Collaborate with Sales representatives and other individuals within Finance to identify and resolve customer disputes.
Assure timely processing of rebates from validation of sales data and rebate submission through reconciliation and final payment to distributor
Assure timely and accurate accruals of rebates at the end of each month
Ensure customer alignment with tracings records
Work with field sales and contract administration to fulfil and measure performance of contracts
Facilitate the contract process to ensure contract compliance
Assure all appropriate policies, processes and audit controls are in place and enforced with internal and external parties
Provide backup support to other functional areas in department, as needed
Operate in a manner consistent with Essity Beliefs and Behaviors
Perform other responsibilities as deemed necessary
Who You Are
Bachelor’s Degree required; preferably in Finance or Accounting
At least three years of analytical experience
Experience with off-invoice contract pricing, rebate chargeback procedures, program analysis, or related fields strongly preferred
Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with key internal and external stakeholders
Experience running reports in Vistex, SAP or large ERP system
Strong data analysis experience
Knowledge of SAP data systems
Familiarity with pricing contracts
Strong Excel and database skills (Access and/or SQL experience a plus)
Excellent interpersonal communication skills
Able to self-manage time and deadlines

Job Title: Product Support Analyst

Location: Greenville, SC

Job Summary:

The Product Support Analyst provides support to customers, answering questions on function and usage of product via the telephone and/or Internet; and conveys customer feedback to the product development staff.This position serves as primary support liaison between company and customer in a highly team oriented environment, and works under close supervision, typically reporting to the Manager, Support Operations.

Responsibilities:
Resolves clients' questions or problems on use of product over the telephone or Internet focusing on product functionality, operating environments and system configuration/setup.
Serves as primary support liaison between company and customer and documents incidents in required tracking systems.
Proactively keeps customer informed of how and when problems are resolved with focus on customer retention and satisfaction.
Involved in any additional follow up, testing and troubleshooting including remote desktop viewing through tools such as Webex.
Responsible for appropriate referral to other support analysts, provides feedback to Development with guidance from mentor (more senior analysts) and liaises with other departments such as services, sales, finance, etc to insure proper handling of customer issues.
Focuses on developing knowledge in specific product suite or operating environments.
Contributes information to the Support knowledge base.
Manages workload effectively following Global Support Procedures to ensure successful completion of tasks.
Provides accurate accounting of work and time allocation.
Off hours shift scheduling may be a requirement
Desirable skills:
Basic skills in database applications (SQL Server)
Ability to write basic SQL statements in Pl/SQL or T/SQL
Good command of English language to be able to provide oral and written communication that effectively articulates complex ideas
Prior experience in related industry or software/technical support
Possesses working knowledge of assigned product and basic knowledge of operating environments.
Advanced problem solving and analytic skills.
Good writing and editing skills
Excellent communications skills.
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills.
Solid PC skills with knowledge of various software applications used for testing, troubleshooting, call logging, etc.
Strong organizational skills required to insure most effective and timely delivery of service to clients.
Possess ability to both multi-task and manage priorities effectively.
Flexibility required to work outside defined role.
Education & Experience:
Bachelors degree in business or computer science.
Prior experience in related industry or software/technical support
Your Responsibilities / Activities:

Involved in any additional follow up, testing and troubleshooting including remote desktop viewing through tools such as WebEx
Able to handle high volume of issues and some challenging issues independently but is responsible for appropriate referral to other support analysts.

Responsible for being the liaison with Development and other depts., i.e. ICS, Finance, etc., to ensure proper handling of customer issues.

As a Data and Reporting Analyst, you will join our team on a journey to help eliminate barriers for patients, increase their access to medications, and help them receive lifesaving treatments while working in an environment that nurtures you.

Must be able to review and analyze data as well as present conclusions in a logical and clear manner. Must be able to effectively work as part of a team

Manage requirements gathering, specifications development, and development of ad-hoc and standardized, production-level reports using MicroStrategy, Salesforce.com, and any other applicable software platform
Build reports using templates, documents and free-form SQL
Act as Subject Matter Expert to provide recommendations and expertise for all TrialCard data and reporting capabilities for assigned programs and/or clients
Track and manage Program suite of reports, both standard, custom and outgoing data feeds
May track and manage inbound data feeds and manage restatement requests based on program needs
Own Level of Effort (LOE) for our reporting services, identifies when a report is chargeable, and recommends cost to Account Team
Identify additional data, reporting, and analytic needs of the assigned pharmaceutical clients and the scope work necessary to fulfill them.
Communicate with the Account and/or Program Leadership Team on required deliverables, provide timelines and recommendations based on best practices, and prioritize work by accounts as necessary
Routinely interact with the Analytics & Reporting Marketing Manager to identify new data and reporting needs and provide updates to Marketing for service capabilities. Varies by Program
Identify, define, and coordinate with other departments to connect our data and reporting to improve TrialCard’s suite of products and services
Collaborate with Data Architects and ETL Developers to design or enhance data warehouse for the purpose of high performance reports
Develop new and innovative data, reporting and analytic products and services, as necessary
Work with programming environments, SQL, SSRS, MS Excel, Salesforce.com, and MicroStrategy platforms
Provide leadership and training to other team members on fundamental data mining and report creation techniques and applications
Develop metrics and provide data for process measurement
Identifying indicators for future process improvement opportunities
Any other tasks or projects as assigned by immediate supervisor

Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering or similar discipline.
Must have 2+ years of client-facing experience
Solid technical writing skills; ability to clearly and completely articulate work to be done and describe tasks using proper terminology
Experience interpreting data and presenting meaningful, client-ready business insights
Demonstrated application of Analytical skills
Mid-level proficiency in SQL programming and common query optimization techniques for data extraction
Advanced Excel and/or Access skills. (e.g., VLOOKUP, SUMIF, Macros)
Intermediate MS PowerPoint skills
Proficiency in MS Outlook, MS Windows
Understanding of dimensional data modeling concepts, as well as data warehousing design highly desirable.
Experience designing and implementing enterprise business intelligence solutions using Microstrategy, Salesforce.com, Microsoft SSRS or similar highly desirable
Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry, direct marketing or finance highly desirable

Overview


Responsible for administration of various facets of HAECO’s network and server infrastructure.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES:
Provide ongoing development and maintenance of new and existing information systems.
Ensure maintenance contracts, and license agreements are tracked and followed.
Administration of corporate email, file, print, and applications server.
Provide technical solutions for the organization.
Troubleshoot problems in servers and local area network.
Evaluate impact and benefits of new technology into existing systems.
Integrate peripheral I/O devices into existing information systems.
Provide leadership and training to staff members.
Provide specialized expertise in OS infrastructure components (i.e. middleware, core OS and options, etc.) and systems infrastructure components (i.e. hardware, network, etc.)
Ensure systems are configured with adequate backup processes, procedures, and hardware to prevent any loses to critical business data.
Ensure all corporate computer systems have proper security
7 X 24 On-Call availability to handle and resolve all systems problems affecting production, emergencies and equipment specific maintenance that involves off-hours downtime.
Administration of all systems equipment service contracts and warranty tracking. Includes support activation, RMA’s, in-warranty equipment replacements, firmware upgrades, server service packs, patches, etc.
Coordinate system changes and downtimes with IT site managers/supervisors.
Coordinate network integration efforts and changes with the IT Operations Director and IT Programming Director.
Be able to cross-train in Linux,UNIX, PBX, and Helpdesk administration.
Qualifications


MINIMUM:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or combination of coursework and experience.
2 or more years experience administering Microsoft Active Directory Services and Microsoft Exchange.
1 or more years experience administering relational databases.
A deep understanding of the various technologies, services and specifications that comprise an enterprise network.
Ability to troubleshoot problems in a logical, methodical method of elimination of possibilities.
Good understanding of networking protocols at all layers of the OSI model. Hands-on, “under the hood” experience with TCP/IP, SMTP, IMAP, POP and HTTP.
1 or more years experience with at least one scripting language and the use of said language to automate common administrative tasks.
Strong Project planning, management and communications skills and ability to champion technology changes within the organization.
Proven experience with systems structure, architecture, operating limits.
Experience with tuning and performance issues.
Strong problem solving and professional presentation skills.
Positive, CAN-DO attitude with an openness to change
Must be self-motivated, have a good attention to detail and be able to complete assigned tasks on or before a due date.
Must participate in job-related training and development programs.
Some travel required.


PREFERRED:
Experience administering at least one distribution of Linux.
Experience with one of the following languages: C, C++, Python, Ruby, Java, Groovy
Experience with PostgreSQL
Experience with virtualization technologies, including VMWare or KVM
Familiarity with DevOps technologies and practices
Understanding of relational database systems.
General experience or training in software development.

General Summary:

The SAP Quality Management (QM) Functional Analyst is responsible for development and support activities in a manufacturing environment. This person assists in development of business processes/requirements, functional and technical specifications and design business solutions ensuring integration with the overall solution.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Assists in development of business processes/requirements, functional and technical specifications and design business solutions ensuring integration with the overall solution.
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to identify issues, create and implement solutions, and configure SAP modules (QM, PP, PM, DMS).
Designs, monitors and performs Quality Assurance testing to ensure accuracy, quality and stability while maximizing performance and scalability.
Supports existing system in daily manufacturing operations.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes.
Documents and maintains personal and business level goals and strives for their completion.
Ensures proper application of security within SAP ECC System, including defining security role adjustments to meet the changing business environment.
Assumes ownership of the system and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Education, Work Experience, Certification and/or Licensure:

Bachelors’ degree in Information Systems, Engineering or related program from a four year college or university,
10 years of SAP business and/or SAP IT experience with at least 5 years of experience implementing the SAP Quality Management (QM) module with integration in procurement, production planning, production execution, warehouse management, and sales and distribution.
QM module experience should include configuration and functional activities for source inspection, incoming inspection, production inspections, goods receipt inspections, distribution inspections, customer return inspections, and test equipment management. Ability to define and configure requirements for inspection lot interfacing with external systems is required. Additionally, configuration and use of quality notifications, service notifications, and maintenance notifications for various business processes is needed to cover activities from procurement up to and including after delivery support. Certificate of analysis processing is desirable. The analyst should have the ability to configure and implement inspection lot processing associated with maintenance orders.
The analyst should have a strong command of the QM master data and know how to effectively use data relationships to support business processes, especially objects such as sampling schemes, dynamic modification rules, condition records, effective use of control indicators for inspection characteristics, and inspection plans, but not limited to these.
The analyst should have a strong command of batch management, serialization, and the classification system.
Previous experience in Materials Management, Production Planning (PP), Plant Maintenance (PM) and Project Systems (PS) preferred.
Previous ABAP and Workflow experience is a plus.
Experience in SAP Global Trade Services (GTS) preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Working knowledge of SDLC methodology and tools.
Excellent presentation, documentation, and project management skills.
Ability to perform SAP QM system configuration.
Ability to work independently or within a team environment.
Ability to communicate effectively (written, verbal) with all levels throughout the organization.
Physical Requirements:

Incumbents may be routinely exposed to equipment operational noise heat-cold-dust, and/or aircraft equipment, parts, or fuel odors.
Incumbents may be required to stand, sit, squat, walk, bend, climb ladders, move, reach, or stretch for prolonged time periods with no restrictions, as required by job duties.
Work in a safe and professional manner while adhering to all regulatory requirements (FAA, OSHA, DOT, EPA, State, and Federal regulations, etc.).
Read, hear, speak, and see with no restrictions, as required by job duties.
Comprehend and adhere to management directions and/or safety instructions with no restrictions.
Effectively communicate in Business English language.
Pull, push, carry, lift, or move items up to 10 lbs. throughout the work shift without assistance, as required by job duties.
Pull, push, carry, lift or move materials/people/items/equipment weighing up to 50lbs or more during the work shift, with the use of Company provided “reach assistance technology” or “movement assist technology” (fork-lifts, pallet jacks, pulleys, dolly’s, robotics reach equipment, people movers etc.), as required by job duties

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Newport Group is a leading provider of retirement plans, insurance, and consulting services. We help companies offer their employees a more secure financial future by offering comprehensive plan solutions and consulting expertise to plan sponsors and the advisors who serve them.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The PMO (Project Management Office) Solutions Analyst will be working within the Enterprise PMO and will be responsible for the planning, organization, training and support of enterprise project systems& tools, processes and reporting as well as providing support for fundamental project and program management activities. The scope of the PMO Solutions Analyst responsibilities will include implementation and support of enterprise project platform(s) for use across all departments to manage inter/intra departmental projects and initiatives. The PMO Solutions Analyst will assist in facilitating department and executive-level project intake, approval, prioritization, scheduling, capacity planning/resource management, hours and budget tracking, in-flight project health or status reporting, and issues management.

PRIMARY DUTIES& RESPONSIBILITIES
Provides assistance in implementing and supporting all enterprise platforms such as MS Project Server, Team Foundation Server, and SharePoint.
Acts as a central point of contact for issues and concerns related to all platforms, tools and reports supported by the PMO.
Provides advice and guidance on PMO best practices.
Creates, maintains, and implements processes and procedures (Traditional and/or Agile Framework) related to project management.
Create, maintain and support the PMO documentation repository which includes templates as well as training and procedural documentation.
Prepares various internal and external reports by gathering, analyzing, and summarizing data from Project Server, SharePoint, and other sources. Creates ad-hoc reports and queries as requested.
Prepares presentation materials and reports for executive management status and update meetings.
Supports tracking and reporting of project hours for monthly capitalization and status reporting. Reviews and audits project data for completeness and accuracy.
Provides new tool evaluations and vendor management as needed.
Provides coordination and assistance with pre-release, release day, and post-release communication and implementation tasks.
Provides analytic and administrative support to the Enterprise PMO and performs special projects as needed.
REQUIRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE & ABILITIES
Must be highly organized with exceptional attention to detail
Must have exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
Must have excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
Ability to effectively collaborate with others to ensure that project tracking and status reports are complete and accurate.
Ability to develop and maintain positive and professional business relationships across all areas and levels within the organization.
Demonstrated ability to work independently on multiple tasks while producing timely, high quality deliverables.
Demonstrated ability to remain effective, flexible, and productive in a dynamic and changing environment.
Ability and desire to improve processes and assist in establishing and implementing best practices
Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite including Microsoft Project, Project Server, SharePoint, and Visio.
Strong understanding and experience with Agile Scrum and traditional project management frameworks.


EDUCATION& EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university
2 to 4 years of experience as a PMO Project Coordinator, Project Analyst, or Business Analyst
2 to 3 years’ experience working with Microsoft Project, Project Server, SharePoint or related project management tools/systems
Scrum Master and/or PMI certification is desired.
Exposure to Microsoft reporting technologies, such as OLAP, ODATA, and SSRS is desired.
Newport group offers for employment are conditional upon satisfactory completion of our employment screening process (including, but not limited to, a review of past employment and education records, background investigation, and/or credit check).

Job Description:

Job Description

The Analyst (Registered) is a fully paid or firm paid (exception only), salaried, exempt position on the Financial Advisor Team to further develop and service their client base. The Analyst is responsible for implementing and executing the Optimal Practice Model (OPM) in their specific functional role (i.e. Business Development, Business Management, Relationship Management or Investments). Specific accountabilities for the role may vary depending on the team’s practice. Performance is measured by the FA or FA team, along with OMT, through specific goals, metrics, and behavior related to the execution of the OPM function. The Analyst (Non Registered) is a non-exempt position for a non -licensed hire lacking a license and/or designation, until fully licensed and designation achieved. The Analyst (Registered) is a non-exempt position for licensed employees that are in progress of completing their designation in 12-months.

Analyst (Non-exempt)
This role is a temporary position to allow externally hired individuals to obtain their license within 6 months.
If they do not do so, they cannot continue in the role beyond 6 months. At the same time, they have twelve months from license completion to obtain a firm approved designation
Obtain license and pursue a firm approved designation
Develop and maintain client profiles including analysis of present position and creation of balance sheet and net worth statement. Ensure risk profiles, goals, objectives and asset allocations are appropriate.
Utilize Investor Personality Analysis tool
Deliver full range of Goals -Based Wealth Management strategies and tools and leverage specialists as appropriate.
Partner with internal specialists (e.g., W M bankers, Retirement specialists, PBIG, Trust and Insurance experts) and external advisors to deliver holistic goals-based financial solutions
Identify and establish target niche client segments and establish a strong reputation within those markets, as well as the designations to support the practice’s specialization
Prepare and present client reports/r reviews and measure progress to goals
Maintain and execute a well-developed and clear marketing plan
Analyst Registered (Non-exempt)
This role is a temporary position to allow externally hired individuals and internally transferred employees to obtain their designation within 12-months. Employees selecting designations with lengthier completion times will be granted the term identified by the designation organization to complete. Failure to complete the designation level per the recommended time frame will result in the employee removed from the role.
Pursue firm approved designation
Develop and maintain client profiles including analysis of present position and creation of balance sheet and net worth statement. Ensure risk profiles, goals, objectives and asset allocations are appropriate.
Utilize Investor Personality Analysis tool
Deliver full range of Goals -Based Wealth Management strategies and tools and leverage specialists as appropriate.
Partner with internal specialists (e.g., W M bankers, Retirement specialists, PBIG, Trust and Insurance experts) and external advisors to deliver holistic goals-based financial solutions
Identify and establish target niche client segments and establish a strong reputation within those markets, as well as the designations to support the practice’s specialization
Prepare and present client reports/r reviews and measure progress to goals
Maintain and execute a well-developed and clear marketing plan
Specific Accountabilities:
Develop and service client segments and the next generations and beneficiaries.
Develop, profile, and qualify new prospective clients through practice client acquisition strategies
Organize client events, referral alliances, and targeted seminars with a focus on strategic networking, sourcing and introductions
Implement Goals-Based Wealth Management process utilizing current tools and technologies for clients and prospects.
Gather additional assets from existing client base and deepen relationships by partnering with all GWIM partners to deliver full breadth of solutions.
Coordinate technological support through the development of portfolio analysis, proposals and direct mail campaigns utilizing Salesforce and other tools and resources.
Provide technical expertise in certain product areas (e.g. Corporate 401(k), Rule 144, Insurance, Wealth Management Workstation )
Provide marketing and organizational support. May support additional activities included in Good/Better/Best of OPM
Requirements:
If Series 7 and 66 licenses or Series 7, 63 and 65 licenses are not currently held, must be obtained within a specified timeframe, if being hired into a Registered job code.
All state licenses in support of FA or FA Team’s client base
All product licenses in support of FA or FA Team’s client base
Obtain and/or maintain at least one firm approved designation
Safe Act Registered
**This position is posted as a more senior position but is flexible to be filled as a lower level position if the posted qualifications are met by a strong lower level applicant

Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future

Join the ManTech team of highly skilled F-15 Maintainers, keeping a fleet of some of the most successful fighter jets ever designed in the air and on mission.

Whether you've retired, separated from the Air Force, or planning for your USAF separation, we want to discuss your future with ManTech. Our teams of F-15 maintainers conduct on-the-job training (OJT) and direct hands-on maintenance, working alongside passionate people to keep these world-class fighter jets in the sky.

Our program is a rarity in overseas contracting: We offer 40 hour work weeks in Saudi Arabia, a geographically centralized country that you are free to explore. With 30 days of vacation and 11 holidays, you will have the opportunity to visit the nations of Africa, Europe, and the rest of Asia easily and conveniently. Add in the potential tax advantages, free housing and transportation, and you have an exciting opportunity that provides memories to last a lifetime.

ManTech Mission Solutions & Services Group established itself as an industry leader in worldwide technology supporting the U.S. Army, U.S. Navy, and U.S. Air Force as well as other key Department of Defense customers. We would like to talk to YOU about joining us!

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

• Provide staff support to the Director of Supply in procedures, systems support and organizational issues pertaining to the RSAF Automated Supply system and Oracle based reporting systems such as GOLDesp.

• Identify major trends and potential problems and recommending action to control and improve logistics support

• Translate program requirements and specifications

• Provide guidance on the computation of forward requirements

• Assist in the management and control of depot level repair, maintenance, modification, overhaul and test of weapons

• Advise on budgetary management

• Advise on the implication of introducing data processing techniques at executive levels of supply

• Work all request from Supply Systems Officer or Director of Supply as needed

Qualifications:

• Must be a fully qualified USAF Supply Management / Operations Officer or civilian equivalent or a USAF 9-level Non-commissioned Officer with a Supply AFSC: 2S090 or equivalent

• 8-10 years of experience in MAJCOM, Department of the AF Command, or Base Munitions SO/NCOIC.

• USAF 9 Level or Senior 7 level with 10 years of experience Federal civilian equivalent

• 8-10 years experience managing munitions and ordinance from the command level for base, federal manufacturing, or Department of Air Force.

• 5 years of experience in procurement and allocation of munitions / ordinance.

• 5 years of experience in providing process improvement for munitions storage, shipping, receiving, destruction, and inspection.

Job Title: Campus Recruiting - Investment Banking 2021 Summer Analyst
Job Description:
Campus Recruiting - Investment Banking 2021 Summer Analyst - Charlotte
Location


NC - Charlotte

Business Area


Investment Banking

Employment Type


Temporary

Apply Now

Piper Sandler Investment Banking Summer Analyst Opportunity

This posting is specifically for summer internships in our Charlotte, NC office.

About Piper Sandler

Piper Sandler is a leading, international middle-market investment bank and institutional securities firm, serving the needs of middle market corporations, private equity groups, public entities and institutional investors. Headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the firm has additional investment banking offices in New York, San Francisco, Charlotte, Houston, Boston, and Chicago. Piper Sandler investment banking specializes in a variety of financial transactions and focuses on the needs of growth companies in the consumer, financial institutions, healthcare, industrial growth, technology, media, telecommunications, and business services sectors. Piper Sandler is one of the premier investment banks focused solely on the middle market.

The Summer Analyst Program

Piper Sandler is currently seeking undergraduate students for our 2021 Investment Banking Summer Analyst Internship Program. Summer Analysts generally work 10 weeks within an industry or product group in Investment Banking and have the opportunity to learn financial modeling and basic analysis of companies and industries, as well as gain an understanding of the dynamics of the capital markets.

The Internship Program includes one week of formal training and a weekly speaker series from executives across the firm. Interns will also attend networking events during the Program. Our IB internships are a direct pipeline to our full-time IB Analyst positions for the following year. Opportunities in our Charlotte office may be anticipated in the following industry groups: Consumer, Diversified Industrials & Services, and Healthcare.

The Internship Program is open to students who plan to graduate in December 2021 or May/June 2022. As a part of our application process, please use the following link to complete your Suited profile: https://app.wellsuited.com/join/QQFHqagHTbxtcSibC6at

Qualifications:
Outstanding academic achievement – minimum GPA of 3.3 or higher
Must plan to graduate in December 2021 or Spring 2022
Most candidates major in Finance, Accounting, Business, or Economics or have self-studied
Strong MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong leadership and teamwork skills
Superior work ethic
What We Look For

Piper Sandler seeks dedicated and motivated individuals possessing demonstrated academic achievement (minimally, a GPA above 3.3) as well as leadership, organizational and teamwork skills. The ability to create innovative solutions, articulate complex ideas and adapt to a rapidly changing environment is essential. Analysts must be able to work well under pressure and manage multiple projects. The most successful analysts have taken courses in finance and accounting and are very familiar with financial modeling.

Piper Sandler is an equal opportunity employer. For California residents, please see our privacy policy for more information: http://www.pipersandler.com/2col.aspx?id=197

Aeroflow Healthcares summer internship program is designed to provide students a unique opportunity to work on meaningful and impactful projects that contribute to overall business objectives while simultaneously contributing to the growth of the student intern and building a foundation for their long-term career success. This program is primarily targeted at undergraduate students entering into either their junior or senior year and serves as a preview for what full-time employment looks like at Aeroflow Healthcare. As an intern, students will have the opportunity to participate in a formalized leadership training program which has been designed to develop leadership and management skills as well as increasing the students knowledge of the healthcare industry and Aeroflow Healthcare.

WHY CHOOSE AEROFLOW HEALTHCARE?

Aeroflow believes in career building. Thats why we promote from within and reward individuals who have invested their time and talent in us. Whether you are looking for a place from which to launch your career - or a stable, ethical company in which to advance, you wont find an organization better equipped to help you meet your professional goals than Aeroflow Healthcare.

YOUR JOB AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

As a Data Analyst Intern, you would be joining our Data Analytics team in analyzing business data to enable our leaders to make more informed decisions. The Data Analytics Intern will assist with interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. Additionally, this position will assist with acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems, work with management to prioritize business and information needs, and locate and define new process improvement opportunities. Some example responsibilities of a Data Analyst Intern include:

Key Responsibilities:
Use existing tools to pull, analyze, and report data analysis
Query database based on requests from all areas of the business
Deliver data to end users in most appropriate format (excel, charts, graphs, etc)
Maintain and update existing reports based on routine schedules
Define user requirements and develop new reports

SQL
Excel
Access

Job Details


We are seeking an Analyst for the syndicated insights specialty area within Kantar’s consulting division. This team manages relationships with clients of our consumer insights service, anchored by the annual U.S. MONITOR, Canada MONITOR, and Global MONITOR lifestyle studies. Our clients span the Fortune 500 with broad industry application.

The Analyst's primary responsibility is to deliver account management and project support for MONITOR clients, combining both “right” and “left” brain skills. They will also be responsible for project work for their assigned accounts in the areas of consumer knowledge, strategic insight, strategic futures, innovation, and trends activation.

Responsibilities
Serve as a team member contact for multiple clients that subscribe to our consumer insights services
Analyze quantitative consumer research and external sources to identify, interpret and translate macro trends and consumer needs into actionable insights and marketing implications for clients in a variety of industries
Support multiple, simultaneous projects and support more senior level consultants in the delivery of projects, taking ownership developing high-quality client deliverables
Distill relevant insights into recommendations for our clients (e.g., marketing communications, brand strategy/positioning, consumer targeting, corporate strategy, innovation and new product/service development, category or portfolio strategy, etc.)
Assist in presenting future-facing insights, implications and recommendations to our clients
Occasional travel required
Qualifications
BS/BA degree, preferably in the social sciences or related disciplines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a creative approach to story-telling and visual presentation of information
Ability to synthesize and translate data (soft and hard) from primary research and other sources into a cohesive and compelling storyline
Ability to think strategically and work in teams to support the development of insights, implications and recommendations for our clients
Passion around consumers, consumer trends, and macro trends
Excellent critical thinking skills, problem solving skills, organization and time management skills and superior attention to detail
Endless curiosity about human behavior and an ability to understand the consumer
Strong work ethic with a client-first approach to service and relationship building and a strong desire to exceed expectations
Ability to take initiative and to work both independently and within a team
Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
Location

New York, World Trade CenterUnited States of America

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

A snapshot of what you would do:

We are seeking an Audit Support Analyst to assist in the Recovery audit process working with our clients' suppliers to ensure we are completing an efficient and successful audit for our clients. Ideal candidate will have a background in Accounts Payable with highly developed analytical skills, including the ability to research issues, understand root causes, and implement solutions. You will initiate and follow through to resolution on overpayment claims, as identified through a statements audit and/or Accounts Payable audit enabled by our FirstStrike software. You will utilize remote client system access for research and resolution and partner with other members of the audit team to keep the client apprised of the audit progress. This is a highly responsible position, as the ability of the Audit Support Analyst to consistently complete claims directly impacts revenue and the overall success of the company.The required location is working onsite in Greensboro, NC corporate headquarters.

Required Experience
Associate's degree in accounting or business administration, or equivalent; Bachelor's degree preferred. Relevant work experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
2+ years of customer service, sales, credit, accounting or business related experience, 3+ years of experience preferred
Required Skills
Fundamental knowledge of accounting principles and familiarity with Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable functions
Adept at working in fast-paced work environments and adapting to change
Exceptional ability to multitask, including seamlessly transitioning between different accounting systems and accounts
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills for communicating with internal staff, clients, and their suppliers
Well-developed time-management skills, with the ability to plan one's tasks and self-manage progress toward task completion
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
Ability to learn/gain proficiency in proprietary software tools.
Fluency or strong background in one or more languages is ideal as we are a global company. Specific language needs: Chinese, Portuguese, German, French, and Spanish
About Us:

APEX Analytix is the leading provider of trusted supplier data; supplier portal software; controls, audit and analytics software; and AP recovery audit services. We protect over $5 trillion in spend and prevent or recover over $3 billion in overpayments annually, and our client portals actively support over 3 million suppliers. Our software and audit services are built on our SmartVM® database of over 20 million supplier records with contacts, scored for accuracy and age, based on integration with over 650 external data sources and over 10 million communications with suppliers each year. APEX Archimedes™, an advanced cognitive technology and innovation system, supported by IBM Watson®, is integrated into APEX Analytix software and services to harness the power of the future through smarter recoveries, controls, analytics, working capital and supplier data. We serve over 250 Fortune 500/Forbes Global 2000 clients around the world and are fluent in languages covering 98 percent of global trade.

Our Culture:

At APEX Analytix, our culture drives everything! We live our culture of performance, respect, candor and fun—in that order. Performance is measured by delivering value to our clients, generating goodwill, trust and partnership. Sincere respect for each other, our diverse backgrounds and our well-being are our cornerstones. We value open and honest relationships with each other, our clients and our communities. And, life is too short to not have fun! We look for team players who possess the qualities of being humble, hungry and smart. We recruit candidates who will strive for accountability in performance and career growth, serving our clients in long-term respectful relationships, and working in a diverse and caring environment.

The Perks:

We owe our growing success to our team of bright, passionate, and innovative individuals. We truly value our associates and strive to provide the highest quality benefits program, offering competitive compensation packages with tailored bonus plans and generous benefits. Our benefits include health and insurance plans (medical, dental, optical, life insurance, disability insurance, FSA, HSA employee assistance program, supplemental insurance options and pre-paid legal), a generous paid time off plan, 401k plan, flexible work schedules, wellness programs (company fitness and weight loss challenges, financial wellness software tool, and gym membership stipend), associate and customer referral bonus programs, and paid community hours. And here at APEX Analytix, you won’t get lost in the shuffle. Our focus on internal training, growth and development results in annually filling over a quarter of our open positions with internal promotions! With resources such as a strong Mentor Program, Internal Training Portal, plus Education, Tuition, and Certification Assistance, we provide tools for our associates to grow and develop. If you are looking for a place to shine, come join the team!

At Dominion Energy we love our jobs. That’s right. Love. Every day we go to work filled with passion to be excellent, to creatively problem solve and to innovate. These are exciting days for energy companies, and Dominion Energy aims to shape the future of energy in America. We are looking at all of our work with fresh eyes, retooling everything we do, in every part of the company, to operate more sustainably and to deliver energy more reliably than ever. We are looking for interesting, independent thinkers and doers who can help shape the culture of a forward-looking company that’s proud of its rich legacy. Are you a change agent? Do you think differently? Do you want to fall in love with your job? If you answered “yes,” then read on!

At this time, Dominion Energy cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position.

This position does not offer relocation assistance.
Job Summary
This position provides entry level analytical expertise to the assigned business unit to include researching, identifying and utilizing existing data sources to conduct various statistical and mathematical analysis to identify and resolve missing/incomplete information, inconsistencies and anomalies in routine research/data analysis with increasing level of independence. Interprets and evaluates routine data analysis results to review with management leading to successful resolution. Participates in conducting surveys, studies, and special project analysis requiring knowledge of analytical practices, problem-solving, and critical thinking. Using spreadsheets and other computer software, generates graphs, charts, reports, and other materials used to convey analysis results to various audiences. Responsible for planning, implementing and maintaining small size and/or participates in medium to large size programs from design to inception. Participates in the collaboration with management and staff to determine analysis scope, data sources, and review results.
Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities & Experience
0-2 years analytical or related experience.
Must have basic analytical, problem-solving, critical thinking, troubleshooting and mathematical skills.
Ability to effectively manage small projects, be well organized and handle assigned priorities and projects is critical.
Must be able to work independently and as a team member.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills utilizing various communication styles is a must.
Must have basic computer knowledge and skills in Microsoft Office Products.
Must be able to build strong business relationships and collaborate effectively with a variety of employees.
Education Requirements
Bachelor's Degree from a recognized college or university in related field
Working Conditions

Job Title: Medical Unmet Needs NLP/Text Analytics Analyst (Oncology)
Job Description:
Site Name: USA - North Carolina - Research Triangle Park, USA - Pennsylvania - Philadelphia
Posted Date: Nov 25 2019
Background:


In GSK Medical Affairs, we focus on communicating the science behind our diseases and medicines to help patients, clinicians and healthcare systems make better informed decisions that beneficially impact patients lives. Patients are at the center of everything that we do, and our objective is to ensure our patients are optimally treated in complex and specialty conditions. To be competitive and deliver the most value, we need to move faster and with more agility and ground all our decisions in data and insights.

The Medical Analytics team you would be joining is a growing team within Medical Affairs. Leaders of the team each have, on average, 15 years of insights/analytics experience from different areas of Pharma and/or across other industries and are bringing this expertise to the table to help build a new foundational capability for GSK Medical Affairs. Join us on the journey!

Job Purpose:


The purpose of the Data Scientist - Medical Voice of Customer/Text Analytics role is to analyse customer feedback and perspectives from a variety of sources, translate the unstructured information into actionable insights in combination with other structured data, and identify opportunities for Oncology that will drive data driven decision making within the US business and for US Medical Affairs.

This role will be responsible for building and enhancing capabilities in text analytics and unstructured data analysis for Oncology to maximize potential insights coming from critical customer feedback such as social media perspectives, ad-boards, critical Oncology congresses, online communities, voice of customer feedback through engagement and research, plus more and for influencing appropriate integration with other analyses and for use with strategic planning and at other decision forums.

Key Responsibilities:
Discover customer and patient findings/potential insights using advanced analytics techniques such as natural language processing, text analytics, machine learning, and analytic modeling aligned with and guided by the Medical Affairs business priorities and strategies for Oncology
Analyse unstructured data from multiple feedback sources including but not limited to Medical voice of customer feedback from customer listening, feedback via surveys and research, forums, online communities, social media/publicly available information, call center voice and email feedback, and other available sources of customer feedback data and information
Translate unstructured data, in combination with other structured data sources, into actionable insights; Conduct text, sentiment, and root cause analyses to answer critical Medical business questions and produce data-driven stories that reveal key insights into customer and patient experience, needs, and understanding to determine appropriate Medical opportunities.
Develop broad methodological and approach expertise with unstructured data analytics; Stay on top of the latest external methods and approaches, current and emerging industry trends, and advanced methods/best practices;
Earn the trust of stakeholder partners through active engagement, demonstrated learning, and business acumen development. Continually seek out and build business knowledge and depth for appropriate business context with analytic recommendations;
Deliver timely/close to real time strategic, relevant and actionable insights, especially around key events/congresses where our science is shared for leading indicators and actions to maximize opportunities. Lead Voice of the Customer (VoC) analyses leveraging a wide range of analytical and data visualization tools and resources available to uncover and communicate opportunities; Identify early warning signals and opportunities;
Collect, document, synthesize and organize complex information, making it relevant, understandable and actionable for internal stakeholders; Develop compelling summaries that visualize the data through narrative dashboards to clearly tell a succinct story in easy to understand ways; Focus on the key findings and insights in alignment with stakeholders' goals/business needs with proper validation techniques to build confidence in the results; Craft and tell compelling stories around commonalities and themes found in the VOC data
Develop in-depth knowledge of Oncology strategies, critical needs, and determine appropriate advanced analytic solutions for more efficient customer focus; Demonstrate analytic curiosity and a desire to understand Medical Affairs challenges to contribute to Matrix Team reviews and strategic discussions through insights discovered.
Proactively identify opportunities and develop advanced analytics methods aligned with and guided by business unit priorities; Partner with colleagues in Medical Analytics, Global Medical Excellence, and Commercial Insights to ensure appropriate analytics insights are integrated into deliverables for a holistic and comprehensive view; Demonstrate effective communication and drive efficiencies through collaboration and teamwork
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:


We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
BA/BS in quantitative sciences field or MS in a related field with up to 2 years experience applying advanced analytics methods to solve critical business challenges/problems and developing recommendations
Proficiency in Python and/or R, with knowledge of basic libraries for data manipulation, machine learning, natural language processing, and text mining
Extensive experience with SQL and/or SAS
Experience applying advanced statistical and database skills to solve business problems
Understanding of machine learning, supervised and unsupervised modeling techniques, and probabilistic models of complex systems with "big data" sources
Preferred Qualifications:


If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
MA/MS/PhD in quantitative sciences field
2+ years of unstructured data analysis/text analytics/natural language processing and/or machine learning application for critical business decisions
2+ years of experience in a professional setting with SQL and/or SAS
2-5 years (or up to 2 years with advanced degree) professional experience
Healthcare or life science experience
Consulting experience preferred
Strong business acumen; Understanding of the healthcare industry and the evolving and rapidly changing healthcare environment; Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry.
Demonstrated knowledge of data manipulation methods and quality check approaches to develop a deep understanding of the data assets available for usage in Medical Affairs with advanced analytics methods and applications
Adept at learning and applying new data, advanced analytics methods and technologies;
Possess analytic curiosity to seek out and develop potential solutions and drive continuous improvement; motivated by challenging, complex problems
Ability to evaluate and recommend advanced analytics/machine learning methods appropriate for a business problem
Strong communication and presentation skills (both oral and written) plus project management skills
Effectively builds relationships and collaborative partnerships across teams to develop a solution
Effective at presenting complex, technical information, concepts, and analysis in a compelling and persuasive manner to non-technical audiences
Ability to work effectively across a matrix environment and influence without formal authority
The ability to focus and thrive in times of change
Why GSK?


Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.

These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:
Operating at pace and agile decision-making using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk.
Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning.
Sustaining energy and well-being.
Building strong relationships and collaboration, honest and open conversations.
Budgeting and cost-consciousness.

About Brooks Bell:

Brooks Bell is the best independent optimization and testing agency in the industry. Our team of data-driven conversion experts focuses on a full-service optimization and testing process, including marketing strategy, design and copy, A/B testing, multivariate testing, analytics, and test management, monitoring, and reporting. We’ll determine what and whom to test, create effective marketing experiments, and then visually communicate them. Brooks Bell’s services focus on site optimization, content optimization, and landing page optimization. http://www.brooksbell.com.
Voted a ‘Best Places to Work’ from the Triangle Business Journal 4 years and counting
Work with talented, energized, and happy people.
Job Description:

We are looking for an Optimization Analyst with experience in digital/web analytics to perform statistical analysis on site-wide or test data.

As an Optimization Analyst, you will be performing statistical analysis on site-wide or test data in the morning, spend the afternoon advising our enterprise-level clients via conference calls on issues pertaining to their optimization and digital analytics program and end the day leading internal test strategy meetings as the voice of the data. The best person for the role is someone who has a strong blend of both web analytics skills and people skills and who lives by the Brooks Bell core values.

Responsibilities:
Perform detailed data analysis and set strategic test direction
Execute day-to-day test result reporting and test design/setup
Use analytical skills to extract business insight from the data and make recommendations
Translate data into a concise, logical, and digestible format for internal and client-facing interactions
Provide advisement services, including training, as a subject matter expert on topics surrounding testing, optimization, personalization, and digital analytics
Become proficient in optimization and analytics tools; including Adobe Target, Maxymiser, Optimizely, MVT Testing, Qubit, Dynamic Yield, Monetate, SiteSpect, Tag Management Systems, and Personalization tools.
Effectively manage multiple tests and analysis spanning several clients
Learn new analytics and data science techniques on the job
Add efficiency and value to the Brooks Bell testing process
Identify opportunities for providing additional value to clients
Maintain close working relationships with members of internal and external groups
Occasionally travel (within the United States) to visit clients on-site on an ad-hoc basis
To join our forces, you will need:
2+ years work experience in digital analytics required
Effective communication skills
Comfort leading client-facing engagements such as test reporting and program advisement
Strong Microsoft Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
The ability to think critically and analyze information for meaningful insights
Strong attention to detail and confidence in one’s analysis

Digital Marketing Analyst (Amazon Marketplaces)
Job Description


Think about the last time you searched Google, Amazon, Yahoo or Bing to purchase a product. Have you ever thought about who creates the Pay Per Click (PPC) advertisements you are seeing in the search results? Do you wonder how many people actually click on those ads? Are they profitable? Were those specific ads targeted to you based on your demographics or shopping habits?

As a Digital Marketing Analyst in our Amazon Marketplaces service, your role will center on work that is fast-paced and autonomous, set within a supportive team structure. The goals are to develop and maintain effective paid search campaigns for your clients, and based on the performance data, continually optimize through ad copy testing, keyword analysis and bidding strategy. Quantitative goals and clearly defined objectives are determined for each campaign within each client account; you will be able to measure the impact of your work upon the growth of your clients’ businesses. If you have an analytical mindset, ability to learn and drive to succeed, we will train you to become a savvy, digital marketing expert!

We invest in a structured, individually-paced training regimen through which you will learn to create and manage paid search advertising campaigns for clients. You will become well-versed in the Amazon advertising platform, as well as our internal suite of proprietary tools. We invest in you so you can deliver your best to our clients, who continue to trust the growth of their business to us. Win-win-win.

If you have strong analytical abilities, a passion for delivering exceptional client service, and a history of high performance and leadership, you could be our next ROI’er!

Essential Responsibilities
Analyze and assess the performance of online advertising campaigns and translate quantitative and qualitative data into recommendations and plans for revising the campaign strategy.
Assist clients with meeting ROI expectations by performing ad copy testing and keyword analysis.
Implement successful bidding strategies and effective keyword management.
Continually monitor, revise, and optimize ad text as necessary.
Communicate regularly with clients on status, timeline, budget deliverables performance reporting and competitive intelligence analysis.
Create, categorize and refine keyword lists to create a comprehensive campaign that drives qualified visitors to client websites.
Use statistical analysis to draw conclusions about marketing campaigns and make recommendations accordingly.
Performing other duties as assigned.
Essential Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, Supply Chain or a related field from an accredited university
Proficient in Excel

**Data Analyst**



**Description**



At Pearson, we're committed to a world that's always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it's one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology - and each other to surpass these boundaries - we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world's innovations, personal and global, large and small.



Pearson is optimizing its technology landscape, through consolidation of applications and their supporting infrastructure on to a small set of core platforms. The inorganic growth of the company over previous decades, and lack of previous consolidation efforts, has created a 'regional' model of supporting technologies. Since 2014, Pearson has embarked on a core platform strategy to promote a consistent set of tools and business processes to support its mission of being the world's leading learning provider.



The Technology Optimization Data Analyst will join the technology team to contribute to Pearson's operational objectives of improving data quality in the configuration management database (CMDB). You will be responsible for the maintenance of accurate technology information at Pearson, onboarding application and configuration information into the CMDB solution, harmonization of business rules and processes, remediation of data issues, and the establishment of policies and processes in conjunction with the business stewards at Pearson. The information contained in the CMDB is vital to the decision making processes of decommissioning legacy applications, reducing data center spend, as well as providing security teams with information to target end of life and vulnerable systems.



As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with the application owners and IT teams to ensure ongoing accuracy of CMDB data, as well as providing performance metrics, detective controls and leading continuous improvement at Pearson.



**Qualifications**



Experience





* Four year degree in a Computer Science, Management Information Systems or similar discipline





* Proven ability to independently research and provide solutions to complex problems





* Experience working effectively in cross functional teams





* Experience in operating a data incident management process as a service





* Experience with writing SQL



Professional Skills





* Written and communication skills to interact with matrix teams and influence outcomes





* Willingness to proactive take responsibility and action to resolve cross functional issues across organizational boundaries





* Proactive, results oriented





* Capability to prioritize in complex environment





* Ability to organize work into actionable plans, projects and committed time frames.





* Strong negotiation skills





* Understanding of business outcomes and align efforts to highest value for Pearson



Desirable Skills





* Experience in the education Industry





* Experience with MS Office tools, Excel pivot charts, reporting across multiple data sources





* Experience with ServiceNow





* Experience in organizing and leading projects

McKesson Corp is a Fortune 7 company and is one of the largest providers of medicines, pharmaceutical supplies and health information technology (IT) products and services in the United States with revenues of $208.4 billion in 2018.
