United by our ICARE values, McKesson's 78,000 employees work together every day to make better care possible for patients around the globe.

Current Need:

We are seeking an Financial Analyst for Specialty Pharmacy.

Position Description

This role supports the financial planning, analysis and reporting tasks within the McKesson Life Sciences Specialty Pharmacy Group. The role will model, analyze and communicate key metrics and drivers of the business with clear ability to create insightful analysis, particularly as it relates to the business unit, revenue, profit and resource requirement measures. This role is expected to handle pharmacy leadership’s financial analysis requirements in a fast paced and demanding environment.

Key Responsibilities
Financial Analysis, Modeling and Reporting
This position is expected to provide timely, relevant and accurate analytics to management to facilitate decision-making objectives including daily tracking reports, operational metrics and cost center variance analysis.

Understand and communicate variance analysis against historical, budget, forecasts and strategic plans.
Maintain forecasting, budgeting, and actual performance models.

Communicate analytical results verbally, in writing and in presentation form to all levels of management.

Participate in process improvement initiatives or projects related to business unit objectives.

3+ years accounting, finance, finance analytics or similar experience
Critical Skills
Complex problem solving, analytical and financial modeling skills - ability to identify the root cause of issues, propose possible solutions or improvements and influence ultimate decision.
Ability to work with and communicate with all organization levels, including senior management; ability to present and explain financial information to non-finance professionals.
Project Management experience is required with the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize appropriately to meet competing deadlines.
Advanced Excel, Proficient PowerPoint.
Additional Skills
Prior experience in management reporting
Thorough knowledge of finance policies, practices and systems.
Excellent knowledge of financial statements.
Large ERP system experience desired (SAP, Hyperion, TM1, Cognos, Essbase, etc)

Bachelor's Degree in accounting, finance, or related field. MBA a plus.

Job Description

The Principal Analyst, Statistical Programming leads and oversees statistical programming activities internally as well as externally through vendors in the application of data standards, production of analysis datasets (ADaM), analysis dataset specifications, tables, listings, figures, electronic submission components (define.xml and XPTs), and ad hoc analyses. He/she partners with Biostatistics to deliver high quality, submission ready statistical outputs.

Job Description :

This person is also responsible for providing input on overall study timeline, monitoring and meeting agreed upon study milestones, escalating issues as needed to their data management counterpart and estimating resources needs. He/she leads a study team of statistical programmers to accomplish tasks and communicate issues, as necessary, to senior management. This includes communication and quality oversight of the vendor. He/she is comfortable representing the Statistical Programming perspective to the study team and is often the sole functional representative.

The Principal Analyst, Statistical Programming helps to implement the Data Strategy, provides input to the Data strategy Lead on the strategic direction of the program, partners with the Data standards & governance Lead to ensure appropriate statistical programming standards implementation and serves as reference for the study to the Data sharing representatives. He/she develops and implements standard programming practices while also ensuring that they are employed across a study.

Principal Accountabilities:

At Cortland, you map the story of your success. We don't adhere to the status quo, we love outside industry perspective, and we thrive on exploring possibilities and reimagining solutions. Role Overview

As an Investment Analyst, you support the development and acquisition of multimillion dollar, multifamily apartment home communities through quantitative analysis, modeling, and reporting. Here are the roles you'll play:

The Model Builder

•Use financial projection models to monitor performance of investments relative to market conditions and specific business plans

•Manipulate and organize numerical data so that astute inferences can be drawn from it

•Extraordinary organizational and strategic planning skills

About Press Ganey

Press Ganey pioneered the health care performance improvement movement more than 30 years ago. Position Description/Overview:

The Business Analyst position will be responsible for leading the collaboration between business, operations, and technology stakeholders to create business and functional requirements for software enhancements and new products. This role will work closely with Managers and Development Teams primarily in an Agile software development environment to ensure that new feature requirements are clearly documented, communicated, and delivered. This role will be located in either our Chicago, South Bend or Charlotte office. The candidate selected will be required to sit in either one of these markets.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Responsible for eliciting requirements through interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.
Function as a subject matter, process, and operational expert working closely with product owners to define business problems and develop alternative solutions.
Responsible for leading design discussions and presenting solutions to groups within the company. Provide training and education on solutions when applicable.
Responsible for being the liaison between the business units and technology teams.
Decompose vision and high-level requirements into detailed technical solutions, processes, procedures, training, and standards
Use a wide range of communication methods to gather necessary information and evangelize the goals of the Client Solutions team. Examples would include, policies, processes, procedures, meeting notes, and workflow diagrams.
Qualifications

The ideal candidate for this opportunity will possess the following work experiences and skillsets:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
3-5 years previous experience as a Business Analyst in similar environment
Proven experience of generating and documenting functional requirements, including business rules, use cases, process flows and proof of concepts.
Self-starter who can work alone or as part of a larger project team.
Strong interpersonal skills (working with a range of business users).
Good presentation / facilitation skills.
Understanding of standard systems project methodology (agile and waterfall).
A structured thinker, but have capability to think outside the box.
Competent interacting with key managers and executives in the business area of the company.
Self-managing and task / deadline focused.
Experience working in Rally is preferred but not mandatory.

Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 100 million members in the U.S., Canada and U.K. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for tips as they work on their financial goals, including helping them monitor their credit, identity monitoring, searching for credit cards, shopping for loans (car, home and personal), filing their taxes with Credit Karma Tax and growing their savings* -- all for free. Credit Karma has grown significantly through the years: we've added more than 70 million members in the last five years alone and now have more than 1,100 employees across our offices in San Francisco, Charlotte, Los Angeles, Leeds, London and soon Oakland.
Banking services provided by MVB Bank, Inc., Member FDIC

Security is a core value at Credit Karma. We help millions of people better manage their credit. Safeguarding their sensitive information is critical to our continued success. From the CEO down to each individual engineer, everyone views security as a personal responsibility. Credit Karma is looking for a SOC Analyst, and your unique mission is to mine a deep data set of security event information for useful signals and feed the results into automated actions and infrastructure changes. This Individual may also sit in our Charlotte Office.
What You'll Do
Perform monitoring, research, assessment and analysis on all notable security events within the Credit Karma environment
Set and tune alerting for important events
Engage with partners in engineering, IT, and operations to respond to and remediate events
Identify opportunities for implementing additional technology controls to create more visibility or defend key points of attack
Design visualizations of key sustaining metrics for 24x7 panes of glass
What's Great About It
Carrying out two positive missions at the same time: helping people take back control of their credit and helping to keep their personal information safe
Solving frontier security problems at scale in a highly technology-focused team
Spending zero minutes convincing anyone why security is important - we all understand that very well already!
What We Expect
2+ years of incident detection and response experience
Strong scripting or relevant programming skills
A creative forensic mindset
Self-starting attitude and fearless ascent up the learning curve
Eagerness to challenge the status quo, balanced with a reasonable and methodical approach to effecting change
A fun and positive attitude!

We offer generous benefits and perks with a single eye to nourishing an inclusive environment that recognizes the contributions of all and fosters diversity by supporting our internal Employee Resource Groups. We’ve worked hard to build an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and the opportunity for professional growth. About the Role

As an IT Support Analyst within the Internal Systems and Tools team at Passport, you will be at the center of providing an exceptional customer experience to Passporters throughout the entire organization. You'll do this in our incredibly fast-paced, exciting, and constantly evolving environment. You will be part of a team that governs, provisions, and fully supports all internal systems and tools used by Passport employees. You'll ensure strong internal relationships and satisfaction with our employee base and maintain a consistent and superior experience with Passport Internal Systems and Tools.

Responsibilities:
Provide a world-class support experience to Passport employees until their reported issue or problem has been resolved
Manage case pipeline, and appropriately prioritize to deliver outstanding service
Responsible for supporting all Passport employees on approved internal systems and tools via Incident, Problem, and Knowledge management of internal stakeholders as it relates to IT Operations support related cases
Deliver service maturity through continual service improvement, automation first mentality, and aligning to a Service Management maturity model and plan
Manage and refresh our internal employee onboarding processes and request fulfillment as it relates to IT operations focus areas
Establish a culture of excellence, learning, and regular best practices sharing across Passport
Understand internal customer needs and challenges, and communicate effectively with all stakeholders to resolve cases
Documenting key workflows, handoffs, and case resolutions in our systems of record and ensuring that documentation stays relevant and up-to-date
Monitor the escalation of cases and highlight critical situations with a sense of urgency
Participate in vendor pilots, testing, and internal system deployments, as defined
Participate in or initiate standard IT policies, workflow
Meet/exceed established performance standards for internal customer satisfaction, response, and case resolution objectives
Key Competencies
Customer focus
High IT acumen
Situational adaptability and flexibility
Manages complexity
Action-oriented
Qualifications:
2 or more years of experience as an IT support analyst in a help desk role providing technical end user support, required
Computer Science or related degree, or equivalent work experience, required
Strong technical background, with solid understanding and administration, required
MacOS administration experience required with Windows administration experience preferred
Process and problem-solving mindset, with proven ability to triage and resolve technical issues, required
Continuous improvement mindset with keen attention to detail and quality, required
Superior time management skills, required
Excellent organizational and communication (written, verbal, and listening) skills
Case management tool experience, a plus (ie. ZenDesk, ServiceNow, JIRA), preferred
CompTIA A+, Network+ and/or Security+ certifications, preferred
ACMT/ACiT strongly preferred
About You

Simply put, you have it together - people enjoy working with you, your team respects you, your colleagues are regularly impressed by you. You have strong technical capabilities, inexhaustible problem solving skills and you can juggle it all. You know the ins and outs of managing large case volumes, and you take tremendous pride in fully understanding the businesses you support. You are not afraid of challenging situations and know how to navigate carefully during challenging client conversations. You constantly set the bar high with your daily work and then raise the bar higher for both you and your team. You thrive in a constantly changing, fast-paced environment. You can balance short and long term objectives. You own the details. You are always thinking a few steps ahead. You listen, collaborate, take note of alternate viewpoints, and implement the best solutions. You can communicate with the best by being clear, concise, and listening.

About Us

Passport is transforming mobility management for cities, empowering them to create more livable and equitable communities. Passport's mobility platform enables clients to digitally coordinate all modes of transportation and implement real-time, data-centric management of their curbside and streetspace through its enterprise software. Trusted by nearly 1,000 cities, universities and agencies, including Chicago, Toronto, London, Los Angeles, and Miami, Passport is one of the fastest growing companies on the Inc. 5000 and Deloitte Technology Fast 500 lists. Passport is backed by Rho Capital Partners, H.I.G. Growth Partners, ThornTree Capital Partners, Bain Capital Ventures, Grotech Ventures, MK Capital, and Relevance Capital. Demonstrated attention to detail
Strong problem solving and logic skills, resourcefulness, needs to be able to interact with people across the organization and departments to resolve bugs/issues/understand their needs.

Passion for helping the business achieve operational success.

Exhibits good business ethics both internally and externally.
Maintain a working knowledge of advances and trends in programming and technology.
Ability to work varied hours to accommodate operational needs and provide after-hours support as necessary.

Good working knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, DHCP, DNS, WINS and SMTP
Experience with cloud environment solutions (O365 & Azure)

Initiative to be a self-starter and require minimal management and direction
Ability to multi-task and expand previous levels of knowledge

Willingness to learn and continue to improve
Organization skills
Written and oral communication skills

PowerBI Experience
Azure Cloud Hosted Environments

Job Description:
Company Overview:

Newport Group is a leading provider of retirement plans, insurance, and consulting services. We help companies offer their employees a more secure financial future by offering comprehensive plan solutions and consulting expertise to plan sponsors and the advisors who serve them.

This position is required to be in a Newport Group office location. Remote opportunity not available.

Job Description:

The Compliance Analyst will perform compliance testing, testing review, document support, government forms preparation and review for moderately complex retirement plan.

The Compliance Analyst will:
Ensure that assigned plans remain tax qualified by meeting all IRS and DOL reporting and testing requirements. This also includes reporting on all accounting and financial activity for the plan.
Prepare all non-discrimination tests and other Compliance related testing on mostly larger and/or moderately complex plans as well as perform contribution calculations.
Review legal plan document and all employee data and determine participant eligibility.
Reconcile and/or review all financial activity as well as prepare all required government forms.
Requirements for this role include:
Bachelor’s degree in a business related field or industry experience, or a combination of education and industry experience.
Ability to obtain ASPPA’s Retirement Plan Fundamental certificate (RPF-1& RPF-2 exams).
2+ years of progressive plan experience in third party administration environment required.
Experience on preparing and explaining qualified plan compliance testing and government form filings.
Previous client services or customer service experience.
ASC experience a plus

Reporting to the SVP Finance, the Business Transformation Analyst (BTA) will be responsible for planning and managing resources to execute finance projects or project components from inception through implementation. The BTA interprets finance requirements, identifies and communicates project scope and ensures program milestones and objectives are met. Effective communication between technical and non-technical functions is essential as well as keeping management informed of key issues and changes which may impact expected business results.

Work collaboratively with and influence teams across business units and functions; continuously engaging various levels across the organization through effective communications
Function as a liaison, between finance, business and technical resources to ensure people, process and technology solutions meet or exceed the needs of our business

Deliver solutions that accomplishes the finance and business objectives with on-time delivery, budget adherence, and exceptional quality
Document finance and business requirements, define scope and objectives, and formulate systems to optimize overall business strategies
Define and execute consistent communications to keep finance and business stakeholders fully informed
Identify and manage project risks/issues to closure and provide proper visibility to senior management

Liaises with IT to resolve technical issues escalated by end-users in their day to day operations

Required:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business or related field

Demonstrated experience in finance operations, financial planning & analysis functions with cross-groups collaboration at all levels

Familiar with relational database concepts, client-server, and technology concepts
Naturally proactive, communicative, and technical savvy
Impeccable judgement on prioritization and escalation
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong follow-through skills to ensure achievement of goals and delivery of expected outcomes
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to effectively prioritize multiple competing tasks and demands
Excellent planning and organizational skills and the ability to work both independently and as a member of a team

Master's degree in Business and/or Project Management certification (PMP)

Through innovation, technology, and unparalleled customer service, TrialCard’s passionate people provide patient-centric solutions to the pharmaceutical industry that improve access, affordability, and adherence to enhance patients’ lives. We work tirelessly on the behalf of our clients, because when they succeed, so do we.
That’s not to say we are all work and no play. TrialCard is an open workplace with fun, energetic people united for a common purpose. In fact, we don’t even refer to each other as employees. We’re team members. We foster a culture that encourages individual personality.
As a Strategic Business Analyst, you will join our team on a journey to help eliminate barriers for patients, increase their access to medications, and help them receive lifesaving treatments while working in an environment that nurtures you.
The position will support researching, analyzing, defining and designing new and existing internal strategic projects aligning with our company objectives. As part of TrialCard’s Enterprise Project Management office, the role works closely with both the business and IT to provide process, technical solutions and project plans that transforms the way we do business.

Serve as a strategic project lead between business departments and technical teams in requirements analysis, process design and implementations, to support various areas of the business using Off the Shelf or TrialCard proprietary application systems and ancillary systems.
Collaborate with business stakeholders, project managers and project sponsors to prioritize collected requirements, refine project scope and vision for TrialCard objective alignment.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, job shadowing, workflow storyboards, scenarios, and other methods for project definition.
Translate conceptual user requirements into workflow storyboards, use cases, functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team, utilizing standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications utilizing process models, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements, verbally or through written documentation, to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Assist in identifying business process improvements, implementing best practices, and full utilization of the capabilities of TrialCard systems.
Conduct limited market research and cost modeling to find the most effective and efficient solution recommendations.
Ensure that TrialCard’s IT solutions are: (1) cost effective and cost justified, (2) optimized to support Trialcard business applications, and (3) secure, scalable and extendable from an architectural standpoint.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Provide multiple options and courses of action for solutioning based on supporting facts and data.
Mitigate project risks and partner with key stakeholders to ensure projects meet timelines and budgets as defined.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership, executive level and steering committees ensuring alignment with strategic and companywide objectives.
Any other tasks or projects as assigned by immediate supervisor.

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM designated field or similar discipline.
3+ years of service-related experience in project/operations management, IT Business, Data, Systems Analyst or relevant field.
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development.
Strong interpersonal skills including negotiating, influencing, and conflict resolution with demonstrated ability in managing high-level relationships
Drives and challenges business units on their assumptions of how they intend to change their processes and/or systems.
If applicable, analyze new requirements or existing process/systems to assist in the development of IT systems to align with business strategies
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.
Strong leadership skills
Excellent logical, analytical, mathematical and creative problem-solving skills.
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Highly organized with ability to multi-task, prioritize and effectively manage high volume workflow and shifting priorities
Highly self-motivated and self-directed.
Strong customer service orientation.
Experience in Project Management processes and Agile/SDLC methodologies
Expertise with Excel, Word, Visio and PowerPoint

Role - Data Analyst:
Job Description:
Work with data engineers, IT teams and business partners to assemble data from various sources into datasets to analyze the information to source Inforce and other related data to create Model inforce feed
Provide support to data quality and data validation through analysis of data and assisting in understanding the meaning of data.
Perform data profiling on large sets data stored on Hadoop platform.
Administer and generate metrics on data to monitor and improve the quality of data.
Participate in changes to key data elements and source data and document the changes to business and technical definitions and data lineage in our metadata repository.
Should be able to explore data to find its meaning and relationship to solving business problems:
Document technical and business data definitions and data lineage from source to target in a metadata management system.
Work with peer technical personnel, members of the DAO team, and our business partners to assemble data from various sources into datasets to analyze the information to solve business problems and improve business efficiency.
Support technical and business testing as a member of development project teams.
Administer and generate metrics on data to monitor and improve the quality of data.
Participate in changes to key data elements and source data and document the changes to business and technical definitions and data lineage in our metadata repository.
Job Requirements:
Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills, a must as there will be significant collaboration with the business and IT
Multi-line Life Insurance and Annuity experience is required for working with business to understand business impact for data issues
Experience in creating dashboards with data quality key performance indicators (KPIs)
Relevant experience in at least one of the following areas are desired:
Connecting, wrangling, and cleaning data from relational, columnar, or Hadoop databases using SQL, Python, R, or other tools to make data consumable for analysis. You can automate and document your processes to make them repeatable.
Creating metadata: Defining the meaning of data and analyzing data flows to determine source to target data lineage, then storing this information in a metadata reference library. Documenting data entity relationships in a tool such as Excel, Erwin, etc..
Analyzing data to obtain new insights that will lead to improved efficiencies, lower cost, or reduced business risk. You may be using Excel, Python, R, SQL / HQL and other tools. You may be able to visualize your results using data visualization tools to make your conclusions more understandable to your audience.
Analyzing the statistical relationship of data to a problem to be solved using SQL, Python, or R. Determine new and creative sources of data and then determining the comparative strength of the relationship to the problem after the new data is applied.
Preferred Skills:.
Training or degree in Data Analysis, Data Engineering or Statistical Modeling.
Experience in exploratory data analysis and how data analysis fits into an analytic lifecycle desired.
Experience in metadata management with a metadata management tool (such as IBM Infosphere tool suite).
Relevant IT or other technical experience in data analysis/mapping, logical and physical data modeling preferred.

bioMerieux has an opening for a Quality Control Analyst II in Durham, North Carolina.

The QC Analyst II executes routine tests per standard operating procedures. Tests may be raw materials, intermediates, environmental samples, finished goods, or stability samples submitted to the laboratory.

Main Accountabilities:
Testing of raw materials and manufactured product in accordance with laboratory guidelines as well as BMX methods and SOP’s.
Assist in the release of finished goods and raw materials after appropriate testing.
Ensures the proper documentation of technical data, generated from testing, is consistent with quality procedures.
Troubleshoots performance testing issues with the help of management and co-workers.
Performs failure analysis to determine preliminary cause of any problem.
Writes Nonconforming Reports (NC’s) and initiates and completes OOS investigations.
Review Device History Records for GMP compliance as per procedures. Approves test results, Releases final product, raw materials and intermediate products.
Provides support to product and process improvement projects. Assists in method development, trials, shelf life validations and equipment and process validations.
Assures routine subculture, maintenance and use of culture collection is performed in accordance with processes.
Responsible for performing activities related to product development and support, including experimental planning and execution as well as creation of detailed documentation.
May design experiments to optimize technical performance.

Exceptional organizational and time management skills
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Intermediate to advanced MS Office skills
Understands the importance of compliance with cGMP
Demonstrated understanding of regulatory requirements and quality system

NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst to join our team in Raleigh, North Carolina (US-NC), United States (US).

The Business Analyst uses business and technology knowledge to serve as a liaison between business initiatives and IT in order to determine the correct course of action to achieve desired results. This person collaborates with business and technical resources to determine business information and application needs and assists clients in the analysis of a proposed idea and performs the review, determines the systems potential, conducts documentation, testing (as needed) and follow through.

Responsibilities:

* Documents client organization's direction, structure, business processes and requirements.

* Liaison between the business and development teams throughout the project.

* Analyzes business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how the application can best function to fulfill those needs.

* Identifies cross impact to other systems.

* Proposes solutions to problems and considers timeliness, effectiveness, and practicality in addressing client needs.

* Understands project plans and is able to clearly articulate roles, project goals, and timelines.

* Adheres to and facilitates project standards.

* Creates, consolidates and presents documents relating to use cases, functional requirements, data mapping, privilege provisioning and authorization models, maintaining them throughout the project, including traceability back to requirements.

* Ensures with the quality management team that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, and that testing plans have been completed.

* Provides a business or process perspective during design reviews.

* Participates in change control process throughout the project.

* Proactively carries out project support /administrative functions.

Skills and Abilities:

* Outstanding organizational and multi-tasking skills

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

* Strong attention to detail

* Ability to deal directly with all levels of management – from consultants to executives and business partners

* Strong sense of urgency and high level of responsiveness

* Ability to work independently and part of a team

* Rapidly adapts and responds to changes in environment and priorities

Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in business or related field

* 5+ years of experience as business analyst

* Understands basic Internet and client/server architectures

* Possesses basic knowledge of HTML

* Proficient in Microsoft Office suite

Preferences:

*Exposure to AML and Fraud systems in Financial Services

*Experience in working with development teams preferred

*Experience in systems implementation, business analysis, and/or project management

*Big 4 and/or boutique consulting firm experience

*Consulting experience with a FSI client

*FSI merger & acquisition experience

The successful canadiate is responsible for working on application/network penetration tests, vulnerability assessment and other security activities as assigned to members of the Red Team. This position will involve working closely with development and projects teams to ensure that internal, secure development processes are adhered to and applications produced by the process are free from security vulnerabilities. Position will also be responsible for providing basic guidance with regard to development best practices, prevention and remediation of application and infrastructure vulnerabilities.

Complete testing engagements, document results using approved report formats and track remediation
Perform manual validation of results from automated/semi-automated tests
Perform manual penetration test activities as needed

Complete analysis and draw conclusions of overall system risk, recommend remediation strategy.
Coordinate with internal colleagues to follow up on vulnerability remediation.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with clients and other team members.
Gain and maintain a working knowledge of the Security Products and Services
Continually review and enhance existing knowledge of threats and analysis techniques
Serve as part of the Enterprise Vulnerability Management team
Perform annual Firewall rule review and remediation

A bachelor's degree information systems or other related field; or equivalent work experience.
Professional security certifications such as CISSP, GPEN, GCIA or GWAPT are a plus
Demonstrate a self-directed approach to learning new technologies in the field; pursue professional development.
Technical acumen in securing software and hardware
Knowledge of Penetration testing tools and testing methodologies
Analysis of operating system, application and network architectures to identify security vulnerabilities
Extensive knowledge and experience of operating systems and distributions.
Windows Server and Desktop Network and domain administration, enumeration and exploitation
Understanding of the TCP/IP protocol stack and other protocols such as routing protocols, web services
Knowledge of security issues related to many common databases including MySQL, MSSQL and Oracle
Working knowledge of application testing tools and techniques such as XSS and SQL injection
Scripting and programming skills are preferred
Previous experience with enterprise vulnerability management applications, Firewall rules review, BURP Suite, IBM AppScan and Core Impact a plus

Opportunities for personal and professional career development.

Description

Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority.

Position Overview:

The idea of surgical robotics was little more than a curiosity until 1999, the year Intuitive Surgical introduced the da Vinci® Surgical System. Today, Intuitive Surgical is the global leader in the rapidly emerging field of robotic-assisted minimally invasive surgery. Intuitive Surgical is also an industry leader in designing data capture from over 5,400 surgical robotics systems used by over 40,000 surgeons globally.

The Enterprise Analytics team powers data-driven decision making across all organizations at Intuitive. As a data analyst on this team, you will shape your colleagues interactions with a wide range of data critical to their decision making. You will also uncover insights that drive product and operational improvements.

For this role, you should have excellent analytical skills, excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to communicate clearly and present information to stakeholders at all levels of the business.

Roles and Responsibilities:


We are looking for an experienced data analyst to join our growing global Enterprise Analytics team who will help derive insight and understanding from the wealth of data at our disposal through data visualization, building informative reports / dashboards, application of statistical methods, and deep investigation. This role presents the opportunity to work with data across a wide variety of functions, from manufacturing to customer insights. We are seeking an individual who has the vision and strategic thinking skills to help take analytics to the next level at Intuitive.

• Storytelling with data: the ability to use data visualization effectively to tell a story and drive action by presenting information
• Defining and designing KPI based dashboards / reports that summarize organizational health and highlight hot spots for executives to focus on
• Continual hypothesis testing through ad hoc analysis and model testing
• Working with Data Engineers, Data Architects, to define back-end requirements for data products (aggregations, materialized views, tables visualization)
• Data investigation to discover correlations / trends and the ability to explain them
• Collaborate with internal and external customers to develop an analytics portfolio consistent with the vision and goals of our stakeholders
• Identify data gaps from downstream and upstream source systems. Work with IT partners to improve data quality and governance with the goal of delivering value added data for analytics
• Collaborate with key stakeholders on how to best leverage analytics to inform better business decisions and optimization operations
• Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of our analytic teams
• Proactively mine data warehouse to identify trends and patterns and generate insights for business units and senior leadership
• Develop frameworks and processes to analyze unstructured information collected through our medical devices for use in the service lines
• Interact with Product team to understand how unstructured information is instrumented, stored, modeled, and tagged
• Support analysts and UI engineers to enhance information visualization through development of dashboards and user interfaces
• Work closely with product managers, architects, and business units for knowledge sharing, mentoring, and training
• Drive standardization of key metrics across various business stakeholders to improve data governance
• Continually recommend, develop, and implement improved processes to collect/analyze data, and visualize/present insights

Qualifications

Skill/Job Requirements:

Basic Qualifications

• 2+ years of experience in a Data Visualization, Data Scientist, or Data Analyst role
• Bachelors or Masters degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, or other quantitative field
• Expertise with data visualization tools like Tableau (certification a plus)
• Experience with full-stack data analysis, insight synthesis and presentation.
• Proven competency in dashboard design and information visualization techniques
• Proficient SQL programming skills with an understanding of database capabilities and experience integrating, structuring, and analyzing large amounts of data from diverse sources
• Proven ability using data to generate insight, tell stories, and drive business results
• You have a curious business mindset with an ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action
• Strong analytical skills creative problem solver with the ability to aggregate, cleanse and analyze a large amount of data from various sources
• Working knowledge of database technologies (e.g. ODBC, Access, SQL)
• Experience with R, Python, and Jupyter Notebook
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Proven ability to effectively build and manage relationships, interact at multiple levels of the organization and across multiple functions
• Medical robotics has unique characteristics that will require immersion in clinical and technical training and you must come up to speed quickly an interest and desire to learn are critical
• Ability to investigate issues to root cause, understand and explain trends/shifts in data
• A sense of pride and personal accountability for resulting customer experience is a must
• You are self-directed, passionate about data, and focused on delivering the right results
Preferred Qualifications

• Advanced degree in Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or other quantitative discipline
• Experience in Medical Devices
• Familiarity with machine learning techniques
• Experience with Cloud Analytics Platforms (MS Azure, AWS, Snowflake or GCP)
• Strong experience in data modeling, data analysis, or analytics work
• Passion for deriving meaning from data and optimizing visual display of information (design perspective)

Job Description:
Overview


JOB SUMMARY:

The IT Business Analyst serves as the conduit between the Software Development team and the rest of the organization. This position is responsible for performing detailed business analysis and outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for a business in conjunction with the understanding of Software Development Life Cycle. The IT Business Analyst also acts as a “Product Owner”, which is a hybrid role focusing on project analysis and execution to maximize the value delivered to the organization as a result of its IT investments.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES:
Identify and understand the business problem and the impact of the proposed solution on the organization's operations.
Act as system users’/stakeholders’ cradle-to-grave champion within IT for their software development requests.
Serve as an interface between software developers and end users by working closely with business stakeholders to understand and document their business needs, assess whether and how their request can be implemented in a system-specific way, coordinate with development on estimating effort and duration, and manage user interaction as their requests are developed.
Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; Monitor project progress by tracking activity; publishing progress reports; resolving problems; recommending actions.
Develop detailed requirements specifications for software enhancement/change requests.
Develop test cases which enable effective traceability to detailed requirements.
Manage and work with IT Operations to schedule software releases and hardware deployments.
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analysis to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues.
Research existing Business systems and identify improvement opportunities.
Develop detailed knowledge of HAECO’s Software Applications, including after-the-fact documentation and business process flows as required.
Attend/conduct exploratory meetings where potential projects are discussed, and provide feedback based upon the reality of software development challenges and timeframes.
Assist in the creation of an online knowledge base that will encompass the various facets of HAECO’s software systems.
Qualifications


MINIMUM:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related fields (such as Information Systems) with minimum 5 years of experience in a Business Analyst role.
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing.
Basic knowledge in generating process documentation.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive.
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools.
Minimum two-year experience with diagramming tools (e.g.: Microsoft Visio).
PREFERRED:
A hybrid role of IT Business Analyst and a Project Manager (PMP preferred)
Experience with at least two of the following toolsets: SQL, Power BI, Java, Python, Groovy, Ruby
Enthusiastic, out-of-the-box thinker with a passion for delivering value and making a positive difference in an organization.

Job Posting Title
Business Analyst

22-Jan-2020

Job Description
Do you want the opportunity to leverage your skills to make a direct impact on the world’s leading life sciences and consumer products companies? Join Clarkston Consulting as a Business Analyst to help deliver innovative business solutions to our market leading clients as a part of an expert team.

We are looking for motivated, self-driven leaders who are energized by team success and interested in joining a firm that values its culture and people as its biggest strengths. Together, we can help find the answers to our clients most challenging business problems.

What You’ll Do as Business Analyst

Clarkston gives you the opportunity to deliver great solutions, become recognized as an industry expert, and help build a great practice.

As a Business Analyst within our strategic advisory services, you will:
Work directly with clients of all levels to guide complex projects and develop innovative solutions
Focus on business process re-engineering efforts and technology enablement
Earn trusted client status and build relationships that extend beyond the project’s lifecycle
At Clarkston, you'll be able to continue to advance your career in a variety of solution, process, and consulting disciplines.

How You’ll Grow

At Clarkston, we feel that we provide the greatest value to our clients through a combination of our industry expertise, business process knowledge, and consulting excellence.

Beyond your day-to-day responsibilities, throughout your career as a Business Analyst you will:
Have the support and mentorship of your Clarkston colleagues and leaders
Own your career – you'll be able to take charge of your career journey with diverse opportunities to lead and expand your skillset both at the client site and within the firm
Have the opportunity to make a real and positive impact not only the clients you work with, but on the firm as well
What We’re Looking For

We are looking for versatile leaders and innovators with 3-5 years of prior industry or functional experience who want to work on diverse and challenging operations and management consulting projects to deliver true value to our clients.

An ideal candidate as a Business Analyst would have gained experience in one or more of the following:
Applying strong knowledge of business processes to identify business issues and opportunities
Assisting with blueprinting and design sessions to gather functional requirements and define new business processes to be implemented
Managing and overseeing the design and development of customized reports, utilizing technical resources and other tools
Designing and development of interfaces and conversion programs to/from existing legacy systems
Conducting knowledge transfer and training of end-users, including sharing best practices
Understanding of systems development lifecycle and system implementation methodologies
All consulting roles at Clarkston are 100% travel, so the desire and willingness to travel extensively to client locations is also essential. Additionally, a 4-year degree is required for employment at Clarkston.

More About Clarkston
Founded in 1991, Clarkston Consulting delivers technology and management solutions to market leaders in the life sciences and consumer products industries. At Clarkston, we drive success --- for our clients, for our people, and for our firm. We utilize a team approach leveraging our collective expertise and industry knowledge to solve our clients’ business challenges.

Visit www.joinclarkston.com to learn more about our culture, benefits, and opportunities. We hope you’ll join us!

Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 100 million members in the U.S., Canada and U.K. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for tips as they work on their financial goals, including helping them monitor their credit, identity monitoring, searching for credit cards, shopping for loans (car, home and personal), filing their taxes with Credit Karma Tax and growing their savings* -- all for free. Credit Karma has grown significantly through the years: we've added more than 70 million members in the last five years alone and now have more than 1,100 employees across our offices in San Francisco, Charlotte, Los Angeles, Leeds, London and soon Oakland.
Banking services provided by MVB Bank, Inc., Member FDIC

Security is a core value at Credit Karma. We help millions of people better manage their credit. Safeguarding their sensitive information is critical to our continued success. From the CEO down to each individual engineer, everyone views security as a personal responsibility. Credit Karma is looking for a SOC Incident Analyst, and your unique mission is to mine a deep data set of security event information for useful signals and feed the results into automated actions and infrastructure changes.
What You’ll Do
Primary duty is responding to security events and incidents
Secondary duty will be assisting in Vulnerability Management activities
Incident Response activities will include, but are not limited to, triaging security events, network and endpoint forensic analysis, malware reverse engineering, threat hunting, vulnerability escalation, and resolving security incidents from detection to remediation
Engage with partners in engineering, IT, and operations to respond to and remediate events.
Creates and implements standard operating procedures and processes to help streamline investigations, daily monitoring and analysis research to ensure all analysts are effective
Identify opportunities for implementing additional technology controls to create more visibility or defend key points of attack
Carry out threat hunting campaigns and missions
Coordination and execution of purple teaming exercises
Design visualizations of key sustaining metrics for 24x7 panes of glass.
What’s Great About It
Carrying out two positive missions at the same time: helping people take back control of their credit and helping to keep their personal information safe
Solving frontier security problems at scale in a highly technology-focused team
Spending zero minutes convincing anyone why security is important - we all understand that very well already!
What We Expect
5+ years experience in working in cyber security operations (CSOC, SOC, CIRT, CSIRT) enterprise environment
Understanding of the Cyber Kill Chain framework and Diamond Model for intrusion analysis
Strong knowledge of tools used for network security (Data Loss Prevention, Network Intrusion Prevention Systems, Host Intrusion Prevention Systems, Anti-Virus, Firewalls, etc.)
Experience with languages such as; Python, Java, Scala, PowerShell, Bash, etc.
Experience with the Network Security Monitoring (NSM) methodologies
Experience in Ethical Hacking or Red Team
Experience with vulnerability scanners such as: Qualys, Nessus, Metasploit, Rapid7
Experience with endpoint detection and response (EDR) suites (CrowdStrike, McAfee EPO, OSSEC, Yara, MIR, CarbonBlack, Tanium, etc.)
Experience with host-centric tools for forensic collection and analysis (SleuthKit, Volatility Framework, FTK, Encase, etc.)
Experience with Network Forensics and/or Network Security Monitoring (NSM) tools (Snort, Bro-IDS, PCAP, tcpdump, etc.) and analysis techniques (alert, flow/session and PCAP analysis)
Experience with SAAS, PAAS, IAAS, public and private cloud technologies, Docker, Kubernetes, etc
A fun and positive attitude!
Equal Employment Opportunity

We offer generous benefits and perks with a single eye to nourishing an inclusive environment that recognizes the contributions of all and fosters diversity by supporting our internal Employee Resource Groups. APEX bridges the gap between sensor and analyst in the evolving field of intelligence analysis. APEX tightly couples analysts, operators, and engineers to produce an unmatched level of problem-solving capacity for any situation.

Spanning various disciplines, including geospatial intelligence (GEOINT), signals intelligence (SIGINT), and human intelligence (HUMINT) analysis, APEX analysts, operators, and engineers work with operational mission partners to deliver novel technology, tactics, techniques, and procedures (T3P), relevant and modern training, and innovative technology solutions.

If you are a motivated individual willing to tackle challenging, and interesting problems, come be a part of our dynamic team!

APEX Expert Solutions is seeking a Geospatial Intelligence Analyst to join their team at the customer site in Fort Bragg, NC. This is a great opportunity for someone that wants to make a difference in the defense of the nation by applying their talents and experience in a fast-paced dynamic environment in support of US Special Operations Command. The opportunity is limited to those that have the operational and technical experience, and skills to effectively apply geospatial practices in support of real-world operations. You will be an integral part of a selective professional geospatial team that is directly part of the operational planning cycle to support mission success.

You will perform full spectrum geospatial analysis in support of complex geospatial, topographic, and imagery problem sets in support of global real-world operations. You will be required to communicate analytical assessments clearly and succinctly both written and orally, and present analysis products from creative analytical techniques in an operational environment. You will use their technical expertise and experience of Processing, Exploitation, and Dissemination (PED) of ground feature data and remotely sensed data such as Multi-Spectral Imagery (MSI), Light Detection and Ranging (LiDAR), and Electro-Optical Imagery to support the operational customer. You will be required to work in dynamic fast paced environments that requires both team interaction and individual efforts. You must be experienced in interfacing with both internal and external leadership.

Specifically, the Geospatial Intelligence Analyst will be responsible to fuse mutli-discipline intelligence sources to provide accurate and timely geospatial analysis in direct support of multiple geographically dispersed DoD organizations. You are the interface to the operational elements to ensure the operational commander's goals are accomplished through the synchronization of the geospatial enterprise. You will use your knowledge and intelligence acumen to provide critical recommendations to operational decision makers. You will work the full spectrum of the problem set utilizing advanced geospatial capabilities and techniques to complete the mission.You will be challenged daily to expand your knowledge and understanding of operational application of geospatial practices with multiple disciplines.

Required:

• Minimum of six years of analytical experience within DOD or relevant non-DOD employers, with four out of the previous six years of actual hands on experience
• Experience directly supporting military operations in both garrison and deployed environments
• Experience and ability to interact professionally with senior leaders of internal and external organizations
• Experience and working knowledge of geospatial and intelligence data management within a variety of OGC compliant applications and databases
• Experience and proficiency utilizing GIS applications and intelligence related automation to support analytical efforts and product development
• Experience with imagery analysis and production to include a broad understanding of collection processes and management
• Experience with geospatial processing and development of new methodologies to solve complex tactical intelligence problems.

Desired:
• Experience in the production of fused multi-discipline geospatial assessments
• Experience and knowledge of geospatial techniques in the Find Fix Finish Exploit Analyze (F3EA) cycle
• Working knowledge of computer scripting languages such as Python, Java Script, HTML, R, or SAS

Clearance Level:
Active TS SCI clearance

Job Title: Product Support Analyst

Location: Greenville, SC

Job Summary:

The Product Support Analyst provides support to customers, answering questions on function and usage of product via the telephone and/or Internet; and conveys customer feedback to the product development staff.This position serves as primary support liaison between company and customer in a highly team oriented environment, and works under close supervision, typically reporting to the Manager, Support Operations.

Responsibilities:
Resolves clients' questions or problems on use of product over the telephone or Internet focusing on product functionality, operating environments and system configuration/setup.
Serves as primary support liaison between company and customer and documents incidents in required tracking systems.
Proactively keeps customer informed of how and when problems are resolved with focus on customer retention and satisfaction.

Advanced problem solving and analytic skills.
Good writing and editing skills
Excellent communications skills.
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills.
Solid PC skills with knowledge of various software applications used for testing, troubleshooting, call logging, etc.
Strong organizational skills required to insure most effective and timely delivery of service to clients.
Possess ability to both multi-task and manage priorities effectively.
Flexibility required to work outside defined role.

Prior experience in related industry or software/technical support

Job Description:

Work with data engineers, IT teams and business partners to assemble data from various sources into datasets to analyze the information to source Inforce and other related data to create Model inforce feed
Provide support to data quality and data validation through analysis of data and assisting in understanding the meaning of data.
Perform data profiling on large sets data stored on Hadoop platform.
Administer and generate metrics on data to monitor and improve the quality of data.
Participate in changes to key data elements and source data and document the changes to business and technical definitions and data lineage in our metadata repository.

Document technical and business data definitions and data lineage from source to target in a metadata management system.
Work with peer technical personnel, members of the DAO team, and our business partners to assemble data from various sources into datasets to analyze the information to solve business problems and improve business efficiency.
Support technical and business testing as a member of development project teams.
Administer and generate metrics on data to monitor and improve the quality of data.
Participate in changes to key data elements and source data and document the changes to business and technical definitions and data lineage in our metadata repository.

Connecting, wrangling, and cleaning data from relational, columnar, or Hadoop databases using SQL, Python, R, or other tools to make data consumable for analysis. You can automate and document your processes to make them repeatable.
Creating metadata: Defining the meaning of data and analyzing data flows to determine source to target data lineage, then storing this information in a metadata reference library. Documenting data entity relationships in a tool such as Excel, Erwin, etc..

Job Description:
nCino offers exciting career opportunities for individuals who want to join the worldwide leader in cloud banking.

Description
Are you the kind of person that isn’t afraid of technology and loves marketing and promoting technology products to businesses? Are you a competitive intelligence ninja? Do you want to play an essential role in go-to-market strategy and execution for the worldwide leader in cloud banking?
nCino is looking for rockstar Product Marketing Analyst to join our team. As a product marketer, you will be a leader in marketing to the financial services industry the benefits and value of nCino’s Bank Operating System and Solutions and helping drive sales results. You will work closely with the marketing, sales and product development teams and be responsible for collaborating on everything from product launches to messaging to competitive intelligence to sales enablement. Collect primary and secondary data, create sales presentations, landing pages, point of view (POV) documents and more that our customers and employees will immediately benefit from. Measure what works, what doesn’t and improve the latter. You must be a self-starter that can build killer content and not only enjoy writing and marketing, but you do it well. Cross-collaboration is the name of the game and you must rock at it!
The ideal candidate has experience in Product Marketing at a technology company and is looking to grow their Product Marketing career at a fast-paced, technology company in Wilmington, North Carolina.

Responsibilities
Develop an understanding of the nCino Banking Operating System and its solutions
Align with and drive success in nCino’s annual goals and Product Marketing department goals
Be a go-to solution marketing expert with a deep understanding of the banking industry and competitive landscape
Cultivate relationships with the nCino sales, marketing and product development teams
Influence go-to-market product launches and work cross-departmentally to create content and launch campaigns to bring products to market
Perform competitive and market research and keep nCino up-to-date on trends and analyses
Channel the voice of the customer – understand the pain points and aspirations of the different banking segments and roles within the financial institution, ultimately translating this into actionable content and output that drives revenue
Create, define and own the content machine for solution messaging and positioning. Apply your expertise to all forms of collateral: feature documents, slides, web content, POV documents, video scripts, FAQs, competitive intelligence, etc.
Show your creative flair with PowerPoint, infographic and visual representation of messages
Develop sales enablement material that the nCino sales team on how to sell nCino’s Bank Operating System across multiple business lines in the financial industry
Be able to demo the nCino Bank Operating System
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Communications or equivalent major
2+ years of experience in a product/solution-marketing role, preferably at a technology company with exposure to financial services
Experience in marketing, sales or as a product manager
Strong storytelling skills, both written and verbal
Track record for collaborating in successful go-to-market product campaigns
Experience in Adobe Creative Suite
Strong aptitude for distilling complex technical differentiators into simple stories that resonate with the customer base
Excellent project management skills and experience working cross-functionally
Ability to work with a variety of teams, gather input, synthesize feedback and coordinate efforts across multiple areas of business
Proven track record of conducting market and competitive analyses to inform corporate strategies and campaigns
Ability to identify and analyze data to identify market trends and sales opportunities
Motivated to achieve and exceed metrics and revenue goals related to products
Self-starter and a problem solver who works well within a team
Have a positive attitude, work hard, have a sense of humor and are constantly looking to improve and learn
You’re able to advocate for the consumer and think like a marketer.
Bonus
Experience in Product Marketing a plus
Experience and knowledge of the Banking and Credit Unions industries a plus
Other
Position requires 10 percent travel
If you thrive in a high-energy, entrepreneurial environment, we invite you to share your passion, ideas and excitement at nCino.

The Financial Analyst (FP&A) is a key member of the finance team, and this role has tremendous upside potential as the company grows. They will work closely with the CFO as well as other internal functions such as Accounting, Sales, Marketing, Purchasing, Operations, and IT. The role will be responsible for updating financial models, general data analysis, and cost accounting. As needed, this position will also assist the Controller with the financial close and reporting activities. An ongoing requirement is for a forward-thinking mindset that leverages industry best practices, adds value by developing analysis that will provide data driven insights, and identifies opportunities for financial efficiencies. For the candidate who possesses uncommon curiosity and determination, this is a fantastic opportunity to work for one of the fastest growing companies in the area!

Primary Responsibilities:
Assist the CFO in the preparation of the annual budget and monthly forecasts
Maintain budget and reforecast information in the accounting system
Track monthly expenses and revenues vs. budget and analyze fluctuations
Prepare, review, and distribute monthly financial reports to internal departments heads
Assist the CFO/Controller in compiling the monthly reporting packet
Perform deep analysis on COGS line items to identify opportunities for financial efficiencies
Responsible for all cost accounting activities for the warehouses which includes developing and maintaining standard costs for all inventory items.
Perform month-end financial close responsibilities for inventory accounts; including journal entries and account reconciliations
Assist the CFO with maintaining the integrity and accuracy of corporate financial model
Support the Controller with the year-end external audit, including direct interaction with independent auditors.
Provide ad hoc analysis and project work to various members of operations and management as required.
Participating in a wide variety of special projects and compiling a variety of special reports
Desired Skills:

To perform this job successful, an individual should meet the following minimum requirements:
2+ years of experience in financial planning and budgeting roles
Advanced Excel and Office Suite skills
Outstanding academic credentials and Public Accounting experience is a strong plus.
Major ERP system experience required, Netsuite knowledge is a strong plus
Demonstrated ability to successfully work cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment
Unquestioned personal integrity and work ethic.
Education:

The Opportunity


CO-OP Financial Services is bringing digital transformation to the credit union movement. We’re creating innovative technology solutions that help not-for-profit credit unions best serve their members and compete with the big banks. As a result, our world-class team is growing faster than ever! If you’re passionate about technology and want to be part of a purpose-driven organization, this is an exciting opportunity to provide real value and help shape the future of human-centered financial services.

We are seeking a talented Senior Data Quality Control Analyst to lead strategic projects, actively analyzes, improves and manages controls within the Data Management Organization (DMO) and plays the role of advisor to our Data Management teammates and business partners in matters of data controls, quality and remediation. This position advises on control standards, tools, and practices as well as design and implement best practices for the Data Quality & Governance team within the DMO. This role works closely with business and technical partners across CO-OP.

What You Can Look Forward to
Serves as a key point of contact for managing operational elements of Data Governance/Data Management Risk within the Data Management Organization.
Works directly with audit, risk, legal and executives to determine best practices and standards as it relates to data management and controls.
Provides thought leadership on industry trends and provides action plans for CO-OP regarding new ideas and challenges within data management.
Uses data quality trends and root cause analysis to provide recommendations and solutions to management (process/system improvement, gaps in controls, etc.).
Documents end-to-end processes within each functional data element, highlighting controls, potential weaknesses, metrics and procedural differences by lines of business.
Prepares documentation for the tracking, monitoring, and escalation of risk related issues to management related to control ineffectiveness.
Identifies and defines data system/reporting requirements as part of the control environment.
Serves as team liaison to technical partners including data analysts, report analysts, and technical writers in daily operations and data related projects, including data triage and remediation efforts.
Acts as Data Quality representative on a variety of initiatives.
Acts as an ambassador of Data Quality and Risk Management.
Participates in various research/remediation efforts as needed by department.
Acts as a champion for enterprise wide operational excellence program for data management including setting strategy, training, and communication.
Mentor other less tenured data control analysts.
Responsible for reporting risks that are identified to the appropriate team and/or management. Additionally, responsible for managing, monitoring and reporting risks within the scope of your work area, to include, but not limited to Information Security risks.
Actively supports our CO-OP culture and embraces our core values of Work as Partners, Communicate Openly and Honestly, Demonstrate Excellence and Champion Change in all interactions.
What You’ll Need to Succeed
Bachelor’s degree in related field plus minimum of five years’ experience in data quality, data management or risk management.
Proven history of successful risk and control management and/or Operations management and process improvement.
A detailed understanding of data from a regulatory, policy, and standards related perspective.
Ability to coach, mentor and lead others in data governance, risk and quality areas of improvement.
Ability to communicate at an Executive level including oral and written skills.
Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally across different areas including Operations, Technology, and Risk.
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Able to work independently and make sound, fact-based decisions.
Ability to convey information to all levels of the organization in a clear, focused, and concise manner.
Ability to clearly and effectively understand and teach complex concepts to a variety of audiences.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects and responsibilities.
Self-starter with strong work ethic, enthusiasm and ability to energize others.
Ability to implement new ideas and influence others.
MS Office including Visio.
Why Join CO-OP?


You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP’s commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver. We are committed to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their value; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. Our vast technological ecosystem facilitates more than 6.5 billion transactions every year and equips credit unions of all sizes to deepen member engagement and prosper in the fast-paced world of fintech.

The Perks
Fun, challenging and, collaborative work environment with passionate colleagues that care deeply about the intersection of technology and human-centered financial services.
Great Work/Life Benefits – Paid Time Off (PTO), Maternity, Parental, Family Care, Adoption Leave Programs, Community Volunteer Time Off, and 10 Paid Holidays.
Health benefits – medical, dental, & vision plus wellness programs and gym reimbursements.
401K with generous company match.
Tuition reimbursement.

At TrialCard, our passion is success - success for clients, success for us. You’ll notice who comes first. We’re committed to providing solutions, through innovation and unparalleled customer support, to the pharmaceutical industry to improve access and affordability of their medicines to patients. We work tirelessly on the behalf of our clients, because when they succeed, so do we.
That’s not to say we are all work and no play. TrialCard is an open workplace with fun, energetic people united for a common purpose. In fact, we don’t even refer to each other as employees. We’re team members. We foster a culture that encourages individual personality.
The Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst will test from a customer perspective, utilizing manual tools. During the development cycle, the QA Analyst will work closely with the Software Developers, Product Management, and Customer Support to understand customer usage models, identify use cases, create test plans and test cases, and then execute tests. Additionally, they will be responsible for identifying and creating test automation solutions.

The ideal candidate will have great knowledge of software QA best practices, including real world experience of a variety of different testing protocols, tools and metrics. They will be expected to work with the development team in driving the software development process toward quality-centric methodologies.

As an integral member of an agile development team, your main goal is to ensure that quality is an essential part of our internal applications.
Be a patient advocate that ensures our patients have the most user-friendly user experience of our applications by identifying gaps in requirements and acceptance criteria.
Deliver and execute effective and efficient test methods and use case scenarios.
Create, maintain and execute regression suites and drive to automation where possible to ensure the greatest coverage with the least manual effort
Identify and communicate quality process improvements focused on all test requirements.

Hunger to learn in a fast-pace environment. Able to synthesize well from partial information sources. Not afraid to identify and ask the awkward questions.
Passion for Quality Assurance balanced with the business need to release software sooner than later.
Able to see the big picture as well as perform detailed analyses.
Self-directed and goal oriented who can grasp difficult concepts.
Strong technical, logic and reasoning skills along with clear and effective verbal and written communication skills for technical and non-technical staff.
Proven ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a team-oriented, collaborative workplace.
Experience with Web application testing including cross-browser experience.
Experience with testing strategies, planning, creation, and execution in an agile environment along with continuous integration practices.
Collaborate with an agile software development and QA team to coordinate and review QA and test activities.
Proactively communicate with peers, management, and cross-functional teams to address and resolve issues.
Solid knowledge of current Quality Assurance methodologies, best practices, and tool sets. Experience with MS TFS, ServiceNow, MSSQL is a plus.
Understanding of Relational database design is plus.
Hands on experience with automated testing using Postman and TestCafe is a plus.
Any other tasks or projects as assigned by immediate supervisor.

BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience in an IT field.
3+ years’ in quality assurance analyst in Information Technology.

Strong detail oriented skills.
