Job Title: Quality Control Analyst I - Sample Control (Contract)
Job Description:
Quality Control Analyst – QC Sample Control

Join bluebird bio's enthusiastic and collaborative team by contributing to the overall success of our novel gene therapy approach. We seek a QC Analyst to support establishing new commercial level GMP testing laboratories for release and stability for multiple stages of our gene therapy products. This position will focus on laboratory operations support activities, including sample management receipt, aliquoting, storage, distribution, shipping, purchasing supplies, reagent preparation, and BSC & instrument calibration & maintenance coordination supporting GMP systems to ensure a compliant Quality Control lab. The candidate will interface with Quality Assurance, Facilities, Manufacturing, and other cross-functional teams as required. cGMP will be utilized in the role.

About the Role:

· Primary function is to prepare for, receive, aliquot, appropriately store, and ship samples

· Maintenance of sample inventory logs and distribution of samples to testing labs

· Maintain, schedule, coordinate, and participate in equipment / instrument maintenance and calibration

· Author SOPs/Forms with management guidance

· Support laboratory deviations and investigations (IA, OOS, AR)

· Participate in equipment validations with guidance

· Support operational systems (equipment/instrument maintenance/calibration, equipment alarm monitoring, sample handling/tracking, data integrity/control, cGMP documentation, and laboratory audit preparation)

· Support CAPA/Continuous Improvement Initiatives

· Manage and monitor inventory of lab supply's and consumables

About You:

· BS or AS with 2+ years in experience in a cGMP environment is preferred

· Laboratory or manufacturing experience preferred

· Must follow SOP instruction and record data contemporaneously using GDP (Good Documentation Practices)

· Must be able to recognize deviation from written procedure and report to management

· Superb organizational, analytical, and communications skills and "do-what-it-takes" attitude

· A passion for addressing the critical unmet medical needs of patients

· Self-directed individual who demonstrates ability to work with limited direction in a fast-paced, goal-oriented environment

· Provide exemplary customer service

· Willingness to embrace and demonstrate the principles of the bluebird bio culture:

Sales/Commercial Analyst

Job Description:
Job Description

CACI has an outstanding opportunity for select Geospatial Intelligence Analysts that want to make a difference in the defense of the nation by applying their talents and experience in a fast-paced dynamic environment in support of US Special Operations Command. The opportunity is limited to those that have the operational and technical experience, and skills to effectively apply geospatial practices in support of real-world operations. You will be an integral part of a selective professional geospatial team that is directly part of the operational planning cycle to support mission success. This position is in support of a Department of Defense (DoD) organization located in Fayetteville, NC.

You will perform full spectrum geospatial analysis in support of complex geospatial, topographic, and imagery problem sets in support of global real-world operations. You will be required to communicate analytical assessments clearly and succinctly both written and orally, and present analysis products from creative analytical techniques in an operational environment. You will use their technical expertise and experience of Processing, Exploitation, and Dissemination (PED) of ground feature data and remotely sensed data such as Multi-Spectral Imagery (MSI), Light Detection and Ranging (LiDAR), and Electro-Optical Imagery to support the operational customer. You will be required to work in dynamic fast paced environments that requires both team interaction and individual efforts. You must be experienced in interfacing with both internal and external leadership.

Specifically, the Geospatial Intelligence Analyst will be responsible to fuse mutli-discipline intelligence sources to provide accurate and timely geospatial analysis in direct support of multiple geographically dispersed DoD organizations. You are the interface to the operational elements to ensure the operational commanders goals are accomplished through the synchronization of the geospatial enterprise. You will use your knowledge and intelligence acumen to provide critical recommendations to operational decision makers. You will work the full spectrum of the problem set utilizing advanced geospatial capabilities and techniques to complete the mission. You will be challenged daily to expand your knowledge and understanding of operational application of geospatial practices with multiple disciplines.

Required:
Top Secret Clearance AND meet the requirements of DCID 6/4
Minimum of six years of analytical experience within DOD or relevant non-DOD employers, with four out of the previous six years of actual hands on experience
Experience directly supporting military operations in both garrison and deployed environments
Experience and ability to interact professionally with senior leaders of internal and external organizations
Experience and working knowledge of geospatial and intelligence data management within a variety of OGC compliant applications and databases
Experience and proficiency utilizing GIS applications and intelligence related automation to support analytical efforts and product development
Experience with imagery analysis and production to include a broad understanding of collection processes and management
Experience with geospatial processing and development of new methodologies to solve complex tactical intelligence problems.
Desired:
Experience in the production of fused multi-discipline geospatial assessments
Experience and knowledge of geospatial techniques in the Find Fix Finish Exploit Analyze (F3EA) cycle
Working knowledge of computer scripting languages such as Python, Java Script, HTML, R, or SAS

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of more than $20 billion and approximately 70,000 employees globally. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics, deliver medicines to market and increase laboratory productivity.

Position Summary:

A business analyst (BA) works as a liaison between IT and the business functions they support. A successful BA combines in-depth functional domain knowledge and technical aptitude with a passion for serving others and driving continuous improvement. The business analyst requires a thorough understanding of business processes and expertise in the business systems that enable them. The BA gathers business requirements then designs and implements process and system improvements to drive continuous improvement in quality, capability, and efficiency. He or she provides business application support to colleagues across organizational levels, analyses system, data, and process problems and determines corrective actions, engaging directly with business partners and extended internal and external support teams as needed. This specific BA position supports the functional domain of commercial operations, which includes processes such as quotations, order management, customer care, order fulfillment, invoicing, and service.

Responsibilities:
Provide direct triage and troubleshooting support to colleagues and partner with internal and external teams to resolve user reported incidents and fulfill business requests
Analyze systems, data, and business processes to determine the root cause of issues (e.g. systems logic, business process issues, data quality, etc.) and communicate findings to business and IT colleagues
Communicate and collaborate with users to analyze business needs and translate into functional design requirements
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to evaluate, design, and recommend business process improvements and system enhancements
Serve as the conduit between the business community and the broader IT team for production support as well as the requirements, design, testing and implementation phases of small, medium, and large projects
Comply with company's Global IT Policies & Procedures
Perform other duties as assigned
Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
3+ years of Customer-facing experience in a fast-paced office environment
Higher education or bachelor's degree preferred
Commercial systems and application experience required, ERP and CRM preferred
Comfortable working with colleagues in person and using remote collaboration tools with offsite or offshore teams
Ability to explain and champion technical concepts clearly and concisely to stakeholders
Ability to perform root cause analysis and develop solutions to address complex problems or issues
Ability to assume and complete assignments independently and on time
Strong analytical and project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application requirements
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of leaders, subject matter experts, end users and developers
Desirable Qualifications:
Experience working in multiple ERPs including SAP, Baan, Macola or other comparable systems
Salesforce.com and Oracle CPQ or experience with other comparable systems
Experience with product configuration and master data management processes
Professional certifications for relevant applications or business functions
Familiarity with query languages, business intelligence tools, and data analysis methods
Knowledge of Microsoft O365 suite including advanced collaboration tools like Teams, Planner, To Do or other comparable applications
Understanding of process modeling principles, methods, and tools
Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria:
Must be able to balance multiple concurrent priorities and maintain persistent customer focus
Must have strong written and oral communication skills
Must be results driven with excellent attention to detail
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission-enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Requisition ID: 1724818

Quality Control Analyst – Raw Materials

Join bluebird bio's enthusiastic and collaborative team by contributing to the overall success of our novel gene therapy approach. We seek an experienced Quality Control Analyst to support establishing new commercial-level GMP testing laboratories performing raw materials sampling, inspection and release testing for multiple stages of our gene therapy and immune oncology products. This includes receipt, inspection, sampling, testing, data review, working with contract testing laboratories, and implementation of GMP operational support systems ensuring a compliant raw material testing program. The candidate will interface with multiple Quality Control functions to support manufacturing. In addition, the individuals will collaborate with Quality Assurance, Supply Chain/Warehouse, Manufacturing, and other cross-functional teams as required. An awareness of cGMP, operational and technical background in raw materials testing and USP, PhEur. monographs will be utilized in the role. This position will require hands on laboratory time.

About the Role:

· Perform cGMP sampling, inspections and testing on raw materials and consumables

· Follow procedures and provide direction on deviations from the norms

· Review and evaluate raw data from a peer or technical review level of all analytical methods, as well as sample authorization.

· Author, review, and/or approve SOPs/policies and technical reports with general guidance

Position Summary:

The Product Intelligence Analysts will work under the mentorship and direction of the Product Intelligence Manager to carry out analytics duties. This position contributes to the overall success of the Product Intelligence Team by performing essential functions that provide the team with accurate and timely data analysis for Marketing, Product, and Sales stakeholders. Further, the position will provide an opportunity to identify areas of process improvement and empower the individual to make recommendations in the areas of internal analytics.

Major Responsibilities:
Assist in the preparation of various business dashboards for product teams
Participate in the process of data integration for strategy initiatives
Aid in the preparation and modifications of quantitative value propositions
Perform market research for new and established markets (e.g. competitive intelligence)
Assist the team in gathering and reviewing information for key performance indicators
Develop analytical skills by performing an in-depth review and analysis of key manufacturers and retailers
Work closely with Product Intelligence team members on a variety of projects to identify and execute continuous improvement efforts to drive savings in process and operational execution
Collaborate with other team members on strategic projects that grow revenue and spur innovation
Assist in pricing and renewal support alongside finance business partners

A self-motivated individual able to multi-task and work well with other professionals

Knowledge of programming languages, such as Python, R, and SQL
Ability to perform detailed work with qualitative and quantitative data sets that produce actionable insights
Demonstrates strong oral and written communication skills

Must be comfortable working in a team environment

Communication: Giving and receiving messages and information in written, oral, and visual formats in a clear and concise way for a complete understanding of meaning and intent.
Urgency: Transfers mission to action by acting clearly and decisively to analyze and implement solutions regardless of pressure or uncertainty and maintains a sense of urgency to complete tasks, accomplish goals, and act in ambiguous and complex situations.
Analytical and Critical Thinking: Ability to tackle a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach.
Problem Solving: Gathers and analyzes information to generate and evaluate potential solutions to problems, issues and challenges while weighing the accuracy and relevance of the facts, data and information.
Influential Communication: Fosters open communication, speaks truthfully and with one voice through clear and consistent messages, listens to others and values all opinions while acting in a respectful manner to influence an outcome, impact, or effect, and responds appropriately to concerns of others.
Inclusivity: Actively seeks to include and engage everyone regardless of backgrounds, cultures, or demographics to leverage the wealth of knowledge, insights and perspectives of a diverse workplace to spark creativity and propel innovation in an open and trusting environment.
Vision and Strategy: Takes a long-term view and builds a shared vision with others while positioning the organization for future success by identifying new opportunities, formulating objectives and priorities, and implementing plans consistent with the long-term interest of the organization in a global environment.
Collaboration: Works collaboratively with others to achieve group goals and objectives.

Position Summary
Position Summary:

This position is open to locations in the following States: Cary, NC; Austin, TX; Mayfield Heights, OH; San Jose, CA or Milwaukee, WI.

Looking for talented individuals to join our collaborative team as we rapidly expand our best-in-class solution capabilities in the Industrial Internet of Things space. Targeting candidates excited to work with new and emerging IIOT, advanced analytic, and augmented reality technologies. Seeking people who have proven capabilities in extracting and unveiling the value behind data, the desire to consult with clients to understand and guide their IIOT journey, and the willingness to collaboratively be an implementer of these solutions.
Essential Functions:

This role will be part of a team developing and deploying our client’s IIOT platforms, analytic and machine learning applications, and augmented reality experiences. Our software engineers will use the ThingWorx IIOT foundation for our services that will be deployed using standard apps, customized solutions, and extended with additional FactoryTalk InnovationSuite technologies.

Technical Analyst:
This role will focus on supporting all disciplines of the Analytics Solutions Group (IIOT, Advanced Analytics, and Augmented Reality) through the installation and management of internal environments for purposes of training, evaluation, customer demonstration and pilots. In addition, this role will develop standardized installation procedures and execute client software installations for FactoryTalk InnovationSuite implementations. Related activities include software installation, configuration, network and security integration, database management, and technical support. In addition to technical expertise, the role requires strong collaboration, communication, and administrative skills. Some client travel is expected, but most of the client work will be performed remote from a Rockwell office.

Functional:
• Installs, manages and administers all internal FactoryTalk InnovationSuite environments (ThingWorx and FactoryTalk Analytics) to ensure availability for team use in prototypes, customer demos and pilot activities
• Develops and maintains installation and support documentation covering internal implementations
• Develops and maintains procedures, installation routines and master images for customer installations of FactoryTalk InnovationSuite applications
• Coordinates with project team members (client, Project Manager, Architect, Software Engineer) to capture and confirm business requirements related to the client application installation and configuration
• Installs and tests FactoryTalk InnovationSuite applications at client sites (on-prem or cloud-based), in conjunction with project team and client resources
• Guides and coaches client team on application security management
• Understands IT/OT industry-specific applications, particularly around Information Solutions, Analytics and MES.

Teamwork:
• Displays strong teamwork, client service and organizational skills
• Creates and presents solutions to clients at multiple levels
• Uses open and appropriate means of communication with management, stakeholders and peers on work status, risks, issues and opportunities

Interpersonal:
• Uses creative and innovative approaches to deliver value to both clients and the company
• Understands and manages business complexity and project interdependencies
• Consistently applies problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking abilities for project success
• Willingly accepts coaching and mentoring from more experienced resources
• Actively pursues personal continuous learning, development of skills and knowledge

EOE, M/F/Disable, Vet

Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:

• Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or Engineering
• Willing and able to travel and work at client sites. Travel can vary on assignment from 0% to 100% but can average 30%.
• Legal authorization to work in the US is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.

Desired Qualifications:

• Experience with the following:
o Application software installation, configuration and maintenance - and the discipline to document and track procedures and activities
o Networking, VMWare environments, and operating systems (Windows server, Linux varieties)
o Platform management activities including application and database backup and restore functions, user management and security integration (ActiveDirectory and SSO concepts)
o Cloud hosting services and subscription management
o Agile development methodologies
• Familiarity with:
o Java, JavaScript, Python, and related development languages
o Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server and Postgres database platforms – SQL and database administration
• At least 2 years technical consulting experience with project management responsibilities
• Demonstrated industry domain experience in one of Rockwell’s core customer segments (Automotive, Mining, Pharma, CPG, etc.)
• Experience with the design and configuration of Rockwell Automation FactoryTalk Analytics, ProductionCentre Application Suites (CPG Suite or PharmaSuite), PTC ThingWorx, Vuforia & Kepware.
• Familiarity with FactoryTalk Historian / OSISoft PI

TIAA is a unique financial partner. NON-EMPLOYEE POSITION SUMMARY:

The anticipated term of this engagement will be 12 months. This term could be extended based on company business needs.

This is a Non-Employee Contingent Worker Role providing services for TIAA’s family of companies and will be employed by TIAA's preferred 3rd Party Supplier. As a Non-Employee CW, duties will include, but not be limited to, providing full life cycle analysis and development of end-to-end business and IT processes. The Analyst will work as part of an IT development team with other technology leaders, development staff and technical/business analysts to create technical solutions and will be responsible for communicating progress, technical issues and issue resolutions.

· Provide forecasts of technical efforts using accepted forecasting techniques

· Participate in delivery of fully-tested applications or components of more complex applications for system and acceptance Testing

Job Title: Senior Cybersecurity Analyst, Identity Access Management
Job Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:
TIAA is a unique financial partner. With an award-winning track record for consistent performance, TIAA is the leading provider of financial services in the academic, research, medical, cultural and government fields. TIAA has $1 trillion in assets under management (as of 9/30/2018) and offers a wide range of financial solutions, including investing, banking, advice and guidance, and retirement services.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The primary function of this position is to ensure applications and platforms within the TIAA environment adhere to security standards. In the event an application or platform does not meet these standards, the analyst’s role is to devise a remediation plan to achieve security compliance. This involves working with application/platform owners to apply security controls within the respective application. Other duties include, but are not limited to, managing user access within centralized applications in queue format, educating end users regarding security protocols and properly requesting access, analyzing trends to drive process reform, and write standard operating procedures for centralized applications. Candidates must be comfortable interfacing with senior executives, providing exceptional customer experience, and delivering value to the business.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Application Scoping
Any application seeking to on-board to CyberArk must go through scoping and it is the duty of the CyberArk operations analyst to complete this process. The process involves guiding the user through completing a questionnaire about their application, performing an account analysis, evaluating the questionnaire and account analysis, and then determining the use case the application will fall under for integration with CyberArk (for standard use cases only).
Processing CyberArk Tasks
CyberArk operations team members are expected to process CyberArk related tasks according to standard operating procedures. These tasks include, but may not be limited to, the following:
Safe creation
Safe access
Vaulting of accounts
Creating CyberArk objects for AIM integration
Host whitelisting
Application scoping and on-boarding
CyberArk clean-up and remediation
Privileged account lifecycle management
Processing CyberArk Incidents
CyberArk operations team members are expected to process CyberArk related incidents according to standard operating procedures. These incidents include troubleshooting, but may not be limited to, the following:
CyberArk integration errors
User access
Customer Interaction
CyberArk operations team members will be in contact with application teams on a regular basis. Team members are expected to communicate processes and answer questions clearly.
On-call Support
CyberArk on-call support rotates between analysts on a scheduled basis. Production incidents that do not occur during normal business hours will result in staff engagement.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Required Skills
3 or more years of work experience in an Identity and Access Management position
5 or more years of work experience in an Information Technology position
Desired Skills
Four year degree preferred
CyberArk Enterprise Password Vault, Application Identity Manager, and Conjur experience
Experience with ServiceNow, Sailpoint, and AWS
Scripting experience (Python, PowerShell, etc.)
Experience with log based troubleshooting using Splunk or a similar tool
Experience analyzing data and developing meaningful metrics
Knowledge in designing access models to secure a platform or application
Knowledge of implementing a privileged access model for a platform or application
Strong documentation and problem solving skills
Highly self-motivated, directed, and can work independently without supervision in a high-pressure environment
Exceptional leadership skills and interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning skills
Experience working in and guiding a team-oriented and collaborative IT environment

You will work on-site within in our Raleigh, NC office, and will be joining a team that maintains the industry's most comprehensive and well-respected source of data & intelligence on Capital Markets institutions and professionals. This position will give you first-hand exposure to the global capital markets industry, with a focus on North American investors. You will work on the collection of comprehensive and accurate information for our global roster of corporate and capital markets clients. You will develop and maintain relationships with equity and fixed income buy-side investors that include hedge funds, mutual funds, pension funds, etc. This role is an exciting opportunity to be a part of a business line with a global presence and client base that is a leader in its space. You will gain a variety of business skills, exposure to various aspects of the capital markets, as well as competency in research & analysis. This is an exciting opportunity for a hardworking, individual to be part of an industry leading, global organization at what is arguably the most exciting time in the evolution of our company.

What youll work on:

• Conduct telephonic research on buy-side institutions and professionals

• Establish and maintain relationships with investment professionals

• Update and maintain a universe of buy-side institutions and professionals

• Analyze and interpret data on institutional investors to formulate descriptions of investment strategies that will be included in buy-side company profiles

• Handle client inquiries regarding IHS Markits industry-leading information

• Collaborate and work closely with colleagues across IHS Markits global offices

• Work within a framework that follows Agile principles

• Excellent communication and persuasion skills, specifically over the telephone

• Strong critical thinking, analytical skills and attention to detail

• Work hours align with stock market operation hours

• Strong writing skills

• Ability to multi-task and excel in a dynamic environment

• A strong sense of ownership over the work you produce, and an unwavering need to do your absolute best on every tasks

• Excellent experience with the Microsoft Office Suite of tools: MSExcel, MSWord, and Outlook

Social Media Marketing Analyst


JOB DESCRIPTION

When scrolling through your social media feed, are you ever surprised at how timely and relevant the sponsored advertisements are? Have you ever wondered how those ads are created and why you were targeted for that specific campaign? Social Media platforms allow a unique window into the lives of consumers; you will be able to meet consumers where they are and help our clients grow their businesses by creating eye-catching, interesting, timely, and relevant suggestions of retail products for consumers to purchase.

Our Social Media Team constructs, manages, optimizes, and reports the performance of the sponsored ads that users see while browsing platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, and Snapchat. Our team has an immediate opening for a smart, creative, and proactive team player to create, manage and optimize successful Social Media Paid Advertising Campaigns for a portfolio of clients.

If you are searching for a position in paid social media digital marketing where you can showcase your strong analytical and creative skills, this may be the position for you!

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze the performance of all social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, and Snapchat) by translating quantitative and qualitative data into comprehensible recommendations for the campaign strategy.
Implement successful bidding strategies for target audiences.
Use statistical analysis to draw conclusions about advertising campaigns and make changes accordingly.
Produce creative and eye-catching Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, and Snapchat advertisements (i.e. writing text, headlines and news feed link descriptions) in order to drive qualified visitors to clients’ websites.
Meet clients’ goals and expectations by performing ad creative testing and audience analysis.
Communicate with clients on a regular basis to keep them in the know about timelines, budgets, reporting, and analysis.
Present data analysis to clients via Google Slides and Google Data Studio.
Continually monitor, revise and optimize advertising campaigns as necessary.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Social Media Advertising Team Lead.

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, Statistics or a related field from an accredited university
2 years of previous experience managing paid social media campaigns
High level of proficiency in Excel
Intense intellectual curiosity, proven leadership experience, and excellent organization and prioritization skills
Agency experience preferred

You have a keen attention to detail and regularly act with a sense of urgency. You own your responsibilities and nothing in the universe will get in the way of delivering quality work on time, every time. You blend technical ability with business acumen and understand how the accounting function supports Passport's massive goals.

You thrive in a changing, fast-paced environment where complex problems require cross-functional solutions. You love working with teams and are an effective communicator, both written and verbal. You quickly assimilate information and are able to connect Passport's long-term vision to near-term objectives.

You are a self-starter and nothing slips through the cracks when you run a project. You are inquisitive and like to ask a lot of questions you have an insatiable curiosity to learn and master each area of our business.

Passport is transforming mobility management for cities, empowering them to create more livable and equitable communities. Trusted by 1,000 cities, universities and agencies, including Chicago, Toronto, London, Los Angeles, and Miami, Passport is one of the fastest-growing companies on the Inc. 5000 and Deloitte Technology Fast 500 lists. Passport is backed by Rho Capital Partners, H.I.G. Growth Partners, ThornTree Capital Partners, Bain Capital Ventures, Grotech Ventures, MK Capital, and Relevance Capital. Analyst: Business Intelligence/Competitive Intelligence

Bulletin Intelligence, Remote- U.S.

Bulletin Intelligence:

A news-monitoring and analysis boutique within Cision, Bulletin creates bespoke, expert-curated briefings and dashboards for approximately 150 of the most demanding clients in the world; chief executives who are household names, and their Comms and other teams. Client contracts are for as much as $1mm per year. Annual client-retention rates are typically in the mid-90% range. Bulletin was acquired by Cision in March 2017.

Location:

This role is completely remote. Bulletin’s primary office is in Reston, VA. The company’s analysts are able to use the company’s cloud-based software to work anywhere in the U.S. that has a high-speed internet connection.

Responsibilities:

Our Analysts live at the intersection of digital information, public policy and markets and apply layers of sophisticated human judgment to the information explosion in order to deliver the essence of what our clients -- a who’s who of government and corporate leaders -- need to know to start their day.

Analysts work overnight (10pm - 6am, on average) utilizing complex proprietary software, to scour tens of thousands of sources – mostly news, but also white papers, financial analyst reports, market research, business opportunities, etc. – and distill their core findings into quick-read briefing. Each briefing service is created specifically for each client, focused on (if govt) its unique mission and (if corporate) its company, competitors and industry.

Successful analysts distinguish between critical, important and non-essential information and must be able to provide insightful briefings that allow senior business executives to begin their day fully prepared. You will be part of a top team using cutting-edge technology in order to research and analyze changing events and information trends.

Qualifications:
Excellent writing and editing ability.
Strong skills in competitive-intelligence analysis.
Understanding the information needs of chief executives and their teams.
Excellent computer skills and comfort learning advanced technical tools.
Ability to work overnight and under tight deadlines.
Demonstrated intellect and curiosity, often via a bachelor’s degree from a leading university; MBA, JD or industry-specific advanced degree helpful.
US citizen or permanent resident.
A plus: fluency in any non-English language often used in business.

*Overview**
The Data Analyst is classified as a senior-level position and requires advanced expertise in modern statistical processes and acute analytical prowess. The incumbent will helm GoRaleigh's entire statistical database and will be tasked with instituting operational and financial transit programs. The Data Analyst will then utilize these tools to improve and elevate company procedure and performance. Will provide a lead role in the preparation and submission of the National Transit Data Report and North Carolina Department of Transportation Reports for the City of Raleigh's transit system.
*Responsibilities**
+ Report data regarding service provided, service consumed, and service resources.

+ Provide relevant transit statistics such as: Vehicle Revenue Hours (VRH), Vehicle Revenue Miles (VRM), Unlinked Passenger Trips (UPT), Passenger Miles Traveled (PMT), and the total count of individual vehicle boarding.

+ Collect financial data such as Operating Expenses (OE) for each mode operated, as well as the sources of funds used to support transit service.

+ Assemble data related to transit staffing levels, and asset data for fleets and facilities.

+ Perform advanced professional analysis and oversight of financial transit programs.

+ Conduct detailed analysis on data used across business units to evaluate and improve

+ Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams

+ Establish appreciation and adherence to data quality management principles, including metadata, lineage, and business definitions.

+ Provide support to tech teams relating to security mechanism management and data access governance.

+ Provide informed, professional consultation to management and partner organizations.

+ Review, utilize, and maintain current Federal Transit Authority processes and statistics.

Other duties as required.
*Qualifications**
+ Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of related education and experience.

+ Two years of relevant work experience.

+ Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel.

+ Capable of identifying outliers and analyzing financial and operational data.

+ Proficient in independently developing and implementing multiple program objectives.

+ Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team.

+ Financial Information Technology experience strongly preferred.

+ Project Management Professional (PMP) is advantageous.
*Experience preferred:** Transportation
*Pre-Employment Requirements:**
Drug testing and background check
*Physical Requirements:**
+ 100% of work is accomplished indoors

+ Long periods sitting in front of a computer

Job Description:
We have a sign on our wall as constant reminder to work hard, stay disciplined and deliver awesome software for our customers. We also want our team to love to come to work! We encourage that through great people, a fantastic collaborative team environment, constant innovation with new technology and processes, flexible schedules, great office space, weekly happy hours, free parking, and much, much more. Ready to go? We are!

Job Description

You will be an integral part of a software delivery feature team in a fast moving, outcome-oriented company. Our teams are agile, automated and delivery focused. To be a part of a Kingsmen team, you need to love delivering software. In our software delivery model, the Business Analyst joins our proven, high-caliber team to design and deliver quality software solutions. This role will manage relationships with client product owners and break down high level client requirements into detailed features/functions/stories for our delivery teams. Planning, design and development work in this operating model is rigorous, disciplined and uses leading-edge technologies to develop simple & efficient solutions. If you love delivering software and are up to the challenge, then we would love to hear from you!

Responsibilities Include
Work with Product Owner to fully understand business processes solving for and translate into detailed system design requirements.
Effectively communicate the functional requirements with the technical team and UX.
Ability to communicate / document system flow, business rules and overall design to product owner and business users to confirm accuracy and completeness.
Manage work items in Rally (Functions / Stories).
Decompose requirements into specific and actionable development stories with the consultation of the development team(s). Associated activities include:
- Breaking out Functions into detailed stories with clear acceptance criteria that covers all required details to reduce communication gaps.

- Story administrative maintenance (updates to story point sizing, sequencing, etc.)

- Story backlog administration (organization of bodies of related work, applying Epic labels, etc.)
Functional testing of completed user stories as well as regression testing of all existing system functionality.
Provide ongoing consultation and clarification of the Features and Stories to development team in order to ensure their understanding of the stories and associated business goals.
Assist business with system documentation and training guides.
Required Skills and Experience
Experience working in a mature agile environment
Experience working with teams building user facing web applications
Basic SQL skills, comfortable working with data, both analyzing existing data sets, as well as validating test results or triaging issues by inspecting data in the database
Experience with agile tools such as Rally or Jira
Experience decomposing work into Features/Functions/Stories
Ability to write user stories and acceptance criteria
Ability to work with UX design team and include product design
Knowledge or understanding of how systems work. Exposure to application components: UI, web services, server architecture, system architecture, databases
Strong linear focus: Should be able to walk through detail for planning and executing a sprint
Very strong communication – ability to articulate complex problems to internal team, as well as confidence in effectively communicating with senior level stakeholders
Strong emotional intelligence - should be very efficient in identifying with their target audience and communicating appropriately.
Highly organized, self-starter, with strong analytical skills
The Kingsmen Software Stack

View our entire stack on Stackshare: https://stackshare.io/kingsmen-software/kingsmen-software

Process Overview

When you submit your resume for this opportunity, it won't just land in the HR abyss. Within the first few days, it will be personally reviewed by members of Kingsmen's leadership and hiring teams. If we see a potential fit, we'll contact you to kick off the process. We'll start with a brief phone conversation to learn about your overall career objectives, strengths, and interests, and to share some more info on the position. We'll then run through a quick online skills assessment to make sure you'll have the tools to excel from day one on our technology platform.

At the next step in the process, we'll have you meet directly with members of our executive and delivery teams for a deep dive into your professional story and our corporate culture and values. We will also work with you to get some reference feedback that will help to make sure you'll be set up for success in this position, based on your career experience and track record of high performance. And we will provide the opportunity for you to meet with other Kingsmen technology folks who will talk more with you about the specific traits, skills, and competencies that will drive your success with us and our clients.

Through this process, you'll get deep insights into the mission and objectives of the position, and together we'll build a clear picture of how it lines up with your capabilities and interests. It might take a couple more steps and a few more days than you're used to investing with other job evaluation processes, but we promise it will pay off! By the job offer stage, we will have a mutual understanding of how well the position matches up with your career path and professional objectives, as well as shared confidence that you'll find continued professional success and growth with us and our clients.

World leader in the field of in vitro diagnostics for over 55 years, bioMérieux conceives, develops, produces and markets diagnostics solutions (systems, reagents, software and services) intended for clinical and industrial applications, which determine the origin of a disease or a contamination to improve the health of patients and insure consumer safety.

bioMérieux is present in 43 countries and servces more than 160 countries with the support of a large network of distributors. Its corporate headquarters are located in Marcy l’Etoile, near Lyon, in France.

Joining bioMérieux, is choosing to join an innovative company with a long term vision, committed to the service of public health and carried out with a humanistic corporate culture.

We look for candidates whose motivation is to invest in themselves, in the projects of the future, and to participate in a collective adventure led by a pioneering spirit.

We have the commitment to offer our collaborators a working environment which encourages team spirit, with priority given to training and development with international career opportunities.

Our Group offers numerous possibilities: so come and join the 11,200 bioMérieux employees who have already identified with these values!

bioMerieux has an internship opportunity for the role of QC Analyst in Durham, North Carolina.

The Intern QC Analyst performs routine tests per standard operating procedures. Tests may be raw materials, intermediates, environmental samples, finished goods, or stability samples submitted to the laboratory.

They document all test results in compliance with procedures and GDP requirements, maintain compliance with SOPs, GLP, GMP, and HSE requirements, maintain laboratory equipment in compliance with procedures and GLP requirements, and enter data into LIMS system.

Skills and Abilities
Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
Willingness to learn, be mentored, and excel
Desire to contribute and improve design of new and existing scientific instrumentation products
Exceptional customer focus and team player
Desire to teach other life sciences colleagues about technology in area of expertise

Qualifications
Students currently enrolled in classes leading to an accredited degree in Microbiology, Biochemistry, or Science life.
Some experience in microbiology laboratory.
At least a 2.7 GPA

We are designed for simplicity, optimized to protect, created to embrace future opportunity, and open to enrich choice. We are the data authority for hybrid cloud, and we are helping our customers realize the full potential of their data.

We’ve built a Data Fabric for a data-driven world – to simplify and integrate data management across the resources that are best for the business. With the Data Fabric, our customers can harness the power of cloud data services, build cloud infrastructures, and modernize storage through data management.
Job Summary
As a Sales Compensation Analyst, you will be responsible for the administrative operations of Sales Compensation. This role will support Sales Compensation Plan implementation, maintain commissioned participant records in the Sales Compensation Systems, validate monthly sales commission payments. To successfully accomplish these goals, this role will closely work with the Geo/Regional Sales Operations and Human Resources, and Finance. Also as part of the Global Sales Compensation team, this role will involve in various project-driven activities.
Job Requirements
Administration of Sales Participant data in the Sales Compensation system working with regional Sales Operations and Sales Management.
Validating sales compensation data for accuracy and consistency with the corporate Sales Compensation policies and guidelines.
Collaborating with HQ Commission Accounting in validating Commission Data Report, manual data adjustment, and manual deposits on a monthly basis to ensure timely and accurate payments.
Supporting non-revenue driven measurement such as MBO and Milestone Objectives in terms of record validation and payments.
Collaborating with regional Sales Operations and Sales Management to timely resolve sales compensation issues in line with the corporate policies and guidelines.
Providing support in implementing Compensation plans for all commissioned employees, and ensuring that plans are executed per Compensation Plan Policy and guidelines.
Providing administrative assistance occasionally for Sales Promotions and Contests, in terms of accurate and timely payments.
Supporting guidance and training to Field Sales team surrounding Compensation-related processes, procedures and program details.
Providing assistance for quarterly compensation health check analysis to the sales leadership
Help to ensure compliance with SOX for our compensation documents and programs.
Education
Bachelor Degree in Business with a minimum of 4 years in sales compensation, sales operations, finance with a focus on sales incentive pay, process and design.
In depth knowledge of sales compensation plan design, principles and best practices
Independent, self-starter who can work cross functionally and build strong working relationships with internal departments.
Hard working and diligent personality with strong attention to detail.
Required to meet critical deadlines while maintaining organization and efficiency.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good analytical mind and skills to change data into information.
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)
SAP Commissions (formerly Callidus) experience

We place importance in trust, integrity, teamwork, and caring above all else. NetApp is a place where people are empowered to make a difference. Empowered to innovate. Empowered to collaborate. Empowered to help ourselves and others be data-driven and change the world. We take care of each other, our customers, our partners, and our communities simply because it’s the right thing to do.

We work hard but also recognize the importance of work-life balance for our employees because what’s important to them is important to us! Recently we implemented Family First, which encourages employees to take paid time off to bond with a new child (through birth or adoption) or to care for a family member with a serious health condition. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off per year to donate their time with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts and fitness centers. We also offer financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.

Join us and see what empowerment can do.

Job Description:
Job Description
Are you the next best Business Analyst? If so, we’re looking for you!

Our client is actively seeking a talented Business Analyst I to work at their location in Charlotte, NC. This is a 1-year assignment with the possibility of extending.

Job Overview:

Analyzes company functions, processes, and activities to improve computer-based business applications for the most effective use of money, materials, equipment, and people.

Key Responsibilities:
Manage the Client Alumni Network including daily monitoring of the Alumni and Business Hospitality mailbox and triage the resulting action items.
Monitoring of the Alumni Network pending registrations. Validate credentials against the HR table and approve as appropriate.
Consult with HR to disposition any alumni registration requests that are not on the approved table.
Oversight of the business hospitality dashboards to identify potential areas of noncompliance. Disposition any identified issues with the appropriate SME.
Develop business hospitality reports and make recommendations for program changes.
Support planning promotional/special events related to sponsored sporting events, coordinate handling of tickets and provide back-office support on various sports hospitality tasks.
Consolidate team information on the department SharePoint site including contracts, hospitality reports, program documents and other supporting documentation.
Support Director with review of monthly spend journal detail.
Assist department staff with planning and implementation of Alumni regional meetings and chapter meetings including mailings, distribution list management and quarterly calls.
Prepare draft agendas and presentations as needed to support SEIT, ERC, GCRM and Alumni meetings, etc.
Support other functions in the department as time permits
Requirements:
Utilizes available computer systems resources and personnel to carry out analysis to support management's quest for performance improvement.
Reviews and analyzes information, forecasts, methods, schedules, systems, processes, and procedures.
Determines most useful business solutions for the company.
Recommends alternative solutions to management as to courses of action that best meet the organization's goals.
Performs duties concerned with the design and improvement of computer-based business systems.
Works closely with senior managers to identify and solve a variety of computer-based business system problems.
Analyzes requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing business systems.
Confers with personnel of organizational units involved to analyze current operational procedures and identify problems.
Solicits from management symptoms of problem, formally defines the problem, breaks problem into component parts, and gathers information about each of these parts from a variety of sources. Selects the most appropriate analytical technique.
Utilizes several study techniques including simulation, linear and nonlinear programming, dynamic programming, queuing and other stochastic-process models, Markov decision processes, econometric methods, data envelopment analysis, neural networks, expert systems, decision analysis, and the analytic hierarchy process.
Writes description of business needs, business program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer-based business systems.
Reviews computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to determine if requested program or program change is possible within existing system.
Studies existing computer-based business systems to evaluate effectiveness, and develops new systems to improve production or workflow as required.
0-3 years’ experience.

Position Overview:

Facilitate and support a new product or enhancement by identifying requirements and acting as the liaison between the business users and the technology teams. Serve as subject matter expert and coordinate resources within the BA team for the integration of large-scale projects.

Essential Job Functions:
Lead and facilitate requirements gathering sessions to understand business unit needs and subsequently be able to translate those needs into tangible, consumable requirements by various audiences
Collect, review, analyze, and document system/user requirements from business users.
Author and maintain software requirements with user stories, use cases, functional requirements and requirements modeling techniques
Create test scenarios to be used in testing the business applications in order to verify that business unit requirements are incorporated into the system design
Drive projects through lifecycle to completion, exercising creative ways to get issues resolved. Act as a liaison between product and development organizations to build strong relationships and be a central point of contact for projects
Participate in meetings with stakeholders to gather and document requirements and explore potential solutions
Analyze information, including oral and written feedback from users, survey responses, and usage statistics to strengthen and validate requirements
Perform business analysis and reporting. Advise on the implementation of business processes
Assist in planning and designing business processes; assist in formulating recommendations to improve and support business activities
Such other activities as may be assigned by your manager

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, IT, Statistics, or Business related degree
Two to four (2-4) years of work experience required
Mortgage industry experience is a plus but not required
Familiarity with JIRA ticketing system is a plus
Experience with software development life cycle methodologies full life cycle projects
Prior experience translating business requirements to technical resources in supporting the project
Prior experience with large-scale project implementations that cross multiple departments using project management techniques
Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Critical-thinker with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Organized, detail-oriented and able to multi-task

The employee may be required to report to a different local office as a normal, contemplated, and mandated incident of their employment.

Sitting for long periods of time

Occasional contact with upset or irate individuals
Office personnel will be exposed to normal office environment
Personnel working from home office are expected to maintain a safe and productive environment, free from non-work related distractions

POSITION OVERVIEW

The PMO (Project Management Office) Solutions Analyst will be working within the Enterprise PMO and will be responsible for the planning, organization, training and support of enterprise project systems& tools, processes and reporting as well as providing support for fundamental project and program management activities. The scope of the PMO Solutions Analyst responsibilities will include implementation and support of enterprise project platform(s) for use across all departments to manage inter/intra departmental projects and initiatives. The PMO Solutions Analyst will assist in facilitating department and executive-level project intake, approval, prioritization, scheduling, capacity planning/resource management, hours and budget tracking, in-flight project health or status reporting, and issues management.

PRIMARY DUTIES& RESPONSIBILITIES
Provides assistance in implementing and supporting all enterprise platforms such as MS Project Server, Team Foundation Server, and SharePoint.
Acts as a central point of contact for issues and concerns related to all platforms, tools and reports supported by the PMO.
Provides advice and guidance on PMO best practices.
Creates, maintains, and implements processes and procedures (Traditional and/or Agile Framework) related to project management.
Create, maintain and support the PMO documentation repository which includes templates as well as training and procedural documentation.
Prepares various internal and external reports by gathering, analyzing, and summarizing data from Project Server, SharePoint, and other sources. Creates ad-hoc reports and queries as requested.
Prepares presentation materials and reports for executive management status and update meetings.
Supports tracking and reporting of project hours for monthly capitalization and status reporting. Reviews and audits project data for completeness and accuracy.
Provides new tool evaluations and vendor management as needed.
Provides coordination and assistance with pre-release, release day, and post-release communication and implementation tasks.
Provides analytic and administrative support to the Enterprise PMO and performs special projects as needed.
REQUIRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE & ABILITIES
Must be highly organized with exceptional attention to detail
Must have exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
Must have excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
Ability to effectively collaborate with others to ensure that project tracking and status reports are complete and accurate.
Ability to develop and maintain positive and professional business relationships across all areas and levels within the organization.
Demonstrated ability to work independently on multiple tasks while producing timely, high quality deliverables.
Demonstrated ability to remain effective, flexible, and productive in a dynamic and changing environment.
Ability and desire to improve processes and assist in establishing and implementing best practices
Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite including Microsoft Project, Project Server, SharePoint, and Visio.
Strong understanding and experience with Agile Scrum and traditional project management frameworks.


EDUCATION& EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university
2 to 4 years of experience as a PMO Project Coordinator, Project Analyst, or Business Analyst
2 to 3 years’ experience working with Microsoft Project, Project Server, SharePoint or related project management tools/systems
Scrum Master and/or PMI certification is desired.
Exposure to Microsoft reporting technologies, such as OLAP, ODATA, and SSRS is desired.

Technical QA Analyst

What makes us Epic?

At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

QA at Epic

What we do

Epic Games is looking to significantly expand its internal full-time Quality Assurance team. We are looking for serious QA professionals with wide ranging skills and experience who want to work embedded on a development team. Whether you have very limited QA experience or you have 15 years or more, we have a position for you. This position owns the testing process, risk management, and quality evaluation of a given feature, function or set of work, where you will be part of a rapidly iterating development team working closely with developers and production. We are actively looking to staff teams across web development, the Unreal Engine, tools creation, backend services, games, and our release process, as well as specialized teams working on specific platforms.If you're excited about working in a fast-paced environment and are highly motivated to ensure the best possible user experience, then we'd like to speak with you!

Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic.

What you’ll do

In this role, you will
Work with product owners, developers and QA management to define acceptance criteria, identify risks, and plan testing coverage for upcoming features / releases
Coordinate test efforts between geographically distributed teams, vendors and agencies to deliver the highest quality product
Build test strategies and test plans to cover multiple features in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Manage functional, qualitative, and performance testing efforts
Using a mix of manual and technical testing skills to execute a variety of testing techniques across your product to analyze the quality of said product
Analyze and troubleshoot reported defects and internal issues
Report and track for data quality, and using that data to drive conversations around product quality and development health.
Support developers before, during and after deployments
What we’re looking for
5+ years of software testing experience in a fast paced environment
Solid understanding of test methodologies and iterative development
Technical understanding of web, mobile, XR, or game technologies
Experience in functional and usability testing in your domain of expertise
Experience with cross-platform or cross-browser testing.
Knowledge in one of these areas
SQL & MongoDB, and the ability to query databases
Game Engines or 3D toolsets
Backend servers and APIs
Games as a Service
Audio tooling and performance
Ability to prioritize and work independently, as well as in a team environment
Ability to thrive while working in a fast-paced working environment, with the ability to juggle multiple projects
Proven track record of successful contributions to the release of high-quality products
You’re user-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative. These traits equal success at Epic and influence everything we do.
Nice to have skills
Knowledge of CMS (Content Management System)
Prior experience with test automation tools

About Us

Epic Games spans across 12 countries with 32 studios and 1,800+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

Epic Job + Epic Benefits = Epic Life

Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay for 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. We offer coverage for Medical, Dental, Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, AD&D and Life Insurance, 401k.

All Epic employees enjoy drinks, snacks, and lunches every day, free of charge - and we offer plenty of annual celebrations for employees and family members to show the love for our people. Additionally, each year, we celebrate the Epic family with company-wide paid breaks, generous paid time off, and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical - we think our people are pretty awesome!

Job Summary
The Incident Handling/Incident Response (IH/IR) team utilizes multiple security technologies and produces enhancements that allow SOC members to work collaboratively and efficiently while responding to threats. The individual in this role will work as a tier III analyst in the cyber security operations team and be responsible for carrying out 24x7 on-site security monitoring operations. The Security Analyst (Level 3) will perform responsibilities associated with investigating Incidents escalated from Tier I and II incident responders for Security Operations Center (SOC), conducting technical investigations for security incidents, providing process improvements, and driving implementation of new capabilities. He/she will serve as a technical escalation resource for other SOC Analysts and provide mentoring for skill development. The individual will partner with Security Engineers to implement and improve technology and process to enhance SOC monitoring, investigation, and response.

Key Responsibilities
Conduct multi-step breach and investigative analysis to trace the dynamic activities associated with advanced threats
Perform investigation and escalation for complex or high severity security threats or incidents
Serve as an escalation resource and mentor for other analysts
Work with SIEM Engineering and other security partners developing and refining correlation rules
Work on complex tasks assigned by leadership, which may involve coordination of effort among Level 1/2/3 analysts
Coordinate evidence/data gathering and documentation and review Security Incident reports
Assist in defining and driving strategic initiatives
Create and develop SOC processes and procedures working with Level 3, Level 2 and Level 1 Analysts
Provide recommendations for improvements to Security Policy, Procedures, and Architecture based on operational insights
Define and assist in creation of operational and executive reports
Define tool requirements to improve SOC capabilities
Job Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess:
7+ years of technical experience in Information Security, System Administration, or Network Engineering with at least 5 - 7 years of experience in Information Security
Extensive experience in Incident Response, Incident Handling and Security Operations
Advanced knowledge and expertise of using SIEM technologies for event investigation
Basic understanding of incident handling/incident response techniques within a cloud-based environment such as Google Cloud, Azure or AWS
Security Certifications Preferred (including but not limited to the following certifications):
Certified Incident Handler (GCIH)
Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA)
Certified Penetration Tester (GPEN)
Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)
Certified Expert Penetration Tester (CEPT)
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Networking Certifications (CCNA, etc.)
Platform Certifications (Microsoft, Linux, Solaris, etc.)
Preferred Competencies
Advanced event analysis leveraging SIEM tools
Advanced incident investigation and response skill set
Advanced log parsing and analysis skill set
Advanced knowledge of networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, network layers, Ethernet, ARP, etc)
Advanced knowledge of current threat landscape (threat actors, APT, cyber-crime, etc)
Advanced knowledge of malware operation and indicators
Advanced knowledge of penetration techniques
Moderate to Advanced knowledge of DDoS mitigation techniques
Moderate to Advanced knowledge or IDS/IPS systems
Moderate to Advanced knowledge of Windows and Unix or Linux
Moderate knowledge of Firewall and Proxy technology
Moderate knowledge of Data Loss Prevention monitoring

Moderate experience with scripting

Job Title:

Job Description:

Position Summary

The Sales Analyst supports the development and analysis of customer and market data for the Sanitaire team. Position will provide cross functional support to the Sales, Marketing and Finance Teams. Responsibilities include data development and analysis of ecommerce activities, forecasting inputs, market dynamics, and reporting on customer sales performance. The Sales Analyst will build and cultivate effective relationships with the Sanitaire team, BISSELL Homecare staff and customers. This is a developmental role within the Sanitaire sales organization with the right individual having opportunities to advance his/her career with material skill development and a consistent record of measurable performance.

Position Profile
Monitors sales performance using Domo, Vendor Central, Velocity, Profitero, Excel, and other tools as needed.
Provide input to sales forecast based on rate of sale, weeks of cover, promotional activity and other metrics. Work with internal forecast team and customers to improve forecast accuracy.
Support the sales team in the Dealer Authorization process and with MAP enforcement. This includes using internal and 3rd party resources to provide weekly tracking and the notification of unauthorized sellers.
Communicate shipment performance, including insights, compared to forecast, update, and plan on a regular basis to both Sanitaire staff and the customer.
Prepare pre and post event analysis for all promotional activities.
Submit monthly/quarterly rebate requests for approval based on customer contracts.
Handle and direct requests from BISSELL staff and customers.
Assist in management of advertising campaigns by monitoring performance and optimizing spend.
Stay current with analytical best practices specific to the customer as well as industry-wide.
Track all customer programs and keep a library of all contracts and program agreements once they are approved and signed.
Assist with internal and customer presentations.
May be required to perform other duties as assigned.

Functional/Technical Expertise
Global Business Acumen
Self-Management
Learning Versatility
Delivers Results
Judgment and Decision Making
Managerial Courage
Continuous Improvement

Required Experience/Education
Degree minimum: Bachelor's degree
Specific concentration: Business, Finance, Marketing
Experience level: 3-5 years
Skills Required

This position requires the ability to manage the flow of data, perform analysis, generate summary reports and communicate by voice or data while being connected in the office, at home or while travelling by laptop or mobile device regularly without regard to time zone or day of the week.

Job Description:

Business Analyst – P&C (Insurance Background is mandatory)

Location: Charlotte, NC

We are looking for applicants who will thrive in an open, dynamic, flexible, collaborative environment and desire creative freedom and an opportunity to work with high performing teams.

Description:

Responsible for all IT business consulting activities for a business group or function serving as the primary interface between business groups and IT.

Responsible for understanding the work processes of the assigned business group and evaluating and integrating IT products and services into the business area to meet business needs or business process improvements.

Provides technical knowledge to ensure efficient design, development, implementation, and support of systems and interfaces with programmers to explain solutions.

Responsible for overall customer satisfaction, customer communications, problem resolution consultation or oversight, and development and adherence to service level agreements.

Responsible for IT representation on assigned business areas steering teams, quality improvement teams, and continuous improvement teams, project implementation teams and working groups.

May also participate in the testing and evaluation of new IT solutions.

Responsible for working with assigned business areas to do annual and long range IT investment planning.

Coordinates the Application Portfolio Management (APM) Process for the assigned business department to systematically review the functional and technical health of all business applications on an annual basis (entire portfolio is assessed over a 3 year rolling cycle).

Outputs of the APM Process are feeders to the short and long term planning process.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline. In lieu of a degree, 8 years of related business experience.

Work experience in addition to degree: 5-10 years of related experience in business and/or information technology systems analysis.

Job-specific knowledge, skills or abilities:

Minimum of 8 years' experience in workstation desktop and mobile technology support and troubleshooting.

At least 5 years of experience participating in delivering IT projects.

Preferred Qualifications:

Demonstrated strong analytical and communication skills. Ability to work effectively with customers, IT management and teammates.

Facilitate meetings and provide direction to others. PMP Certification. Demonstrated ability to lead efforts across multiple business groups.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in search of a Business Analyst in Morrisville, NC.

Summary:
The Senior/Lead Business Analyst will develop and manage user stories and requirements for select IQVIA D&DI Technology products. These products have both internal and external users and form a major technical facet of the company's overall strategy to value to our customers. This role requires collaborating cross-functionally with clinical stakeholders, technology teams, offshore resources and third-party vendors. The Senior BA should have excellent facilitation and elicitation skills as well as in-depth experience working with end users, developers, and other analysts to refine identified business needs using a variety of proven techniques.

Responsibilities:
Elicit requirements and perform associated analysis in order to provide high quality and detailed requirements, ensuring the closest involvement with, and agreement from, the user community
Act as subject matter expert on technology products
Collaborate with designated members of the applicable business groups and product development team to create requirement documents
Facilitate and/or participate in joint analysis and design sessions with developers to understand needs of the customer
Assist with process modeling to clarify business requirements, and to enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with, solution design and implementation, as necessary
Be a -go to- subject matter expert for company technology systems; Assist in knowledge transfer to other technical staff members of business data processes
Collaborate with developers and other analysts to ensure adherence to business requirements and customer needs
Triage of issues reported by users
Resolve conflicting end-user requirements
Author and enter requirements/user stories into a requirements management tool, such as Top Team and Jira
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree with a preferred background in Computer Science, Business, or Healthcare-related subject area
Minimum of 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst
IIBA or PMI Certification strongly preferred
Strong ability to communicate technical and data concepts to non-technical audiences, and business concepts to technical audiences
Strong analytical, organizational, verbal communication and business writing skills
Strong relationship building and facilitation skills to work directly with business users who are not technical in nature
Critical thinking abilities to take complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them into smaller components, patterns, views and features
Strong knowledge of technical and grammatical editing
Expert knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and agile lifecycle methodologies and the role of Business Analysis with the SDLC
Familiarity with Agile development methodology is highly desirable
Pharma/CRO or healthcare experience within a regulated industry preferred
Ability to conceptualize and think creatively

IAT has an immediate need for a Systems Analyst to provide–insurance forms application support to provide quality assurance and integrity from an IAT Office located in Scottsdale, AZ, Naperville, IL, Rolling Meadows, IL or Raleigh, NC. Remote will be considered but it is not a preferred option.

Responsibilities:
Respond to requests from the production support team to confirm required behavior
Respond to User Acceptance Testing questions and requests to verify if issues they have raised are bugs
Review bugs to determine if it is a bug or requirement issue
Respond to questions from the Product team (most requests are looking for current attachment/select rules on specific forms, most current edition date of the form, or when a specific edition date is/was effective)
Gather requirements and complete Jira stories for tasks assigned by the Lead Business Analyst. Most of these are forms-related for General Liability or Excess. Groom requirements for Development/QA estimate and respond to any clarifications from Development/QA

Submit tickets to the vendor for any base software issues that are found when comparing base and proprietary behavior
Provides guidance to users to develop automated solutions to business problems.
Prepares policies, procedures, work instructions and job aids in support of systems operations and business processes.

Systems administration and configuration updates: Administers one or more systems, including setting up and removing users, granting access, updating application drop-downs following standard procedures. Identifies system problems/issues; resolves and tests system changes for problems/issues; prepares documentation and holds walk-throughs for the users of the systems, and performs ad hoc research projects.

Participates in the integration of new technologies/solutions.
