Project Description
Position Overview: Middleware Support Analyst supports operation and enhancement of system integration and middleware solutions globally across all functional areas for customer. This position is part of the Global Technical Services team working with various locations around the world to supporting business solutions and systems that require middleware functionality

Responsibilities:
• Provide operational support to middleware applications 24x5 (Onshore /Offshore model) including rotating on-call duties.
• Work on incident/request tickets with various technical and business teams to help resolve issues.
• Monitor, provide support, and provide expert knowledge for system integrations and workflows.
• Create and maintain job schedules and manage execution within expected service levels.
• Perform root cause analysis and assist in efficient resolution of all production incidents
• Support the Analysis, Planning, Design, and Implementation of Oracle Fusion Middleware implementations, including upgrades/migrations from legacy and/or non-Oracle platforms.
• This position will include assisting in the evaluation and implementation of new technology initiatives
• Perform routine operations tasks including server monitoring, periodic system health check, integration performance monitoring, resolving production incidents, participate in collaborative working teams, and executing planned production changes.
• Ensure ongoing operations remain within established SLA.
• Contribute to operational excellence with continuous improvement activities.
• Partner with application development teams to fix defects through full life-cycle of software development, including: requirement and risk/benefit analysis, effort estimation, acceptance testing, implementation, and stabilization.
• Participate in code reviews and architecture review to assess the new development is done as per standards
• Participate in disaster recovery planning, design, implementation, business impact analysis, vulnerability assessment and contingency planning
• Demonstrate excellent verbal and written customer service skills through all levels of communication
• Contribute to the knowledge repository to help insure that information is disseminated.

• Must have more than 6 years of total middleware experience.
• Must have experience with webMethods development including experience developing integration solutions using webMethods.
• Experience preferred with webMethods Integration Server, Trading Networks, Designer, MywebMethods Server (MWS), Process Models (BPMS) , Broker,Java Messaging Services (JMS), EDI, WebServices ,Flat Files and Pub Sub model .
• Preferred experience in developing solutions for EDI/B2B/BPM implementations.
• Experience developing/implementing SOAP/REST Web Services.
• Knowledge of web services, XML and defining schemas using DTD/XSD preferred.
• Hands on experience in UNIX, Java, PL/SQL , DSP.
• Good communication and technical skills.
• Good to have experience in Agile methodology using tools like JIRA.
• Apex and OEM is a plus experience
• 4 years Bachelors of Computer Engineering is required.

Job Description
Are you the next best Business Analyst? If so, we’re looking for you!

Our client is actively seeking a talented Business Analyst I to work at their location in Charlotte, NC. This is a 1-year assignment with the possibility of extending.

Job Overview:

Analyzes company functions, processes, and activities to improve computer-based business applications for the most effective use of money, materials, equipment, and people.

Key Responsibilities:
Manage the Client Alumni Network including daily monitoring of the Alumni and Business Hospitality mailbox and triage the resulting action items.
Monitoring of the Alumni Network pending registrations. Validate credentials against the HR table and approve as appropriate.
Consult with HR to disposition any alumni registration requests that are not on the approved table.
Oversight of the business hospitality dashboards to identify potential areas of noncompliance. Disposition any identified issues with the appropriate SME.
Develop business hospitality reports and make recommendations for program changes.
Support planning promotional/special events related to sponsored sporting events, coordinate handling of tickets and provide back-office support on various sports hospitality tasks.
Consolidate team information on the department SharePoint site including contracts, hospitality reports, program documents and other supporting documentation.
Support Director with review of monthly spend journal detail.
Assist department staff with planning and implementation of Alumni regional meetings and chapter meetings including mailings, distribution list management and quarterly calls.
Prepare draft agendas and presentations as needed to support SEIT, ERC, GCRM and Alumni meetings, etc.
Support other functions in the department as time permits
Requirements:
Utilizes available computer systems resources and personnel to carry out analysis to support management's quest for performance improvement.
Reviews and analyzes information, forecasts, methods, schedules, systems, processes, and procedures.
Determines most useful business solutions for the company.
Recommends alternative solutions to management as to courses of action that best meet the organization's goals.
Performs duties concerned with the design and improvement of computer-based business systems.
Works closely with senior managers to identify and solve a variety of computer-based business system problems.
Analyzes requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing business systems.
Confers with personnel of organizational units involved to analyze current operational procedures and identify problems.
Solicits from management symptoms of problem, formally defines the problem, breaks problem into component parts, and gathers information about each of these parts from a variety of sources. Selects the most appropriate analytical technique.
Utilizes several study techniques including simulation, linear and nonlinear programming, dynamic programming, queuing and other stochastic-process models, Markov decision processes, econometric methods, data envelopment analysis, neural networks, expert systems, decision analysis, and the analytic hierarchy process.
Writes description of business needs, business program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer-based business systems.
Reviews computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to determine if requested program or program change is possible within existing system.
Studies existing computer-based business systems to evaluate effectiveness, and develops new systems to improve production or workflow as required.
0-3 years’ experience.

By trade we are a technology company, but if you ask anyone that works here, they’ll tell you we are a people company. AvidXchange is the industry leader in automating invoice and payment processes for mid-market businesses. Founded in the year 2000, AvidXchange processed 9.5 million payments last year across its network of more than 500,000 suppliers, transforming the way 5,500 customers in North America pay their bills. AvidXchange is distinguished as a global fintech unicorn and one of the
fastest growing technology companies in the U.S. with 1,300 employees in seven office locations. Our employees live by our core values, including “Innovate to Change the Game,” “Passion about Customer Success,” “Win as a Team,” "Play to our Strengths," and “Have a Blast.” We are on a mission to create something different at AvidXchange. Come join the team!

To drive growth and the future ability of AvidXchange to continue to be a leader in Accounts Payable & Payment Automation we are looking for an AvidBill Services intern for summer 2020. From June 1st – July 31st you will work with diverse, smart, and passionate people to deliver results that have a direct impact on the company’s bottom line. You will be challenged to grow, excel, and lead alongside the brightest talent in the industry and be rewarded for your achievements. Internships are offered in several different areas including analytics, sales, process improvement, customer support, etc.

Duties and responsibilities
Optimize invoice intake process by working on conversion of paper suppliers to electronic intake

Thrive in a team-based atmosphere where the workload is distributed across the team but where success is dependent on each other
Be motivated by a fast paced, high volume deadline driven environment
At the end of the internship, interns will be responsible for collecting their best suggestions, and presenting conceptual solutions for automation and innovating how we are working with the team to business leaders and executives
Required Skills
Excellent organizational, leadership, facilitation, problem solving and decision-making skills
Proactive, accountable, autonomous and solutions oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Google Docs
High attention-to-detail
Exposure to change management preferred

Communication: Effectively transfers information and expresses ideas to individuals or groups in oral and written form
Business Acumen: Strong business understanding and judgment
Problem-Solving: Identifies problems, develops and evaluates options, and implements solutions
Team Work: Promotes and facilitates coordination and cooperation among peers
Strategic Thinking: Looks at existing processes and works with their supervisor to explore possible enhancements that could positively affect client experience and organizational excellence
Adaptability: Manages competing demands and adapts to frequent change, delays, and unexpected results. Leverages the proper tools, solutions, methods for the situation, does not take a one size fits all approach
Required Education
All interns must have completed at least two years toward an undergraduate degree
A minimum GPA of 3.0 is required, major or cumulative
All majors are welcome to apply

Technical QA Analyst

What makes us Epic?

At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

QA at Epic

What we do

Epic Games is looking to significantly expand its internal full-time Quality Assurance team. We are looking for serious QA professionals with wide ranging skills and experience who want to work embedded on a development team. Whether you have very limited QA experience or you have 15 years or more, we have a position for you. This position owns the testing process, risk management, and quality evaluation of a given feature, function or set of work, where you will be part of a rapidly iterating development team working closely with developers and production. We are actively looking to staff teams across web development, the Unreal Engine, tools creation, backend services, games, and our release process, as well as specialized teams working on specific platforms.If you're excited about working in a fast-paced environment and are highly motivated to ensure the best possible user experience, then we'd like to speak with you!

Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic.

What you’ll do

In this role, you will
Work with product owners, developers and QA management to define acceptance criteria, identify risks, and plan testing coverage for upcoming features / releases
Coordinate test efforts between geographically distributed teams, vendors and agencies to deliver the highest quality product
Build test strategies and test plans to cover multiple features in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Manage functional, qualitative, and performance testing efforts
Using a mix of manual and technical testing skills to execute a variety of testing techniques across your product to analyze the quality of said product
Analyze and troubleshoot reported defects and internal issues
Report and track for data quality, and using that data to drive conversations around product quality and development health.
Support developers before, during and after deployments
What we’re looking for
5+ years of software testing experience in a fast paced environment
Solid understanding of test methodologies and iterative development
Technical understanding of web, mobile, XR, or game technologies
Experience in functional and usability testing in your domain of expertise
Experience with cross-platform or cross-browser testing.
Knowledge in one of these areas
SQL & MongoDB, and the ability to query databases
Game Engines or 3D toolsets
Backend servers and APIs
Games as a Service
Audio tooling and performance
Ability to prioritize and work independently, as well as in a team environment
Ability to thrive while working in a fast-paced working environment, with the ability to juggle multiple projects
Proven track record of successful contributions to the release of high-quality products
You’re user-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative. These traits equal success at Epic and influence everything we do.
Nice to have skills
Knowledge of CMS (Content Management System)
Prior experience with test automation tools

About Us

Epic Games spans across 12 countries with 32 studios and 1,800+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

Epic Job + Epic Benefits = Epic Life

Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay for 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. We offer coverage for Medical, Dental, Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, AD&D and Life Insurance, 401k.

All Epic employees enjoy drinks, snacks, and lunches every day, free of charge - and we offer plenty of annual celebrations for employees and family members to show the love for our people. Additionally, each year, we celebrate the Epic family with company-wide paid breaks, generous paid time off, and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical - we think our people are pretty awesome!

LexisNexis Legal & Professional (www.lexisnexis.com) is a leading global provider of content and technology solutions that enable professionals in legal, corporate, tax, government, academic and non-profit organizations to make informed decisions and achieve better business outcomes. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis« and Nexis« services. Today, LexisNexis Legal & Professional harnesses leading-edge technology and world-class content, to help professionals work in faster, easier and more effective ways. Through close collaboration with its customers, the company ensures organizations can leverage its solutions to reduce risk, improve productivity, increase profitability and grow their business. Part of RELX Group plc, LexisNexis Legal & Professional serves customers in more than 100 countries with 10,000 employees worldwide.

What you’ll do:
Drive product decisions using data, working closely with product teams
Teach product teams how to access, use, and make decisions based on data
Work with product teams to define success metrics
Mine data for insights
Help product teams prioritize work based on insights
Propose experiments using insights
Communicate complex ideas about our product through visual aids like dashboards
Communicate high-level goals to stakeholders in the product team and executive team
What we’re looking for:
Determination, focus, attention to detail, and motivation to succeed
The ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and succinctly
Experience with programming languages like R and/or Python
Experience with dashboarding tools like Tableau or Looker
Experience with Elasticsearch and Kibana
Experience with SQL tools like Redshift, Athena, or Aurora
Keen statistical sensibilities
The ability to explain why this is funny: https://xkcd.com/1132/ (or not)
Can see all sides of an argument and use data to settle the differences
Product experience
1+ years in industry
Masters+ in CS, Stats, Psychology, Economics, or some other field where you worked with lots of data
Proven track record of driving business outcomes through data
About us:

We’re a small, scrappy data science team that is trying to change the culture at LexisNexis to be more data driven. We’ve already proved the value of data and AB testing, now we need to go to the next level – getting teams to make data central to their decision-making process. We need someone who understands product, user experience, and engineering, as well as serious data analytics chops. We’re looking for someone with a proven track record of delivering insights and using those insights to change the business in some meaningful way. We are looking for diverse candidates that can bring different perspectives to this role. This role is really about setting the direction of data-driven decision making at LexisNexis for years to come. Join us and we can really have a huge impact on how LN does business.

The leader of the Product Analytics team, James Rubinstein, has been a product manager, a statistician, and a data scientist at companies like eBay, Apple, and Pinterest. He’s seen the value that data-driven decision making can have at an organization. He took the role at LexisNexis for the opportunity to change the culture of a company as big as LN, as well as “expanding the rule of law” (LexisNexis’ mission). So far, he’s been fairly successful, creating an AB testing platform and getting teams throughout LN to engage in AB testing. However, there’s still a lot of ground left to cover. He’s looking for growth-minded data professionals that can grow in their careers as they grow the impact of data for teams throughout LexisNexis.

Job Summary
The Incident Handling/Incident Response (IH/IR) team utilizes multiple security technologies and produces enhancements that allow SOC members to work collaboratively and efficiently while responding to threats. The individual in this role will work as a tier III analyst in the cyber security operations team and be responsible for carrying out 24x7 on-site security monitoring operations. The Security Analyst (Level 3) will perform responsibilities associated with investigating Incidents escalated from Tier I and II incident responders for Security Operations Center (SOC), conducting technical investigations for security incidents, providing process improvements, and driving implementation of new capabilities. He/she will serve as a technical escalation resource for other SOC Analysts and provide mentoring for skill development. The individual will partner with Security Engineers to implement and improve technology and process to enhance SOC monitoring, investigation, and response.

Key Responsibilities
Conduct multi-step breach and investigative analysis to trace the dynamic activities associated with advanced threats
Perform investigation and escalation for complex or high severity security threats or incidents
Serve as an escalation resource and mentor for other analysts
Work with SIEM Engineering and other security partners developing and refining correlation rules
Work on complex tasks assigned by leadership, which may involve coordination of effort among Level 1/2/3 analysts
Coordinate evidence/data gathering and documentation and review Security Incident reports
Assist in defining and driving strategic initiatives
Create and develop SOC processes and procedures working with Level 3, Level 2 and Level 1 Analysts
Provide recommendations for improvements to Security Policy, Procedures, and Architecture based on operational insights
Define and assist in creation of operational and executive reports
Define tool requirements to improve SOC capabilities

Job Description:

Net2Source is a Global Workforce Solutions Company headquartered at NJ, USA with its branch offices in Asia Pacific Region. Company: One of Our Clients
Position: Data Analyst
Location: Charlotte, North Carolina
Duration: 6+ Months

Job Description:
Must have skills
· Strong functional knowledge of Insurance (Life, Annuities), experience in creating various insurance data products (e.g Inforce file, Experience study, claims data e.t.c)
· Good understanding of SQL (exposure to Impala, Hive are added advantage).
Good to have skills
· Experience in machine learning, Spark, IBM Infosphere (or any metadata management tool)

Job Requirements:
• Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills, a must as there will be significant collaboration with the business and IT
• Multi-line Life Insurance and Annuity experience is required for working with business to understand business impact for data issues
• Experience in creating dashboards with data quality key performance indicators (KPIs)
• Relevant experience in at least one of the following areas are desired:
• Connecting, wrangling, and cleaning data from relational, columnar, or Hadoop databases using SQL, Python, R, or other tools to make data consumable for analysis. You can automate and document your processes to make them repeatable.
• Creating metadata: Defining the meaning of data and analyzing data flows to determine source to target data lineage, then storing this information in a metadata reference library. Documenting data entity relationships in a tool such as Excel, Erwin, etc..
• Analyzing data to obtain new insights that will lead to improved efficiencies, lower cost, or reduced business risk. You may be using Excel, Python, R, SQL / HQL and other tools. You may be able to visualize your results using data visualization tools to make your conclusions more understandable to your audience.
• Analyzing the statistical relationship of data to a problem to be solved using SQL, Python, or R. Determine new and creative sources of data and then determining the comparative strength of the relationship to the problem after the new data is applied.
Preferred Skills:.
• Training or degree in Data Analysis, Data Engineering or Statistical Modeling.
• Experience in exploratory data analysis and how data analysis fits into an analytic lifecycle desired.
• Experience in metadata management with a metadata management tool (such as IBM Infosphere tool suite).
• Relevant IT or other technical experience in data analysis/mapping, logical and physical data modeling preferred

You will initiate and follow through to resolution on overpayment claims, as identified through a statements audit and/or Accounts Payable audit enabled by our FirstStrike software. You will utilize remote client system access for research and resolution and partner with other members of the audit team to keep the client apprised of the audit progress. This is a highly responsible position, as the ability of the Audit Support Analyst to consistently complete claims directly impacts revenue and the overall success of the company.The required location is working onsite in Greensboro, NC corporate headquarters.

Adept at working in fast-paced work environments and adapting to change
Exceptional ability to multitask, including seamlessly transitioning between different accounting systems and accounts
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills for communicating with internal staff, clients, and their suppliers
Well-developed time-management skills, with the ability to plan one's tasks and self-manage progress toward task completion
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications

About Us:

APEX Analytix is the leading provider of trusted supplier data; supplier portal software; controls, audit and analytics software; and AP recovery audit services. We protect over $5 trillion in spend and prevent or recover over $3 billion in overpayments annually, and our client portals actively support over 3 million suppliers. Our software and audit services are built on our SmartVM® database of over 20 million supplier records with contacts, scored for accuracy and age, based on integration with over 650 external data sources and over 10 million communications with suppliers each year. APEX Archimedes™, an advanced cognitive technology and innovation system, supported by IBM Watson®, is integrated into APEX Analytix software and services to harness the power of the future through smarter recoveries, controls, analytics, working capital and supplier data. We serve over 250 Fortune 500/Forbes Global 2000 clients around the world and are fluent in languages covering 98 percent of global trade.

Our Culture:

At APEX Analytix, our culture drives everything! We live our culture of performance, respect, candor and fun—in that order. Performance is measured by delivering value to our clients, generating goodwill, trust and partnership. Sincere respect for each other, our diverse backgrounds and our well-being are our cornerstones. We value open and honest relationships with each other, our clients and our communities. And, life is too short to not have fun! We look for team players who possess the qualities of being humble, hungry and smart. We recruit candidates who will strive for accountability in performance and career growth, serving our clients in long-term respectful relationships, and working in a diverse and caring environment.

The Perks:

We owe our growing success to our team of bright, passionate, and innovative individuals. We truly value our associates and strive to provide the highest quality benefits program, offering competitive compensation packages with tailored bonus plans and generous benefits. Our benefits include health and insurance plans (medical, dental, optical, life insurance, disability insurance, FSA, HSA employee assistance program, supplemental insurance options and pre-paid legal), a generous paid time off plan, 401k plan, flexible work schedules, wellness programs (company fitness and weight loss challenges, financial wellness software tool, and gym membership stipend), associate and customer referral bonus programs, and paid community hours. And here at APEX Analytix, you won’t get lost in the shuffle. Our focus on internal training, growth and development results in annually filling over a quarter of our open positions with internal promotions! With resources such as a strong Mentor Program, Internal Training Portal, plus Education, Tuition, and Certification Assistance, we provide tools for our associates to grow and develop. If you are looking for a place to shine, come join the team!

OUR COMPANY

JELD-WEN (NYSE:JELD), founded in 1960, is one of the world's largest door and window manufacturers, with more than 21,000 employees operating in 24 countries globally. Headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina, JELD-WEN designs, produces and distributes an extensive range of interior and exterior doors, wood, vinyl and aluminum windows and related products for use in the new construction and repair and remodeling of residential homes and non-residential buildings.

Our products and services afford us the opportunity to enter peoples' workplaces, homes and daily lives. With this privilege comes great responsibility to ensure that the products we deliver are reliable and enrich the places and lives that they touch. We bring beauty and security to the spaces that touch our lives.

We act with integrity, invest in people, inspire through innovation, deliver on our promises and improve every day. We are seeking talented individuals who share this purpose and values and want to excel in their field of expertise. We offer excellent benefits, a collaborative environment in which to apply your talent and a dynamic and growing company, with exceptional career progression opportunities.

THE ROLE

As a valued member of the global compensation team, the compensation analyst will help drive the effective design and delivery of compensation plans and solutions across the organization. This is an exciting opportunity to join a team that is shaping global compensation policies and procedures across JELD-WEN. The incumbent will advise on a range of compensation solutions and processes with the potential to impact employees world-wide. This role has the potential to develop a broader focus as the department initiatives and priorities evolve. The compensation analyst will have a high degree of autonomy in gathering, analyzing, and presenting data to leaders of JELD-WEN. He/she will also support the implementation of change projects for the organization to support the compensation department's strategy.

Principle Duties and Responsibilities
Reporting directly to the Global Director of Compensation, this position will help to drive the compensation strategy
Manage salary survey participation, adhering to deadlines and job match accuracy
Conducts annual benchmarking to evaluate jobs and ensure the desired market position
Provides input into the annual review, analysis, and development of salary ranges
Performs ad-hoc market pricing requests to support pay decisions within the business
Supports annual salary review process by providing summary reports to leadership, administering compensation statements, and compiling the overall spend and related metrics.
Conducts internal pay analyses to analyze internal equity and market adjustments
Partner with HRIS and local HR to ensure the system of record meets the requirements of the department and is updated to reflect changes to salary structures, bonus programs, or compensation information
Helps maintain the company listing of jobs and oversee the governance process for any changes
May work on a variety of projects that include pay and gonus administration and opporutnities to collaborate cross-funtionally
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Foundational knowledge and acumen in compensation principles, programs and practices
Professional knowledge to support the delivery of compensation solutions and processes within company policy
Project management skills including excellent planning, time management, decision making and organization skills
Able to build effective working relationships by taking a customer-focused approach
Exemplary ability to analyze, evaluate and report compensation information and data
Self-motivated to seek out and act on feedback to develop own expertise and share learning with colleagues
Strong communication skills, in writing correspondence and effectively presenting information individually or in group situations to customers, clients, and employees in the organization
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form
Commitment to own professional development
Education and Experience
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience / education
Experience and expertise in compensation field (ie 3 years or equivalent expertise)
Qualitative and analytical skills including manipulating data, querying, and reporting
Systems experience including reporting and data management.
SAP Success Factors experience an advantage.
CCP accredited coursework an advantage
COMPETENCIES / BEHAVIORS
Salary Survey Administration
Market Pricing
Project Management

Who is Foodbuy?

We are the industry leader in procurement and supply chain solutions. We are the subsidiary to the 6th largest company in the world (Compass Group PLC), yet Foodbuy has the feel of a small entrepreneurial Company. We pride ourselves on our ability to source and provide a variety of products and services that help our customers more easily, and cost effectively, run their businesses. We work with clients in the Hospitality, Restaurant, Healthcare, Education, Entertainment, and Gaming industries, and of course we support Compass Group-- which is the world’s largest contract food and support services provider.

Why Foodbuy?

We care about our associates, our clients, and our community. We think big, encourage innovation and debate, and seek out game changers. Our benefits and PTO offerings are strong. Our compensation packages are competitive. And we are constantly growing, and we want our associates’ careers to grow along with us. We have an open and modern work environment, believe in flexibility, and promote a collaborative open door environment.

Additionally, we follow a value system called FORT, which stands for Flexibility, Optimistic, Resourceful, and Transparent. FORT is the foundation for everything we do at Foodbuy. It is how we behave and interact with our clients, business partners and fellow associates.

Description/Job Summary

The primary function of this position involves developing, modeling, and analyzing all types of credit information to finalize a “recommend” or “denial” determination on a particular loan request or treatment action.

The responsibilities of the Credit Analyst center on building strong relationships with business contacts, Loan Officers, as well as customers, accomplished by creating relationships and networking with customers, prospects, business contacts and influencers. The Analyst will utilize his/her knowledge of credit and agriculture to provide “value added” business-consulting and financial services to both Loan Officers and customers based upon the customer’s need for various products and services. Such services require the Analyst to use discretion and independent judgment. The Analyst will typically spend approximately 90% of their time in the process of meeting with Loan Officers and customers; and then developing, modeling, and analyzing a customer’s request with the responsibility to meet credit administration and risk assessment characteristics.

The analyst will work in a local branch or admin office and be responsible for servicing the analytical needs of our Loan Officers and customers. This position has no direct reports, however, in keeping at the forefront of our “hedgehog” of customer service, will work very closely with the Branch employees to effectively meet all customer needs. This employee must learn and live Carolina’s Core Values, Key Business Principles, and Core Competencies to create a culture of greatness within CFC.

Responsibilities/Duties

Performs complete analysis of loans and loan treatments as assigned. Assists loan officers in completing credit investigations, completing record credit checks, and asset and liability verification. Analyzes financial statements and cash flows to develop a complete assessment of a borrower’s financial and historical operating performance. Develops credit information for use by loan officers or loan committees in the making of lending decisions.
Completes training assignments as assigned by members of the credit department.
Completes projects and/or research as assigned by Senior Credit Manager and other Senior Credit Staff.

Required Qualifications

Education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Agriculture Economics, Finance or related field
2-4 years’ experience
Demonstrated computer proficiency and familiarity with financial databases and spreadsheet applications
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to employ diplomacy and tact with both employees and customers while articulating the benefits of certain loan structures or loan covenants along with the benefits of Farm Credit. Self-starter; good problem-solving & time management skills; knowledge of agriculture; strong analytical skills
Ability to be assertive and decisive in arriving at sound business decisions which serve the best interest of CFC and the borrower
Current awareness of economic developments and production technology affecting agriculture in the region
Travel to/from customers’ businesses/homes, other CFC offices, Associations, AgFirst or other facilities

Preferred Qualifications

Farm or ranch background with related practical experience
Farm Credit experience

Perform data validation & reconciliation through control monitoring, trend analysis and/or ad hoc analysis
Research data issues and drive detailed resolution, including technical approach, lower environment testing and production validation
Partner with GFCI DM (India based) and interface directly with multiple stakeholders globally which includes US, EMEA, APAC based teams within Finance Production Support, Finance Technology and reporting
Support master or reference data management processes
Support development and enhancement of data control monitoring tools, documentation and reporting
Support monthly production reviews across key stakeholder groups
Partner with GFC DM Governance & Control and reporting teams with data issue communications, documentation and inquires
Serve as key resource and/or lead for data operations automation and process improvements utilizing emerging technology tools
Support analysis, design, and testing of technical changes outside of production cycle, as needed
Represent GFC DM Operations and provide subject matter expertise to broader work efforts internal and external to GFC DM

2+ years in operational and reporting processes

Positively and skillfully influences peers, colleagues, leaders and business partners to collaborate and deliver consistent quality results.

RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations.

Working as a consultant you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments.

As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know:
We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them.
We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.
We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.
If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.
THE RGP CONSULTING EXPERIENCE
RGP has a unique consulting model that provides opportunities for consultants to work in different ways. Most consultants work in a model where they have the flexibility and autonomy to choose projects aligning to their experience, skills and desired lifestyle. Other opportunities exist in team-based, strategy and solutions work. In all models, you will feel the full support of RGP to assist you in your work and guide you on your chosen path.
PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for evaluating an organization objectively and advising on opportunities to improve the efficiency of specific areas of our clients business. This requires special attention to increasing both the profitability and the stability of the business. You will combine your systems knowledge with your functional experience in accounting, information management, human capital, internal audit, and supply chain to help Clients ensure project success.

ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS WITH RGP
Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues
A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues
Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues
Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents
A strong personal identification with RGPs values loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE
Lead business stakeholder engagement meetings, striving to understand the Clients processes and building trust among business groups
Define and document business requirements and functional specifications from business users and subject matter experts
Understand as-is business processes to effectively identify and document the to-be requirements
Identify root cause(s) of an issue to help determine the optimal solution(s)
Write test plans and/or perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and functional testing of new solutions
Perform business needs analysis and design workflows, including as is and to be process mapping
Collect timely feedback from stakeholder groups and ensure terms of requirements and specifications are being met through the solutions being built
DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
BA or BS in Business, Accounting or related field required; MBA preferred
A minimum of 5 years of Business Analyst experience
Exceptional communication skills and professionalism
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability
Experience in technical writing (business cases, project charters, etc.)
Experience in business process improvement efforts
Experience with SQL, Tableau, or related systems is a plus
Strong business acumen

Job Description
Join Resolvit as a Security Analyst and be part of a creative, forward-thinking team. Our success at deploying skilled, highly knowledgeable experts has landed us on the Inc. 5000 list of America’s fastest-growing companies four times – and we’re just getting started.

As a Security Analyst, you will be responsible for researching, managing and reporting on customer security assurance, data protection and privacy questions. You will be working closely with different product security and information security teams to help reduce sales friction and enable the client's effectiveness at winning new business and retaining current customers.

What You'll Do:

• Drive security compliance and sales enablement by assessing and resolving current and prospective customers’ security and/or compliance requests
• Engage with sales, field and internal support personnel to understand product security architecture, implementations, and operations to adequately address customer security questions
• Process information security questions within the confines of customer and 3rd part GRC portals
• Leverage automated process workstreams to support acceleration of customer requests.
• Partner with information security, technical marketing engineers, product managers, and other SMEs to manage responses to RFPs, RFIs, security assessments, and other pre-sales questionnaires
• Support sales opportunities by addressing customer’s detailed technical security questions
• Report on customer trends and identify new areas within security for creation of collateral
• Maintaining internal security metrics/reports

Desired Skills:

• Bachelor's Degree in CS, Engineering, MIS, a related field or equivalent work experience
• 2 or more years of experience in information security risk, governance or compliance, preferably in the SaaS or cloud security space
• Prior knowledge of ISO 27001, NIST 800-53, SOC 2, HIPAA, HITRUST, FedRAMP, SOX, PCI and other information security frameworks / regulations
• Experience with Proposal and Knowledge Management applications (ex. Qorus, Loopio, RFPIO, Qvidian).
• Be able to work with internal as well as external customers and stakeholders in a cross-functional manner
• Self-starter, with the ability to manage multiple simultaneous engagements, and attention to detail
• Demonstrated experience with written and verbal communication skills
• Being able to work well with different functions within Cisco and report to management on customer trends

Great Additions:

• Prior experience performing third-party risk assessments and knowledge of industry standard questionnaires and vendor management documents, e.g. SIG, CAIQ, CCM Matrix (from Cloud Security Alliance)
• Experience using Salesforce
• Understanding of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Business Continuity, ISMS programs, Vulnerability and Incident Management areas within security
• Familiarity or experience drafting enterprise information security policies
• Familiarity with reporting and metrics or Data Analytics
• Security and other related certifications desired (but not mandatory) such as CISA, CISSP, CISM, ISO Lead Implementer, etc.
Company Description
About Resolvit:

Resolvit is an international technology consulting firm with industry-leading customers in the financial services, high tech, manufacturing, retail, life sciences, and government sectors. Through its partnerships, Resolvit delivers highly impactful, innovative solutions across five core areas: Infrastructure Modernization, Application Development Services, Enterprise Data Management & Analytics, Knowledge & Content Management, and Strategic Staffing.

What if you had the opportunity to do something you love and make a difference in people’s lives at the same time? McKim & Creed is a company of people helping people. And that’s what gets us energized. That’s why we’re excited to get up and go to work every day. That and the cool tools.

With almost 200 geomatics professionals on staff, McKim & Creed is one of the largest geospatial and land surveying firms in the Southeast. Since 2012, ENR Southeast has ranked McKim & Creed one of the largest surveying and mapping firms in the Southeast. And, McKim & Creed has recently been ranked lucky #13 in POB magazine's first-ever listing of the top 100 geospatial firms in the U.S.

Our staff includes 40+ professional/registered land surveyors licensed to work in more than 20 states, 60+ field crews, more than 65 survey technicians, five ASPRS-certified photogrammetrists and one certified inshore hydrographer. Our crews are based in offices as far south as Florida and as far west as Texas, and travel throughout the United States and the Caribbean to respond to our clients’ land surveying needs.

Our state-of-the-art technologies, which include mobile and airborne LiDAR, utility detection instruments, vacuum excavation equipment and GNSS units, robotic total Stations and UAS’s, enable us to complete projects swiftly, accurately and safely.

We have an exciting opportunity to join our team. If you want to work at a company that will help you become the best you can be, we’re glad you found McKim & Creed.

Description
This person is responsible for the operation of a SUE field crew.
The major objectives are the quality (accuracy, thoroughness, clarity, meets regulatory requirements, public relations) of work, safety, meeting schedules, within budgets, and responsive service to clients.
They will organize field work and direct crew members, while accurately and efficiently collecting field data, locating features, and deliver data to the office; while maintaining accurate records of work and expenses.
Some overnight travel may be required.
Requires a lot of walking outside year round through all kinds of terrain and in extreme heat and cold.
Required Skills

Required Experience
3 to 5 year's progressive experience in SUE field operations, proficiency with survey equipment (total stations and GPS, SUE locating equipment, or hydrographic equipment).
Individual will have good technical skills; behavioral traits of process oriented, steady, helpful, honest, trustworthy, adaptable, analytical, problem solver, likes work alone when required, methodical, consistent, detail oriented, precise, hates mistakes, likes structure.
Employment may be contingent upon being able to pass background check for Nuclear Facilities.
Must have a valid driver's license and an acceptable motor vehicle record.

TIAA is a unique financial partner. With an award-winning track record for consistent performance, TIAA is the leading provider of financial services in the academic, research, medical, cultural and government fields. TIAA has $1 trillion in assets under management (as of 9/30/2018) and offers a wide range of financial solutions, including investing, banking, advice and guidance, and retirement services.

Work with the business to identify key decision points

Promote awareness about the advantages of business rules and decision management
Analyst with specialty experience in the area of Business Rules Management/Decision Management

10+ years of overall IT experience

Must have specific 2-3 years’ experience with BRMS tools (for rules building/development, rule repository, rule engine)
Strong analysis and design skills with a technical background
Experience as an analyst involved with enterprise applications in a full SDLC

Proactive attitude, ability to work independently and a desire to continuously learn new skills and technologies
Strong written and verbal communication skills & customer-focused attitude
Must be a demonstrated "self-starter"

Desired:
Development experience with Red Hat Decision Manager, IBM ODM, Blaze Advisor or other BRMS products
Decision Modeling including DMN
Leadership experience is a strong plus, having led projects and teams
Experience in pension and retirement related financial services sector

Position Summary

The Sales Analyst supports the development and analysis of customer and market data for the Sanitaire team. Position will provide cross functional support to the Sales, Marketing and Finance Teams. Responsibilities include data development and analysis of ecommerce activities, forecasting inputs, market dynamics, and reporting on customer sales performance. The Sales Analyst will build and cultivate effective relationships with the Sanitaire team, BISSELL Homecare staff and customers. This is a developmental role within the Sanitaire sales organization with the right individual having opportunities to advance his/her career with material skill development and a consistent record of measurable performance.

Position Profile
Monitors sales performance using Domo, Vendor Central, Velocity, Profitero, Excel, and other tools as needed.
Provide input to sales forecast based on rate of sale, weeks of cover, promotional activity and other metrics. Work with internal forecast team and customers to improve forecast accuracy.
Support the sales team in the Dealer Authorization process and with MAP enforcement. This includes using internal and 3rd party resources to provide weekly tracking and the notification of unauthorized sellers.
Communicate shipment performance, including insights, compared to forecast, update, and plan on a regular basis to both Sanitaire staff and the customer.
Prepare pre and post event analysis for all promotional activities.
Submit monthly/quarterly rebate requests for approval based on customer contracts.
Handle and direct requests from BISSELL staff and customers.
Assist in management of advertising campaigns by monitoring performance and optimizing spend.
Stay current with analytical best practices specific to the customer as well as industry-wide.
Track all customer programs and keep a library of all contracts and program agreements once they are approved and signed.
Assist with internal and customer presentations.

The Americas Global Cash Products focuses on confirmation, settlement and reconciliation of cash transactions with internal and external clients for Foreign Exchange (FX), Money Markets, Over the Counter (OTC) Derivatives, and Primeswap products. Along with the EMEA and APAC regions, we provide operational support across various Credit Suisse (CS) entities within the Investment Banking divisions, working across the front-to-back processing areas to resolve discrepancies and enquiry requests.


The team is composed of highly motivated individuals, who communicate effectively, have strong analytical and problem solving skills, and continuously seek to improve our processes. Analysts within this role develop specialized product and industry knowledge while engaging in day-to-day responsibilities and ad hoc projects.
Act as the Single Point of contact for clients for any and all queries related to the client’s settlement activity.
Ensure timely settlements, dedicated approach to identification of settlement breaks, critical issue and remediation.
Where queries cannot be actioned upon by the employee, liaise internally utilizing your Credit Suisse network of contacts to ensure the query will acted upon by the appropriate team(s) on time.
Maintain a high level of customer service at all times, timely answering of telephone and using the appropriate greeting. Ensure timely response to written queries ensuring that the client will continually update on the status of all enquiries with written follow up in all cases.
Gain an outstanding understanding of product knowledge, and it’s flow while utilizing the appropriate systems to carry out day to day responsibilities.
Ensure that processes and services offered to clients are in line with Credit Suisse and industry control regulations.
Identify and understand risk items and raise these appropriately. All risk items will be verbally brought to the attention of your Team Leader and / or Manager whilst also being followed up in writing.
Understand and adhere to the various controls and policies associated with settlement of cash flows, funding deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Work on ad-hoc projects to improve efficiency and control across the teams.
Exposure to control and governance of settlement risk
Exposure to data analysis to identify themes and trends to support delivery of key initiatives
Conducive and exciting work environment!
Guidance, support and mentorship to foster learning and growth

Ability to communicate with internal and external clients in a professional, courteous, and client-focused manner
Problem solving and analytical skills
Enthusiasm and motivation in your work
Attention to detail
Collaborative approach and a good great teammate.
Ability to multi-task, working to deadlines accommodating varying levels of volume without deterioration in task quality
Basic excel knowledge is required, whilst advanced Excel and Access is a plus
IB Operations experience is a plus

Golden Hippo is a young, growing digital marketing company committed to helping everyone live their healthiest life. We create cutting edge health, wellness, and beauty products and work tirelessly to get them into the hands of the people who need them most - our customers. We're growing fast, but our core values remain the same as when we were founded in 2010.

Golden Hippo is currently looking for a Fraud Analyst to join our team in Raleigh, North Carolina. The Fraud Analyst will work a daily queue to identify any suspicious or high-risk transactions, determine if there is improper activity involved, and determine if there is any risk to the company or its customers.

About Public Consulting Group

Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) is a leading public sector solutions implementation and operations improvement firm that partners with health, education, and human services agencies to improve lives. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has over 2,500 professionals in more than 60 offices worldwide. PCG’s Education practice offers consulting services and technology solutions that help schools, school districts, and state education agencies/ministries of education to promote student success, improve programs and processes, and optimize financial resources. To learn more, visit http://www.publicconsultinggroup.com/education/.

The role is responsible for guiding and monitoring the technical implementation of new data collections, data integration system interoperability and reporting within multiple technical systems. The successful candidate will leverage her/his analytical skills, technical prowess and business acumen to make state and district level education data systems more useful to educators, administrators, and policymakers. Familiarity with Advanced Reporting, ACCESS and Excel is preferred. Individual must have experience in reading and writing technical Business Requirements.
Identifies and creates systems that lead to efficiencies and improvements in state and district level education data collection, integration and reporting;
Participates in presentations and trainings related to school-based data for multiple projects

Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals and implementations

Proficiency with large datasets, understanding of data models, data flows and knowledge of data querying tools.

Excellent organizational, oral presentation and written communication skills; including the ability to listen, question and communicate effectively
A relentless commitment to contributing to a team culture that is focused on exceptional client service, high quality products, effective communication, and collaboration
Ability to work effectively in both independent and diverse multi-task team environments
Ability to recognize issues, provide solutions, and drive positive change.
Understanding of software development methodologies and appropriate use of those methodologies
Proficiency in MS Office products, including PowerPoint, Access, Excel, Word and other databases
Required Experience:
Masters in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field is required.
Must have 7-8 years’ experience in common data warehouse design principles and data structures.
Prior work experience (6 - 7 years) using visualization tools and applications, preferably in an education context or setting.
Understanding of application servers and related web based software.

Job Description:
Overview


The Supply Chain Optimization Analyst I performs process analysis, process improvement and implementation of proven advanced business initiatives across the global supply chain. Under direct supervision, projects may involve: inventory optimization and management, supply planning, S&OP, advanced scheduling, financial modeling and supporting metrics. Projects will frequently entail a blend of process redesign, new technology enablers, system integration and change management. The scope of this position includes functions and processes that support nearly $5.0 billion in sales, involve more than 190,000 products, and span the globe with more than 150 manufacturing locations.

As a team member, incumbent will leverage an understanding of supply chain theory and then practically apply both theory and supporting analysis to optimize working capital investment, customer service and inventory investment. Incumbent must be able to assist on multiple projects, work across multiple functions and have advanced communication skills to achieve their targeted supply chain savings goals. Incumbent will help develop business cases that credibly communicate analytical results to many levels of the organization, across all functional areas and include interactions with Executive and Senior Management.

Responsibilities


Assist in the maintenance of the Target Inventory Level (TIL) process across the organization with the primary objective of setting a global inventory mix that achieves targeted customer service levels.

Manage the process:
On a consistent, on-going basis, establish and adjust critical inventory targets for each sku based on the current supply chain profile including factors such as:
Forecast error, lead-time, demand trends/volatility, receipt intervals and desired service levels.
Promotions, distribution and account changes, product phase in & phase outs
Respond to ad hoc requests for TIL changes and reviews.
Assist in integrating newly acquired businesses onto the process.
Assist with seasonal max build strategies and setting.
Conduct training of new users across the business.
Monitor the process:
Conduct master data analysis on key inputs to improve accuracy and integrity of results.
Generate TIL alerts to indicate changes in underlying assumptions that will lead to potential problems.
Monitor performance of planners to maintain TILs within predetermined targeted range.
Monitor sku level demand signals for changes in average monthly demand or variation levels.
Develop and maintain a dashboard of inventory management & optimization key performance indicators (KPI’s) that track inventory quality, turnover, customer service fill rates and financial/cost performance.
Provide ad hoc analysis, reports, and special projects as requested.
Analyze slow moving, obsolete and stranded inventory. Conduct root cause analysis for excess inventory and stock outs at each node and develop recommendations that drive supply chain improvements.
Assist in strategic process optimization initiatives.

Analyze existing business processes and operating models:
Map and gap existing processes looking for ways to eliminate, automate and improve.
Create and run simulation models where appropriate.
Provide a transformation roadmap of quick hit, tactical and strategic opportunities that leverages people, process and technology enablers.
Create implementation plan and business case with major stakeholders
Deliver the targeted value along with required change management, training and sustaining metrics
Optimize the global end-to-end supply chain planning process:
Work cross-functionally with Forecasting, Marketing, Sales, Capacity Planning, and Supply Planning functions to align with Sales & Operations Planning strategies and goals.
With direction, leverage supply chain maturity models, best practices and supply chain knowledge to analyze and apply the correct planning techniques for each problem.
Assist in the design and deployment of advanced supply chain planning systems.
Qualifications


Minimum:
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Operations Research, Supply Chain Management, Statistics, Analytics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or related field.
2 - 3 years using quantitative methods to analyze and improve supply chains.
Exposure in some or all of following: strategic supply chain design, demand planning, forecasting, supply planning, sales & operations planning, production planning, advanced scheduling, DRP, inventory optimization, and supplier management.
Working knowledge of implementation methodologies, project planning, and management of client expectations and deliverables.
Demonstrated knowledge of basic statistical analysis.
Proficient use of MS Office tools is required including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Excellent interpersonal, including strong verbal and written communication skills necessary to work effectively with all levels of the organization as well as geographically disbursed teams.
Highly motivated self-starter, driven for results, effective at prioritizing and managing complex initiatives.
Preferred:
Experience in the consumer packaged goods and/or textile and apparel industries is preferred
Experience using SCOR, APICS and CSCMP frameworks to design and transform manufacturing supply chains. APICS or CSCMP Certification preferred.
Experience in working on large scale supply chain transformation initiatives that included system integration and substantial change management.
Experience in business process improvement and/or optimization
Knowledge or experience with advanced planning software such as IBM IPFA, Adexa, SAP APO or Oracle Value Chain Planning.
Knowledge or experience with some or all of the following tools: SAS JMP, Crystal Ball and Arena.
Practical knowledge of manipulating, cleansing, aggregating, and compiling analytic data
Practical knowledge of relational databases including ability to write basic SQL queries.
Advanced Excel skills including experience in VBA and data analysis add-ins very desired.
To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States and should not require now, or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status

You will be utilized as a strong independent thinker and expert in the accounting and finance organizations.

This position can be based out of our satellite office in Charlotte, NC, with travel as needed to our Corporate headquarters in Hartsville, SC (Month-end, quarter-end, yearly close, etc.)

Responsibilities include:
Performing and /or reviewing analyses of corporate accruals and related expenses (e.g. defined benefit plans, derivatives, revenue recognition, share-based compensation, et al.)
Preparing consolidated financial statements and SEC filings
Researching accounting/reporting issues and developing support for selected accounting treatments

Coordinating the corporate expense budgeting and forecasting processes
Preparing internal reports and analyses of business operating results

Detailed oriented and task driven

Elicit requirements and perform associated analysis in order to provide high quality and detailed requirements, ensuring the closest involvement with, and agreement from, the user community
Act as subject matter expert on technology products
Collaborate with designated members of the applicable business groups and product development team to create requirement documents
Facilitate and/or participate in joint analysis and design sessions with developers to understand needs of the customer
Assist with process modeling to clarify business requirements, and to enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with, solution design and implementation, as necessary
Be a -go to- subject matter expert for company technology systems; Assist in knowledge transfer to other technical staff members of business data processes
Collaborate with developers and other analysts to ensure adherence to business requirements and customer needs
Triage of issues reported by users
Resolve conflicting end-user requirements
Author and enter requirements/user stories into a requirements management tool, such as Top Team and Jira
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree with a preferred background in Computer Science, Business, or Healthcare-related subject area
Minimum of 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst
IIBA or PMI Certification strongly preferred
Strong ability to communicate technical and data concepts to non-technical audiences, and business concepts to technical audiences
Strong analytical, organizational, verbal communication and business writing skills
Strong relationship building and facilitation skills to work directly with business users who are not technical in nature
Critical thinking abilities to take complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them into smaller components, patterns, views and features
Strong knowledge of technical and grammatical editing
Expert knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and agile lifecycle methodologies and the role of Business Analysis with the SDLC
Familiarity with Agile development methodology is highly desirable
Pharma/CRO or healthcare experience within a regulated industry preferred
Ability to conceptualize and think creatively

The Senior BA should have excellent facilitation and elicitation skills as well as in-depth experience working with end users, developers, and other analysts to refine identified business needs using a variety of proven techniques.

Responsibilities:
Elicit requirements and perform associated analysis in order to provide high quality and detailed requirements, ensuring the closest involvement with, and agreement from, the user community
Act as subject matter expert on technology products
Collaborate with designated members of the applicable business groups and product development team to create requirement documents
Facilitate and/or participate in joint analysis and design sessions with developers to understand needs of the customer
Assist with process modeling to clarify business requirements, and to enhance or re-engineer business processes, prior to, or in parallel with, solution design and implementation, as necessary
Be a -go to- subject matter expert for company technology systems; Assist in knowledge transfer to other technical staff members of business data processes
Collaborate with developers and other analysts to ensure adherence to business requirements and customer needs
Triage of issues reported by users
Resolve conflicting end-user requirements
Author and enter requirements/user stories into a requirements management tool, such as Top Team and Jira
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree with a preferred background in Computer Science, Business, or Healthcare-related subject area
Minimum of 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst
IIBA or PMI Certification strongly preferred
Strong ability to communicate technical and data concepts to non-technical audiences, and business concepts to technical audiences
Strong analytical, organizational, verbal communication and business writing skills
Strong relationship building and facilitation skills to work directly with business users who are not technical in nature
Critical thinking abilities to take complex, ambiguous, abstract requirements and break them into smaller components, patterns, views and features
Strong knowledge of technical and grammatical editing
Expert knowledge of Software Development Life Cycles (SDLC) and agile lifecycle methodologies and the role of Business Analysis with the SDLC
Familiarity with Agile development methodology is highly desirable
Pharma/CRO or healthcare experience within a regulated industry preferred
Ability to conceptualize and think creatively

Are you looking to further your Career in a unique team environment? Do you want to directly impact the success of an industry-leading company? Then you belong at Europa Sports Products. Our growing Company is seeking talented employees to join our full-service, in-house distribution team.

The Financial Analyst will be an integral part of the finance and accounting team and have direct reporting line to the Global Manager of FP&A, while also supporting the CFO and the finance team. The Analyst will assist with the preparation of internal/external financial reports, Board of Directors materials, monthly financial analysis materials/dashboards, and provide ad-hoc analysis for special projects as well as support and leadership for process improvement projects across the company.

PRIMARY JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with Group finance team to develop monthly reports and financial dashboards.
Collaborate with Commercial Operations Analyst, Supply Chain Analyst, Operations Cost Analyst, Plant Controllers and regional teams to collect information and fully integrate analysis and reporting functions.
Assist FP&A Manager drive reporting deadlines for monthly, Quarterly and annual budget processes as well as any special reporting requirements.
Develop additional reporting metrics and analysis as needed to better understand the company's income statement, productivity and the key drivers.
Help FP&A Manager to integrate cash flow, working capital metrics and analytics into monthly reporting process.
Provide ad-hoc project analysis as needed supporting special initiatives and potential acquisitions or other business transactions.
Work with Group controller to develop process for periodic forecast updates, to include monthly, Quarterly updates and full mid-year reforecast.
Develop/collect inputs for monthly and quarterly Board of Director calls and meetings.
Act as surge resource for the company helping support and lead special projects as they come up.
Timely and accurate preparation of large program management reporting on a continual ad-hoc basis.
Reporting of monthly, quarterly & annual financial performance through the development & use of revenue & expense forecasts, variances & trends of financial results.
Perform financial analysis on monthly and quarterly results as well as ad-hoc analysis as required.
JOB SKILLS, EXPERIENCE, AND KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting/Finance Preferred
Minimum 3-5 years of relevant work experience
Ability to solve complex problems and drive continuous improvement in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Drive for results and a strong sense of urgency
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to influence on a wide range of audiences and subjects
Advanced analytical skills and proficiency in Excel, Access and other standard reporting and analytical software required
Navigate and extract data from enterprise databases (Hyperion) to compile, interpret and create financial reports
Ability to interact with all levels of management across the Company
Ability to effectively and efficiently use fiscal tools, models and reports to make recommendations to management
Knowledge of accounting and financial concepts

General Summary:

This is a lead position of the Teamcenter/CATIA design/development team responsible for PLM process re-engineering efforts through application development, deployment and customization as required. The candidate will be leading the integration of recommended PDM/CAD tools for the Design Engineering processes. The candidate will be responsible for the deployment of Teamcenter, CATIA, and other mechanical design tools and work closely with the business community, supporting a variety of Teamcenter application.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Function as PLM architect with focus on Core Teamcenter.
Define and design systems architecture for new or existing PLM systems.
Translate business requirements into specific PLM solutions for complex projects.
Develop/document AS IS and TO BE Solution Specification for team members to work from.
Work with support team to Investigate and troubleshoot Teamcenter data to continuously improve the application.
Provide Technical guidance and mentor support team members in advanced PLM functionalities.
Lead designing, developing, coding and testing the architected solutions.
Support project management activities to control scope, cost, schedule and quality.
Education, Work Experience, Certification and/or Licensure:

BS in Engineering or computer science, MS preferred.
10 years designing Teamcenter solutions
7-10 year’s work experience demonstrating knowledge and experience in the administration of all phases of Teamcenter Engineering.
Ability to present complex information and communicate in an effective manner
Experience in computer science, information management, system engineering, or related technical field.
Experience with programming languages: C, C , JAVA, Perl and XML.
Extensive experience with PDM information system infrastructure.
Experience with development tools and processes.
A self-starter with strong communication skills.
Demonstrated experience with Siemens, Teamcenter application usage and development and rollout.
Knowledge of Configuration Management Practices
Strong BMIDE, client side, server side customization, SOA and Integration with ERP systems.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Requires excellent problem solving, oral and written communication skills.
Must have strong interpersonal and service-oriented skills with the ability to interface well with engineers, vendors and other staff members at all levels.
Strong communications and leadership skills.
Knowledge of PC and UNIX Workstation operating systems and application implementation as related to CAD.
Highly motivated individual with the ability to complete tasks with minimal supervision.
Physical Requirements:

Incumbents may be routinely exposed to equipment operational noise heat-cold-dust, and/or aircraft equipment, parts, or fuel odors.
Incumbents may be required to stand, sit, squat, walk, bend, climb ladders, move, reach, or stretch for prolonged time periods with no restrictions, as required by job duties.
Work in a safe and professional manner while adhering to all regulatory requirements (FAA, OSHA, DOT, EPA, State, and Federal regulations, etc.).
Read, hear, speak, and see with no restrictions, as required by job duties.
Comprehend and adhere to management directions and/or safety instructions with no restrictions.
Effectively communicate in Business English language.
Pull, push, carry, lift, or move items up to 10 lbs. throughout the work shift without assistance, as required by job duties.
Pull, push, carry, lift or move materials/people/items/equipment weighing up to 50lbs or more during the work shift, with the use of Company provided “reach assistance technology” or “movement assist technology” (fork-lifts, pallet jacks, pulleys, dolly’s, robotics reach equipment, people movers etc.), as required by job duties.

IAT has an immediate need for a Systems Analyst to provide–insurance forms application support to provide quality assurance and integrity from an IAT Office located in Scottsdale, AZ, Naperville, IL, Rolling Meadows, IL or Raleigh, NC. Remote will be considered but it is not a preferred option.

Respond to requests from the production support team to confirm required behavior

Review bugs to determine if it is a bug or requirement issue

Submit tickets to the vendor for any base software issues that are found when comparing base and proprietary behavior
Provides guidance to users to develop automated solutions to business problems.
Prepares policies, procedures, work instructions and job aids in support of systems operations and business processes.

Identifies system problems/issues; resolves and tests system changes for problems/issues; prepares documentation and holds walk-throughs for the users of the systems, and performs ad hoc research projects.

Participates in the integration of new technologies/solutions.

Provides superior customer service to both internal and external customers.

Performs other duties as assigned.
