Description of Work

THIS POSITION HAS BEEN DESIGNATED AS EXEMPT IN ACCORDANCE WITH NORTH CAROLINA GENERAL STATUTES § 126-5 (c1) (24).

In furtherance of the Department of State Treasurer's existing ethics and transparency programs, this position is subject to the ethics and conflict of interest requirements of the Department of State Treasurer Supplemental Ethics Policy (Tier 2 Ethics Policy)

THE STARTING SALARY FOR ANY NEW HIRE TO THIS POSITION IS LIMITED TO THE RECRUITMENT RANGE OF $58,000 - $76,000.

The North Carolina State Health Plan for Teachers and State Employees, a division of the Department of State Treasurer, provides health care coverage to more than 700,000 teachers and local school personnel, state employees, retirees, current and former lawmakers, state university and community college faculty and staff, and their dependents.

The Financial Analyst will:
Assist with analysis and evaluation of Plan revenues and expenditures, program information and performance measures.
Perform review of monthly financial reports for quality and to evaluate factors contributing to budget variance.
Prepare, review and analyze various vendor generated reports, including detailed reporting of membership, medical and pharmacy claims experience, cost and utilization trends, performance results.
Develop customized reports and summary presentations of findings and issues as needed.
Request data and perform review and analysis of output from the Data Warehouse to identify cost reductions, vendor inefficiencies, waste, fraud and abuse.
Assist with coordination and monitoring of services provided under actuarial and health benefits consulting services contracts.
Assist business owners in developing and drafting the scope of work for projects and studies, overseeing completion, setting project priorities, monitoring performance guarantees and reviewing deliverables and invoices for accuracy, completeness and timeliness.
Assist with coordination, management and tracking actuarial notes and required data.
Review actuarial forecasts, updates and alternate scenarios, studies, and projects to assess the appropriateness of underlying assumptions.
Evaluate methodologies and analytical results to ensure quality control and reasonableness.
Provide technical assistance to the Plan's Contract and Legal Compliance section in the development of contract documents and the procurement process.
Assist business owners with the development of performance measurers and cost proposals, reviewing financial payment provisions and performance guarantees, and evaluating proposals review return of investment methodologies and results for certain contracts and programs.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies
Knowledge and ability to understand and analyze actuarial forecasting methodologies.
Ability to analyze complex healthcare financial and programmatic issues and determine data needs, identify alternatives for consideration, and make recommendations.
Ability to extract, manipulate and categorize complex healthcare data and produce accurate output.
Ability to synthesize, summarize and present complex information clearly and concisely.
Ability to work independently with minimum supervision and actively participate in meeting organizational goals.
Ability to evaluate, assess and solve multi-dimensional problems.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Management Preference:
Two years of experience in a healthcare or related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
1 or more years of Revenue Cycle experience.
Minimum Education and Experience Requirements

Bachelor's in finance, healthcare administration, health policy, public administration, public policy, business administration, economics, accounting or related discipline and five years of experience in budget/financial analysis or forecasting.

(GP) is a global pacesetter in energy, helping customers to meet the evolving

Job Title: Medical Unmet Needs NLP/Text Analytics Analyst (Oncology)
Job Description:
Site Name: USA - North Carolina - Research Triangle Park, USA - Pennsylvania - Philadelphia
Posted Date: Nov 25 2019
Background:


In GSK Medical Affairs, we focus on communicating the science behind our diseases and medicines to help patients, clinicians and healthcare systems make better informed decisions that beneficially impact patients lives. Patients are at the center of everything that we do, and our objective is to ensure our patients are optimally treated in complex and specialty conditions. To be competitive and deliver the most value, we need to move faster and with more agility and ground all our decisions in data and insights.

The Medical Analytics team you would be joining is a growing team within Medical Affairs. Leaders of the team each have, on average, 15 years of insights/analytics experience from different areas of Pharma and/or across other industries and are bringing this expertise to the table to help build a new foundational capability for GSK Medical Affairs. Join us on the journey!

Job Purpose:


The purpose of the Data Scientist - Medical Voice of Customer/Text Analytics role is to analyse customer feedback and perspectives from a variety of sources, translate the unstructured information into actionable insights in combination with other structured data, and identify opportunities for Oncology that will drive data driven decision making within the US business and for US Medical Affairs.

This role will be responsible for building and enhancing capabilities in text analytics and unstructured data analysis for Oncology to maximize potential insights coming from critical customer feedback such as social media perspectives, ad-boards, critical Oncology congresses, online communities, voice of customer feedback through engagement and research, plus more and for influencing appropriate integration with other analyses and for use with strategic planning and at other decision forums.

Key Responsibilities:
Discover customer and patient findings/potential insights using advanced analytics techniques such as natural language processing, text analytics, machine learning, and analytic modeling aligned with and guided by the Medical Affairs business priorities and strategies for Oncology
Analyse unstructured data from multiple feedback sources including but not limited to Medical voice of customer feedback from customer listening, feedback via surveys and research, forums, online communities, social media/publicly available information, call center voice and email feedback, and other available sources of customer feedback data and information
Translate unstructured data, in combination with other structured data sources, into actionable insights; Conduct text, sentiment, and root cause analyses to answer critical Medical business questions and produce data-driven stories that reveal key insights into customer and patient experience, needs, and understanding to determine appropriate Medical opportunities.
Develop broad methodological and approach expertise with unstructured data analytics; Stay on top of the latest external methods and approaches, current and emerging industry trends, and advanced methods/best practices;
Earn the trust of stakeholder partners through active engagement, demonstrated learning, and business acumen development. Continually seek out and build business knowledge and depth for appropriate business context with analytic recommendations;
Deliver timely/close to real time strategic, relevant and actionable insights, especially around key events/congresses where our science is shared for leading indicators and actions to maximize opportunities. Lead Voice of the Customer (VoC) analyses leveraging a wide range of analytical and data visualization tools and resources available to uncover and communicate opportunities; Identify early warning signals and opportunities;
Collect, document, synthesize and organize complex information, making it relevant, understandable and actionable for internal stakeholders; Develop compelling summaries that visualize the data through narrative dashboards to clearly tell a succinct story in easy to understand ways; Focus on the key findings and insights in alignment with stakeholders' goals/business needs with proper validation techniques to build confidence in the results; Craft and tell compelling stories around commonalities and themes found in the VOC data
Develop in-depth knowledge of Oncology strategies, critical needs, and determine appropriate advanced analytic solutions for more efficient customer focus; Demonstrate analytic curiosity and a desire to understand Medical Affairs challenges to contribute to Matrix Team reviews and strategic discussions through insights discovered.
Proactively identify opportunities and develop advanced analytics methods aligned with and guided by business unit priorities; Partner with colleagues in Medical Analytics, Global Medical Excellence, and Commercial Insights to ensure appropriate analytics insights are integrated into deliverables for a holistic and comprehensive view; Demonstrate effective communication and drive efficiencies through collaboration and teamwork
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:


We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
BA/BS in quantitative sciences field or MS in a related field with up to 2 years experience applying advanced analytics methods to solve critical business challenges/problems and developing recommendations
Proficiency in Python and/or R, with knowledge of basic libraries for data manipulation, machine learning, natural language processing, and text mining
Extensive experience with SQL and/or SAS
Experience applying advanced statistical and database skills to solve business problems
Understanding of machine learning, supervised and unsupervised modeling techniques, and probabilistic models of complex systems with "big data" sources
Preferred Qualifications:


If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
MA/MS/PhD in quantitative sciences field
2+ years of unstructured data analysis/text analytics/natural language processing and/or machine learning application for critical business decisions
2+ years of experience in a professional setting with SQL and/or SAS
2-5 years (or up to 2 years with advanced degree) professional experience
Healthcare or life science experience
Consulting experience preferred
Strong business acumen; Understanding of the healthcare industry and the evolving and rapidly changing healthcare environment; Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry.
Demonstrated knowledge of data manipulation methods and quality check approaches to develop a deep understanding of the data assets available for usage in Medical Affairs with advanced analytics methods and applications
Adept at learning and applying new data, advanced analytics methods and technologies;
Possess analytic curiosity to seek out and develop potential solutions and drive continuous improvement; motivated by challenging, complex problems
Ability to evaluate and recommend advanced analytics/machine learning methods appropriate for a business problem
Strong communication and presentation skills (both oral and written) plus project management skills
Effectively builds relationships and collaborative partnerships across teams to develop a solution
Effective at presenting complex, technical information, concepts, and analysis in a compelling and persuasive manner to non-technical audiences
Ability to work effectively across a matrix environment and influence without formal authority
The ability to focus and thrive in times of change
Why GSK?


Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.

These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:
Operating at pace and agile decision-making using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk.
Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning.
Sustaining energy and well-being.
Building strong relationships and collaboration, honest and open conversations.
Budgeting and cost-consciousness.
If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).

GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

The Business Analyst is a key delivery role in digital application development team. The key responsibility of the Business Analyst is to be the communication conduit between key system users and the IT development team to translate business needs into project requirements documentation. Advises development teams of future business applications needs in order to formulate and recommend project strategies to keep pace with the business demands.

Elicit user requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs, gather functional requirements
Deliver business requirements mapping, process flows, functional designs, test plans, training requirement and high level project timeline for each assigned project
Design and develop support fixes, small enhancements and coding for major projects.
Demonstrate a sound knowledge of the Systems Development Life Cycle methodology (SDLC) like Waterfall, Agile, and others for assigned projects and tasks.
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
Work under the direction of a managers
Develop and maintain business process mapping documents
Provide research and analysis to support the selection of business application software required to support business requirements
Participate in the deployment of business applications and other projects are assigned
Track all requests for business application changes and new requests
Keep up to date with technical as well as industry sector developments.
Customer satisfaction.
Accomplishment of IT objectives and execution of goals.
Works with internal and external vendor teams on all support/enhancement/project related activities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g. Product owners, QE, EA, PE, DevOps, Security, etc.).

Required
Education: Bachelor’s degree from four-year College or university required: MBA preferred
Preferred
Iterative project development methodology experience
Technical & Domain Specific
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
SQL query writing experience
3+ years experience in Business Intelligence solution delivery, including requirements gathering/documenting, developing QA strategies, and ensuring delivered product meets customers needs
2+ years experience performing analytics/prototyping dashboards using self-service BI tools i.e. Microsoft Power BI (preferred), MicroStrategy Visual Insights, or Tableau

Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction
Suggests areas for improvement in internal processes along with possible solutions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.

Job Description:
Overview

JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest Commercial, Manufacturing and Life Sciences companies in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. Additionally, JAGGAER is the leading procure-to-pay provider in the Higher Education and Government sectors. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

The Financial Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Finance & Treasury, will be an integral part of the FP&A team and will be responsible to shape, drive, and deliver management reporting/dashboards, variance analysis, and forecasting and planning activities to support decision making, maximize access to capital, safeguard assets, and minimize risks.

Principal Responsibilities
Develop and prepare insightful and meaningful management reporting package with analysis for Senior Management including explanations of variances to forecast/plan, and prior periods and other ad hoc analysis as requested
Identify, understand, analyze and provide insight into key performance metrics
Drive accountability through monthly reporting and analysis relative to performance against targets
Establish and maintain forecasting processes across the global business including long-term planning, annual planning, and rolling forecast
Foster trusted relationships with business teams to proactively identify essential needs, provide functional and regional teams with necessary data and incisive analysis, as well as collaborate with key stakeholders across to develop accurate assumptions and analytical inputs to support plan/forecast
Identify, quantify, and communicate risks and opportunities to plan
Assist with global cash management and forecasting, including daily cash positioning, determine funding needs, as well as forecast and monitor short and long term cash position
Build and support Treasury infrastructure including streamline global bank accounts, balance consolidation, cash pooling, opening/closing bank accounts, as well as support debt and risk management, etc.
Collaborate with the team members to develop process improvements within the Finance Department, including but not limited to internal controls, report generation, process automation, improved use of technology, and documentation processes & procedures, etc.
Perform adhoc analysis and/or projects with respect to Finance and Treasury as assigned
Position Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field
Relevant experience in FPA&A, Finance/Accounting roles; or equivalent combination of education and work experience
Experience with NetSuite or similar ERP system and/or CPM system; knowledge of Adaptive Insights a big plus
Advanced Excel skills required
Driven self-starter with the ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven, and evolving environment while maintaining n a high level of accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees, management and external parties
Strong problem solving, analytical and critical thinking skills
Ability to take ownership and drive improvement in efficiency and effectiveness
About Our Benefits

JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics. We offer a generous benefits package including employee and family health, dental and vision coverage, reimbursement accounts for eligible medical expenses; company-paid life insurance, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability benefits; retirement plan with company match and generous paid time off benefits. Additional benefits include education and well-being reimbursements.

JAGGAER is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and will consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Privacy Analyst

JOB SUMMARY

This position is responsible for assisting with the design and implementation of an effective global privacy program. This position will support the Company's implementation of privacy program governance and policies, procedures, practices and standards related to Company's efforts to comply with the requirements of applicable data protection laws. This position will interact with colleagues within the global Corporate Compliance and Privacy Office, the General Counsel's Office and other company departments/business units
across the Company.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Leads aspects of the development, enhancement and documentation of the Company's privacy program.
Contributes to the team's efforts to monitor data privacy laws and regulations.
Contributes to the development and operational implementation of a periodic privacy risk assessment and management process, including the development of an action plan based on the results of the risk assessment; may own aspects of issue and risk mitigation.
Contributes to the development of awareness and training materials development to ensure that impacted individuals within the organization are appropriately familiar with applicable privacy requirements.
Creates or oversees development of artifacts to demonstrate that the Company's compliance with applicable data protection laws, including working with the business to facilitate data maps and overseeing the creation of records of processing.
Coordinates privacy due diligence workflow and documentation. Facilitates data gathering associated with initial and periodic privacy assessments in conjunction with third-party vendor risk assessments and data protection criticality and impact assessments; makes recommendations and presents conclusions, and maintains critical information in data privacy control systems.
Participates as the Global Privacy Office representative in cross-functional third party review meetings.
Utilizes the Company's privacy mailbox and case management system for case handling, including the triage of matters between team members, and identifies opportunities to improve case handling procedures.
Provides technical support and guidance during investigations and the corrective actions process.
Maintains all privacy office documentation and artifacts in designated departmental document repositories.
Supports the process for providing responses to client and other sources of internal and external audits, questionnaires, certifications, etc. related to the Company's privacy program, including development of content for standard FAQ library. May attend audits on behalf of the Company.
Collaborates with other departments and personnel (e.g., Human Resources, Business Technology, and Corporate Communications) in the development of policies, operational procedures, the documentation of data flows, data privacy impact assessments, third party diligence, and processing activities.
Documents corrective action or remediation plans, including developing mechanisms for monitoring compliance with established policies and procedures.
Supports the development of routine reports and presentations to measure the operation and effectiveness of the company's privacy program.
Perform special assignments and projects as needed.

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
Possesses an undergraduate degree and privacy program experience, preferably in a global organization; relevant industry certifications (e.g., CIPP/E, CIPP/US) preferred.
Possesses working knowledge of applicable data privacy, regulations and standards.
Some exposure to state-of-the-art technological and organizational security controls preferred.
Possesses experience implementing a wide range of policy and operational elements of an effective global privacy program, including privacy policies and procedures, training and education, risk assessments, etc.
Performs complex conceptual analyses, solves complex problems and develops innovative solutions and approaches for the company's privacy program.
Can independently resolve moderately complex privacy issues or questions and/or conduct moderately complex analyses.
Translates concepts into practice. Provides explanations and information to others on difficult issues.
Acts like a resource for others with less experience; coaches and provides feedback, and guides others.
Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex corporate compliance and ethics program tasks.
Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments.
Possesses excellent communication skills.
Is detail oriented with strong organizational skills.
Possesses a high degree of integrity.
Prior experience working in the pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device industry is a plus.

Department 440301 - Facilities Budget Office
Department Facilities Budget Office
Job City & State Raleigh, North Carolina
Primary Function of Organizational Unit

The 900+ positions of the Facilities Division serves the students and staff of the University’s teaching, research, and administrative space. The Facilities Division provides design and building services, maintenance, custodial, landscape, solid waste removal, utility, mail, and motor pool services 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. The goal is to deliver cost effective services to the University, ensure completed projects and maintenance that conform to codes and regulations, while minimizing University liabilities and disruptions caused by the maintenance, repair, building, and equipment modifications to the University.
Essential Job Duties

The budget Analyst assists in maintaining the operating budget of the Facilities Division at NC State University. This position reports to the Facilities Budget Manager for the Facilities Division and manages one of the largest operating budgets in the University domain.

Primary duties of the budget analyst include, but are not limited to:
Providing leadership, oversight, and support in the execution of the budget to agency head and/or division management.
Examine budgets and expenditures for compliance with applicable state budget rules, legislative intent as well as federal and state laws.
Providing consultation, technical assistance, and coordination in the preparation and execution of the continuation, operating and expansion budgets which may utilize multiple funding sources.
Completing or evaluating methodologies used in the preparation of budget or program spending forecasts and provide technical assistance to improve the accuracy of projections.

Other Work/Responsibilities

Developing complex spreadsheets and reports on an ad-hoc and periodic basis.
Minimum Experience/Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, Accounting, or related discipline; or equivalent combination of training and experience.

All degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions.
Departmental Required Skills
Significant experience in finance and business.
Advanced skill in business oriented software applications, such as Microsoft Excel. High level of detail.
Demonstrate the interpersonal, communication, and strategic planning skills necessary to interact and facilitate change with administrators and staff.
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to communicate, manage and problem solve well at all levels of the organization.
Strong communication skills including written and verbal communications.
Ability to work cross-functionally with teams to build consensus, develop effective relationships, and resolve conflict.

Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education
Bachelor’s Degree with a major in Business, Accounting, Economics, Statistics, or a related field. Knowledge of state government policies and regulations.
Progressive experience creating reports using Excel.
Significant experience in finance and business related to state agencies and universities.
Experience with Google Suite, specifically Sheets and Data Studio.

Required License or Certification

N/A

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Nuveen, the investment manager of TIAA, offers a comprehensive
range of outcome-focused investment solutions designed to secure the long-term
financial goals of institutional and individual investors. Its affiliates offer
deep expertise across a comprehensive range of traditional and alternative
investments through a wide array of vehicles and customized strategies.

For more information
about the firm please visit our website at www.Nuveen.com

POSITION SUMMARY:

Currently, Nuveen has an
opportunity in their Charlotte, NC office for a Lead Application Analyst to
provide support to their 24x7 production organization. This role will be
responsible for ensuring that production incidents are managed effectively with
minimal customer impact. In addition, the individual will manage the response
to incidents globally and use a variety of incident management tools,
communications, and facilitation methods to ensure issues are identified and
the right stakeholders are involved in resolution.

This is a hands-on
position with a strong emphasis on regular production support. The right
candidate should be comfortable learning new technologies and thrive in a
true-agile, fast-paced, production environment.

The ideal candidate will
have experience with handling challenges and have the ability to drive and
inspire technical and process changes. This position is a strong advocate and
catalyst for continual process and technology improvements related to all
aspects of MIM (Major Incident Management), Problem Management and Disaster
Recovery.

This position will work
assigned shifts (Morning, Afternoon or Evening).

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Oversee recovery efforts for
major incidents or problems (irrespective of severity) that cause service
impact and acts as escalation point for incidents not being resolved in a
timely manner
Ensure that required technical
resources are engaged and actively working to restore service for
business-critical events and performing functional and hierarchical
escalations as appropriate
Ensure that issues are
responded to and that normal service operations are restored as quickly as
possible
Review and revise incident
management processes, policies and escalation procedures on a regular
basis to drive efficiencies and effectiveness in responding to issues
On call for 24/7/365 for all
major incidents
Develop, implement and
continually refine and improve incident and problem management procedures
and documentation to align service operations with best practices and
addressing triage/analysis, response, resolution, escalation and
communication
Conduct after action reviews
after an incident is closed to ensure key learnings are gathered and
mitigations put in place
Understand the business impact
of the escalated Incident
Work closely with the Nuveen
application teams and Converged Technical Operations (C-TOC) to
collaboratively support the mission of monitoring critical services,
critical batch monitoring reducing incidents and shortening the impact of
events and minimizing service disruption to our customers
Monitor applications for most
efficient operation, identifying fault conditions as well as opportunities
for further optimization
QUALIFICATIONS:
Required:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer
Information Systems, Mathematics, or a related field
Experience working in a 24x7 production environment
Minimum of two (2) years’ experience working with a
Linux or Unix-like command line
Experience with Linux/UNIX Systems administration (such
as Ubuntu, CentOS, RedHat, Solaris, etc.)
Ability to troubleshoot at all levels (i.e. from
Application to Network to host)
Experience with multi-tenant architecture
Ability to work shifts (morning, mid-afternoon or
evening, Sunday-Thursday, Tuesday-Saturday
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiar with debugging applications running on Linux
and/or UNIX servers
Experience with Splunk and Splunk ITSI
Familiarity with Dynatrace, CA- Wily, Introscope,
Executive Insight APM solution
Experience with AWS cloud platform services
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
Experience with SSO and permissions management
Experience with Federated Identity Management
Experience with Automation or Monitoring framework
deployment or development
Experience with process automation and orchestration
products
Experience with Windows servers
Previous experience working in the financial services
industry

Red Ventures is seeking advanced marketers experienced in content marketing and technical SEO skill sets for our HigherEducation.com brand. We are looking for creators to drive natural search growth for our growing portfolio of owned and operated assets.

As an SEO Analyst, you'll support one or more of our businesses and drive innovation for some of the biggest sites in a wide range of verticals ranging from home services and healthcare to financial services, and more.

Being an SEO Analyst at Red Ventures means doing all the things you have always "wanted to do," but never had the time or resources to do at your previous job. It means means working alongside a data science and engineering team fully dedicated to creating SEO products and tools that give you access to more data and better insights, meaning you spend less time on SEMrush and more time making decisions that impact the business.

What You'll Do:
Test, innovate, and build custom solutions with our world-class digital marketing, data science, and big data talent.
Analyze organic search landscapes to find opportunities that drive valuable traffic and bottom-line value for the business in collaboration with our experience and business teams.
Set and experiment with content strategy and promotion with world-class experience, creative teams and digital tools and channels.
Leverage our proprietary primary source marketing stack to report on everything from operational (production) progress to upper funnel demand capture, rank position, and full funnel visibility to conversion and P&L metrics.
Keep our sites and pages technically optimized for mobile users and search performance - including information architecture, schema management, semantic HTML, page speed, and other components of crawling and indexing performance.
Who We're Looking For:
Passionate about innovating in organic search, don't accept theories at face value, and enjoy testing to prove effectiveness of tactics.
A self-starting, curious, proven performer with at least 3 years of experience in SEO.
Innovative, on-the-spot, creative problem solver who demonstrates both technical and analytical skills; candidates must be comfortable measuring, interpreting, and making fast-paced decisions based on large volumes of sales and marketing performance data.
Experience working in the weeds with data using tools such as Microsoft Excel, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Power BI, Tableau, Google Cloud Projects/Big Query, Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager, SQL, and other common reporting platforms.
The ideal candidate will have strong data analytics skills with at least conceptual experience of data cleansing/wrangling/munging, joining disparate datasets
Comfortable optimizing HTML, CSS, and JS necessary to optimize page load speed.
Familiar with a number of SEO suites and tools including: STAT, Moz, SEMRush, Majestic, Botify, Screaming Frog, Ahrefs, Brightlocal, and DeepCrawl.
Comfortable working with business leaders in forecasting, budgeting, sensitivity analysis, and business modeling.
Find out why Red Ventures ranks above the rest https://inspired.redventures.com/inside-rv-life-as-a-red-ventures-seo-pro/
Even Better:
Proficiency in R, Python, GREP/REGEX or command line chops
Who We Are:

Founded in 2000, Red Ventures is a portfolio of growing digital businesses that bring consumers and brands together through integrated e-commerce, strategic partnerships and many proprietary brands including Bankrate, AllConnect.com and Reviews.com. Headquartered south of Charlotte, NC, Red Ventures has over 3000 employees in offices across the US, as well as London and Sao Paulo. For more information, visit www.redventures.com.

At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.

NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst to join our team in Raleigh, North Carolina (US-NC), United States (US).

The Business Analyst uses business and technology knowledge to serve as a liaison between business initiatives and IT in order to determine the correct course of action to achieve desired results. This person collaborates with business and technical resources to determine business information and application needs and assists clients in the analysis of a proposed idea and performs the review, determines the systems potential, conducts documentation, testing (as needed) and follow through.

Responsibilities:

* Documents client organization's direction, structure, business processes and requirements.

* Liaison between the business and development teams throughout the project.

* Analyzes business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how the application can best function to fulfill those needs.

* Identifies cross impact to other systems.

* Proposes solutions to problems and considers timeliness, effectiveness, and practicality in addressing client needs.

* Understands project plans and is able to clearly articulate roles, project goals, and timelines.

* Adheres to and facilitates project standards.

* Creates, consolidates and presents documents relating to use cases, functional requirements, data mapping, privilege provisioning and authorization models, maintaining them throughout the project, including traceability back to requirements.

* Ensures with the quality management team that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, and that testing plans have been completed.

* Provides a business or process perspective during design reviews.

* Participates in change control process throughout the project.

* Proactively carries out project support /administrative functions.

Skills and Abilities:

* Outstanding organizational and multi-tasking skills

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

* Strong attention to detail

* Ability to deal directly with all levels of management – from consultants to executives and business partners

* Strong sense of urgency and high level of responsiveness

* Ability to work independently and part of a team

* Rapidly adapts and responds to changes in environment and priorities

* Understands basic Internet and client/server architectures

* Possesses basic knowledge of HTML

* Proficient in Microsoft Office suite

Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in business or related field

* 3+ years of experience as business analyst

Preferences:

*Experience in working with development teams preferred

*Experience in systems implementation, business analysis, and/or project management

*Big 4 and/or boutique consulting firm experience

*Consulting experience with a FSI client

*FSI merger & acquisition experience

*100% travel tolerance

This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.

About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.

NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.

This role supports Nuveen’s investment
management team by ensuring trading activity is confirmed and settled in a
timely manner. This job involves maintaining and processing sensitive
trade data that could compromise the security and integrity of the
organization. Trade data related to billions of dollars of participant
assets are being processed and transmitted on a daily basis. There is
inherent risk in ensuring that data is not compromised and that the trades are
settled in a timely manner to avoid market trading disruptions and staying
within the guidelines mandated by each fund and the firm

As Senior Analyst on the US Fixed Income
Trade Settlements team, you will be responsible for the confirmation,
communication, and settlement of Nuveen’s US Fixed Income trades. This
individual works closely with Traders, Brokers, and Custodians to ensure trades
are recorded accurately, matched against the counterparty’s details, and
recorded and settled in a timely manner by the custodian banks.

mismatched and missing confirmations

fund administrators, and other interested parties

Management of failed trades

·
Other duties as assigned and required

3-5 years of experience including a solid
knowledge of the lifecycle of a trade from execution to settlement

·
Solid understanding of various Investment
Management products (Pension funds, Mutual funds, Separate accts)

·
Experience with industry trade matching
utilities, like DTCC ALERT, CTM, OASYS

Bloomberg AIM and Charles River Investment Management Solution

Bachelor's Degree

Experience with Portfolio Accounting Systems

Effective communication skills to facilitate
deadlines.

under pressure in high stress environments

Strong analytical and quantitative skills with
an ability to understand complex workflows

Good understanding of operational risks and
controls

We don’t just sell and build new homes; we also manage teams, acquire land, manufacture materials, provide mortgages to our customers, and provide corporate support to NVR’s multi-billion dollar business operations.

Your analytical approach to business will allow you to successfully take financial responsibility for profit center operations as a Financial Analyst on our team. Job Title: Financial Analyst, US Commercial Finance

Department: Commercial FP&A

Location: Raleigh, NC

Job Type: FTE

Job Summary

Team member will support the US Clear Aligner Sales & Commercial Operations organizations and will play an integral part in advising them on how to meet financial objectives while delivering optimal results. This role will report to the Sr. Director Finance, US.

Our growing company is searching for individual who has strong attention to detail, great business acumen and proficiency in software tools and ERP systems. This is an exciting role providing financial controllership, cost management, timely analysis and support to the commercial team. This role will work closely with cross-functional teams and will develop strong relationships with all assigned business partners while maintaining an objective mind in evaluating programs to drive growth.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Prepare annual operating plan, quarterly forecasts, monthly/quarterly outlooks as it relates to operating expenses for the US Commercial teams

Perform period end closing responsibilities including, but not limited to, journal entries, review of expenses, and calculating accruals associated with the US commercial teams.

Monthly budget versus actual reports as required to support the Commercial teams decision making process with budget owners

Support the Commercial organization with analysis and ad-hoc financial projects when necessary

Responsible for headcount approvals in Workday, purchase requisition approvals in SAP, contracts approvals in CLM. If out of budget, partner with business leaders to ensure there is a plan in place that manages overall spend within budget.

Research accounting matters when needed

Ability to effectively interface with cross-functional partners and develop relationships with business partners while maintaining objective mindset

Enter financial data to Financial Planning system CPM (aka Host Analytics)

Maintain positive and active relationships with leaders and business partners to ensure financial transparency.

Other duties and ad hoc projects may be assigned

Requirements

3+ years of relevant Finance experience;

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field

Strong communication and presentation skills required

Dependable, trust-worthy individual with control oriented mindset and high attention to detail.

Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Problem solver, system and detailed oriented and analytical capability, especially dealing with large volumes of data without sacrificing on accuracy

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage time effectively

Advanced Excel skills and systems experience such as SAP, Business Objects BI reporting, planning systems (Host Analytics) and data visualization tools a plus

Ability to travel up to 10%

Implementation Analyst – Overview:

DealCloud is the premier deal management and CRM solution for firms in the private capital markets. The Implementation Analyst will work within an energetic professional services team and will be responsible for designing and configuring the DealCloud platform for our clients in response to their specific business requirements. The role is a mix of client-facing consultative work and behind the scenes platform design, configuration, data analysis, and data manipulation. The Implementation Analyst should demonstrate passion in and a desire to become skilled in four broad areas:
Technology: As a market leading Software as a Service (SaaS) company, the Implementation Analyst will be working with cutting edge technology solutions. A strong interest in technology and being passionate about using technology to create value for our clients is a must.
Client facing skills: A significant amount of day-to-day responsibilities will involve communicating with clients, both on the phone or via email. Strong written and verbal communication skills are required for success.
Private Capital Markets: In order to speak confidently and authoritatively to our clients, the Implementation Analyst must either have or be willing to be trained about private equity and investment banking front office business operations.
Data: Analyzing and understanding client data is an important factor that influences a client's system design; as such, the Implementation Analyst must be eager to understand data relationships and the interplay between data and business requirements.
Requirements

Responsibilities include:
Participating in requirement gathering sessions onsite at client offices or virtually via web conferencing (potential travel up to 30%)
Documenting client requirements
Configuring the DealCloud platform in response to requirements
Analyzing client legacy data sets to understand the impact of the data on system design
Working with Microsoft Excel to map, collate, and normalize disparate data sets for import into DealCloud
Providing consultative system design and industry best practice recommendations throughout a implementation
Holding both clients and internal team members accountable to project timelines and budgets
Managing multiple client implementations concurrently
Requirements include:
3 years + of working experience
Organization, effective time management, and ability to multi-task
Passion for delivering high quality outcomes
Ability to work under tight deadlines
Experience working as part of a team
Lead client meetings and communications
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving abilities
Comfort with Microsoft Excel, familiarity with basic Excel functions
Ability to adapt to rapidly evolving situations
Strong sense of personal responsibility and ownership over your work
Willingness and love of learning new technology, new processes and procedures, and new business models
Benefits

What you'll get:
Competitive compensation
Challenging and rewarding work
Generous benefits package
An incredible team of smart and mission-driven people to work with

JOB SUMMARY:


The purpose of the Operations Analyst role is to provide system administration and process support (transactional and non-transactional) for HR Partnering (HRP), People and Organizational Development (POD) and Compensation and Benefits. An HR Operations Analyst is aligned to an HR function and the supporting HR technology such as SAP, Kronos, Cornerstone or SharePoint as well as skilled in managing data relationships with external vendor systems. They will develop broader expertise across multiple systems and programs as part of a future HR Operations team.

Our Analysts are system and program subject matter experts who assist in implementing and provide on-going HRIS support (for their primary systems), providing tools and training to our users and key stakeholders. This role is also responsible for process and work instructions, customer support and issue resolution, maintaining HR content, data maintenance, reporting and transactional program support.

System Administrator/Support (40% - 50%)
Implement (assist), support and manage HRIS and technology platforms.
System maintenance and updates.
Customer support and issue resolution.
Research and resolve system issues.
Act as subject matter expert in understanding system capabilities and enable HR to optimize the system to deliver best practice processes.
Manage data and analytic functions within the system, create on-going and adhoc reports, manage dashboard KPI data. Enable business decision making.
Create system tools and user toolkits, provide training to users across the enterprise.
Program Support (50%-60%)
Process and work instructions.
Data transactions and maintenance.
Coordinate and administer programs, issue resolution.
Program scheduling and logistics.
Manage online content.
Manage program collaterall

As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will provide meaningful analysis to support decision making. This could include normal business operations, project assessments, or external engagements. You will work across the business to apply analytical skills to provide deep and objective assessments to be used for critical business decisions.

Job Responsibilities

- Prepare monthly financial reporting packages for Executive management team, department heads & outside interested parties.
- Coordinate with corporate accounting and FP&A teams on accounting, systems and planning matters.
- Support the routine forecasting and annual budgeting process for FP&A teams.
- Find opportunities and execute centralization of data in budgeting and planning system for distributive use.
- Develop into subject matter expert for budgeting and planning system and support business in reporting and analysis requirements.
- Drive analysis for business case evaluations.
- Perform other ad hoc business analysis and modeling as needed.

Required Education, Skills, and Qualification

- A minimum of three (3) years of financial analysis experience, preferably in $500M+ software business (preferably including Software-as-a-Service and transactional revenue models)
- Bachelor’s degree with a major in Accounting or Finance
- Must have demonstrated the highest levels of mastery of Microsoft Excel
- Knowledge of accounting, reporting, forecasting/business intelligence systems
- Intermediate database skills, as well as familiarity with other Microsoft Office products and corporate ERP systems
- Ability to perform effectively in a fast-paced, demanding environment
- Unquestioned professional integrity

Identifies problems, develops and evaluates options, and implements solutions

Understands organizational strengths and corporate vision and identifies points within programs or projects to drive integration between the two
Manages competing demands and adapts to frequent change, delays, and unexpected results.

Why HNI Corporation?

HNI Corporation (NYSE: HNI), is a $2.3 billion-dollar, global office furniture and hearth product enterprise. A leading furniture manufacturer and distributor, OFM is headquartered in North Carolina with distribution centers there and in California, Pennsylvania, Kansas and Washington state. Job Description
The Franchise Profitability Senior Analyst, FP&A is responsible for supporting the effort to build out a comprehensive solution around franchisee profitability. The Franchise Profitability department will ultimately encompass all verticals across 2,400+ franchised centers and is responsible for helping franchisees maximize their profitability by creating an automated solution for data collection and standardization, financial statement analysis, franchisee communication and feedback, systems implementation, deliverable design and development, training, and reporting.

The Franchise Profitability Senior Analyst, FP&A will support these efforts by helping integrate brand point of sale systems with franchisee accounting systems, creating an accounting handbook, and conducting franchisee outreach to drive enrollment and adoption of brand policies and procedures.

This role will also aid in providing reliable financial reporting information to Senior Executives and Business Unit Management to be used to make decisions impacting the performance of the corporation. This role will also be responsible for performing analysis and providing meaningful reports and metrics that help drive results of the business.

This position reports to the Director of Franchise Profitability, and offers a high level of visibility with the CFO and other Senior/Executive Management Team members. There is also a high level of interaction with the Operations, Financial, Marketing and Business Development teams.

Duties and Responsibilities:

· Develop processes and procedures to integrate brand POS systems with QuickBooks

· Create an accounting handbook by brand and publish on brand communication platforms

· Conduct franchisee outreach to drive enrollment in each brand’s respective profitability tools and drive adoption of program policies and procedures

· Assist franchisees in adoption of brand chart of accounts and mapping to various profitability tools

· Create brand specific training materials to educate stakeholders on the purpose and operation of franchise profitability programs and tools

· Prepare, review and analyze financial forecasts, operating budgets and strategic plans

· Provide in-depth analysis on financial performance and root cause variances to forecasts

· Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variance

· Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators including all areas of revenue, cost of sales, expenses and capital expenditures

· Develop and analyze financial models to support strategic initiatives

· Understand business requirements and translate them into specific reporting tools

· Develop quarterly and monthly financial and business reports

· Prepare monthly reports to summarize the progress/effectiveness of profitability tools

· Prepare presentations for the Board of Directors and Senior Management Team

· Work alongside Brand leads to identify pilot franchisees, solicit P&Ls, review and identify exceptions

· Design standard reporting deliverables, including benchmarking, cohort/peer comparisons and opportunities

· Publish monthly newsletter to franchisees to highlight new programs and tools, share success stories, scheduled trainings, best practices, maintenance of hosted profitability tools, etc.

· Assist with research on cross-functional cost savings measures for franchisees

· Ad-hoc reporting and analysis

Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s Degree (Business, Accounting or Finance, preferred)

· Licensed CPA (preferred)

· Preferred 2-3 years of relevant work experience

· Aptitude for Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint

· Comfort analyzing large data sets via SQL queries, pivot tables, etc.

· Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized

· Strong analytical and problem solving skills

· Ability to handle multiple priorities against multiple deadlines

· Ability to work well with people across multiple functions

· Ability to communicate/present to senior level managers

Job Title: Land Acquisition Analyst - New Home Construction
Job Description:
Job Description


American Homes 4 Rent

As one of the country’s fastest-growing property management companies of single-family rental homes, American Homes 4 Rent has an exhilarating and fluid start-up culture and permanency of a well-founded corporation, rich with diversity. As pioneers in the industry, solidified by our place on Wall Street, American Homes 4 Rent (AMH:NYSE) is currently looking for qualified candidates. With a culture of unprecedented growth, quality and innovative collaboration, we are seeking personalities to complement our attributes.

The Land Acquisition Analyst facilitates and assists in the land acquisition function including research, financial and pricing analysis. The Analyst will identify acquisition opportunities through contacts with brokers, builders, bankers, landowners, engineers, planners, attorneys, and municipal officials. In addition, this position will scrutinize all property deals and find land in areas and price ranges consistent with company needs, while optimizing the return on investment and minimizing risk to the company.

Responsibilities -
Develops analysis of property value and underwriting for raw land and vacant Development lots for acquisitions
Prepares time-to-market underwriting proformas
Conducts general research in selected markets to facilitate the identification of land opportunities; prepares graphs, maps, marketing boards and standard features comparisons
Reviews and interprets zoning and land use ordinances; gathers competitive information from other residential communities; negotiates contracts with sellers
Ensures Architectural Review Board (ARB) approvals with developers, owners and HOAs; oversees the compilation of data related to specific jurisdiction, HOA obligations and property taxes
Performs asset sales pricing analysis (e.g., residual value analysis) and formulates/analyzes financial deal points for potential disposition opportunities; develops feasibility packages
Visits site location and evaluates property for purchase; provides lot analyses on all communities; collects and analyzes data to prepare reports with a snapshot of all acquisitions for any given time; builds strong internal relationships with Purchasing, Construction and Property Management.
Processes all applications and permits for approval
Requirements –
Bachelor’s degree in Real Estate, Economics, Statistics, Government Relations or a related field required
Minimum of five (5) years of experience in land acquisitions that specifically includes contract negotiation and relationship building required
Intermediate experience with Microsoft Office Suite required
Valid driver’s license required
Must be financially literate
Three (3) or more years as a financial analyst and/or business analyst preferred
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics CRM preferred
Work where you feel right at home –

If you are a versatile professional who values culture, a constructive environment and the potential for exponential growth, we want to work with you! Apply now and someone from our Talent Acquisition team will reach out to you soon!

Information regarding AH4R’s collection and use of your personal information can be found at https://www.americanhomes4rent.com/addenda/employee_privacy

Related keywords –

Land acquisition analyst, acquisition, land acquisition, real estate, economics, statistics, government relations, business analyst, financial analyst, contract negotiation, relationship building, property management, full time

REQUISITION NUMBER: 022520.0Xb-M22p
FUNCTIONAL / LABOR CATEGORY: Logistics Analyst
POSITION TITLE: Consultant/Senior Consultant
LOCATION: Havelock, NC

DESCRIPTION:
Sehlke Consulting is looking for qualified individuals to join a team that shall provide Logistics support to the United States Marine Corps, II Marine Expeditionary Force.

EDUCATION: N/A

CERTIFICATION(s): N/A

LABOR CATEGORY / DUTIES:

• Provide logistics support services which include, draft policies, provide Support Agreement Manager (SAM) services, and procurement system services within the Procure-to-pay, Plan-to-stock, Acquire-to-Retire, and Order-to-Cash business processes. Work involves analyzing metadata and developing corrective actions for anomalies using ROCoE and/or SIPRIA which will assist the supply community with developing well-defined requirements, develop costing methodologies, cradle-to-grave oversight of the procurement lifecycle, validations in accordance with DoD FMR and other regulatory policy.
• Conduct analysis on various Table of Authorized Material Control Number end items on Total Life Cycle Management, mean time before failure, sustainment costs, problem class IX consumables, and overall readiness trends.
• Utilize ROCoE and/or SIPRIA data output and subject matter expertise related to equipment Total Life Cycle Management in order to prioritize funding allocations for future maintenance efforts and programs..
• Utilize ROCoE and/or SIPRIA data to conduct analysis on the supply readiness posture of various Table of Authorized Material Control Number end items, analyze equipment deficiencies and provide corrective action recommendations or mitigation measures to fill capability gaps, analyze excess and obsolete equipment and provided recommendations to divest in order to conserve sustainment and maintenance resources, and analyze programs for equipment sourcing and distribution processes to recommend efficiency improvement opportunities.
• Determine trends and process improvements through analysis and ROCoE and/or SIPRIA outputs of key supply performance indicators.
• Develop a process for analyzing past equipment maintenance spending trends, service request part demands, and deployment schedules to predict future demands and resource requirements.
• Conduct a Requirements Analysis to assess maintenance demands and resource requirement fluctuations and determine data sources and data extraction methodology to be used in further ROCoE and/or SIPRIA improvement and development.
• Conduct analysis of supply and maintenance data to create a historical baseline and comparison for various performance metrics that serve to provide Logistics entities and subordinate units with logistical flow data for resource allocation and budgeting projections.

REQUIREMENTS:

• Four years of service within a DoD logistics field.
• Shall possess strong communications skills and experience in interacting with Marine Corps Officers, Senior Noncommissioned Officers, and Civilian Employees.
• Experience, demonstrated knowledge of use, and ability to obtain and maintain access to relevant systems.

Founded in 2011, Sehlke Consulting is a rapidly-growing Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Arlington, VA – and an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Who is Domtar?

At Domtar, we're driven to improve quality of life. With annual sales of US $5.5 billion, we make a wide variety of products that people around the world rely on every day, from copy paper to baby diapers. And how we do business is just as important as what we make. We've earned Great Place to Work Certification in the U.S. and a Forbes ranking as one of Canada's Best Employers. Through our values of agility, caring and innovation, we constantly find better ways to champion health, dignity and comfort with our customers, colleagues and in our communities.

Who is Domtar Personal Care?

Personal care is not just our business. It's Personal. It's a child, a loved one; it's often about those that can't help themselves. Caring for them can only be personal. So Personal Care isn't our category; it's our calling, our mission. We imagine the solutions that make caring for babies' skin, and preserving dignity and independence easier and more affordable for everyone. At Domtar, we believe everyone deserves personal care.

Our Vision

To be a global leader in absorbent hygiene by meeting consumers' diverse needs through effective, affordable and widely available personal care solutions.

Our Mission

We champion health, dignity and comfort. We serve consumers and caregivers wherever they access personal care, through healthcare, retail and direct channels. We create value through our innovative solutions and achieve cost efficiency through operational scale, flexibility and the use of technology.

Your Role

Highly motivated self-directed individual who can facilitate gathering of financial information, analyzing the data, reporting and distributing the results, and making recommendations that continuously improve our financial performance. Individual must possess knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and understand appropriate application.

Key Responsibilities
Participate and support the organization's annual budgeting process which includes exploding bill of materials and applying current raw material pricing, direct labor and overhead rates.
Coordinates/assists in the preparation of a detailed rolling twelve month forecast based on sales, marketing, manufacturing and corporate input.
Maintain and support Company product costing system to include material costing, freight costing, conversion costing, packaging costing and scrap rates. Perform and validate Standard Cost Updates.
Prepare analysis and interpretation of purchase price variances, monthly raw material price/volume analysis as well as related index movement.
Participate in monthly close process to include preparation of journal entries and reconciliation of general ledger accounts including accrual analysis and account reconciliation. Assist in preparation, generation and review of monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements. Includes preparing waterfall charts that bridge comparative periods while providing detailed commentary on variances.
Provide validation of the manufacturing lines reported throughput and other key performance indicators as requested. Backup for operations weekly metrics reporting.
Recognize emerging trends and make recommendations to improve business profitability, generate "what-if" analysis based on selected financial/business assumptions, assist in establishing operating procedures and reporting tools that allow management to make informed business decisions and assist in continuous improvement, development, modification and implementation of financial systems as necessary.
Interact with Sales, Marketing, Manufacturing, Finance and Supply Chain on business issues that impact financial performance or projections. Responsible for providing internal customers (Sales, Marketing and Operations) with information and ad-hoc reports and analysis as requested.
Assist in annual audit review and SOX compliance for internal and external auditors. Review financial transactions and apply accounting theory and principles to ensure compliance with GAAP and applicable laws, rules, policies, and procedures.
Maintain weekly metrics scorecard to include production and shipment data; Prepare and interpret profitability by customer, product, channel and product category.
Key Competencies
Mastery skill level and knowledge of Microsoft Office Products.
Knowledge of Oracle Financial Systems preferred.
Ability to work in a team environment and effectively work independently.
Exceptional organizational and time management skills are crucial.
Position Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting OR 3 to 5 years of related work experience

Job Description:

This role resides within Enterprise Capital Management. The position involves the calculation, reporting and analysis of economic and regulatory capital and risk-weighted assets (RWA) for wholesale exposures, which consists of ~$0.7T in funded balances spanning multiple products and lines of businesses. The team member will ensure calculations appropriately handle the positions in the portfolio including new transactions/products; identify alternatives/assumptions within the Basel rules that can tangibly improve our capital position; work with support partners to supervise the implementation of models and enhancements to calculations; design and produce reports of capital and RWA; assist in the bank’s explanation of capital and RWA to the lines of business and senior management; assist in wholesale capital variance commentary on various regulatory reports, and perform other analyses, such as measuring the effect of changes to rules or to the portfolio.

Enterprise Role Overview

Responsible for independently conducting data analysis and reporting projects. Responsible for querying large sets of data, maintaining analytic processes and systems approaches. Creates documentation for all activities and works with Technology staff in design of any system to run models developed. Incumbents possess excellent data analytic skills and a broad knowledge of financial markets and products.

Required Skills and Experience:
Finance or Quantitative related Undergraduate with 2+ years working in financial services
Analytical ability and problem-solving skills with desire for continual learning including impact of potential new or changing regulations
Strong attention to detail with ability to simplify the complex and drive key initiatives
Ability to work collaboratively with teams and interface credibly across various LOBs and support partners at both junior and senior levels
Experience with SQL or other programming language
Experience working with large data sets.
Must be able to read and understand python code.
Desired Skills and Experience:
VBA strongly desired
Wholesale product knowledge
Familiar with Basel rules
Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40

Job Title: Real Estate Industry Customer Solutions Analyst
Job Description:
SoftPro is the nation's leading provider of real estate closing and title insurance software. A division of Fidelity National Financial (NYSE: FNF), SoftPros technology solutions are used in thousands of law firms and title companies throughout the country and are an essential part of residential and commercial Real Estate transactions. SoftPro is located in North Raleigh and is a great alternative to driving in RTP traffic each day!

We recently moved to a brand new work space that has cool features such as team collaboration areas, automatic height-adjustable desks, game room and a market area with gourmet coffee, free sodas and a flavored sparkling beverage system as well as discounted healthy food offerings!

SoftPro has received national recognition for our excellent customer service and products and we were recently recognized as one of the Best Places to Work by Triangle Business Journal for the 8th year in a row!

What are we looking for?
SoftPro is seeking a Real Estate Customer Solutions Analyst in our Raleigh, NC office to join our talented and passionate Customer Solutions team.

What will I do as a Customer Solutions Analyst?
In this position you resolve Real Estate industry application issues for all SoftPro applications, primarily SoftPro Select and accompany services/utilities. Additionally, you will:
Assist SoftPro customers with various tasks, including but not limited to, CDF/file balancing, reconciliation of trust accounts, and other related pieces of the Real Estate closing process.
Accurately document all customer issues, resolution steps, and gather feedback in support tracking software.
Providing a high level of customer service to each customer he/she works with at all times.
Ability to handle several priorities and manage knowledge of multiple products and their features.
Additional duties as assigned.
What do I need to be successful as a Customer Solutions Analyst?
Experience with the Real Estate closing and Title Insurance procedures
Experience with West Coast Escrow & Closing process experience is a plus.
The ideal candidate will have a great attitude and feel comfortable working in a high-paced team environment, and have great problem solving/troubleshooting skills.
Quick learner, eager to learn new technologies that provide solutions for the Real Estate closing and title industry.
Excellent communication, organization and interpersonal skills.
Strong Problem Solving, troubleshooting, analysis and testing skills.
Must be familiar / comfortable with working in the Microsoft Windows operating system and applications.
Proficient in typing and math a must!
Ability to work outside of an 8am-5pm timeframe at times
2 years of previous Customer Service experience
Prior experience with SoftPro is a plus!
Join us and live our Core Values
Deliver AMAZING Customer Service, Be an AWESOME Teammate, Adopt a Sense of Urgency, Innovate to be Efficient, Produce Quality Work, Take Initiative, Go the Extra Mile.

Digital Marketing Analyst (Amazon Marketplaces)
Job Description


Think about the last time you searched Google, Amazon, Yahoo or Bing to purchase a product. Have you ever thought about who creates the Pay Per Click (PPC) advertisements you are seeing in the search results? Do you wonder how many people actually click on those ads? Are they profitable? Were those specific ads targeted to you based on your demographics or shopping habits?

As a Digital Marketing Analyst in our Amazon Marketplaces service, your role will center on work that is fast-paced and autonomous, set within a supportive team structure. The goals are to develop and maintain effective paid search campaigns for your clients, and based on the performance data, continually optimize through ad copy testing, keyword analysis and bidding strategy. Quantitative goals and clearly defined objectives are determined for each campaign within each client account; you will be able to measure the impact of your work upon the growth of your clients’ businesses. If you have an analytical mindset, ability to learn and drive to succeed, we will train you to become a savvy, digital marketing expert!

We invest in a structured, individually-paced training regimen through which you will learn to create and manage paid search advertising campaigns for clients. You will become well-versed in the Amazon advertising platform, as well as our internal suite of proprietary tools. We invest in you so you can deliver your best to our clients, who continue to trust the growth of their business to us. Win-win-win.

If you have strong analytical abilities, a passion for delivering exceptional client service, and a history of high performance and leadership, you could be our next ROI’er!

Essential Responsibilities
Analyze and assess the performance of online advertising campaigns and translate quantitative and qualitative data into recommendations and plans for revising the campaign strategy.
Assist clients with meeting ROI expectations by performing ad copy testing and keyword analysis.
Implement successful bidding strategies and effective keyword management.
Continually monitor, revise, and optimize ad text as necessary.
Communicate regularly with clients on status, timeline, budget deliverables performance reporting and competitive intelligence analysis.
Create, categorize and refine keyword lists to create a comprehensive campaign that drives qualified visitors to client websites.
Use statistical analysis to draw conclusions about marketing campaigns and make recommendations accordingly.
Performing other duties as assigned.
Essential Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, Supply Chain or a related field from an accredited university
Proficient in Excel
