About Avalara

Avalara helps businesses of all sizes achieve compliance with transaction taxes, including sales and use, VAT, excise, communications, and other tax types. The company delivers comprehensive, automated, cloud-based solutions designed to be fast, accurate, and easy to use. The Avalara Compliance Cloud® platform helps customers manage complicated and burdensome tax compliance obligations imposed by state, local, and other taxing authorities throughout the world.

Avalara offers more than 600 pre-built connectors into leading accounting, ERP, ecommerce and other business applications, making the integration of tax and compliance solutions easy for customers. Each year, the company processes billions of indirect tax transactions for customers and users, files more than a million tax returns, and manages millions of tax exemption certificates and other compliance documents.

Headquartered in Seattle, Avalara has offices across the U.S. and overseas in the U.K., Belgium, Brazil, and India. More information at www.avalara.com

The perks of working at Avalara go beyond amazing physical spaces and a Tiki Bar. We’re committed to continued progress in diversity and inclusion. As an employee at Avalara, you’ll have the opportunity to join resource groups focused on diversity of thought, engage with your local or global community about topics that matter to you and the organization and receive continued education around inclusion and development. As Avalara grows, so do the voices within it. It’s time to hear your voice.

Avalara is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, gender, nation of origin, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law. We thrive on diversity and encourage people from all walks of life to apply to Avalara’s open positions.

Are you looking for an opportunity to turn your ambition and your people skills into a rewarding career with an industry leader? Join our team at American Tire Distributors! As the nation's premier tire distributor, ATD’s coast-to-coast distribution network provides approximately 80,000 customers across the U.S. and Canada with rapid and frequent delivery of high quality tires, custom wheels and shop supplies.

Position Description:

Logistics done right.

At American Tire Distributors, our employees are our greatest asset and we’re always on the lookout for inspirational leaders who know how to get the best out of the team. We are looking for a Merchandising Analyst under the leadership of the Senior Vice President of Merchandising - PLT, who will be responsible for providing analysis to support the execution of Merchandising Strategy across all passenger and light truck brands. This person will work cross functionally across Merchandising and with functional partners in Finance, Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain, and Pricing. This position plays a key role in informing the Vendor Strategy for the overall enterprise.

Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.

What you’ll do on a typical day:
Support the Merchandising team with analysis that will inform a vendor strategy and assist the Brand Leadership team in executing that strategy
Own and maintain the Vendor “Performance Review” (Scorecard)
Maintain inputs to the GMROI model to drive brand, style, and SKU decisions
Work with the Advanced Analytics department to create and leverage a Vendor Bonus optimization engine
Perform ad hoc analysis based on requests from the Brand Leaders and the Vendors to identify what’s driving results (both favorable and unfavorable) in sales, margin, or inventory.
Assemble the monthly Brand Review presentation to senior leadership
Produce required on-going set of daily/weekly/monthly reports
Assist in creating Merchandising content for Board of Directors presentations (or similar)
Meet departmental standards for quality, quantity and turn time expectations.
Prioritize multiple responsibilities to ensure all deadlines are met, and resolve any issues in a timely manner by partnering with appropriate business partner(s).
You will need the following to succeed at ATD:

At a minimum:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in a related business discipline (Business, Marketing, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Economics)
Experience: 5+ years of experience in vendor management, planning & analysis, or merchandising analytics
Systematic problem solver who understands the value of leveraging analytical insights to drive innovative solutions
Experience with analytical tools such as Power BI, BI, Tableau, ThinkCell, Excel, PowerPoint
Strong analytical and conceptual skills
Strong ability to collaborate with multiple departments and functions
Demonstrated decision-making ability
Demonstrated leadership ability
Ability to partner and influence
Highly effective written/verbal communication and collaborative skills
It’d be great if you also have:
MBA
Merchant and/or Manufacturing experience
Experience in the Tire industry
B2B and B2C experience
Additional Details (work environment, specializations, etc.)

FUNCTIONAL / LABOR CATEGORY: Financial Analyst
POSITION TITLE: Consultant/Senior Consultant
LOCATION: Havelock, NC

DESCRIPTION:
Sehlke Consulting is looking for qualified individuals to join a team that shall provide Accounting, Budgeting and Financial Analysis support to the United States Marine Corps, II Marine Expeditionary Force.

EDUCATION: N/A

CERTIFICATION(s): N/A

LABOR CATEGORY / DUTIES:

• Assist the Assistant Chief of Staff (AC/S), Comptroller in establishing internal controls to provide reasonable assurance that process weaknesses can be prevented or detected early enough to mitigate and prevent an adverse impact on the organization.
• Assist the organization by identifying weaknesses in internal controls, programs, operational, or administrative areas through audits, inspections, and Internal Control assessments.
• Assist AC/S, Comptroller with testing internal controls in order to assess the functions, programs, and operations. Ensure subordinate commands develop corrective action plans to resolve Internal Control weaknesses.
• Assist with preparation of the Statement of Assurance (SOA) and results of internal control submissions. Track and perform follow-up on all reportable conditions and material weaknesses.
• Provide advice, assistance, and guidance to other Marine Corps entities as requested or directed.
• Provide Financial Improvement and Audit Readiness (FIAR) and Financial Program Management (FPM) support services.
• Support the demands of existing, expanding, and new requirements to comply with the Chief Financial Officers Act of 1990, Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Circular A-123, and various other regulations as they pertain to auditable financial statements and effective internal controls.
• Advise and coordinate with Government personnel and conduct tasks related to the remediation of sample deficiencies discovered by the DoD Inspector General/Independent Public Accounting audit personnel.
• Assist in the developing, coordinating, and disseminating of lessons learned.
• Serve as Subject Matter Expert (SME) advisor for Marine Corps budget, accounting, and financial management policy and procedures within the organization.
• Provide interpretive and analytical advice on Marine Corps financial transactions and program execution; develop format and content to provide various listings, reports, and data relative to status of funds and the propriety of obligations; and ensure the financial integrity, timeliness, accuracy and validity of supporting managerial accounting, budget execution.
• Analyze and advise on whether or not Marine Corps resources are managed efficiently and effectively, Marine Corps programs and operations are discharged with integrity, Marine Corps programs comply with applicable laws and regulations, and if the potential for fraud, waste, and mismanagement are minimized.

REQUIREMENTS:

• Four years of service within a DoD financial management field, and expert knowledge of budget processes and ability to explain the life cycle of an accounting transaction.
• Shall possess strong communications skills and experience in interacting with Marine Corps Officers, Senior Noncommissioned Officers, and Civilian Employees.
• Full grasp of the concepts, principles, practices, laws, and regulations of USMC budget, accounting, and internal controls. Knowledge must be sufficient enough to analyze programs at all levels and develop internal control policy recommendations. Must be able to interpret, assess, and project potential impact of new/revised internal control requirements.
• Must display knowledge of Statement of Budgetary Resources (SBR) and Schedule of Budgetary Activity (SBA) audit procedures and source documentation requirements.
• Experience, demonstrated knowledge of use, and ability to obtain and maintain access to relevant financial systems.

Founded in 2011, Sehlke Consulting is a rapidly-growing Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Arlington, VA – and an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Our Analysts are system and program subject matter experts who assist in implementing and provide on-going HRIS support (for their primary systems), providing tools and training to our users and key stakeholders. Process and work instructions.
Data transactions and maintenance.
Coordinate and administer programs, issue resolution.

Manage online content.

HR Certifications.

Job Description

The Sr. Analyst is responsible for Patient Services (PS) Aducanumab (ADU) reporting and data analysis as required to support our call center operations and patient strategic initiative programs. This involves the design, development and implementation of new reports and metrics as well as the evaluation and validation of existing measures. Develops and designs reports in conjunction with internal teams and partners using Business Objects, Tableau and other tools.

• Work with Leads to balance the needs of senior management, internal and divisional teams through prioritization process.

Identify limitations or issues in the reporting infrastructure and manage the process to have them rectified

Perform business analysis on all aspects of PS including individual, program and general department performance, present data insights, make recommendations to colleagues as well as senior management teams

Ability to communicate and present to leadership/stakeholders
Excellent problem solving, time management and organizational skills.
Action oriented.
Ability to adapt to change

HNI Corporation (NYSE: HNI), is a $2.3 billion-dollar, global office furniture and hearth product enterprise. The fourth largest employer in Iowa, HNI Corporation has been ranked by Industry Week magazine as one of the "Top 100 Best Managed Companies in the World", by Fortune magazine as "The Most Admired Company" in the furniture industry; and named by Chief Executive Magazine as one of the world's best companies for leadership development.

For more than twenty years, OFM has provided affordable, quality furniture through a dealer network serving a variety of markets including home and hospitality, government offices and businesses, and health care and educational facilities. A leading furniture manufacturer and distributor, OFM is headquartered in North Carolina with distribution centers there and in California, Pennsylvania, Kansas and Washington state. Job Overview

As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will provide meaningful analysis to support decision making. This could include normal business operations, project assessments, or external engagements. You will work across the business to apply analytical skills to provide deep and objective assessments to be used for critical business decisions.

Job Responsibilities

- Prepare monthly financial reporting packages for Executive management team, department heads & outside interested parties.
- Coordinate with corporate accounting and FP&A teams on accounting, systems and planning matters.
- Support the routine forecasting and annual budgeting process for FP&A teams.
- Find opportunities and execute centralization of data in budgeting and planning system for distributive use.
- Develop into subject matter expert for budgeting and planning system and support business in reporting and analysis requirements.
- Drive analysis for business case evaluations.
- Perform other ad hoc business analysis and modeling as needed.

Required Education, Skills, and Qualification

- A minimum of three (3) years of financial analysis experience, preferably in $500M+ software business (preferably including Software-as-a-Service and transactional revenue models)
- Bachelor’s degree with a major in Accounting or Finance
- Must have demonstrated the highest levels of mastery of Microsoft Excel
- Knowledge of accounting, reporting, forecasting/business intelligence systems
- Intermediate database skills, as well as familiarity with other Microsoft Office products and corporate ERP systems
- Ability to perform effectively in a fast-paced, demanding environment
- Unquestioned professional integrity


Preferred Education, Skills, and Qualification
MBA preferred and minimum 5 years of prior relevant experience.
Strong business understanding and judgment, across multiple lines of business / functional areas more likely a business background than technology background
Identifies problems, develops and evaluates options, and implements solutions
Applies management science, statistics, and computer technology to solve problems
Understands organizational strengths and corporate vision and identifies points within programs or projects to drive integration between the two
Manages competing demands and adapts to frequent change, delays, and unexpected results.

Job Description
The Franchise Profitability Senior Analyst, FP&A is responsible for supporting the effort to build out a comprehensive solution around franchisee profitability. The Franchise Profitability department will ultimately encompass all verticals across 2,400+ franchised centers and is responsible for helping franchisees maximize their profitability by creating an automated solution for data collection and standardization, financial statement analysis, franchisee communication and feedback, systems implementation, deliverable design and development, training, and reporting.

The Franchise Profitability Senior Analyst, FP&A will support these efforts by helping integrate brand point of sale systems with franchisee accounting systems, creating an accounting handbook, and conducting franchisee outreach to drive enrollment and adoption of brand policies and procedures.

This role will also aid in providing reliable financial reporting information to Senior Executives and Business Unit Management to be used to make decisions impacting the performance of the corporation. This role will also be responsible for performing analysis and providing meaningful reports and metrics that help drive results of the business.

This position reports to the Director of Franchise Profitability, and offers a high level of visibility with the CFO and other Senior/Executive Management Team members. There is also a high level of interaction with the Operations, Financial, Marketing and Business Development teams.

Duties and Responsibilities:

· Develop processes and procedures to integrate brand POS systems with QuickBooks

· Create an accounting handbook by brand and publish on brand communication platforms

· Conduct franchisee outreach to drive enrollment in each brand’s respective profitability tools and drive adoption of program policies and procedures

· Assist franchisees in adoption of brand chart of accounts and mapping to various profitability tools

· Create brand specific training materials to educate stakeholders on the purpose and operation of franchise profitability programs and tools

It is an exciting time to join ABB Power Grids. ABB and Hitachi have signed an agreement to create a joint venture (JV). By combining ABB Power Grids’ with Hitachi’s complementary strengths, we plan to form a new and stronger global leader in the power sector. ABB Power Grids and Hitachi will have more than 230 years of combined heritage and experience. Job Title: Land Acquisition Analyst - New Home Construction
Job Description:
Job Description


American Homes 4 Rent

As one of the country’s fastest-growing property management companies of single-family rental homes, American Homes 4 Rent has an exhilarating and fluid start-up culture and permanency of a well-founded corporation, rich with diversity. As pioneers in the industry, solidified by our place on Wall Street, American Homes 4 Rent (AMH:NYSE) is currently looking for qualified candidates. With a culture of unprecedented growth, quality and innovative collaboration, we are seeking personalities to complement our attributes.

The Land Acquisition Analyst facilitates and assists in the land acquisition function including research, financial and pricing analysis. The Analyst will identify acquisition opportunities through contacts with brokers, builders, bankers, landowners, engineers, planners, attorneys, and municipal officials. In addition, this position will scrutinize all property deals and find land in areas and price ranges consistent with company needs, while optimizing the return on investment and minimizing risk to the company.

Responsibilities -
Develops analysis of property value and underwriting for raw land and vacant Development lots for acquisitions
Prepares time-to-market underwriting proformas
Conducts general research in selected markets to facilitate the identification of land opportunities; prepares graphs, maps, marketing boards and standard features comparisons
Reviews and interprets zoning and land use ordinances; gathers competitive information from other residential communities; negotiates contracts with sellers
Ensures Architectural Review Board (ARB) approvals with developers, owners and HOAs; oversees the compilation of data related to specific jurisdiction, HOA obligations and property taxes
Performs asset sales pricing analysis (e.g., residual value analysis) and formulates/analyzes financial deal points for potential disposition opportunities; develops feasibility packages
Visits site location and evaluates property for purchase; provides lot analyses on all communities; collects and analyzes data to prepare reports with a snapshot of all acquisitions for any given time; builds strong internal relationships with Purchasing, Construction and Property Management.
Processes all applications and permits for approval
Requirements –
Bachelor’s degree in Real Estate, Economics, Statistics, Government Relations or a related field required
Minimum of five (5) years of experience in land acquisitions that specifically includes contract negotiation and relationship building required
Intermediate experience with Microsoft Office Suite required
Valid driver’s license required
Must be financially literate
Three (3) or more years as a financial analyst and/or business analyst preferred
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics CRM preferred
Work where you feel right at home –

If you are a versatile professional who values culture, a constructive environment and the potential for exponential growth, we want to work with you! Apply now and someone from our Talent Acquisition team will reach out to you soon!

Information regarding AH4R’s collection and use of your personal information can be found at https://www.americanhomes4rent.com/addenda/employee_privacy

Related keywords –

Land acquisition analyst, acquisition, land acquisition, real estate, economics, statistics, government relations, business analyst, financial analyst, contract negotiation, relationship building, property management, full time

Overview


To support our growing organization, Jaggaer is eager to identify a Compensation Analyst to lead the global sales compensation administration. This role will be primarily responsible for the development, implementation, execution and payment of our sales compensation plans.

Success will rest heavily upon your analytical skills, attention to details, efficiency, enthusiasm and leadership.

Principal Responsibilities
Lead administration of sales compensation including the issuance of sales comp plans, developing processes to ensure accurate and timely payouts, and responding to plan design exception requests from Sales leadership
Program manage the compensation planning process; ensuring final decisions and approvals of potential changes, analysis and reporting of compensation data, and insurance of compensation plans
Project manage initiatives to improve plan comprehension, quota and attainment tracking accuracy, systems (Xactly) enhancements, and effectiveness of variable incentives to improve sales engagement
Serve as subject matter expert for all comp plans, understanding key compensation plan drivers and proactively relating any plan design issues to sales and finance leadership; recommend solutions to any technical challenges related to the administration of sales comp
Support other analytical functions as needed by the Commercial Ops team
Position Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree required; focus on Business Management, Finance or Accounting preferred
Understanding and experience with sales compensation structures and mechanics (i.e. plan components and weights, pay mix, quotas, MBOs, crediting, accelerators)
Strong analytical skills including advanced modeling and SQL skills.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and process standardization
Experience configuring and administering EIM systems (i.e. Xactly, Callidus).
Advanced working knowledge of SalesForce.com
You’re a self-starter who embraces rolling up your sleeves and getting work done. You thrive on change and are comfortable with ambiguity
Strong personal code of ethics and integrity

#LI-MT1

PURPOSE OF ROLE:

The primary purpose of this role is to provide general pricing support for all product categories for their assigned business area. Their primary focus will be on managing day to day pricing activities that support their senior/lead pricing analysts and their merchant partners. This may include running pricing scenarios, generating reports, and running price updates in response to business and competitive needs, The pricing analyst will work with the rest of their team to ensure the timely implementation of all pricing recommendations.

RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENTS

• Responsible for delivering recommendations that support their teams Pricing related sales and margin objectives through the use of legacy and new pricing tools in alignment with the Pricing Program
• Responsible for maintaining relationships, communicating effectively, and building cross functional partnerships within P&P
• Responsible for supporting their respective team as they implement Lowe's pricing strategies. Develop a baseline understanding of Lowes pricing strategy frameworks and gain basic proficiency in the IBM pricing solution(s) and legacy pricing applications.
• Responsible for ensuring that they utilize all available tools, data, and insights to deliver the best possible level of service and results to their respective partners
• Pricing analysts are responsible for conducting themselves in a manner that reflects positively on the Pricing organization with a focus on SERVE and personal accountability.
• Responsible for ensuring that they meet all key deliverables and timelines for their projects and tasks
• Responsible for sharing best practices across their team. Identifies largest areas of repetitive manual work and raises to management team to look for automation opportunities.

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

• Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance or related field and 1+ years experience in data analytics or H.S. Diploma and 5+ years relevant experience (pricing, merchandising, finance, or related field focused on retail analytics)
• 2+ years experience using standard analytics tools (MS Excel, Access) to develop data driven recommendations to identify opportunities to improve business performance

Preferred Education/Experience:

• 1+ years experience working in an omnichannel environment
• 1+ years experience in Home Improvement Retail
• 1+ years experience developing processes and procedures to support business objectives
• 1+ years experience in retail pricing and promotional organization

Lowes Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving more than 18 million customers a week in the United States, Canada and Mexico. With fiscal year 2018 sales of $71.3 billion, Lowes and its related businesses operate or service more than 2,200 home improvement and hardware stores and employ approximately 300,000 associates. Founded in 1946 and based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowes supports its hometown Charlotte region and all communities it serves through programs focused on safe, affordable housing and careers in the skilled trades. For more information, visit Lowes.com.

Overview

Krispy Kreme Doughnut Corporations mission is to touch and enhance lives through the joy that is Krispy Kreme. In order to accomplish this mission, Krispy Kreme has expanded business into the CPG (consumer packaged goods) market, which delivers fresh sweet treats daily to stores including convenience stores and retail shops across the United States.

Location

Winston-Salem, NC. Occasional travel is expected to our Charlotte, NC (South End) office and to our field locations. Consistent presence in the workplace is expected.

The Opportunity

The Sr. Business Systems Analyst (BSA) position is pivotal role that is responsible for developing and sustaining partnerships with our business champions and technology peers to define, design, and implement key business capabilities for executing and delivering value at-scale for our CPG growth domestically and internationally. The Sr. BSA will champion the benefits of process and technology optimization throughout Krispy Kreme CPG Sales and Operations Execution.

This individual will demonstrate a high level of autonomy, flexibility, and agility to lead cross-functional teams through CPG business process and technology related initiatives ensuring the CPG ecosystem is robust and scalable.

Initiatives in this space include field delivery applications, improved end-user experience through technology innovation, and streamlining of CPG execution processes and its related technology offerings.

The Senior BSA will work on multiple concurrent initiatives and properly document all CPG processes and the technology landscape that supports them.

This individual will build relationships with our CPG business partners to enable flexible and agile business capabilities on a global scale. This role will be responsible for optimizing and adapting the end to end solutions in partnership with the business to provide the capabilities needed to grow revenue, increase operational efficiencies, and become a flexible data driven enterprise.

Responsibilities

Business Partnering
Provide counsel to our CPG business partners on all Information Technology related issues and initiatives
Exchange and share information, regular account management with business leaders,
Review applications and assist with access requirements, business continuity, service excellence review with key business partners
Prepare RFI and RFP documents in partnership with CPG business leaders and lead the review and selection of target-state solutions
Develop, define & build technology cases that will enable business process improvement and technology change
Validate that the solution meets the business goals, objectives, and business strategies.

Develop recommendations and work with technology development team to prepare detailed design specifications. Gain input and approval from development team and then gain input and approval from business unit.
Recommend system or process enhancements
Partner with business leaders on all initiatives to design and develop the required infrastructure and solution, lead and participate in global projects, and conduct pilot testing
Plan and lead solution deployment activities
Plan and execute user acceptance testing.
Develop and publish user documentation.
Work closely with the development team throughout the project life cycle to ensure functionality achieves the defined goals and requirements.
Create relevant documentation, including but not limited to, user stories/use cases, wireframes, screen mockups, process flow documents, and data flow diagrams.
Assist Project Managers in development of project documentation including but not limited to Project Charter, Status Reports, Change Notifications, etc.
Convey complex topics to members of the business community and IT team.
Track requested enhancements and known issues and defects. Assist with prioritization.
Translate business scenarios into relevant user acceptance, system and integration testing scenarios and plans. Validate results. Perform usability testing.
Service Level Management
View and monitor all support incidents
Create and manage vendor SLAs and lead regular review of Service Level Management reporting
Partner with Service Management to perform after-actions reviews for continuous improvement
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree or higher degree in computer science, business management, finance, or other quantitative discipline required
5 or more years in a BSA or BA role with hands-on experience implementing IT projects end to end from business requirements to delivery and deployment

About Press Ganey

Press Ganey pioneered the health care performance improvement movement more than 30 years ago. Today, Press Ganey offers an integrated suite of solutions that enable enterprise transformation across the patient journey. Delivered through a cutting-edge digital platform built on a foundation of data security, Press Ganey solutions address safety, clinical excellence, patient experience and workforce engagement. Position Description/Overview:

The Business Analyst position will be responsible for leading the collaboration between business, operations, and technology stakeholders to create business and functional requirements for software enhancements and new products. This role will work closely with Managers and Development Teams primarily in an Agile software development environment to ensure that new feature requirements are clearly documented, communicated, and delivered. This role will be located in either our Chicago, South Bend or Charlotte office. The candidate selected will be required to sit in either one of these markets.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Responsible for eliciting requirements through interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.
Function as a subject matter, process, and operational expert working closely with product owners to define business problems and develop alternative solutions.
Responsible for leading design discussions and presenting solutions to groups within the company. Provide training and education on solutions when applicable.
Responsible for being the liaison between the business units and technology teams.
Decompose vision and high-level requirements into detailed technical solutions, processes, procedures, training, and standards
Use a wide range of communication methods to gather necessary information and evangelize the goals of the Client Solutions team. Examples would include, policies, processes, procedures, meeting notes, and workflow diagrams.
Qualifications

The ideal candidate for this opportunity will possess the following work experiences and skillsets:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
3-5 years previous experience as a Business Analyst in similar environment
Proven experience of generating and documenting functional requirements, including business rules, use cases, process flows and proof of concepts.
Self-starter who can work alone or as part of a larger project team.
Strong interpersonal skills (working with a range of business users).
Good presentation / facilitation skills.
Understanding of standard systems project methodology (agile and waterfall).
A structured thinker, but have capability to think outside the box.
Competent interacting with key managers and executives in the business area of the company.
Self-managing and task / deadline focused.
Experience working in Rally is preferred but not mandatory.

FUNCTIONAL / LABOR CATEGORY: Logistics Analyst
POSITION TITLE: Consultant/Senior Consultant
LOCATION: Havelock, NC

DESCRIPTION:
Sehlke Consulting is looking for qualified individuals to join a team that shall provide Logistics support to the United States Marine Corps, II Marine Expeditionary Force.

EDUCATION: N/A

CERTIFICATION(s): N/A

LABOR CATEGORY / DUTIES:

• Provide logistics support services which include, draft policies, provide Support Agreement Manager (SAM) services, and procurement system services within the Procure-to-pay, Plan-to-stock, Acquire-to-Retire, and Order-to-Cash business processes. Work involves analyzing metadata and developing corrective actions for anomalies using ROCoE and/or SIPRIA which will assist the supply community with developing well-defined requirements, develop costing methodologies, cradle-to-grave oversight of the procurement lifecycle, validations in accordance with DoD FMR and other regulatory policy.
• Conduct analysis on various Table of Authorized Material Control Number end items on Total Life Cycle Management, mean time before failure, sustainment costs, problem class IX consumables, and overall readiness trends.
• Utilize ROCoE and/or SIPRIA data output and subject matter expertise related to equipment Total Life Cycle Management in order to prioritize funding allocations for future maintenance efforts and programs..
• Utilize ROCoE and/or SIPRIA data to conduct analysis on the supply readiness posture of various Table of Authorized Material Control Number end items, analyze equipment deficiencies and provide corrective action recommendations or mitigation measures to fill capability gaps, analyze excess and obsolete equipment and provided recommendations to divest in order to conserve sustainment and maintenance resources, and analyze programs for equipment sourcing and distribution processes to recommend efficiency improvement opportunities.
• Determine trends and process improvements through analysis and ROCoE and/or SIPRIA outputs of key supply performance indicators.
• Develop a process for analyzing past equipment maintenance spending trends, service request part demands, and deployment schedules to predict future demands and resource requirements.
• Conduct a Requirements Analysis to assess maintenance demands and resource requirement fluctuations and determine data sources and data extraction methodology to be used in further ROCoE and/or SIPRIA improvement and development.
• Conduct analysis of supply and maintenance data to create a historical baseline and comparison for various performance metrics that serve to provide Logistics entities and subordinate units with logistical flow data for resource allocation and budgeting projections.

REQUIREMENTS:

• Four years of service within a DoD logistics field.
• Shall possess strong communications skills and experience in interacting with Marine Corps Officers, Senior Noncommissioned Officers, and Civilian Employees.
• Experience, demonstrated knowledge of use, and ability to obtain and maintain access to relevant systems.

Founded in 2011, Sehlke Consulting is a rapidly-growing Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Arlington, VA – and an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Job Description:


The Compliance Analyst assists in the day-to-day transactions relating to compliance. The analyst will work with senior staff to ensure Dimensional remains compliant with all regulatory bodies and governing laws.

Responsibilities:
Provide pre- & post- trade compliance support to portfolio management and trading staff
Extract investment guidelines from prospectuses, SAI's, investment management agreements, and other contractual constituent documents
Assist with the general administration of the order management system, including rule creation, testing, and production enhancements
Review post trade exceptions and escalate to front office staff and Compliance Officers when necessary
Assist in the design, refinement and execution of internal controls and corporate compliance procedures
Assist Compliance Officers with surveillance and forensic testing of the front office compliance program
Review substantial shareholder limitations and execute US and foreign regulatory filings
Prepare account compliance confirmation to sub-advised and separate account clients
Use SQL& CRIMS at a basic level
Ensure compliance with regulations and controls by examining and analyzing records, reports, operating practices, and documentation
Extract and compile data from various systems and sources; verify the accuracy and integrity of data
Conduct descriptive and/or diagnostic analysis to provide actionable insight derived from both internal and external data to enable Compliance to better understand, profile and enhance reporting requirements
Research, analyze, and identify key data-driven insights
Create processes and draft procedures regarding reporting requirements and other compliance related activities
Review reports, risk indicators, and red flags to identify and propose corrective action
May coordinate or conduct delivered Compliance training
Assist with departmental compliance projects as assigned, such as annual compliance testing
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
2+ years of professional work experience preferred; experience in a compliance related field is a plus
Understanding of the financial services industry and applicable rules, regulations, and federal and state securities laws (SEC, FINRA, FCA, etc.)
Technical and professional skills or knowledge of testing methodology, risk and controls analysis
Strong oral and written communication skills
Exceptional interpersonal and relationship management skills; ability to interact with all levels of employees
Ability to operate and prioritize in a fast-moving & demanding environment and deal with complex situations
Strong analytical mindset with an ability to synthesize data; detail oriented with a focus on quality results
Ability to be self-guided and motivated, working to complete tasks thoroughly and requesting assistance if needed
Ability to maintain confidentiality and data accuracy when handling sensitive information
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Product Suite
Series 7 or working towards Series 7; must complete within 2 years in role
Previous experience with a trade compliance and/or portfolio management order management system preferred

JOB SUMMARY

Responsible for the application of all available security tools and intelligence to identify, communicate, and provide technical guidance to help resolve technical anomalies and vulnerabilities across the Company’s IT environment.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

• Performs security data analysis and event tracking.
• Obtains, monitors, reviews, and analyzes reports, logs, and other security-related information from various tools, network and other computing devices, external intelligence sources, and the Company employees.
• Utilizes security logs and tools to identify vulnerabilities in systems, and detect anomalous activity.
• Liaises with network operations, application, sever, and workstation groups to deliver actionable guidance to mitigate risk from the evolving threat environment and existing vulnerabilities.
• Proactively identifies gaps in the security visibility provided by current tools and services.
• Works to identify critical event data for additional analysis and escalation as appropriate.
• Responds to reported security incidents and events through the Company’s ticketing system.
• Utilizes all available resources to provide real-time intelligence during incident response activities.
• Performs incident forensics.
• Writes documentation and reports.
• Evaluates new security technology in the Company environment.
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

AS degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Health Information Management, or equivalent combined education and experience. Experience with security tools such as firewalls, anti-malware, Intrusion Detection/ Intrusion Prevention systems (IDS/IPS), Data Leak Prevention (DLP), Unified Threat Management (UTM). Familiarity with common information security standards such as ISO-27000 and NIST SP 800 series. Industry security certifications such as Global Information Assurance Certification (GIAC), Security , or Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) desirable. Applicable knowledge of information technology and networking. Ability to review reports and system activity logs to identify critical events, categorize according to priority, and escalate as appropriate. Strong analytical skills.

POSITION TITLE

Accelerated Talent Development Analyst (ATD Program)

LOCATION

Raleigh, NC

YOUR ROLE

The Accelerated Talent Development (ATD) Program seeks to deepen the USMI talent pipeline by developing entry level talent with diverse educational and work backgrounds via a combination of cross-functional rotational assignments, dedicated training, and stretch projects. Beginning in July 2020, Analysts will complete 4 rotational assignments over two years, receiving comprehensive developmental feedback and coaching throughout. Analysts are guaranteed placement in USMI upon successful completion of the program, contingent on sustained strong performance at a minimum.

Work assignments balance current business needs and Analyst development needs and will be engineered to ensure that each ATD experiences a broad diversity of work during their time in the program. This program is designed to give you a well-rounded view of the organization, build technical skills and professional network, and instill an ability to demonstrate the USMI values (Excellence, Improvement and Connection).

Examples of rotational assignment project work you may lead include:
Drive process improvements and simplify/streamline systems
Research behavior of key market constituencies to inform strategic planning
Partner with Sales team to generate leads and maximize use of technology in Sales process
Risk portfolio analysis and reporting
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors degree (3.0 GPA and up) with some business studies and graduation date between 12/19 and 5/20
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite including Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Outlook
Exceptional communication skills including verbal, written and presentation
Demonstrated project management and proactive problem-solving skills
Analytical mindset; can work with high degree of accuracy and strong attention to detail
Collaborative team player with influence, persuasion, and conflict management skills
Ability to learn quickly and desire to grow and improve; seeks feedback and acts on it
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS
Enthusiasm for the financial services industry; experience in financial services is a plus
Excellence and/or leadership in extracurricular activities
Basic knowledge of Tableau
COMPANY

Genworth Financial, Inc. is a leading insurance holding company committed to helping families achieve the dream of home ownership and address the financial challenges of aging through its leadership positions in mortgage insurance and long-term care insurance. Headquartered in Richmond, Virginia, Genworth traces its roots back to 1871.

Genworth Mortgage Insurance, headquartered in Raleigh, North Carolina, is a global mortgage insurer with a major presence in the United States, Canada, and Australia. With origins dating back to 1980, Genworth Mortgage Insurance provides primary mortgage guaranty insurance coverage on residential mortgage loans, as well as mortgage pool insurance policies that enhance insurance coverage for various types of mortgage-related securities. Our mortgage insurance can help individuals secure low down payment loans and realize the dream of home ownership faster even for the first time.

Business Analyst Summary:

Signature Consultants is seeking a Business Analyst for a 24+ month contract opportunity with a client in Center City Charlotte.

This position will be part of a team that provides business analysis and testing coordination for all projects, initiatives, and production support for the General Ledger reporting and Regulatory Data Repository (RDR) tools of the Controller's Division in Corporate Finance. This Business Analyst acts as a liaison and consultant between Corporate/LOB Finance teams, technical partners, QA team, and Project Management for Corporate Finance by planning, conducting, and directing the analysis of complex business problems to be solved with automated systems. Focus will be on projects and initiatives that impact the General Ledger and the Regulatory Data Repository systems supporting Accounting Engine and V4 source systems. The position primarily focuses on supporting the General Ledger Tools supporting Reconciliation, GL Maintenance, and Financial Monitoring & Control.

Key Responsibilities include:
Providing assistance to identify, evaluate, and develop solutions that are cost effective and meet or exceed business requirements.
Working with end-users, business partners, and cross-functional teams to provide project support, resolve questions, assess needs, and recommend changes.
Providing production support, testing, validating changes, writing requirements, documentation, and change management related to tool releases and other needs.
Working with user groups to provide training, resolve questions, assess user needs, and recommend changes.
Documenting system requirements and high-level designs. Preparing specifications for system changes.
Recommending and initiating systems testing. Identifying dependencies and assessing change impact for new platform enhancements and system integrations.
Manage end to end integrated testing.
Coordinate communication plans, test strategies, test plans, and detailed test execution schedules.
Lead meetings during all phases of project to facilitate testing across all involved groups and applications.
Lead discussions with partners to resolve testing challenges and provide solutions to complex test problems in coordination with BA, Tech, and QA teams.
Basic Qualifications:
7+ years of experience in business analysis and/or design
Minimum Qualifications:
Strong understanding of accounting concepts and financial analysis
Quality assurance experience related to coordination of integrated testing efforts
Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio for document preparation and presentations
Demonstrated experience in assessing, translating, and communicating abstract ideas/issues into detail documents
Strong understanding of financial reporting systems, GL Actuals and Averages, Reconciliation of System Data to General Ledger, and reporting hierarchies
Preferred Skills:
4 year degree in Business or Technology
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate through oral and written communication skills
Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, with excellent time management and organizational skills
Experience managing changes through the Enterprise Change Management process
Experience with ALM HP Quality Center and/or JIRA
Quality assurance methodologies, standards and best practices
Software development life cycle methodologies and the documents which support the testing functions (i.e. test cases, traceability matrix, and test plan)
Strong skillset in coordinating and managing multiple initiatives simultaneously
Knowledge of basic SQL and query writing to research and troubleshoot application issues

Who is Domtar?

At Domtar, we're driven to improve quality of life. With annual sales of US $5.5 billion, we make a wide variety of products that people around the world rely on every day, from copy paper to baby diapers. And how we do business is just as important as what we make. We've earned Great Place to Work Certification in the U.S. and a Forbes ranking as one of Canada's Best Employers. Through our values of agility, caring and innovation, we constantly find better ways to champion health, dignity and comfort with our customers, colleagues and in our communities.

Who is Domtar Personal Care?

Personal care is not just our business. It's Personal. It's a child, a loved one; it's often about those that can't help themselves. Caring for them can only be personal. So Personal Care isn't our category; it's our calling, our mission. We imagine the solutions that make caring for babies' skin, and preserving dignity and independence easier and more affordable for everyone. At Domtar, we believe everyone deserves personal care.

Our Vision

To be a global leader in absorbent hygiene by meeting consumers' diverse needs through effective, affordable and widely available personal care solutions.

Our Mission

We champion health, dignity and comfort. We serve consumers and caregivers wherever they access personal care, through healthcare, retail and direct channels. We create value through our innovative solutions and achieve cost efficiency through operational scale, flexibility and the use of technology.

Your Role

Highly motivated self-directed individual who can facilitate gathering of financial information, analyzing the data, reporting and distributing the results, and making recommendations that continuously improve our financial performance. Individual must possess knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and understand appropriate application.

Key Responsibilities
Participate and support the organization's annual budgeting process which includes exploding bill of materials and applying current raw material pricing, direct labor and overhead rates.
Coordinates/assists in the preparation of a detailed rolling twelve month forecast based on sales, marketing, manufacturing and corporate input.
Maintain and support Company product costing system to include material costing, freight costing, conversion costing, packaging costing and scrap rates. Perform and validate Standard Cost Updates.
Prepare analysis and interpretation of purchase price variances, monthly raw material price/volume analysis as well as related index movement.
Participate in monthly close process to include preparation of journal entries and reconciliation of general ledger accounts including accrual analysis and account reconciliation. Assist in preparation, generation and review of monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements. Includes preparing waterfall charts that bridge comparative periods while providing detailed commentary on variances.
Provide validation of the manufacturing lines reported throughput and other key performance indicators as requested. Backup for operations weekly metrics reporting.
Recognize emerging trends and make recommendations to improve business profitability, generate "what-if" analysis based on selected financial/business assumptions, assist in establishing operating procedures and reporting tools that allow management to make informed business decisions and assist in continuous improvement, development, modification and implementation of financial systems as necessary.
Interact with Sales, Marketing, Manufacturing, Finance and Supply Chain on business issues that impact financial performance or projections. Responsible for providing internal customers (Sales, Marketing and Operations) with information and ad-hoc reports and analysis as requested.
Assist in annual audit review and SOX compliance for internal and external auditors. Review financial transactions and apply accounting theory and principles to ensure compliance with GAAP and applicable laws, rules, policies, and procedures.
Maintain weekly metrics scorecard to include production and shipment data; Prepare and interpret profitability by customer, product, channel and product category.
Key Competencies
Mastery skill level and knowledge of Microsoft Office Products.
Knowledge of Oracle Financial Systems preferred.
Ability to work in a team environment and effectively work independently.
Exceptional organizational and time management skills are crucial.
Position Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting OR 3 to 5 years of related work experience

This role resides within Enterprise Capital Management. The position involves the calculation, reporting and analysis of economic and regulatory capital and risk-weighted assets (RWA) for wholesale exposures, which consists of ~$0.7T in funded balances spanning multiple products and lines of businesses. The team member will ensure calculations appropriately handle the positions in the portfolio including new transactions/products; identify alternatives/assumptions within the Basel rules that can tangibly improve our capital position; work with support partners to supervise the implementation of models and enhancements to calculations; design and produce reports of capital and RWA; assist in the bank’s explanation of capital and RWA to the lines of business and senior management; assist in wholesale capital variance commentary on various regulatory reports, and perform other analyses, such as measuring the effect of changes to rules or to the portfolio.

Job Title: Real Estate Industry Customer Solutions Analyst
Job Description:
SoftPro is the nation's leading provider of real estate closing and title insurance software. A division of Fidelity National Financial (NYSE: FNF), SoftPros technology solutions are used in thousands of law firms and title companies throughout the country and are an essential part of residential and commercial Real Estate transactions. We recently moved to a brand new work space that has cool features such as team collaboration areas, automatic height-adjustable desks, game room and a market area with gourmet coffee, free sodas and a flavored sparkling beverage system as well as discounted healthy food offerings!

Experience with the Real Estate closing and Title Insurance procedures

Strong Problem Solving, troubleshooting, analysis and testing skills.

Fiscal Analyst

General Statement of Duties
Performs technical and specialized accounting tasks in the general ledger accounting, payroll management and processes, and accounts payable functions for the town. Provides professional level work in the development of financial processes and procedures, fiscal reporting, data analysis, and performance metrics. Work includes assisting finance director in establishing best practices in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).

Work also includes conducting special studies independently or as a member of a team; and preparing and presenting reports. Judgment and initiative are required. Work is performed under supervision of the Finance Director

Essential Duties and Tasks
 Prepare daily cash deposits to post to general ledger.
 Oversees work of Accounting Technician
 Monitors, processes and ensures accuracy for all documents pertaining to accounts payable; invoices, purchase orders, checks and credit cards and ensure appropriate reconciliation per departmental budgets.
 Manages the payroll processing function for all town employees, reporting, compliance, and documentation. Subject Matter Expert (SME) for all payroll functions.
 Prepares and updates database and annual report of fixed assets and manages surplus property.
 Serves as a functional liaison and provides internal and external customer support; performs research and review of financial accounts, budget transfers, contract documentation, grant funding, payments/receipts, billing, requisitions, asset tracking and lease information and/or other fiscal process and verifies accuracy, compliance, and/or need for change; recommends and implements adjustments, enhancements or updates.
 Performs analysis of financial data and information; develops, updates and/or maintains budget and financial reports, spreadsheets, statements, journal entries, schedules, agendas, projections, budget amendments, budget ordinances and/or presentations.
 Provides professional and technical support of assigned program or special project which may include budget development, monitoring and analytical support.
 Analyzes and assists in the development of financial processes and procedures, fiscal reporting, data analysis, and performance metrics
 Work with large amounts of data, interpret financial records, detect errors, and prepare financial reports.
 Performs other duties of a similar nature and level as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

 Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
 Principles and applications of critical thinking and analysis.
 Principles and methods of qualitative and quantitative research.
 Best practices, trends and emerging technologies.
 Budget development experience.
 Applicable federal, state and local laws, codes, regulations governing accounting, finances, budget, and personnel and payroll functions.
 Customer service principles.
 Innate problem solving skills
 Analytical skills
 Adaptable communication skills
 Ease with technology
 Compatibility for both independent and team work
 Ability to prepare and maintain complex financial reports and records

Physical Requirements

 Must possess the visual acuity to prepare and analyze data, examine and work with maps, charts, and detailed materials, operate a computer, inspect sites, and to read extensively.

 This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to move files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.

Desired Education and Experience
A four-year degree in public administration, accounting, finance, business administration, or related area and two years related budget and research experience in public sector or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Preference will be given to applicants possessing a CPA certificate.

Special Requirement
Possession of a valid North Carolina driver’s license.

**Senior Portfolio Analyst**



**Description**



Pearson is the worlds leading learning company. Our education business combines 150 years of experience in publishing with the latest learning technology and online support. We work in more than 70 countries. Courses are available as books, online and through multilingual packages, helping people learn whatever, wherever and however they choose.



**SCOPE AND IMPACT OF JOB**



The Senior Portfolio Analyst will work within Pearsons Information Technology Portfolio & Program Management team, reporting to the TBM Manager. This role will require working closely with business partners and program managers to effectively communicate processes; monitor and maintain accurate and timely information in planning systems (Jira and Planview); and participate in continuous improvement exercises.



**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES**



Provide governance over projects to ensure they are following the correct processes and meeting goals for timing and data quality.



Work closely with Business Partners to ensure that all technology requests follow the demand management process



Work closely with Program Managers to lead the demand process for assigned geography, including subsidiary processes like prioritization, ARB, IRB, continuous improvements, KPIs, SLAs, financial and status reporting



Maintain information on assigned projects in line with standards to meet SLAs and provide transparency for all stakeholders



Support portfolio management, providing data, reports and supporting project managers



End to end management of portfolio tools



Facilitate meetings and communicate action items



Maintain good quality materials and consistency on processes, advocating for unified IT Ways of Working



Ensure projects close out successfully



Own the planning & communication of the Ops reporting timetable and delivery of the Ops reporting pack for the Monthly Information Technology review which, by working with the program leads, includes adherence to the timetable and minimum rework to the data



Manage and support the end to end Demand to Project Close process for all Info Tech requests including Business case reviews, Pre IRB reviews



Act as POC for all strategic work including but not limited to 3 Year Planning, Strat Planning, Op Planning, Quarterly Forecasting



Support the Project Analysts by ensuring that project leads are tracking finance actuals to YTD planned/forecast by facilitating a monthly call and communicating actions needed to correct the data being presented in the Finance tracker



Work closely with CIO directs to ensure visibility to project and BAU budgets, highlighting poor performance areas and variances that need to be addressed and making recommendations to either meet spend or savings targets



Work with the Info Tech team to ensure that all technology spend requests follow the correct processes



Work with the Finance business partner to address issues and clear blockers where appropriate



Own and enhance the Portfolio & PPP governance, standards and processes ensuring that there is a plan and mechanism for keeping all project/program leads in Information Technology trained/informed and using the correct tools



Support and maintain the roll out of new demand management process including data quality checks, adherence to the process, monitoring and tracking submissions



Support annual work on goals and KPIs for leadership team.



Design, implement & manage the process of project closure and the handover into a BAU environment including Tech-Ops & AMS support processes are in place



All other duties as assigned



**Workstream Responsibilities:**



Work supportively and collaboratively within Portfolio team and across other teams



Build relationships and trust with key stakeholders to support program delivery and adoption of enterprise architecture



Communicate in line with program communications and plans with team and wider stakeholders



Matrixed reporting of all technical stakeholders responsible for a solution



Support the relevant project technical teams to deliver effectively



**Key Challenges:**



Understanding and supporting simplified processes around governance, reporting, and demand management across the whole of technology



Ensuring understanding and adoption of the processes, tools and templates in a global environment



Working in a matrixed and virtual environment



Working with several stakeholders: externally, internally and internationally



Working on multiple projects and tasks at one time



Working as part of a global team and thinking globally



Working with a global customer base and engaging effectively and collaboratively with people from different cultures



Some out of hours working will be required to support the global organization



Building internal confidence in a situation of consistent change



**Qualifications**



**Essential Skills and Experience**



2-4 years experience in working within a global PMO or Portfolio function or with delivering global programs throughout the software development life cycle



Strong attention to detail and project management skills



Strong skills in meeting facilitation, verbal and written communications, and interpersonal interactions (e.g. partnering, conflict management, consulting, etc.).



Strong analytical & problem-solving skills to remove obstacles and proactively solve problems



Proven capability to understand and meet requirements from both internal and external customers



Proficient in Microsoft and Google productivity applications (e.g., Excel, Word, Docs, Sheets, Teams, Hangouts, etc.)



Proven ability to work independently, remotely, and under pressure to successfully meet deadlines



**Desirable Skills and Experience**



Bachelors degree



Experience with Portfolio and delivery tools such as Planview, Jira, Smartsheets



Experience in the Education or Finance industry and specifically with education technology sector or background in Technology

About the Company

Lincoln Financial Group, a Fortune 250 company with over 10,000 employees, provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence. Our core business areas — Life Insurance, Annuities, Retirement Plan Services and Group Protection — focus on supporting, preserving and enhancing over 17 million customer’s lifestyles and retirement outcomes.

Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $238 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2018.

Ranked one of the Best Large Employers in America by Forbes magazine, Lincoln Financial Group makes a serious investment in our employees’ futures through a broad range of wealth accumulation and protection plans, health and wellness programs, and career development resources designed to help each individual reach their personal and professional goals.
The Role
This position will provide Business System subject matter expertise and direction on complex HR/Law and Compliance IT projects/initiatives for his/her assigned area(s) of responsibility. S/he will also advise and collaborates with business stakeholders to define and validate complex information technology solutions that meet the needs, goals and objectives for his/her assigned area(s) of responsibility.

Must be able to take vendor technical requirement and determine implications for implementing within the Lincoln framework, both from a security and technical perspective. Must be able to determine what internal groups must be engaged to accomplish implementation and provide guidance on requirements.

Have a detailed understanding of requirements for implementing Single Sign-on, vanity URL’s, and deep links.

Acquire working knowledge of Lincoln vendor security standards in order to support vendor implementations, vendor remediation, and insure security compliance.

Responsible for providing guidance on setting up data file transfers into and out of Lincoln according to security standards. Knowledge of SFTP, SSH Keys, and PGP encryption. A good working knowledge of Autosys, File systems permissions and Active Directory would be helpful.
Responsibilities
Advises and provides expertise to appropriate internal stakeholders to assess and deliver proposed complex technical solutions which meet business requirements and/or which integrate process, business rules and business data with technology.
Determines and advises the most appropriate technical response to identified complex problems, issues and/or defects by assessing impact and prioritization.
Determines complex IT best practices and suggests how to improve current practices.

Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 100 million members in the U.S., Canada and U.K. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for tips as they work on their financial goals, including helping them monitor their credit, identity monitoring, searching for credit cards, shopping for loans (car, home and personal), filing their taxes with Credit Karma Tax and growing their savings* -- all for free. Credit Karma has grown significantly through the years: we've added more than 70 million members in the last five years alone and now have more than 1,100 employees across our offices in San Francisco, Charlotte, Los Angeles, Leeds, London and soon Oakland.
Banking services provided by MVB Bank, Inc., Member FDIC

Security is a core value at Credit Karma. We help millions of people better manage their credit. Safeguarding their sensitive information is critical to our continued success. From the CEO down to each individual engineer, everyone views security as a personal responsibility. Credit Karma is looking for a SOC Analyst, and your unique mission is to mine a deep data set of security event information for useful signals and feed the results into automated actions and infrastructure changes. This Individual may also sit in our Charlotte Office.
What You'll Do
Perform monitoring, research, assessment and analysis on all notable security events within the Credit Karma environment
Set and tune alerting for important events
Engage with partners in engineering, IT, and operations to respond to and remediate events
Identify opportunities for implementing additional technology controls to create more visibility or defend key points of attack
Design visualizations of key sustaining metrics for 24x7 panes of glass
What's Great About It
Carrying out two positive missions at the same time: helping people take back control of their credit and helping to keep their personal information safe
Solving frontier security problems at scale in a highly technology-focused team
Spending zero minutes convincing anyone why security is important - we all understand that very well already!
What We Expect
2+ years of incident detection and response experience
Strong scripting or relevant programming skills
A creative forensic mindset
Self-starting attitude and fearless ascent up the learning curve
Eagerness to challenge the status quo, balanced with a reasonable and methodical approach to effecting change
A fun and positive attitude!
Equal Employment Opportunity
Credit Karma is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. We believe that such an environment advances long-term professional growth, creates a robust business, and supports our mission of championing financial progress for everyone. We offer generous benefits and perks with a single eye to nourishing an inclusive environment that recognizes the contributions of all and fosters diversity by supporting our internal Employee Resource Groups. We’ve worked hard to build an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and the opportunity for professional growth. Job Summary:
The Information Security Operations Analyst contributes to the success of the University by working to protect information systems and resources from security threats on a daily basis. This position provides day-to-day information security operations support including security event handling, security incident response, threat hunting, threat intelligence analysis, forensic analysis, vulnerability identification, and security incident recovery services. The Analyst is responsible for monitoring the safety and security of the Universityâ??s information systems and resources using a Security Event Information Management (SEIM) system with auditable logs of all investigations and response activities. The Information Security Operations Analyst is also responsible for planning and executing short- and medium-term information security improvement projects and initiatives intended to improve UNCGâ??s information security posture, tools, policies, processes, and procedures with guidance and support from the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) as well as information security architects and engineers. This includes investigating, evaluating, developing, and deploying customized security solutions to meet UNCG's specific information security needs according to the adopted ISO/IEC 27002 framework. The Analyst works actively with other IT staff as well as end-users and leadership from other University departments and divisions to help determine information security requirements and deploy appropriate solutions that meet security best practices and recommendations. The Information Security Operations Analyst provides ongoing support and advice to IT staff and end-users on a variety of security topics and issues, helping to ensure adherence to the Universityâ??s security policies and procedures along with compliance with applicable regulations. The Analyst recommends strategies to prevent security exposures and intrusions and plays a key role in helping University business units address extant and emerging security concerns.

Minimum Qualifications:
Entry level with Master's Degree; Bachelor's Degree and 0 to 2 years' experience; or equivalent education/experience. Degree should be in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Security or closely related discipline from an appropriately accredited institution. Demonstrated recent experience with information security operations functions, activities, tools, and systems. Demonstrated recent experience with security configurations on cloud computing systems.
