As a GIS Analyst in our Charlotte office, you will have the chance to work on a broad range of consulting projects with a focus on supporting our global client base\. Working with other members of our team, you'll help deliver complex technical projects while applying GIS technology\. You will leverage your strong geospatial skills and collaborate with experts in various disciplines\. If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you\. Join our team, and help us lay the foundation for human progress\.

Job Description
Our client is seeking a SharePoint Analyst to work at their location in Morrisville, NC. This is a contract to hire position.

The SharePoint Analyst is responsible for supporting SharePoint on premise system – including business user support, business analysis for new functionality and maintaining existing farms (Development, Testing and Production). In addition, this role is responsible for full development life cycle for new SharePoint functionality – including gathering requirements, documenting solution, developing and testing solution, assisting business users with testing, installation, user support and ongoing maintenance. The SharePoint Analyst will also support the future analysis of content management and collaboration in the cloud.

Position Responsibilities / Accountabilities:
Analyze needs of functions and departments with respect to systems initiatives and issues
Gather, compile, and interpret information regarding business changes, summarize and recommend appropriate course of action, then implement approved solutions
Translate business requirements into appropriate system development form and write supporting technical documentation
Assist with installation, configuration, and maintenance of SharePoint software applications
Provide technical support, training, and documentation as needed for end users
Requirements:
Ability to interface with senior business decision-makers in a professional manner to understand their requirements and analyze these requirements in order to plan, execute, and manage the delivery of SharePoint solutions.
Support business users at all levels of the organization using existing SharePoint content/solutions.
Excellent written, verbal, interpersonal and collaboration skills
Well organized and detail oriented with strong customer service focus
Ability to manage many concurrent projects and user requests.
Understanding of best practices and practical experience of SharePoint architecture, content management, business processes, collaboration and security.
Develop and maintain LVB SharePoint content taxonomy – site columns, content types, libraries/lists.
Develop and maintain custom business process workflows and forms, preferably Nintex
Develop and maintain business system integrations using External Content Types, custom C# web services to SQL Server databases.
Install, configure and maintain 3rd Party SharePoint Add-Ons.
Develop and maintain client-side development utilizing JQuery, JavaScript, XML, CSS, HTML, AJAX, CAML.
Manage SharePoint security through farm, site and list permissions
Analyze, troubleshoot and solve SharePoint issues using Central Administration, IIS, ULS logs and PowerShell for SharePoint.
Knowledge of SharePoint features such as Excel Services, User Profile Service, BCS, eDiscovery, Search management, Information Retention Policies
Five (5) years of experience in SharePoint administration and/or SharePoint development
Three (3) years of experience working with end users, providing technical information, support, and customer service
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business, or equivalent business experience required
SharePoint certification a plus
Unusual working conditions / hours – Occasional after-hours installations of new solutions.

Through innovation, technology, and unparalleled customer service, TrialCard’s passionate people provide patient-centric solutions to the pharmaceutical industry that improve access, affordability, and adherence to enhance patients’ lives. We work tirelessly on the behalf of our clients, because when they succeed, so do we.
That’s not to say we are all work and no play. TrialCard is an open workplace with fun, energetic people united for a common purpose. In fact, we don’t even refer to each other as employees. We’re team members. We foster a culture that encourages individual personality.
As a Strategic Business Analyst, you will join our team on a journey to help eliminate barriers for patients, increase their access to medications, and help them receive lifesaving treatments while working in an environment that nurtures you.
The position will support researching, analyzing, defining and designing new and existing internal strategic projects aligning with our company objectives. As part of TrialCard’s Enterprise Project Management office, the role works closely with both the business and IT to provide process, technical solutions and project plans that transforms the way we do business.

Serve as a strategic project lead between business departments and technical teams in requirements analysis, process design and implementations, to support various areas of the business using Off the Shelf or TrialCard proprietary application systems and ancillary systems.
Collaborate with business stakeholders, project managers and project sponsors to prioritize collected requirements, refine project scope and vision for TrialCard objective alignment.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, job shadowing, workflow storyboards, scenarios, and other methods for project definition.
Translate conceptual user requirements into workflow storyboards, use cases, functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team, utilizing standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications utilizing process models, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements, verbally or through written documentation, to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Assist in identifying business process improvements, implementing best practices, and full utilization of the capabilities of TrialCard systems.
Conduct limited market research and cost modeling to find the most effective and efficient solution recommendations.
Ensure that TrialCard’s IT solutions are: (1) cost effective and cost justified, (2) optimized to support Trialcard business applications, and (3) secure, scalable and extendable from an architectural standpoint.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Provide multiple options and courses of action for solutioning based on supporting facts and data.
Mitigate project risks and partner with key stakeholders to ensure projects meet timelines and budgets as defined.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership, executive level and steering committees ensuring alignment with strategic and companywide objectives.
Any other tasks or projects as assigned by immediate supervisor.

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM designated field or similar discipline.
3+ years of service-related experience in project/operations management, IT Business, Data, Systems Analyst or relevant field.
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development.
Strong interpersonal skills including negotiating, influencing, and conflict resolution with demonstrated ability in managing high-level relationships
Drives and challenges business units on their assumptions of how they intend to change their processes and/or systems.

COMMERCIAL ACCOUNT ANALYST

With 150 years experience, Scott Insurance is a leader in developing smart strategies and innovative programs customized to the needs of mid-market companies. We offer property & casualty, employee benefits, captive insurance and surety bonds solutions, as well as personal risk services. An employee-owned company, we are one of the largest independent agencies in the Southeast and have Captive Insurance operations in Grand Cayman and Vermont. For 21 years, we have earned the distinction of a Best Practices Agency and have consistently been ranked among the top 30 agencies in the country by Reagan & Associates. Scott has nine offices across North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee and Virginia. Our employee owners enjoy a strong, team-centric culture, excellent benefits and retirement programs. As an employee-owned company, our associates are more than employees; they are owners. This ownership creates a unique company culture and provides significant opportunities for our employee owners. We are driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and guided by out-of-the box thinking to deliver world-class service to our clients, primarily mid-market companies.

We currently have an opening for a Commercial Account Analyst in our Greensboro, NC office. If you enjoy working in a dynamic environment that rewards excellence and encourages entrepreneurial thinking, we like to hear from you!

PRINCIPAL OBJECTIVE OF THE POSITION

This position will provide assistance to the Producer in the handling and processing of commercial business.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

Four year college degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Property & Casualty license or the ability to obtain within 90 days is required.
CISR and/or CIC designations preferred.
Proficient in Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Superior organizational skills, ability to handle multiple tasks and effectively prioritize.
Excellent relationship building skills.
Strong math and analytical skills.
Exceptional time management skills.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Managing accounts in accordance with agency standards and workflows.
Binding and issuing policies, endorsements and audits.
Preparing Premium/Loss Analysis and Modification Analysis.
Determining appropriate marketing strategy for placement of business.
Processing new business/renewal applications, endorsements, certificates, cancellations, audits, check policies and preparing proposals.
Preparing binders, certificates, account summaries (to include premium and loss experience as well as coverage), endorsements, policies, lost policy releases and account balance status when requested. CBM Analyst

Description

This position is accountable for providing lead technical direction and philosophy throughout SPC for the condition based maintenance technology(ies) in their area of expertise (examples of the recognized technical areas of expertise include: vibration, infrared, lubrication, motor diagnostics, etc.). The incumbent in this position provides strategic direction for equipment condition assessments and for making the resulting maintenance and operational recommendations. The incumbent in this position is recognized as a technical expert in more than one area of expertise and in the overall CBM process. The incumbent in this position will communicate closely with plants, leadership, operating review boards and corporate to share best practices, communicate issues, and to ensure consistency across Southern Power. The incumbent will be expected to support multiple plants and is responsible for knowledge transfer in the applicable CBM technologies and processes to plant personnel.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Experience in more than one CBM technology area (Required)
Working experience in gas and renewables (Preferred)
Knowledge gained by working at, or supporting, multiple plants on different systems and equipment.
Knowledge gained through internal, EPRI, and Vendor Training.
Ability to learn and stay up to date in technological advances.
Experience in integrating all pertinent information to make equipment maintenance and operational recommendations.
Experience in organizing and managing multiple projects at the same time. Proven ability to plan; ability to discern problems that need immediate attention versus those that allow more time to resolve.
Experience in directing others is desired.
Extensive knowledge or experience in plant maintenance and/or operations.
Self Starter that can work independently
Proven interpersonal and communication skills.
Experience in Maximo.
Frequent and extensive travel throughout the country supporting our wind, solar, and gas plants (75% or more)
Experience in drone technology (preferred)
JOB RESPONSIBILITIE
Support SRCM Maintenance Strategy and provide Operational Guidance in the expertise area.
Establish an ongoing relationship with key vendors; gather and analyze acceptance data on new/rebuilt equipment.
Communicate with Plant Management; Corporate Management; Peer Groups and Utility Experts concerning operation, maintenance repairs, replacement, modifications, improvements, and schedules.
Research to stay informed of current technologies.
Provide lead direction and support in setting the Southern Power equipment condition assessment/technology strategy. Support set-up and direction of new plants in relation to CBM strategy.
Ensure appropriate consistency in areas of expertise for all supported plants.
The incumbent may provide ownership and accountability.This includes managing and maintaining a budget for system expenditures, prioritizing expenses, providing expertise when problems arise, seeking improvements in the equipment operation, reviewing alternative equipment, and providing budgetary input.
Interpret CBM data, analyze results, and recommend course of action to the respective plants

Overview


JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest Commercial, Manufacturing and Life Sciences companies in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. Additionally, JAGGAER is the leading procure-to-pay provider in the Higher Education and Government sectors. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

The Financial Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Finance & Treasury, will be an integral part of the FP&A team and will be responsible to shape, drive, and deliver management reporting/dashboards, variance analysis, and forecasting and planning activities to support decision making, maximize access to capital, safeguard assets, and minimize risks.

Principal Responsibilities
Develop and prepare insightful and meaningful management reporting package with analysis for Senior Management including explanations of variances to forecast/plan, and prior periods and other ad hoc analysis as requested
Identify, understand, analyze and provide insight into key performance metrics
Drive accountability through monthly reporting and analysis relative to performance against targets
Establish and maintain forecasting processes across the global business including long-term planning, annual planning, and rolling forecast
Foster trusted relationships with business teams to proactively identify essential needs, provide functional and regional teams with necessary data and incisive analysis, as well as collaborate with key stakeholders across to develop accurate assumptions and analytical inputs to support plan/forecast
Identify, quantify, and communicate risks and opportunities to plan
Assist with global cash management and forecasting, including daily cash positioning, determine funding needs, as well as forecast and monitor short and long term cash position
Build and support Treasury infrastructure including streamline global bank accounts, balance consolidation, cash pooling, opening/closing bank accounts, as well as support debt and risk management, etc.
Collaborate with the team members to develop process improvements within the Finance Department, including but not limited to internal controls, report generation, process automation, improved use of technology, and documentation processes & procedures, etc.
Perform adhoc analysis and/or projects with respect to Finance and Treasury as assigned
Position Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field
Relevant experience in FPA&A, Finance/Accounting roles; or equivalent combination of education and work experience
Experience with NetSuite or similar ERP system and/or CPM system; knowledge of Adaptive Insights a big plus
Advanced Excel skills required
Driven self-starter with the ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven, and evolving environment while maintaining n a high level of accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees, management and external parties
Strong problem solving, analytical and critical thinking skills
Ability to take ownership and drive improvement in efficiency and effectiveness
About Our Benefits

JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics. We offer a generous benefits package including employee and family health, dental and vision coverage, reimbursement accounts for eligible medical expenses; company-paid life insurance, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability benefits; retirement plan with company match and generous paid time off benefits. Additional benefits include education and well-being reimbursements.

JAGGAER is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and will consider all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Please review the following job description:
Complete and interpret a variety of complex financial, regulatory and/or business analyses of financial information, trend analyses, revenue performance and expense management. Coordinate with other departments in the preparation of such analyses. Bring inconsistencies and problems to the attention of management. Act as team lead for more junior staff, as assigned. Provide project financial analysis for initiatives with potential financial reporting impact.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Coordinate financial analysis and reporting process workflow within team. Provide leadership and mentoring for less experienced team members; review and approve work of other team members. Ensure that changes to reporting process workflow and/or source data are documented and communicated to downstream reporting groups.
Respond to inquiries and provide thorough analysis of financial information for assigned area of responsibility. Confer with Accounting Policy or Regulatory Reporting on requests related to external audits or regulatory examinations.
Compile and submit timely and accurate reports related to complex aspects of the Bank’s financial performance or strategy. These may include: pro-forma projections for transaction, products, market segmentation strategies or acquisitions; income/expense or cash flow forecasts; regulatory interpretations, variance analyses and explanations for financial statement line items; or summaries, charts and graphs of data to highlight key results. Ensure that source data is reliable and complete and documentation is maintained to support data integrity initiatives. Interpret and summarize results and trends for Executive Management. Build/maintain specialized product/technical expertise for assigned area.
Monitor financial performance to detect unusual or significant transactions or trend development. Conduct or assist in root-cause analysis, as assigned.
Become familiar with products, fees and fee codes, regulatory reporting requirements, business cycles, origination channels and accounting flow for assigned area of responsibility.
Understand cost allocation methods for assigned area of responsibility.
Maintain financial information via the use of simple spreadsheets to more complex databases. Assist in the development and testing of economic models. Maintain necessary documentation of source data, ensuring adequate support of data integrity.
Review and update policies and procedures for compliance with governmental regulations and corporate policies and standards. Coordinate development of new accounting processes and procedures, as needed.
Analyze business and accounting processes for control and efficiency improvements.
Maintain a working knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles; build expertise related to assigned area of responsibility.
Maintain a working knowledge of regulatory reporting requirements; build expertise related to area of responsibility.
Provide line of business (LOB) personnel with the monthly performance review package by preparing and providing explanation of changes and identification of trends for use in discussions with the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and other members of Executive Management.

Coordinate internal or external audits and examinations (responses to External and Regulatory requests are to be made in collaboration with Accounting Policy).

You’ll oversee operating overhead expense (leases, rentals, equipment repairs and maintenance, etc.), while providing insight into the market, products/services, operational execution and other key drivers within the department. You’ll partner with various team members around the world to ensure our finance team is able to provide support to meet the growing needs of the business. Pay, benefits and more.

As a people-centric organization, we attribute the success of our Distribution Centers to the individuals who come to work each day. We foster a diverse supply chain team where your work will meaningfully impact the wellbeing and productivity of our entire squad. We believe that problems are best solved when backgrounds are mixed, perspectives are shifted, and boundaries are pushed. So—wherever you’re from—come join our crew!
The Global Supply Chain Team is responsible for the operations and strategic direction of transportation and distribution of merchandise through J.Crew’s multi-channel supply chain. The International Logistics Analyst will be responsible for planning, analyzing, and optimizing imported cargo from overseas; from booking to delivery to the US deconsolidation points and International 3PL warehouses. Partnering with Planning, DC Operations, Inventory Management, PO Fulfillment, Domestic Transportation team, Merchandise Manager’s and Assistants, and other internal groups will be required. This role works externally with Global Logistics Provider, ocean carriers, airfreight forwarders, Customs broker, draymen, FTL and LTL truckers, and 3rd-party warehouses. This Analyst will track-and-trace purchase order and shipments, reconciliation, and exception reporting related to the movement of our goods throughout the International portions supply chain.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Proactive exception management of all import activities to ensure on-time delivery
Coordinate with overseas vendors to manage import activities in order to meet service level expectations.
Work with vendors to identify and eliminate logistics obstacles to ensure safe and timely shipping of products.
Effectively monitor and track non-compliances, initiate Corrective Action Plan to resolve Root Cause
Maintain good relationship with vendors and service providers to improve overall business performance
Establish and define vendor routing guide, logistics procedures, carrier’s service level agreement and SOPs, review routinely to ensure they are continuously maintained and updated
Develop standard operating procedures and scheduling/shipping practices for efficiently carrying out logistics activities
Ensure that logistics system is operated in accordance with local, state and federal customs laws.
Ensure that logistics activities are in compliance with United States Customs and Border Protection regulations.
Develop Metrics and KPIs to measure vendors, carriers and 3PL’s performance
Create and maintain detailed financial reporting on all import activities including order management, logistics and shipping.
Inform cost changes, shipment issues, supply concerns to respective personnel and team in timely manner
Identify opportunities to streamline and standardize processes
Identify opportunities for cost reduction, material flow improvement, and business development
Research, analyze, develop and manage import programs, including reporting and presenting results, devising recommendations for change in processes and procedures.
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree required (or equivalent work experience)
3+ years of relevant industry experience with focus on analytics and logistics
Supply chain and retail, especially fashion/soft lines, experience a plus
Microsoft Office skills required with strong Excel and/or Access skills preferred
Skills & Abilities
Self-starter with good judgment and can proactively manage up where appropriate
Accountable for results, strives to meet and exceed expectations
Time management/prioritization and follow-up skills
Highly organized, detail and process oriented
Strong critical and analytical thinking
Strong written, verbal and presentation skills
Effective communication across all functions and levels
Visual analytics (Tableau, Qlik, etc.)

Sit in a chair at a desk most of the time

Office environment within a Distribution Center / Warehouse environment

Job Summary
As a Financial Analyst supporting the World-Wide Service and Support organization, specifically Professional Services, you will play an essential role in providing financial analysis and guidance to NetApp PS leadership by providing financial support and analysis in budgeting, planning and business processes. You will perform economic research, studies and financial modeling to help future business planning decisions and create reports and summaries as required by Corporate procedure or compliance regulations. You will interface with cross-functional peers and managers and have an opportunity to contribute across various business challenges.

The Financial Analyst’s role has responsibility for a wide range of financial support and analysis tasks. You will help to ensure that Professional Services objectives and project deadlines are met and align to NetApp Strategy. The essential functions of the Professional Services financial support model include:
Provide Business Partnership, Decision Support and Fiduciary guidance
Prepare and drive operational and financial metrics in support of key decision making

Gather, analyze, prepare and summarize recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts
Work with cross-functional groups to provide financial support including:
Forecasting
Budgeting
Variance analysis
Cost analysis
Product pricing
Management Reporting
Organization and Cost Center Structure
Revenue and Operational Policy review
SOX and Audit testing
Participate in Close Cycle – prepare and post JEs for areas of responsibility
Integrate financial processes and operations of the business

Good written and verbal communication skills.
Innovative thought leadership
Good interpersonal communication skills as needed to work successfully with staff and managers within and outside of function.
Strong analytical skills and ability to work both independently and on cross functional teams.
Ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization, including remote areas.
Ability to function well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with competing priorities.
Ability to work in a project based environment.
Ability to follow standard accounting and finance practices, and departmental procedures and processes.
Strong Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.
Strong working knowledge of Oracle G/L Applications.

So get ready to tap into the data visionary within, and join us as we accelerate digital transformation and empower our customers to change the world with data!

If you ask a NetApp employee why they work here, the answer is inevitably the same: the people. At NetApp, our culture is at the heart of what we do. We place importance in trust, integrity, teamwork, and caring above all else. NetApp is a place where people are empowered to make a difference. Empowered to innovate. Empowered to collaborate. Empowered to help ourselves and others be data-driven and change the world. We take care of each other, our customers, our partners, and our communities simply because it’s the right thing to do.

We work hard but also recognize the importance of work-life balance for our employees because what’s important to them is important to us! Recently we implemented Family First, which encourages employees to take paid time off to bond with a new child (through birth or adoption) or to care for a family member with a serious health condition. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off per year to donate their time with their favorite organizations. Generate spread sheets detailing Tooling & Material requirements as not to impact the programs in work.

Research and coordinate all material / tooling needs by service order along with the Inventory Control group to ensure adequate stock and availability across all North American sites.

bioMerieux has an opening for a Quality Control Analyst II in Durham, North Carolina.

The QC Analyst II executes routine tests per standard operating procedures. Tests may be raw materials, intermediates, environmental samples, finished goods, or stability samples submitted to the laboratory.

Main Accountabilities:
Testing of raw materials and manufactured product in accordance with laboratory guidelines as well as BMX methods and SOP’s.
Assist in the release of finished goods and raw materials after appropriate testing.
Ensures the proper documentation of technical data, generated from testing, is consistent with quality procedures.
Troubleshoots performance testing issues with the help of management and co-workers.
Performs failure analysis to determine preliminary cause of any problem.
Writes Nonconforming Reports (NC’s) and initiates and completes OOS investigations.
Review Device History Records for GMP compliance as per procedures. Approves test results, Releases final product, raw materials and intermediate products.
Provides support to product and process improvement projects. Assists in method development, trials, shelf life validations and equipment and process validations.
Assures routine subculture, maintenance and use of culture collection is performed in accordance with processes.
Responsible for performing activities related to product development and support, including experimental planning and execution as well as creation of detailed documentation.
May design experiments to optimize technical performance.
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree in a science related discipline – preferably microbiology with > 3 years of experience or Master degree with > 1 - 2 year of experience.
Demonstrated technical experience and knowledge of microbiological products and production process
High attention to detail
Exceptional organizational and time management skills
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Intermediate to advanced MS Office skills
Understands the importance of compliance with cGMP
Demonstrated understanding of regulatory requirements and quality system
Good communication, able to work independently and in a team environment
Good knowledge in the interpretation and analysis of QC Test Results
Working knowledge and application of relevant Domestic and International Regulations and Industry Standards (eg ISO, QSR, CLSI, USP, etc)

* Possesses basic knowledge of HTML

Are you looking for an opportunity to turn your ambition and your people skills into a rewarding career with an industry leader? Join our team at American Tire Distributors! As the nation's premier tire distributor, ATD’s coast-to-coast distribution network provides approximately 80,000 customers across the U.S. and Canada with rapid and frequent delivery of high quality tires, custom wheels and shop supplies.

Position Description:

Our Margin Analyst team is a critical piece of the Revenue Management operations. You will partner with a Regional Margin Manager to support two ATD regions. Together, in partnership with the Field Sales organization, you will help those regions achieve their revenue and margin targets. You will look at products, brands and customers to determine what is going right and wrong. Analyze pricing requests and decisions to determine the financial impact. Track the performance of past decisions so we can learn from them. Some of the work will be ‘in the weeds’ looking at a SKU (item) for one customer to understand how the pricing got set or how our price compares to a competitor. Other assignments will be broader in scope. You will be called upon to work on many margin growth special projects. We need you to be able to build models and employ advanced analytic techniques (e.g., elasticities, regression and other deep-dive analysis).

We want this role to be an analytical talent pipeline into ATD. There are places within Revenue Management that you can grow but there are also other teams across the company that can use your skills. We will help you develop and contribute in your current role while preparing you for whatever lies ahead for you at ATD.

Primary Responsibilities:
Own essential elements of pricing analytics. Lead the collection of pricing data, create frameworks for pricing decisions, and identify opportunities to optimize sales.
Apply advanced statistical and analytic techniques to large amounts of data with the goal of driving business decisions and providing the primary input in evolving the company’s pricing strategies.
Develop detailed pricing and demand models (incl. cannibalization), elasticity analyses, and measure the effectiveness of pricing strategy shifts.
Suggest and implement enhancements to existing pricing processes and systems
Models the impact of pricing strategy revisions by conducting what-if analysis on pricing actions. Shares insights and develops the analytics and RevMan-related skills of the broader organization.
Act as the subject matter expert on complex pricing analyses and executive requests, from data acquisition using SQL to formulation of pricing strategy and presentation to executive audiences
Key Partners (Positions):
Revenue management team members
Advanced Analytics COE
Category management
Field Sales leadership
Experience(s) that Best Prepares You:
Education: Degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Methods, Finance, Business, related fields, or equivalent years’ experience. Advanced degree preferred: MS in Business Analytics / Data Science, MBA with a specialization in Analytics or Revenue Management.
Experience: Pricing or Revenue Management experience is desirable but not required; likely candidate will have a ~5 year experience in a highly analytical and technical role.
Key Competencies:
Productive – former managers frequently marveled at the volume of high quality work you could produce
Advanced analytics expertise
Ability to effectively and efficiently convey complex data/findings
Strong business acumen and judgement
Demonstrate organizational empathy while delivering results. You will be coming in from the outside. Build relationships, demonstrate your value and earn respect.
Ability to tackle a project in a new area by employing problem structuring, analytics and problem solving approach
Project management
Team/people management
Expert level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel, intermediate or higher PowerPoint skills
Strong data manipulation, modeling and data visualization skillsets using Excel, R, SQL and Tableau
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Excellent leadership capabilities and communication and documentation skills
Proactive and works effectively under tight timelines
Be accountable
Build a challenging and rewarding career with us!

Job Title: Technical System Analyst
Location: Charlotte, NC

Job Description:

The Technical Analyst is primarily responsible for interpreting the functional requirements of a project into high/mid-level technical designs that will be consumed by the development teams. A major focus of the Technical Analyst is working with vendors and company developers to create technical specifications for system integrations at the web service level. The Technical Analyst participates in projects from the discovery phase throughout development and testing phases of the project.

Primary responsibilities and deliverables:
Create mid-level technical designs (ex: System Integration Diagrams, System Process Flows, Sequence Diagrams, web service level Data Maps)
Lead technical impact analysis for change requests, new applications, and enhancements
Facilitate JAD sessions to define vendor system integrations, and facilitate clear understanding between vendor and company development teams
Work with Architecture, Security, Business, and other Technology groups as needed to define solutions
Ensure consistent standards, processes, quality, and efficiency in Technical Analyst deliverables.
Ensure right level of detail and rigor in Technical Analyst deliverables
Ensure Technical Analyst deliverables conform to all compliance and security policies and procedures.
Ensure all necessary participants are included in work stream
Responsible for ensuring appropriate approvals, version control, and publication of Technical Analyst design deliverables
Review and provide input to Systems Requirements Document (SRS) to ensure clear, consistent, comprehensive and feasible
Review and provide input to Detailed Functional Requirements for screen functionality (UI Specs) to ensure clear, consistent, comprehensive and feasible
Review and provide input to Architectural Design Document (ADD)
Review and provide input to Test Plans
Support Functional Testing
Support development teams in understanding requirements and Technical Analyst design deliverables
Provide input to project planning, estimates and schedules
Identify dependencies, risks/issues, mitigation plans, and escalate as needed.
Proactive, regular communications with business and technology partners to keep informed of status, changes, or issues
Ensure Technical Analyst deliverables are completed according to defined schedules and requirements
Manage and mentor other Technical Analysts
The primary constituents for the Technical Analyst role are the company development teams, architecture and the Systems Analysts.

Qualifications:
Experience with web services and middleware integrations
Experience with SOA, SOAP, JSON, REST, XML
Experience creating high level designs, low level designs, process flows
Experience creating system integration diagrams
Experience creating sequence diagrams, web service level data mapping
Proficient at facilitating JAD sessions
Experience as Systems Analyst
Experience with Online Banking, Login Authentication, RSA is desired
Programming background is beneficial
Ability to explain technical issues and present proposed solutions clearly in both technical and non-technical terms
Experience with large scale development projects, including data migrations and 3rd party vendor integrations
Experience working with onshore/offshore staffing model
Flexible and comfortable in a fast-changing environment
Able to work independently in a leadership role to facilitate solutions from a variety of highly competent opinions
Highly organized and detail oriented, Excellent communication skills
Effective at managing team with many tasks and stakeholders, setting priorities, creating schedules, managing expectations and delivering on schedule.
Ability to create and implement processes to facilitate quality technical analyst deliverables

The Genesys Cloud Security & Compliance organization ensures the security and compliance of Genesys Cloud from initial design to Production by way of security policy, processes, and procedure standards including the definition, assessment/audit and certification, operation and continuous monitoring of cloud-based security infrastructure. This is a very dynamic high growth environment and requires great flexibility.

Successful candidates for this role must be very comfortable with evaluating, documenting, and creating remediation plans for multiple compliance requirements in a fast-paced organization.

Candidates will be expected to obtain an understanding of our Cloud SaaS technical environment and determine how our leading edge technologies and controls provide satisfaction, compensation, or mitigation for sometimes outdated compliance standard language. This will also involve translating the requirements into language Developers, DevOps, and Leadership can apply to our environments Candidates will be expected to participate in new compliance efforts, as well as maintain existing compliance obligations. A background in owning, and managing the day-to-day compliance operations, including auditing, risk assessment policy/procedure review, and maintaining status of controls is required.

The individual in this role is also expected to participate in and support various department activities which may include: the development and maintenance of information security policies, procedures, and standards; training, and awareness activities; review and respond to security requirements and inquiries regarding existing or proposed solutions.

Major Responsibilities/Activities:
Conduct and lead comprehensive assessments of information security and privacy policies and procedures against applicable regulations, laws, policies and standards. Assessments may include GAP analysis, recommendations and prioritize enhancements to the security and privacy infrastructure to remove or mitigate risk.
Perform Compliance Risk Assessments for vendors, products, services or processes
Work with Information Security, Engineering and Operations teams to define and document security standards and controls required to meet various regulatory and compliance guidelines and directives.
Evaluate and audit security control systems to address requirements.
Identify control deficiencies and make appropriate recommendations.
Provide guidance to Development & Operations on the appropriate selection, design, implementation, and configuration of security controls.
Provide expert guidance on implementation and operation of Change Management.
Revise and maintain a library of information security and privacy policies, standards and guidelines covering all areas within the environment.
Engage with Infrastructure and/or Architect Teams to assess the security risk of proposed projects and system/application modifications.
Collaborate with management, the legal department, facilities staff, and applicable law enforcement agencies to manage and remediate security vulnerabilities and incidents.
Understand & comply with all applicable security and privacy laws globally.
Adhere to Genesys’ Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.
Required Qualifications:
Experience in compliance auditing in Public Cloud environments (Amazon Web Services preferred).
A firm grasp of technical security in the Amazon AWS environment.
Experience auditing domestic and international information security standards (e.g., ISO 27001/27002, SSAE18/ ISAE 3402, PCI DSS, HIPAA, HITRUST, FEDRAMP, etc.) preferred.
Strong knowledge of security technologies and architecture, including encryption, cloud network security design, security group configuration, intrusion detection, data loss prevention and application security.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Good balance of technical competence and people skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in a team environment that is located in multiple locations globally.
Ability to take initiative and be proactive.
Ability to work independently and be resourceful.
Complex problem-solving and analytical skills.
Creative and critical thinking skills.
Flexible and adaptable.
Ability to present complex information in a clear, concise manner.


Desired Qualifications:
One or more Information Security Certifications: CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional), CISA (Certified Information Systems Auditor), CISM (Certified Information Security Manager), AWS Solutions Architect, or other security certification/accreditation.
Well-developed change management skills. Effective in working across organizational boundaries to build a case for changes, and to execute on the change plan - from strategy through to ongoing operation and process improvement.
Project management.
Proficiency with Linux server operating systems.

Job Description
Data Analyst/Insight Analyst

Sirch Incorporated is currently looking for a Data Analyst/Analytic Analyst to work as a full-time employee for a global healthcare solutions company in the Charlotte, NC area. They are one of the top companies in their industry and gained this recognition because of the strength within their IT and Data Analytics teams. Because of that, they refuse to hire anyone except the most successful Data Analysts. Their benefits, culture, and work environment are top-notch. This is an ideal opportunity for someone looking for challenging work and the potential for advancement.

Responsibilities

The Data Analyst / Insight Analyst designs, develops and delivers analytics insights for our client's clients, helping them better serve patients and improve the delivery and use of their products. The Analyst has adept analytics skills to understand strategic customer needs and then prepare finished analyses to help drive strategic recommendations. Additionally, the Analyst can successfully tell a data narrative and the “story behind the story” that defines the “What”, “So What” and “Now What” for Client Group customers.

Analysts are aligned with internal and external stakeholders in the analysis of complex data, ensuring all analytics and insights, other deliverables and program data are high quality. This position is largely self-directed and independent in the exploration of data, receiving minimal oversight in the preparation of their deliverables, and they share their analytics techniques with others on the Business Analytics Team to continuously improve our capabilities. Analysts are also expected to provide mentoring and development support to mid-level and junior staff.

The Data/Insight Analyst works in partnership with Analytics Consultants, who also serve on the Business Analytics Team. Analytics Consultants manage the customer relationship and develop the program of work, while the Analyst performs the discovery and analysis work, prepares analytic deliverables, and briefs stakeholders on the results. Collectively Analysts and Consultants take general direction from Program Directors and Client Executives. The Data/Insight Analyst is keenly aware of project deliverable and timelines, proactively planning and coordinating efforts with others.
Understand Analytic Needs and Prepare Deliverables
Understand Client product strategy and Client services, and how each is reflected in internal and external data.
Collaborate with Analytics Consultants, Client representatives and Operations stakeholders to target analytics opportunities and define deliverable scope.
Assess tasks and timelines required for on-time, quality deliverables.
Prepare analytics-optimized data.
Develop models and perform analysis to final client deliverables.
Collaborate with colleagues to share and propagate best practices.
Direct-Request Reporting Services
Prepare deliverables to meet client-directed, ad hoc reporting requests.
Deliver output in a timely manner, in accordance with contractual SLAs, as stated in the MSA.
Share insights gleaned from ad hoc requests with all appropriate account stakeholders.
Assist Business Reporting Team in the maintenance, oversight, and distribution of analytics and reporting deliverables.
Data Quality Management
Understand and develop business rules to be applied to analytics data
Assist with development and storage of analytics-ready data to facilitate reporting and development of analytic deliverables
Help maintain a data reporting environment that provides consistent and accurate reporting of the client's data
Take an active role in quality assurance, sharing data “gaps” and working in a matrixed environment to improve the immediate and long term.
Design analytics and reporting deliverables, especially around data visualization best practices, and data storytelling
Perform data curation, cleansing, validation, modeling, interpretation and reporting.
Act as the data expert, leading the way in data discovery, both proactively and by request, to identify key insights and trends to help drive strategic recommendations.
Provide consulting support on all data-related solutions (program design, report design, data feed design, data aggregation, etc.).
Deliver ad hoc reporting and analytics within an agreed-upon SLA.
Ensure solutions meet the client's needs, support the extraction of actionable information, and align with client objectives.
Act as the voice of the client internally at Client Group to ensure solutions are provided with high-quality to meet the client's needs.
Emphasize the customer experience with each interaction and deliverable.
Play an active role in business reviews, especially in reviewing analytical findings and in strategic planning discussions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

• Develop financial models for acquisition targets. • Analyze financial income statements for potential acquisitions.• Conduct and evaluate demographic growth analysis.• Develop accurate business driver models such as number of visits. • Decipher market and economic research data into CORA Physical Therapy model. • Consolidate and prepare investment documentation and recommendations to include narrative, graphic charts and financial analysis.• Provide support for due diligence and sourcing efforts relating to acquisitions.• Track progress and assist with action items related to due-diligence process. • Reconcile potential acquisition accounts with QuickBooks files. • Create pro forma projections for acquisition and development clinics.• Conduct Valuations and ROI analysis on acquisition targets including risk tolerances and sensitivity analysis. • Assist in the review, tracking, and data management of contractual changes.• Perform any other duties as directed.

With the guidance of the Chief Acquisition & Development Officer, the Acquisition Analyst will support CORA Physical Therapy business growth and acquisitions. Develop, coordinate, and oversee acquisition activities through the entire project management cycle including metrics analysis, budgeting, accounting, auditing, and reporting and document preparation. Work directly with senior leadership to help drive deals from the due-diligence process to acquisition. Work remotely with flexibility as it relates to work hours and travel.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Develop financial models for acquisition targets.
• Analyze financial income statements for potential acquisitions.
• Conduct and evaluate demographic growth analysis.
• Develop accurate business driver models such as number of visits.
• Decipher market and economic research data into CORA Physical Therapy model.
• Consolidate and prepare investment documentation and recommendations to include narrative, graphic charts and financial analysis.
• Provide support for due diligence and sourcing efforts relating to acquisitions.
• Track progress and assist with action items related to due-diligence process.
• Reconcile potential acquisition accounts with QuickBooks files.
• Create pro forma projections for acquisition and development clinics.
• Conduct Valuations and ROI analysis on acquisition targets including risk tolerances and sensitivity analysis.
• Assist in the review, tracking, and data management of contractual changes.
• Perform any other duties as directed.

Education and/or Experience:
• A minimum of Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Public Health, Business Administration or equivalent degree.
• A minimum of 3 years of professional experience supporting acquisitions in markets within the United States.
• Demonstrated experience in financial modeling.
• Preferred past experience in health care sector (outpatient segment preferred).
• Preferred experience with QuickBooks.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
• Conveys positive professional image.

About Avalara

Avalara helps businesses of all sizes achieve compliance with transaction taxes, including sales and use, VAT, excise, communications, and other tax types. The company delivers comprehensive, automated, cloud-based solutions designed to be fast, accurate, and easy to use. The Avalara Compliance Cloud® platform helps customers manage complicated and burdensome tax compliance obligations imposed by state, local, and other taxing authorities throughout the world.

Avalara offers more than 600 pre-built connectors into leading accounting, ERP, ecommerce and other business applications, making the integration of tax and compliance solutions easy for customers. Each year, the company processes billions of indirect tax transactions for customers and users, files more than a million tax returns, and manages millions of tax exemption certificates and other compliance documents.

Headquartered in Seattle, Avalara has offices across the U.S. and overseas in the U.K., Belgium, Brazil, and India. More information at www.avalara.com

Coordinate with internal colleagues to follow up on vulnerability remediation.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with clients and other team members.
Gain and maintain a working knowledge of the Security Products and Services
Continually review and enhance existing knowledge of threats and analysis techniques
Serve as part of the Enterprise Vulnerability Management team
Perform annual Firewall rule review and remediation

Demonstrate a self-directed approach to learning new technologies in the field; pursue professional development.

Knowledge of Penetration testing tools and testing methodologies
Analysis of operating system, application and network architectures to identify security vulnerabilities
Extensive knowledge and experience of operating systems and distributions.
Windows Server and Desktop Network and domain administration, enumeration and exploitation
Understanding of the TCP/IP protocol stack and other protocols such as routing protocols, web services
Knowledge of security issues related to many common databases including MySQL, MSSQL and Oracle
Working knowledge of application testing tools and techniques such as XSS and SQL injection
Scripting and programming skills are preferred
Previous experience with enterprise vulnerability management applications, Firewall rules review, BURP Suite, IBM AppScan and Core Impact a plus

Assemble the monthly Brand Review presentation to senior leadership
Produce required on-going set of daily/weekly/monthly reports
Assist in creating Merchandising content for Board of Directors presentations (or similar)
Meet departmental standards for quality, quantity and turn time expectations.
Prioritize multiple responsibilities to ensure all deadlines are met, and resolve any issues in a timely manner by partnering with appropriate business partner(s).

Education: Bachelor’s degree in a related business discipline (Business, Marketing, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Economics)

Systematic problem solver who understands the value of leveraging analytical insights to drive innovative solutions
Experience with analytical tools such as Power BI, BI, Tableau, ThinkCell, Excel, PowerPoint
Strong analytical and conceptual skills
Strong ability to collaborate with multiple departments and functions
Demonstrated decision-making ability
Demonstrated leadership ability
Ability to partner and influence

MBA

Experience in the Tire industry
B2B and B2C experience
Additional Details (work environment, specializations, etc.)

Description:
United Rentals, Inc. is an $8 billion dollar Fortune 500 organization and the largest equipment rental company in the world. The company has an integrated network of over 1,100 rental locations in 49 states, every Canadian province, and 11 in Europe. The company's 18,000+ employees serve construction and industrial customers, utilities, municipalities, homeowners and others. Additional information about United Rentals is available at unitedrentals.com.

The Payroll Analyst is responsible for various Payroll tasks and functions for North American and European payrolls supporting over 18,000 employees. The role provides reports for payroll taxes, accounting analysis and other strategic planning activities while contributing to ancillary payroll support through the coordination of the tax; payroll banking; and union functions. United Rentals is a Fortune 500 company and industry leader.

Essential Duties:

Banking

o Investigate returned checks and deposits; process ACH reversals and stop payments as required

o Review Positive Pay exceptions and make determination whether to pay or reject

o Prepare funding totals and send to Treasury for all payrolls weekly

o Print all live manual checks for processors

Reporting

o Provide ad hoc reports for CorporateTax; Finance and others as needed

o Prepare monthly multiple worksite reports for various states

o Prepare/Review union reports and check requests monthly

o Provide monthly Close reports including but not limited to: PTO reports; GL's; Tax Funding; Severance Taxes; Co tax totals; Cash Flow; Bonus data and Charitable contributions

o Prepare monthly metrics reports including but not limited to: Overtime; On-Call pay statistics; punch data; unapproved records; negative leave balances for termed employees and IVR statistics and expenses

o Run and review all SumTotal reports used in various processes such as on-cycle payrolls; monthly metrics; annual bought vacation payouts etc

o Prepare monthly region metrics data.

o Prepare annual vacation roll-forward exercise and re-set beginning balances

Payroll Taxes:

o Point of contact for all payroll tax and tax compliance issues and questions

o Process refund checks from various jurisdictions

o Handle registrations for any new jurisdictions

o Process misc EFT tax payments for any jurisdictions not in our third party provider's direct debit.

Payroll Processing

o PeopleSoft wage and tax adjustments as needed

o Excel to Component Interface loads for imputed income transactions

o Review earnings and deduction codes to ensure proper mapping to W2's and T4's.

o Review Canadian Union Pension amounts and adjust as required for T4's

o Load all SumTotal hours; Benefit deduction files; Concur files; Adjustment files et al each pay period.

o Complete and submit all certified payrolls as required

o Review and ensure compliance for any employees working under a prevailing wage requirement.

o Confirm all on and off-cycle payrolls and ensure deposit files are processed and received by the bank within the required timeframes.

o Flag all US Other inbox emails and assign to a processor.

o Quarterly perform an OT True-up for our ISRIP's receiving a discretionary bonus.

o Work with certified payrolls and prevailing wages.

o Compile new hire data and audit against payroll system to ensure correct and complete payroll processing.

o Work with time and attendance system; troubleshoot issues; pull hours for upload into payroll system and be the point person for clock deployments to branches.

Auditing

* Point person for external auditors. Provide necessary data as requested.

* Thoroughly review and audit each payroll before it is confirmed looking for reasonableness with totals. Research any notable variances.

* Periodic reviews and handling of various processes including but not limited to: vehicle deductions; leave balances; annual Wellness/Floating Holiday limits and other data audits as needed.

Account Reconciliations

* Pull and format all required input files; load files and reconcile any unmatched items.

* Submit monthly account reconciliations for up to 6 cash accounts.

Union Compliance

* Pull and compile monthly employee data; submit monthly reports and remit required payments to each Local.

* Compile data for Labor Cost Model plans as requested.

* Establish rapport with locals and maintain list of current rates for monthly calculations.

* Keep copy of all current union contracts and provide input and guidance to processing staff related to hour calculations and deductions for union employees.

Requirements:
Education: Bachelor's degree or comparable work experience, accounting or finance degree preferred.

Experience:

5+ years of experience with national & international payroll that includes 1+ years in an analytical role is required.

Experience with peoplesoft is preferred.

Other Skills Required: * Highly motivated

* Strong oral and written communication skills

* Strong organizational skills

* Strong Microsoft Excel skills

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Prepares monthly corporate journal entries & account reconciliations for revenue accounts
Researches general ledger & revenue related questions, including aged accruals for adherence to Company policies
Perform analysis of monthly, quarterly and yearly revenue data to help identify process/procedure improvements
Prepares audit schedules and assists with analysis during the annual audit
Compiles data for analysis and performs research as needed
Participate on and support various projects and tasks
Generate ad-hoc reports as necessary
Performs other duties as assigned
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's Degree (finance or accounting preferred)
1 - 3 years general business experience preferred
Prior experience with Concur preferred
Prior experience with credit card programs preferred
Knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office and Internet applications

Sealed Air partners with customers to solve their most critical packaging challenges with innovative solutions that leave our world, environment, and communities better than we found them. Our portfolio of widely recognized brands includes Cryovac® food packaging and Bubble Wrap® protective packaging which respectively enable a safer, more efficient food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.7 billion in sales in 2018 and has approximately 15,500 employees who serve customers in 123 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com.
Summary
The Tax Analyst is a key member of the Tax Team who interacts with the Sales & Use Tax Manager and may also interact with other functional groups within the Tax Department (US Federal, US State, and International). They will also interact heavily with a variety of other departments such as Customer Experience, Credit and Collections, Supply Chain as well as other teams within the finance organization. This position will support multiple facets of the Sales & Use Tax and Property Tax functions, as well as support special projects and tax planning initiatives. Knowledge of multi-state Sales & Use Tax and Property Tax laws are key to providing timely and accurate analysis and reporting results.
Responsibilities
• Extract and prepare data for third party Sales & Use Tax, Property Tax and business license compliance service providers
• Analyze financial information to prepare consumer use tax accruals
• Review reconciliations and returns prepared by third party service providers and request funding
• Reconcile all indirect tax related general ledger accounts
• Perform multistate research as needed on Sales & Use Tax and Property Tax related topics
• Receive and review customer exemption certificates and update DMA webtool kit
• Review and approve sales tax debits and credits
• Review requests for vendor exemption certificates and prepare certificates as appropriate
• Assist with Sales & Use Tax and Property Tax audits
• Identify process improvements and cost saving opportunities
• Assist with various income tax returns as needed
• Assist in tax planning projects
• Perform other duties as needed
Qualifications
Education:

• Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field

Experience:

• 1-2 years combined experience with a public accounting firm or corporate tax department
• Experience with multistate Sales & Use Tax and Property Tax filings
• Knowledge of Sales & Use Tax calculation software such as Sovos (Taxware), One Source, AvaTax or Vertex
• Experience with exemption certificate management software such as DMA Webtool Kit, CertCapture, ControlPoint. or TTR
• Experience using tax research software such as TTR, Thomson Reuters Checkpoint or CCH
• SAP experience preferred

Skills/Certifications/Special Training:

• Proficient in MS Office, with emphasis on excel
• Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail
• Strong communication skills both written and oral
• Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects, effectively prioritize and meet deadlines
• Must be a team player

Requisition id: 29682

Relocation: No

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. Sealed Air participates in the E-Verify Program (US sites only).

FUNCTIONAL / LABOR CATEGORY: Financial Analyst
POSITION TITLE: Consultant/Senior Consultant
LOCATION: Havelock, NC

DESCRIPTION:
Sehlke Consulting is looking for qualified individuals to join a team that shall provide Accounting, Budgeting and Financial Analysis support to the United States Marine Corps, II Marine Expeditionary Force.

EDUCATION: N/A

CERTIFICATION(s): N/A

LABOR CATEGORY / DUTIES:

• Assist the Assistant Chief of Staff (AC/S), Comptroller in establishing internal controls to provide reasonable assurance that process weaknesses can be prevented or detected early enough to mitigate and prevent an adverse impact on the organization.
• Assist the organization by identifying weaknesses in internal controls, programs, operational, or administrative areas through audits, inspections, and Internal Control assessments.
• Assist AC/S, Comptroller with testing internal controls in order to assess the functions, programs, and operations. Ensure subordinate commands develop corrective action plans to resolve Internal Control weaknesses.
• Assist with preparation of the Statement of Assurance (SOA) and results of internal control submissions. Track and perform follow-up on all reportable conditions and material weaknesses.
• Provide advice, assistance, and guidance to other Marine Corps entities as requested or directed.
• Provide Financial Improvement and Audit Readiness (FIAR) and Financial Program Management (FPM) support services.
• Support the demands of existing, expanding, and new requirements to comply with the Chief Financial Officers Act of 1990, Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Circular A-123, and various other regulations as they pertain to auditable financial statements and effective internal controls.
• Advise and coordinate with Government personnel and conduct tasks related to the remediation of sample deficiencies discovered by the DoD Inspector General/Independent Public Accounting audit personnel.
• Assist in the developing, coordinating, and disseminating of lessons learned.
• Serve as Subject Matter Expert (SME) advisor for Marine Corps budget, accounting, and financial management policy and procedures within the organization.
• Provide interpretive and analytical advice on Marine Corps financial transactions and program execution; develop format and content to provide various listings, reports, and data relative to status of funds and the propriety of obligations; and ensure the financial integrity, timeliness, accuracy and validity of supporting managerial accounting, budget execution.
• Analyze and advise on whether or not Marine Corps resources are managed efficiently and effectively, Marine Corps programs and operations are discharged with integrity, Marine Corps programs comply with applicable laws and regulations, and if the potential for fraud, waste, and mismanagement are minimized.

REQUIREMENTS:

• Four years of service within a DoD financial management field, and expert knowledge of budget processes and ability to explain the life cycle of an accounting transaction.
• Shall possess strong communications skills and experience in interacting with Marine Corps Officers, Senior Noncommissioned Officers, and Civilian Employees.
• Full grasp of the concepts, principles, practices, laws, and regulations of USMC budget, accounting, and internal controls. Knowledge must be sufficient enough to analyze programs at all levels and develop internal control policy recommendations. Must be able to interpret, assess, and project potential impact of new/revised internal control requirements.
• Must display knowledge of Statement of Budgetary Resources (SBR) and Schedule of Budgetary Activity (SBA) audit procedures and source documentation requirements.
• Experience, demonstrated knowledge of use, and ability to obtain and maintain access to relevant financial systems.

Founded in 2011, Sehlke Consulting is a rapidly-growing Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Arlington, VA – and an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

The Business Analyst uses business and technology knowledge to serve as a liaison between business initiatives and IT in order to determine the correct course of action to achieve desired results. Responsibilities:

* Documents client organization's direction, structure, business processes and requirements.

* Liaison between the business and development teams throughout the project.

* Analyzes business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how the application can best function to fulfill those needs.

* Identifies cross impact to other systems.

* Proposes solutions to problems and considers timeliness, effectiveness, and practicality in addressing client needs.

* Understands project plans and is able to clearly articulate roles, project goals, and timelines.

* Adheres to and facilitates project standards.

* Creates, consolidates and presents documents relating to use cases, functional requirements, data mapping, privilege provisioning and authorization models, maintaining them throughout the project, including traceability back to requirements.

* Ensures with the quality management team that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, and that testing plans have been completed.

* Provides a business or process perspective during design reviews.

* Participates in change control process throughout the project.

* Proactively carries out project support /administrative functions.

Skills and Abilities:

* Outstanding organizational and multi-tasking skills

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

* Strong attention to detail

* Ability to deal directly with all levels of management – from consultants to executives and business partners

* Strong sense of urgency and high level of responsiveness

* Ability to work independently and part of a team

* Rapidly adapts and responds to changes in environment and priorities

* Bachelor’s degree in business or related field

* 3+ years of experience as business analyst

* Understands basic Internet and client/server architectures

* Possesses basic knowledge of HTML

* Proficient in Microsoft Office suite

Preferences:

*Experience in working with development teams preferred

*Experience in systems implementation, business analysis, and/or project management

*Big 4 and/or boutique consulting firm experience

*Consulting experience with a FSI client

*FSI merger & acquisition experience

Job Description:

This entry-level position will offer the opportunity to learn the business methods and processes for Enterprise Asset Management as applied to a variety of industries for purposes of optimizing production equipment reliability. The position will also afford the business analyst the opportunity to learn and work with IBM Maximo; a contemporary, web-based, best of breed Enterprise Asset Management system.

The role of business analyst is to work with senior consultants as they lead customers in applying industry best practices for asset management while implementing the Maximo product. Business Analysis will play the important role of participating in project workshops, taking notes, and then supporting the development of deliverables to the client in the form of business process definition, functional and technical requirements, and system testing materials. Business Analysts will also support the final solution deployment by assisting customers with using the system properly once the system is placed into product.

Business Analysts will also have the opportunity to apply the leading software development life-cycle methodologies that consist of both agile and waterfall methods.

Essential Job Duties:
A successful candidate for this position will be able to execute the following job duties under direction of Cohesive Senior resources:
Workshop Participation
Document Meeting Minutes
Design of User Experience
Build of User Experience Prototypes
End User Training Program Execution
Post Software Deployment Support
Documentation of Business Processes and Functional Requirements
Report Designs
Mobile Solution Requirement Definition
Software Quality Assurance Testing Definition and Execution
Support Change Management Activities
End User Training Material Development
Ensuring Quality of Written Materials
Other duties as assigned
Required Qualifications
Master's degree or equivalent from a nationally recognized higher educational institution in the United States, in the field of Business, Engineering, or Information Technology.
Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills
Willing to relocate.
Must have an aptitude for using and applying technology to address business problems and requirements
Proficient in use of the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
0-3 years experience with ERP, CRM systems, or equivalent systems
Must enjoy working in a team environment and with individuals alike
Must be a resourceful self starter with the ability to work alone
Must be capable of weekly travel to customer locations for long duration projects.

Valassis is the leader in marketing technology and consumer engagement. and risk points

standard reports for senior management

are met

updates and critical issues using CS systems (Archer, Micos, Snow, etc).

meetings; attend ESS / CISO meetings

technical and metrics reports using Tableau, DataLake, Splunk, etc.

owners, architects, engineers to get data sources and requirements

demands reporting to senior management

service support role, in a business analysis role and/or IT product manager.

in an enterprise IT environment. This is not about a detailed knowledge of IT infrastructure

components that have a role to be played in Network Security service;

understanding of the how the ownership/support responsibilities are organized.

and presentation of service management information.

network and security products and services.

relationship with senior management (DIR and above).

He will conduct regular presentations to team/stakeholders.

- 5 plus years of providing L2 Application support for .NET applications

As a Sales Compensation Analyst, you will be responsible for the administrative operations of Sales Compensation. This role will support Sales Compensation Plan implementation, maintain commissioned participant records in the Sales Compensation Systems, validate monthly sales commission payments. To successfully accomplish these goals, this role will closely work with the Geo/Regional Sales Operations and Human Resources, and Finance. Also as part of the Global Sales Compensation team, this role will involve in various project-driven activities.

Job Requirements
Administration of Sales Participant data in the Sales Compensation system working with regional Sales Operations and Sales Management.
Validating sales compensation data for accuracy and consistency with the corporate Sales Compensation policies and guidelines.
Collaborating with HQ Commission Accounting in validating Commission Data Report, manual data adjustment, and manual deposits on a monthly basis to ensure timely and accurate payments.
Supporting non-revenue driven measurement such as MBO and Milestone Objectives in terms of record validation and payments.
Collaborating with regional Sales Operations and Sales Management to timely resolve sales compensation issues in line with the corporate policies and guidelines.
Providing support in implementing Compensation plans for all commissioned employees, and ensuring that plans are executed per Compensation Plan Policy and guidelines.
Providing administrative assistance occasionally for Sales Promotions and Contests, in terms of accurate and timely payments.
Supporting guidance and training to Field Sales team surrounding Compensation-related processes, procedures and program details.
Providing assistance for quarterly compensation health check analysis to the sales leadership
Help to ensure compliance with SOX for our compensation documents and programs.

Bachelor Degree in Business with a minimum of 4 years in sales compensation, sales operations, finance with a focus on sales incentive pay, process and design.
