Independent, self-starter who can work cross functionally and build strong working relationships with internal departments.
Hard working and diligent personality with strong attention to detail.
Required to meet critical deadlines while maintaining organization and efficiency.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good analytical mind and skills to change data into information.
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)
SAP Commissions (formerly Callidus) experience

Credit Karma is a mission-driven company, focused on championing financial progress for our more than 100 million members in the U.S., Canada and U.K. While we're best known for pioneering free credit scores, our members turn to us for tips as they work on their financial goals, including helping them monitor their credit, identity monitoring, searching for credit cards, shopping for loans (car, home and personal), filing their taxes with Credit Karma Tax and growing their savings* -- all for free. Banking services provided by MVB Bank, Inc., Member FDIC

Security is a core value at Credit Karma. We help millions of people better manage their credit. Safeguarding their sensitive information is critical to our continued success. From the CEO down to each individual engineer, everyone views security as a personal responsibility. Credit Karma is looking for a SOC Incident Analyst, and your unique mission is to mine a deep data set of security event information for useful signals and feed the results into automated actions and infrastructure changes.
What You’ll Do
Primary duty is responding to security events and incidents
Secondary duty will be assisting in Vulnerability Management activities
Incident Response activities will include, but are not limited to, triaging security events, network and endpoint forensic analysis, malware reverse engineering, threat hunting, vulnerability escalation, and resolving security incidents from detection to remediation
Engage with partners in engineering, IT, and operations to respond to and remediate events.
Creates and implements standard operating procedures and processes to help streamline investigations, daily monitoring and analysis research to ensure all analysts are effective
Identify opportunities for implementing additional technology controls to create more visibility or defend key points of attack
Carry out threat hunting campaigns and missions
Coordination and execution of purple teaming exercises
Design visualizations of key sustaining metrics for 24x7 panes of glass.
What’s Great About It
Carrying out two positive missions at the same time: helping people take back control of their credit and helping to keep their personal information safe
Solving frontier security problems at scale in a highly technology-focused team
Spending zero minutes convincing anyone why security is important - we all understand that very well already!
What We Expect
5+ years experience in working in cyber security operations (CSOC, SOC, CIRT, CSIRT) enterprise environment
Understanding of the Cyber Kill Chain framework and Diamond Model for intrusion analysis
Strong knowledge of tools used for network security (Data Loss Prevention, Network Intrusion Prevention Systems, Host Intrusion Prevention Systems, Anti-Virus, Firewalls, etc.)
Experience with languages such as; Python, Java, Scala, PowerShell, Bash, etc.
Experience with the Network Security Monitoring (NSM) methodologies
Experience in Ethical Hacking or Red Team
Experience with vulnerability scanners such as: Qualys, Nessus, Metasploit, Rapid7
Experience with endpoint detection and response (EDR) suites (CrowdStrike, McAfee EPO, OSSEC, Yara, MIR, CarbonBlack, Tanium, etc.)
Experience with host-centric tools for forensic collection and analysis (SleuthKit, Volatility Framework, FTK, Encase, etc.)
Experience with Network Forensics and/or Network Security Monitoring (NSM) tools (Snort, Bro-IDS, PCAP, tcpdump, etc.) and analysis techniques (alert, flow/session and PCAP analysis)
Experience with SAAS, PAAS, IAAS, public and private cloud technologies, Docker, Kubernetes, etc
A fun and positive attitude!

• Responsible for recording, monitoring, and resolving agency tax notices & tracers with 3rd party provider & government agencies, as well as validating of all agency responses.
• Performs detailed jurisdictional reconciliations for internal & external audits.
• Creates adhoc reporting to support internal & external functions.
• Researches and remains current with payroll tax compliance laws and regulations covering the US regions & provides payroll tax guidance & awareness of applicable changes & provides appropriate recommendations.
• Assists with Year-End processing and closing
• Assists with HRSP and regression testing collectively with team. Develops test cases and tests BSI Tax updates. Keeps SAP and BSI tax configuration current by submitting requests for applicable changes, such as rates and new tax authorities.
• Collectively collaborates with team to proactively monitor internal controls to ensure accuracy, compliance and timely tax filing & reporting to government authorities.

FILING AND DEPOSITS
Proactively audits and validates payroll tax filings / reports submitted on behalf of by our 3rd party service provider. This position reviews & confirms that all payroll tax deposits are accurate and executed on-time to eliminate any late filing penalties. Position identifies unusual transactions, escalates when appropriate, coordinates resolution and interacts with 3rd party payroll provider. Leads Quarter Balancing & Year End processes with ADP Tax Services.

INTERNATIONAL PAYROLL TAX AND REPORTING
Initiates and records earnings and tax adjustments into the applicable payroll system, as requested by 3rd party International Tax Partner (PWC). Ensures appropriate documentation exists to prove our employees taxable wages and tax liabilities. Engaged in payroll transactions related to Expatriate & Inpatriate employees, and monitors the impacts to their taxation.

SARBANES-OXLEY AND INTERNAL CONTROL
Provides recommendations for compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) requirements. Confirms that all controls are functioning as designed and proactively identifies areas for improvement in internal controls. Includes testing of segregation of duties (SOD), testing of payroll services controls and identifies gaps, as well as participating in annual SOX testing and validation exercises.

Assists with quarterly and annual audit engagements with Internal & External Auditors. Ensures informational requests are documented, information is provided and that any issues are clearly identified and resolved.

OTHER
Assists with implementation of key strategies and projects as identified or assigned.

Job Description

On the battlefield, success depends on accurate and timely intel. As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of information gathered from or about the enemy. Intelligence Analysts provide Guard personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action.

Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparation of all-source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and the preparation and maintenance of graphics.

Job Duties
• Prepare all-source intelligence products to support the combat commander
• Assess the significance and reliability of incoming information with current intelligence
• Establish and maintain systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and files

Some of the Skills Youll Learn
• Critical thinking
• Preparing maps, charts, and intelligence reports
• Military symbology

Helpful Skills
• Interest in reading maps and charts
• Gathering and analyzing information

Through your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career with Federal Government agencies, such as the Central Intelligence Agency or the National Security Agency.

Earn While You Learn
Instead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.

Job training for an Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and part in the field.

Benefits/Requirements

Benefits
Paid training
A monthly paycheck
Montgomery GI Bill
Federal and State tuition assistance
Retirement benefits for part-time service
Low-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)
401(k)-type savings plan
Student Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)
Health care benefits available
VA home loans
Bonuses, if applicable
Most non-prior service candidates will earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to change
Requirements
Military enlistment in the Army National Guard
Must be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or a GED certificate
Must be between the ages of 17 and 35
Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standards
Must meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)
Requires military enlistment. Programs and benefits are subject to change. Ask your Army National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability.

This position may qualify for a bonus, ask your National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION / PRIMARY PURPOSE

The Senior Financial Reporting Analyst will be responsible for assisting with the preparation of the Company's quarterly and annual consolidated US GAAP financial statements, preparing IFRS reporting packages provided to the company’s international investor, assisting with technical accounting projects and maintaining the Company’s internal controls over financial reporting.



MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS/DUTIES OF THE POSITION
Consolidate divisional reporting templates and compile quarterly and annual US GAAP financial statements
Assist with compilation of semi-annual IFRS reporting packages and reconciliations to US GAAP
Perform accounting research and analysis of new transactions, business initiatives and new accounting pronouncements and document the appropriate accounting treatment
Assist in the coordination of the annual audit and quarterly review activities performed by the external auditors
Maintain, document and improve the company’s internal controls over financial reporting including testing of key controls
Work with the divisions to respond to questions and implement process improvements in order to create efficiencies and reduce timeframes for deliverables in the financial close and reporting processes
Assist with ad hoc requests and special projects including acquisition due diligence activities and integration of newly-acquired business
Required Skills

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skill And Experience Requirements)
Minimum of 3 years of accounting experience
Experience at a Big 4 or large accounting firm, preferably on publicly traded clients
US GAAP financial reporting experience preferred, IFRS experience is a plus
Experience using HFM and web-based financial reporting applications preferred
Solid background and understanding of accounting principles, including the preparation of financial statements and technical accounting experience.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office and database applications
Ability to effectively prioritize multiple projects in order to meet tight deadlines and produce high quality work is required
Strong attention to detail and ability to work well both independently and in a team, environment is required
Strong analytical and interpersonal skills
Bilingual in English and Spanish is a strong plus
Ability to travel internationally, as needed

Functional Expertise
Requires conceptual and practical expertise in own discipline and basic knowledge of related disciplines

Business Acumen
Interprets internal/external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes or services

Problem Solving
Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information

Leadership
Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience; may lead small projects with manageable risks and resource requirements

Impact
Impacts the achievement of customer, operational, project or service objectives; work is guided by functional policies

Interpersonal Skills/ Influence
Explains difficult or sensitive information; works to build consensus

INTERNAL & EXTERNAL RELATIONS
Senior Management, Corporate Reporting and Consolidation group
All Divisions’ Controllers, Finance Managers, and Financial Analysts


EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION
BS in Accounting, Masters preferred
CPA or Chartered Accountant
Public accounting or financial reporting experience
EMPLOYEE MANAGEMENT
“N/A”
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; and talk or hear.
The employee frequently is required to stand, walk reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
WORK HOUR REQUIREMENT
Ability to work overtime and weekends as position requires.
Ability to travel up to 25% international and domestic, as required.

The incumbent will be responsible for leading the user business requirement gathering, develop and propose advance technical design solution and review and mentor with other developers and system architects to implement and deploy the solution. This position will work closely with the Engineering community to support a variety of PLM activities.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Facilitates and conduct user requirement sessions with user community to document AS-IS and TO-BE process.
Develops solutions from customer requirements
Develops/document Solution Specification for team members to work from
Works with support team to Investigate and troubleshoot Teamcenter Engineering data to continuously improve the application
Responsible for leading several technical PLM projects with user requirement, development schedules and testing and delivery of the solution to the end customers.
Supports IS Management with developing roadmap, strategy and supporting the governance model.
Works with leadership team to create and enhance vision and strategy for PLM at in the eco system of other Enterprise applications.

15 year’s direct work experience with PLM strategy, roadmap, implementation and support.
Broad hands-on experience with all levels and modules of PLM application from development to release.
Experience in product and engineering processes related to PLM Solution set.
Previous experience as a cross functional team leader with ability to bring disparate IT and business functions to create solutions that enable PLM vision
Experience with Siemens, Teamcenter Engineering Multi-site is preferred

Experience with development tools and processes
Extensive experience with PDM information system infrastructure

Strong leadership skills
Highly motivated individual with the ability to complete tasks with minimal supervision

Ability to collaborate with PLM Business Leadership to manage training and other organization change management activities associated with the rollout of PLM modules
Physical Requirements:
Incumbents may be routinely exposed to equipment operational noise heat-cold-dust, and/or aircraft equipment, parts, or fuel odors.
Incumbents may be required to stand, sit, squat, walk, bend, climb ladders, move, reach, or stretch for prolonged time periods with no restrictions, as required by job duties.
Work in a safe and professional manner while adhering to all regulatory requirements (FAA, OSHA, DOT, EPA, State, and Federal regulations, etc.).
Read, hear, speak, and see with no restrictions, as required by job duties.
Comprehend and adhere to management directions and/or safety instructions with no restrictions.
Effectively communicate in Business English language.
Pull, push, carry, lift, or move items up to 10 lbs. throughout the work shift without assistance, as required by job duties.
Pull, push, carry, lift or move materials/people/items/equipment weighing up to 50lbs or more during the work shift, with the use of Company provided “reach assistance technology” or “movement assist technology” (fork-lifts, pallet jacks, pulleys, dolly’s, robotics reach equipment, people movers etc.), as required by job duties.

The candidate should have 2 to 4 years of public accounting or large company in-house corporate tax experience. The position's salary and title will be commensurate with the individual's experience.

Essential Job Functions:
Prepare federal and state corporate income tax returns, estimates and extensions.
Prepare international tax compliance forms of a U.S. based multinational corporation.
Assist with budgeting and forecasting of key income tax metrics.
Assist with income tax audits.

Scenario planning and modeling to assist with business unit expansion or restructuring initiatives.
Assist with special projects.
Research tax issues and draft memorandum.
Seek out process improvements.

Desire to work in a flexible "team-based" environment.
Drive to get involved in ad-hoc planning projects.

Job Description
FP&A Analyst

Note: In addition to the listed base this position offers a superior base, plus bonus and profit sharing, and is a highly visible role in the FP&A group that also supports Strategy and Risk Management.

Our manufacturing client has retained us to find an energetic and results-driven FP&A Analyst eager to join an established yet rapidly growing, industry-leading company.

The ideal candidate will have a thorough knowledge of financial concepts and possess strategic business acumen which can be leveraged to create value. This position interacts extensively with other functions and thus requires an ability to build and sustain relationships while ensuring business partners are successful in their contributions to cross-functional processes. The candidate should also have enthusiasm for leveraging IT to create tools that are user-friendly and value-added to benefit our expanding business.

Responsibilities:

· Provide forecasting and planning oversight – working with cross-functional teams to validate inputs, drive for consensus, and analyze variances.

· Monitor and synthesize macroeconomic trends and enterprise risk.

· Perform complex analytics and modeling that may include profitability optimization, scenario analysis, cap ex business cases, or product line innovation.

· Leverage IT to improve finance processes and drive value across the organization (Alteryx, Planful, Power BI).

· Compile quarterly BOD decks, strategy decks, leadership updates, and other presentations as needed.

· Provide analytical decision support for cross-functional teams including product management.

· Assist with the annual long range strategic planning and OP&B compilation, reporting, and analysis.

Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree required; MBA, CPA preferred

· Strong record of achievement (GPA, promotions, awards/accolades)

· 3-5 years of experience in Corporate Finance, Investment Banking, Consulting or Private Equity

· Understanding of GAAP required; standard cost accounting a plus

· Strong financial modeling skills including full financial statement output

· Analytical and creative problem-solving skills

· Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills – Mekko Graphics experience preferred
Company Description
Note: In addition to base salary, this position qualifies for a performance bonus and substantial profit sharing and an unusual 401K plan.

The Billing Operations team is responsible for maintaining and reporting all fee related data to internal and external customers. In addition, the team is an escalation point for performance related inquiries, creates ad hoc reports for internal business needs, and reviews existing procedures for process improvement. Adhesion is looking for an individual to join this team as a Data Analyst. This person will have a true love of numbers and puzzles. Daily tasks will focus around fee billing and portfolio performance with a focus on data accuracy and the finer details of mathematical nuances and calculations.

Responsibilities:
Update billing data regularly, coordinating with Sales and Investment Consulting teams for accuracy
Run quarterly fee billing report generation process
Research performance returns for Client Support escalations
Generate and review model returns for outliers and/or anomalies
Enhance fee billing process and reports for new requirements and scalability
Analyze data across Salesforce, NetSuite, SQL, and Access for accuracy, implement audits and procedures
Find trends in billing data and identify indicators of trends
Assist conversion of Access databases to SQL
Support external clients with their fee billing needs
Assist QA with data validations
Skills and Key Attributes:
Excellent Excel skills, beyond the vlookup
Understand portfolio and asset performance return methodologies and calculations
SQL Query, Access SQL View Query, or similar database query knowledge
Understand nuances of file imports/exports across multiple platforms, preferably Salesforce, Jitterbit, NetSuite
Analytical mind with a love of numbers and problem solving
Accuracy oriented, belief that decimal places matter and math is either right or wrong
Thrive on puzzles and challenges analyzing multiple days without losing interest
Education/Experience:
BS or BA required, preferably in an analytical field
3 – 5 years of experience in the financial industry specific to financial reporting such as performance reporting, composite reporting, advisor fee billing
1+ years of experience creating reports utilizing relational databases such as Access and SQL
1+ years of experience supporting, creating, or troubleshooting performance, i.e. composite returns

A Structural Analyst job in Greenville SC is currently available at Belcan. This job is a full-time direct position with benefits. To be considered for this role, you will need Bachelor"s Degree in Aerospace Engineering or equivalent, and five+ years of experience in gas turbine structural analysis. In this job your primary responsibility will be structural finite element analysis for power generation and propulsion gas turbine components. You will report to an FEA Group Leader as a key member of an integrated product team to design/develop, optimize, integrate, deliver, and transition engineering designs to production. Your office will be located in Greenville, SC.

Structural Finite Element Analyst job duties:
Generate and maintain ownership of turbomachinery structural finite element models
Perform plan, model, and results reviews, internally and with the customer
Ensure that models are systematically checked and validated
Perform analysis, evaluate results, and prepare formal reports of the findings
Liaise with heat transfer, fluids, design engineering, drafting, and other teams
Maintain strong communication with the internal project management and with the client
Manage your own project work and oversee teams of junior analysts to achieve project success
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor"s degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering, or equivalent
5+ years of structural finite element non-linear analysis experience using Ansys
Proficiency in understanding technical drawings
Capability to assess the quality and impact of design changes in the context of a larger system
Due to the nature of our work US Citizenship or Permanent Residence is required
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance
Preferred Qualifications:
Master"s degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering, or equivalent
Ten or more years in the aerospace industry
Experience with highly non-linear large deflection structural finite element structural analysis
Additional experience in any of the following is highly preferred: Nastran, Hypermesh/Optistruct, Patran, UGNX, Lsdyna, Femap
If you are interested in this Structural Analyst job opportunity in Greenville, SC please apply via the 'apply now' link provided. As an employee with Belcan Engineering, you will be part of one of the largest engineering firms in the United States. We maintain a small-company atmosphere as well as open communication at all levels of our organization, allowing for much more dynamic decision-making processes. We offer flexible schedules as well as an excellent mentoring system to ensure that you have all of the knowledge and tools you need to meet a diverse range of engineering challenges. You will also have opportunities to advance to positions of greater responsibility, including management roles. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with a competitive compensation package.

Belcan is an equal opportunity employer. EOE/M/F/D/V

Build a challenging and rewarding career with an industry leader!

http://belcan.com/

POSITION DESCRIPTION: The Senior Digital Analyst is responsible for all digital analytics including analyzing on-site and off-site traffic, deriving insights from website performance and digital programs that connect to customer and enterprise insights, creating holistic dashboards for presentation to senior level management, and collaborating with external partners to provide best in class reporting and analytics.


DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible for all digital program reporting and analytics including but not limited to website performance, onsite search, search engine marketing, and social listening.
Analyzes web data and corresponding offline data to monitor website performance (e.g. customer experience, fall out points, customer demographics & trends, etc.).
Develops analysis to discover underperforming areas of the website to identify opportunities to improve site performance.
Produces daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly reports and/or “dashboards” using clickstream analytics, BI tools, Excel, PowerPoint, etc. including but not limited to:
General site health and company-level key performance indicators (KPIs) including site revenue, conversion rate, visits, AOV, orders, bounce rate, etc.
Onsite and offsite search behavior and trends (SEM/PPC, SEO)
Coordinates with internal and external teams the development and full implementation of onsite tags through our tag management solution (TMS) as well as any other tracking parameter implementations.
Participates in website projects as a measurement and analytics expert, identifying data and reporting requirements, creating and managing report implementation, and analyzing post-launch metrics.
Documents new and existing processes while maintaining a continual improvement approach to identify and implement opportunities for improved performance within these processes.
Presents verbal and written results, findings and insights to all levels including the Senior Executive Team.
Fosters the MSC Culture in the department and throughout the company to ensure unity of purpose and fulfillment of MSC’s mission.
Participates in special projects and performs additional duties as required.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or statistics is required. MBA preferred.
Five years business experience including three years working in a web analytics role is required
Experience in advanced web analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing (Test & Target, Google Web Optimizer), competitive analysis, surveys and market research is preferred.
Experience in working with a tag management system such as Tealium, Ensighten, or Adobe DTM is preferred.
SKILLS:

High level of proficiency with web analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics (SiteCatalyst), GA360, or IBM Digital Analytics (Coremetrics) is required.
High level of proficiency with tools for data visualization (e.g., Tableau) and data blending (e.g., Alteryx)
Excellent analytical, planning & prioritization skills are required. Experience developing and executing strategic initiatives for growing digital sales
Proficient with Business Intelligence tools such as SAP Business Objects, Web Intelligence, or Cognos, and writing SQL queries in an online or offline environment.
Proficient in SEM/PPC and SEO strategy and measurement preferred.
Proficient user of the Microsoft Office suite with advanced Excel skills (lookups, pivot tables, advanced formulas, statistical tools).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required, including the ability to clearly and effectively communicate and present analysis findings to internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
Ability to work independently and across multiple business functions.

We are seeking a sales order operations professional who is very experienced in the best practices of order management and the Quote-To-Cash process and can demonstrate significant contributions to work process improvement.

The role will be directly responsible for the daily review and approval of all incoming sales orders and renewal quotes in accordance to the team SLA and company booking and revenue policies.

The Sales Review Analyst will support the sales teams in areas such as review of Quotes to validate pricing and follow-through on account discrepancies. The role requires daily coordination with various teams: Credit, Customer Support/Fulfillment, Billing, Revenue, Sales and Legal.

Key Responsibilities and Tasks:
Review and approve daily incoming sales orders according to the team SLA and company revenue policy, procedures and accounting guidance
Ensure customer or partner credit worthiness
Review accuracy of agreements, signed quotes, purchase order details including terms, customer or partner billing instructions, shipping, product, pricing, discounts
In Salesforce and in Netsuite, ensure order is set-up for prompt and correct provisioning and invoicing with correct billing & shipping contact information, product, subscription dates and revenue recognition and recorded in the correct accounting period
Proactively follow through on orders that are with questions to ensure that these are resolved timely and recorded in the correct period
Provide quotes and assist a high volume key partner
Support the sales teams by review of Sales quotes with accurate assessment of customer’s account and history
Provide and follow-through to completion recommendations to streamline and automate the business process
Prepare excellent desktop work instructions and proactively update these
Track and report on customer account discrepancies and follow-through to resolution
Monitor and distribute incoming Orders to the correct opportunity owner
Research and address partner queries related to order status such as fulfillment and billing
Requirements/Qualifications:
BS/BA degree
At least 3 years directly responsible and outstanding track record in order processing, order management, order approval, fulfillment, revenue and billing
Must know the basics of US GAAP
Has worked in an order management role that is linked to Finance areas such as revenue forecasting, revenue recognition, billing and commissions
Has successfully worked with Sales teams and teammates worldwide to facilitate a smooth quote to cash process
Possesses discipline and time management skills to meet the daily SLA and other related deadlines such as Accounting month-end close
Must have extreme attention to detail, problem solving and research and critical thinking skills to handle all types of deals
Proactive and responsible approach to customer support through excellent communication skills. Thoroughly communicates feedback, solutions and recommendations to teammates, opportunity owners and other teams
Can demonstrate significant contributions to work process improvement
Can work extended hours when work volume requires and in the run-up to month-end and month-end
Experience with using Salesforce, MS Office suite
Experience in SaaS or Software industry is a plus

Thank you for your interest in a position with the AXA Equitable Life Insurance Company (Equitable). The position is an individual contributor role who serves as an influential intermediary between the assigned business clients and the development and other teams in the IT function, and requires a developing knowledge of both environments. This position may work directly on smaller projects or as a team member on larger ones.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Plays an advocacy role on smaller less complex projects for the business clients in all phases of the solution development lifecycle for each of the critical stages, including: initiation, analysis, development, testing, implementation and post implementation follow up.
This position performs important intermediate level analysis and works closely with the business clients to identify core business issues in order to map out possible solutions. The mapping is used to develop the business case for action, defining the need, the method, and the benefits of proposed solutions.
This position undertakes complex analysis to develop the detailed user stories or requirements of the solution in order to satisfy the business need.
This position works closely with Architects and others on the applications development team to refine the solution design, methods and outcomes.
In its capacity as the eyes and ears of the business, this position closely monitors progress to ensure that the emerging solution meets the demands of the user stories or requirements document. This may require the resolution of any conflicts arising due to any technical deviations from the agreed user stories or requirements.
This position works very closely with the testing team, using the user stories or requirements document as a critical guide, to ensure that issues are identified and fully resolved prior to roll out.

Bachelors Degree
4 Years of complex software development concepts and development methods
4 Years hands on application experience of various software development life-cycles and techniques (agile)

Knowledge of business and IT technology practices and trends

Are you the kind of person that isn’t afraid of technology and loves marketing and promoting technology products to businesses? Are you a competitive intelligence ninja? Do you want to play an essential role in go-to-market strategy and execution for the worldwide leader in cloud banking?

Be able to demo the nCino Bank Operating System

POSITION TITLE

Actuarial Analyst

LOCATION

Raleigh, NC

YOUR ROLE

This position reports to the Senior Director of Modeling and Actuarial Services for US Mortgage Insurance and is responsible for providing support to the reserve valuation process. This position will work cross-functionally to help the company determine and understand the US Mortgage Insurance reserve balances. Data analysis is a key part of this role as we strive to understand and explain trends in borrower behavior and the foreclosure process. Additionally, exercising accepted actuarial standards and methodologies is imperative.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Support the actuarial function in valuing reserves for the US mortgage insurance product lines
Apply traditional actuarial reserving techniques to assess reserves
Conduct quarterly loss reserve updates and review results with management
Monitor actuarial model performance and update models regularly
Work with the modeling team to utilize machine learning in the model build process
Produce internal and external communications to inform the business about trends in delinquent loans and claims that will support reserve changes
Create and review documentation procedures and policy documents that ensure transparent and cohesive reserving process
Incorporate and share best practices regarding reserving models, techniques, and research with other functions within Genworth
Respond to questions from senior leadership, auditors, consultants, and other interested parties in regard to reserves
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors degree in actuarial science, statistics, or a related field
2+ years in actuarial, finance, or risk functions
3+ actuarial exams; commitment to learning casualty actuarial principles by actively pursuing CAS actuarial exams and making regular progress in completing them; USMI will provide support for those pursuing actuarial certifications
Proficient ability to analyze data and develop recommendations
Attention to detail in a fast-paced environment; the ability to manage multiple priorities
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Highly collaborative both within the team and with other departments
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and Power Point)
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS
Experience and interest in property and casualty loss reserving process
Experience with actuarial science, statistics, predictive modeling, and machine learning techniques
Computer programming knowledge (such as SAS, VBA, or other programming language)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to work independently and without close supervision on multiple projects simultaneously, anticipate necessary effort and difficulty and adhere to mutually-agreed upon schedules
WHY WORK AT GENWORTH
We have a real impact on the lives of the people we serve
We work on challenging and rewarding projects
We give back to the communities where we live

Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Account options beginning your first day

40 hours of volunteer time off
401K Account with matching contributions

RGP is a global consulting firm helping some of the most recognized companies in the world work differently. Our success comes from a shared belief in rolling up our sleeves and doing the hard work of solving complex challenges, executing plans and implementing technology to help transform organizations.

Working as a consultant you will be connected to work that matters, putting your expertise to its best use while developing skills for the future. The result is a career defined by you, supported by RGP and built on tangible accomplishments.

As we continue to grow and deepen our impact on organizations around the world, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, there are a few things you should know:
We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them.
We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth-minded.
We care how work gets accomplished and are deeply invested in the success of our clients and our colleagues.
If this sounds like you, we invite you to read on and learn more.
THE RGP CONSULTING EXPERIENCE
RGP has a unique consulting model that provides opportunities for consultants to work in different ways. Most consultants work in a model where they have the flexibility and autonomy to choose projects aligning to their experience, skills and desired lifestyle. Other opportunities exist in team-based, strategy and solutions work. In all models, you will feel the full support of RGP to assist you in your work and guide you on your chosen path.
PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
As a Finance Analyst, you will play an instrumental role in assisting clients in a variety of challenging projects and reviewing complex financial data to help drive strategic decision making.

ATTRIBUTES OF CONSULTANTS WITH RGP
Respect for people and opinions and confidently offer your point-of-view with clients and among colleagues
A drive for proactively cultivating relationships with clients and colleagues
Optimism when faced with challenges and complex situations, coupled with the drive to solve client issues
Dedication to continuous improvement and development of your skillset and talents
A strong personal identification with RGPs values loyalty, integrity, focus, enthusiasm, accountability and talent
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE
Compile and analyze annual operating plans, monthly forecasts, and monthly business performance
Analyze data, develop reporting, and provide recommendations to management, including; cost reduction measures, revenue generation ideas and ways to streamline operations or increase customer satisfaction, executes value added analysis and provides decision support for special projects and initiatives
Prepare in-depth financial and business analyses, including; product profitability, expense management, capital projects, and working capital, and assist in the preparation of financial forecasts and budgets
Prepare financial modeling related to growth, productivity and other strategic initiatives and in partnership with other key stakeholders, develop and deploy BI / decision support tools and technologies that enhance the depth, breadth, speed and efficiency of the decision support capabilities
Perform tasks in support of monthly closing and forecasting processes


DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
Bachelors Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field required
MBA preferred
7-plus years of Financial Analysis experience
Advanced technical skills including MS Excel with proficiency in creating pivot tables and V/H lookups and exposure to macros
Excellent communication and facilitation skills to build relationships and foster trust at all organizational levels
Strong orientation to client service, time management, and project delivery
Equal Opportunity Employer
RGP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or veteran status, and encourage all applicants to apply.
Competitors: Deloitte, Huron Consulting Group, Point B

Designs, delivers, communicates, monitors and/or administers broad-based or executive compensation programs and practices, including job attributes, pay structure, incentive plans, annual rewards and other compensation related programs. Develops and implements strategies for delivery of compensation to ensure competitiveness, appropriate linkages between pay and performance, and compliance with legal and regulatory requirements. Consults with Human Resources Business Partners and the business regarding ongoing compensation management, job evaluation, program/plan design, and other compensation related topics. Ensures the effectiveness of compensation policies, procedures, and controls. Leverages a process improvement mindset to recommend efficient and effective ways to carry out core responsibilities.

Evaluates jobs to determine salary grade, FLSA status and other job attributes and may present findings to managers. Participates in compensation surveys and leverages results. Analyzes incumbent and market data and presents conclusions. Analyzes and maintains data and draws conclusions in support of Compensation administration and projects. Works closely with Compensation Managers and Consultants to produce Compensation related reports, analyses, and insightful presentations. May manage Compensation projects or programs. Experienced professional contributor. Applies a solid understanding of concepts within own professional discipline. Should demonstrate the application of business and industry knowledge, understanding of key processes and practical experience, when creating work products. Solves routine problems of moderate complexity by analyzing possible solutions using experience, judgment and precedents. Operates in ambiguous circumstances and proactively seeks clarification as needed. Actively participates in projects, including planning and execution activities; may be responsible for project workstream from start to finish. Provides informal guidance to new teammates. Works under moderate supervision.

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent and 3 years of professional experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
At least 2 years of demonstrated experience using principles, practices, theories, and/or methodologies associated with the Human Resources discipline. Ability to manage competing priorities. Ability to solve problems by analyzing possible solutions using experience, judgment and precedents. Ability to communicate complex information in a straightforward manner as appropriate for the intended audience. Analytical experience working with Excel, Access or other databases. Intermediate skills in MS Office software.

Preferred Requirements:
4 years of experience as a compensation professional. Project management experience. Experience working with HRIS systems and Market Data tools. Experience working in a matrixed environment.

OR. To view qualifying educational requirements and/or combination of education and specialized experience click on the following link: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0500/budget-analysisseries-0560/

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (KSAs): Your qualifications will be evaluated on the basis of your level of knowledge, skills, abilities and/or competencies in the following areas:

Ability to analyze and evaluate program effectiveness problems, trends, and significant program accomplishments.
Skill in preparing written forms, schedules, and reports related to the obligation and expenditures of funds.
PART-TIME OR UNPAID EXPERIENCE: Credit will be given for appropriate unpaid and or part-time work. You must clearly identify the duties and responsibilities in each position held and the total number of hours per week.

VOLUNTEER WORK EXPERIENCE: Refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service Programs (i.e., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student and social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge and skills that can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Position Description:

This Demand Planning Analyst position is responsible for all forecasting and demand planning activities associated across sales channels and products. The Demand Planning Analyst creates and maintains demand plans by taking statistical forecasts and incorporating business intelligence and forecast information gathered from internal and external sources.
The Demand Planning Analyst is the highly visible interface to sales, marketing, pricing, procurement, supply chain, category management and finance. This position leads monthly dialogue with key counterparts in these departments and provides input to business plans.

Primary Responsibilities:

Basic Functions:
Basic and advanced time-series forecast modeling.
Develop demand plans at multiple levels of item, location and time horizons.
Collaboratively work with sales, marketing, pricing, procurement, supply chain, category management and finance to:
Ensure that current and accurate business assumptions are included
Research demand drivers and evaluate the impact on demand plan
Research and reconcile significant demand plan variances
Refine the demand plan to reflect assumptions from collaborators
Provide input to Supply Planning team in developing inventory strategies on existing items, new products introductions, and product phase-outs.
Use and maintain Demand Planning tool parameters and assumptions.
Job Functions:
Create, execute and aggregate statistical forecasts at multiple levels
Gather, analyze and validate data
Review resulting statistical forecast models
Identify root causes and drivers to improve forecasts
Review demand drivers including sales, financial and marketing plans:
Present, solicit, and assess feedback from key stakeholders
Review promotional plans with sales
Review marketing plans with marketing
Review pricing adjustments with pricing
Review assortment changes with category management
Facilitate collaborative planning process with stakeholders to reach consensus:
Prepare relevant material to facilitate research and discussion
Lead demand plan review meetings with stakeholders
Manage demand planning/vendor meetings
Recommend adjustments for operational forecasts
Enter and modify data and ensure the correctness of product hierarchy
Monitor monthly trends in forecast error and identify drivers
Identify relevant market-related data and competitive intelligence
Prepare and maintain reports to support demand planning process
Key Results:
Monthly demand plan which incorporates current market information that allows the company to predict customer demand and provide its supply chain with the appropriate information to plan how to meet that customer demand.
Relationships with sales, marketing, pricing, procurement, supply chain, category management and finance to facilitate knowledge sharing.
Feedback to the supply chain team around opportunities and risks regarding customer replenishment approaches and goals.
Demand plan input to annual and quarterly financial/ business plans.
Continually improved systems, tools and methods to improve forecasts.
Key Partners (Positions):
Stakeholders in the Executive Sales & Operations planning process (SVP or EVP level)
Subject matter experts including but not limited to sales, marketing, pricing, procurement, supply chain, category management and finance personnel
Cross-functional team members including but not limited to sales, marketing, pricing, procurement, supply chain, category management and finance personnel
Strategy, business development and transformation team members
Senior Executive team
Experience(s) that Best Prepares You:
Education: Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or university required: MBA or other advanced degree preferred.
Experience: Prior experience in forecasting is highly desirable with minimum 3-4 years of post-MBA experience. APICS or other forecasting Certification preferred
Key Competencies:
Expert level of proficiency in Time-Series Forecasting.
Knowledge of Demand Planning software (e.g. ToolsGroup, Kinaxis Logility) preferred.
Understanding of financial and operational impacts of forecasts and uncertainty.
Ability to solve new problems through problem structuring, analytics and approach
Knowledge of Tableau, Alteryx or other data mining/ analytical software is preferred.
Excellent analytical, organizational, decision making skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group from subject matter experts to executives.
Meeting leadership/ facilitation and presentation skills required.
Expert level proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access).
Team and people management including ability to lead and work in teams.
Proactive with the ability to work effectively under tight timelines.
Be accountable for results: Assume full responsibility for the consequences of one’s behaviors and decisions.
Physical Demands/Work Environment/Travel Requirements:
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk, hear, taste and/or smell; the employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
Work Environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Travel Required: Minimal.

Job Description:
Sealed Air partners with customers to solve their most critical packaging challenges with innovative solutions that leave our world, environment, and communities better than we found them. Our portfolio of widely recognized brands includes Cryovac® food packaging and Bubble Wrap® protective packaging which respectively enable a safer, more efficient food supply chain and protect valuable goods shipped around the world. Sealed Air generated $4.7 billion in sales in 2018 and has approximately 15,500 employees who serve customers in 123 countries. To learn more, visit www.sealedair.com.
Summary
The Senior Accounts Payable / Accounts Receivable Analyst (Sr. AP/AR Analyst) is responsible for several AP / AR transactional processes for the North America region of Sealed Air. In addition to operational execution, the Senior Analyst will be responsible for assessing relevant processes and identifying improvement needs while partnering with internal stakeholders as well as 3rd party outsourced services providers.
This position is within our Global Business Services group and reports directly to the Director AP/AR Americas. The role is based at the global headquarters in Charlotte, NC.
Responsibilities
• Execute monthly Accounts Receivable Securitization analysis and related journal entries
• Manage incoming cash receipts process and related accounting
• Participate / lead process improvement task forces related to acquired business units
• Serve as backup for Travel and Entertainment related processes (within Concur)
• Partner and build relationships with outsourced 3rd party to drive change and results in a collaborative environment
• Strengthen controls and compliance surrounding the AP/AR processes via improved reconciliation processes as well as detailed account balance reviews
• Develop and enhance methodologies and procedures for process management in the spirit of continuous improvement
Qualifications
• Solid multi-year experience of Accounts Payable processes (5 - 8 years+)
• Accounting or Finance degree
• Transactional level SAP experience related to AP/AR/GL
• Previous experience managing AP/AR/GL processes in a Shared Services environment
• Experience with T&E Processes utilizing Concur or similar systems
• Direct experience with internal controls and compliance
• Willingness to travel (expected frequency quarterly)

ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
• Experience managing customer and vendor related processes and implications on accounting
• Ability to understand complex operational issues and clearly articulate improvement ideas
• Strong analytical abilities to identify issues and self-start initiatives to address
• Ability to communicate & liaise broadly across functions and global organizations

Description:
Overview: Analyzes company functions, processes, and activities to improve computer-based business applications for the most effective use of money, materials, equipment, and people. Typical Functions: Utilizes available computer systems resources and personnel to carry out analysis to support management's quest for performance improvement. Reviews and analyzes information, forecasts, methods, schedules, systems, processes, and procedures. Determines most useful business solutions for the company. Recommends alternative solutions to management as to courses of action that best meet the organization's goals. Performs duties concerned with the design and improvement of computer-based business systems. Works closely with senior managers to identify and solve a variety of computer-based business system problems. Analyzes requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing business systems. Confers with personnel of organizational units involved to analyze current operational procedures and identify problems. Solicits from management symptoms of problem, formally defines the problem, breaks problem into component parts, and gathers information about each of these parts from a variety of sources. Selects the most appropriate analytical technique. Utilizes several study techniques including simulation, linear and nonlinear programming, dynamic programming, queuing and other stochastic-process models, Markov decision processes, econometric methods, data envelopment analysis, neural networks, expert systems, decision analysis, and the analytic hierarchy process. Writes description of business needs, business program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer-based business systems. Reviews computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to determine if requested program or program change is possible within existing system. Studies existing computer-based business systems to evaluate effectiveness, and develops new systems to improve production or workflow as required. 6-9 years experience.

Job Description:
Job Description
CREO has an opening for an IT Business Analyst (BA) to help support our clients in creating process flows, developing requirements and user stories, evaluating solutions against requirements, assisting in application configuration, developing test scenarios, planning end user communications, and preparing other documentation.

What You’ll Do
For your first assignment, you will support one of our clients in implementing a new quoting system. In this role, you will work onsite in RTP, NC to support the client’s Project Manager and functional teams. You will be an integral part of the team making this project a success. You will have an opportunity to gain detailed knowledge of how the client’s sales team functions and then you'll provide insights to increase the team’s efficiency and effectiveness.

About You
For this assignment, you will need direct experience with pricing, order management, distribution, and channel management.

To be a great fit for this and other CREO opportunities, you should be detail-oriented, technically savvy, have an analytical mind, and demonstrate strong writing and communication skills. You should identify with CREO's core values (https://www.creoinc.net/careers), think creatively, process information quickly, build trusting relationships, and enjoy working in dynamic environments. If this sounds like you, keep reading!

Responsibilities:
Interface and collaborate with project team members, including clients, to coordinate the completion of assigned project activities.
Create detailed current state process flows and future state optimized flows using diagramming software (such as Visio or Lucidcharts).
Interview key stakeholders, facilitate workshops, and use other techniques to gather and document user and technical requirements.
Utilize structured methodologies to evaluate products against requirements.
Create spreadsheets to evaluate scenarios, compare costs, project ROI, and provide insights for key stakeholders.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Willingness to travel to client locations as needed (will vary based on engagements, estimated at less than ~40%).
Direct experience with pricing, order management, distribution, and channel management.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate the problem and solution to different audiences (both technical & non-technical).
Strong desire and flexibility to learn new technology, tools, subject-matter areas and context.
Attention to detail and ability to adhere to processes/procedures.
Experienced with Microsoft products (specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).
These qualifications are a plus:
Experience in regulated environments (particularly Life Sciences or Federal agencies) or manufacturing
Experience working with international organizations supporting merger and acquisition activities
Direct experience with one of the leading CPQ solutions such as Model N, Salesforce CPQ, or Oracle CPQ.
Master's Degree
Certifications in Six Sigma, ITIL, and Agile
About CREO

CREO, Inc. is an innovative management consulting and advisory firm based in Research Triangle Park. CREO helps its clients operate effectively, freeing them to apply their talents, pursue their mission, and realize their vision through a focus on effective operations and organizational health. CREO’s senior team of C-level advisors works shoulder-to-shoulder with clients to solve their toughest challenges and realize their biggest opportunities. To learn more, visit www.creoinc.net

The Senior Financial Analyst, Income Tax will report to the Senior Director, Income Tax and will be responsible for complex tax compliance, tax accounting and tax forecasting.

Accountabilities will be multi-dimensional and will range from forecasting, accounting, compliance, and dispute resolution across all entities included in the consolidated federal income tax return and state compliance obligations across all jurisdictions.

Principle Duties & Responsibilities:
Prepare pro forma federal returns and consolidated federal income tax return.
Provide assistance with federal and state tax credits.
Prepare Forms FinCen 114 and Forms 1042.
Maintain W-8s.
Prepare Forms 1120F.
Prepare Forms 5472, 5471, and 8858.
Prepare earnings and profit calculations.
Prepare forecasts and provisions and associated accounting entries for domestic and or foreign entities.
Prepare separate company financial statements.
Prepare stand-alone and combined state income tax returns and related apportionment calculations.
Prepare responses to state notices.
Prepare other state and local reports and returns.
Prepare federal and state estimates and extensions.
Prepare Federal Form 1120-POL.
Prepare monthly tax forecasts and cash tax analysis.
Prepare quarterly analysis of deferred tax assets and liabilities.
Prepare cash tax analysis of payments and refunds.
Prepare quarterly analysis of federal and state income tax reserves and associated accounting entries.
Assist with federal and state income tax audits and special projects.
Perform regular recurring record retention requirements.
Responsible for performing internal controls related to SOX Compliance.
Prepare reports required for Controlled Foreign Reporting and Country by Country Reporting.
Continuously look for opportunities to streamline existing processes to promote organizational and operational efficiencies.
Monitor federal and state tax law changes and provide insight as to impact for all legal entities.

Working Title:
Technology Support Analyst ? Journey

Job Summary:
This position will provide Tier 1 and 2 (intermediate) support for Audio Visual (AV) technology used in general classrooms, teaching labs, conference rooms, and other instructional spaces. Typical systems include control systems, matrix switchers, audio amplifiers, audio mixers, LCD or Projectors, plasma/ LCD monitors, interactive touch displays, computer workstations, streaming media, and SIP/Web video conferencing systems. This includes support calls, diagnostic testing, evaluation and repair of equipment, inventory control, preventative maintenance, and general maintenance such as lamp replacement. This position also serves as the primary contact for providing and scheduling professional level audiovisual support for academic, clinical, and administrative meetings, which may occur during, after-hours, and weekends. Collaborates with the Central Reservation Office and other faculty and staff on events as needed. This position will support instructional workstations, this includes diagnosing and resolving software and hardware incidents including issues involving operating systems (e.g., Windows and Mac) and software applications. This position will provide recommendations on future hardware and desktop solutions and maintain an inventory of desktops and assist with the replacement schedule of the desktops. This position will collaborate with ITCS internal teams to ensure computer systems meet university security standards. This will involve making sure policies and procedures are updated and located in the approved departmental location. This position will assist with inventory control and maintaining equipment stored in all Classroom Technologies Team controlled areas. This position will ensure the receiving, warehousing, and distribution of hardware purchased for the Classroom Technologies Team location. This position will assist with the organization of all storage spaces and ensure efficient space utilization. This position will assist in keeping equipment used for maintenance and operation in stock and ensure that there is adequate equipment available in the event of equipment failure in supported rooms. This position will maintain and adhere to environmental health and safety standards. This position will stay abreast of current classroom technology and cooperate with other members of the Classroom Technologies Team to develop training and reference materials for hardware and software used for instruction in classrooms. This includes print & electronic reference materials, group, and one-on-one training. The candidate of choice has to adjust their standard work schedule to meet the requirements of their position, which includes and not limited to evening and weekend hours to perform scheduled and unscheduled workload requirements to maintain University operations.

Minimum Qualifications:
Associate's degree in Computer Information Technology, Computer Technology Integration, Networking Technology, or related area and one year of experience in the information technology field related to the position's role; or Bachelor's degree from an appropriately accredited institution and one year experience in the information technology field related to the position's role; or Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, math or engineering or related technical degree from an appropriately accredited institution; or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Journey level requires an additional one year of experience.

The budget Analyst assists in maintaining the operating budget of the Facilities Division at NC State University. This position reports to the Facilities Budget Manager for the Facilities Division and manages one of the largest operating budgets in the University domain. *Primary duties of the budget analyst include, but are not limited to:* * Providing leadership, oversight, and support in the execution of the budget to agency head and/or division management. * Examine budgets and expenditures for compliance with applicable state budget rules, legislative intent as well as federal and state laws. * Providing consultation, technical assistance, and coordination in the preparation and execution of the continuation, operating and expansion budgets which may utilize multiple funding sources. * Completing or evaluating methodologies used in the preparation of budget or program spending forecasts and provide technical assistance to improve the accuracy of projections.

Bachelor's Degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, Accounting, or related discipline; or equivalent combination of training and experience. All degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions.

Significant experience in finance and business. * Advanced skill in business oriented software applications, such as Microsoft Excel. Job Title: SAP SD MM Business Analyst (Supply Chain)
Job Description:
World leader in the field
of in vitro diagnostics for over 55 years, bioMérieux
conceives, develops, produces and markets diagnostics solutions (systems,
reagents, software and services) intended for clinical and industrial
applications, which determine the origin of a disease or a contamination to
improve the health of patients and insure consumer safety.

bioMérieux
is present in 43 countries and services more than 160 countries with the
support of a large network of distributors. Its corporate headquarters are
located in Marcy l’Etoile, near Lyon, in France.

Joining
bioMérieux, is choosing to join an innovative company with a long term vision,
committed to the service of public health and carried out with a humanistic
corporate culture.

We
look for candidates whose motivation is to invest in themselves, in the
projects of the future, and to participate in a collective adventure led by a
pioneering spirit.

We
have the commitment to offer our collaborators a working environment which
encourages team spirit, with priority given to training and development with
international career opportunities.

Our
Group offers numerous possibilities: so come and join the 11,200 bioMérieux
employees who have already identified with these values!

SAP
SD MM Business Analyst (Supply Chain)

The Information Systems
department at bioMerieux is a Global organization with a Regional presence in
France, US and China along with our Managed Services Partners in India. The IS
team is very well integrated with the business organization and collaborating
with them to bring digital innovation to life, deliver transformations on Core
platforms as well as ensure operational efficiency.

Within the IS Supply
Chain and Manufacturing team, you will be expected to deliver on solving
operational issues using ITIL processes, enhancements, and on request
participating on projects . You will work closely with your Manufacturing
and Supply chain business counterparts to understand their requirements and
deliver results by defining, implementing and maintaining the information
systems. You will need to work with both traditional waterfall as well as
Agile methodology depending on the nature and positioning of the project. We
also operate in delivering minimum viable products (MVP) and then to progressively
build on them in an iterative manner.

You will be based in
Durham, NC and will have opportunities to work on all related modules of SAP,
SAP Cloud Platform, SAP Leonardo, APS, EDI and SaaS solutions. You will engage
in Technology watch activities to propose innovative and best in class solutions
for BioMerieux.
Main Accountabilities:
Assist in the support and maintenance service
manager (Run) in resolving complex incidents and in the implementation of
enhancement on our various platforms. For the Americas region, this
represents at least 50& of the role.
Provide input to manufacturing operational (SAP,
MES) and transformation teams (digitalization, Industry 4.0, IT/OT roadmap)
Participate in supply chain and manufacturing
and warehousing pre-project studies in:
Order Entry, Demand & Planning, Customer
Promise, Transport & Distribution, Equipment & Spare Parts and
warehouse mgmt..
To propose innovative solutions meeting the
needs of Business in a context of strong digital transformation
To contribute to the success of projects (Build)
of international / regional dimension as a solution consultant
Functional/technical specifications,
configuration, testing, UAT and start support
Contribute to regional and global projects by
providing solutions and configuration, authoring functional/technical
specifications and testing services
Contribute to techwatch
and propose best-in-class technological solutions to improve bioMérieux's
logistics operations (RFID, IIoT, Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, SaaS) in
fail-fast mode.

Required
profile:
Bachelor’s degree with 5 years or 10 years experience
in lieu of degree in Computer Science or Logistics/Supply chain
3 - 7 years of experience in an industrial or
consulting company;
Good knowledge of logistics, manufacturing and
warehousing processes with experience as a functional consultant and
/ or profession of the domain
Expertise on SAP LE SD MM PP and/or WM HUM and are
comfortable with best-of-breed SaaS solutions;
Autonomous, you have an appetite for digital
technologies, innovation and cultural transformation;
Good written and verbal communication skills and
ability to present
Experience in a highly regulated industrial
environment is a plus;
Proficient use of oral and written English – French
speaking ability a plus
Business travel up to 10" can be expected including
international travel.

Action Employer. M/F/Vet/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/GINA

troubleshooting experience using analytical tools

This role will involve work with developing and maintaining the Program Standards, Procedures, Processes and Tools.

Responsibilities
Perform quality assurance (QA) reviews and validation reviews of CIP-related implementations (processes, procedures, internal controls) and associated evidence to ensure compliance with the companys NERC CIP cybersecurity policy and with the NERC CIP Standards
Develop interpretations of new CIP Standards using a variety of inputs such as regulatory guidance and industry benchmarking to produce unambiguous descriptions of compliance obligations for internal stakeholders to use as guidance for implementations
Develop modifications to the NERC CIP cybersecurity policy that are triggered by: new and/or changing NERC Standards, newly published guidance from the regulators, and by internal requests for improvements

Perform training, change management, and communication support for CIP implementations and ongoing compliance activities
Influence new standard development through industry and regulator engagement

Experience with large programs and efforts, particularly with Agile method experience
Understanding of basic principles of power system protection theory, practices, and application

Government Auditing Professional Certification (CGAP), NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) Foundation, etc.

Experience working effectively in a matrixed organization
Ability to communicate clearly, concisely and accurately with peers, customers, team members, and leadership verbally and in writing
Ability to conduct challenging conversations in a tactful, professional manner

Job Description
BCforward is seeking a highly motivated and experienced IT Analyst role inCharlotte NC 28217

Title: IT Analyst

Expected contract duration: 12 months

Location: Charlotte NC 28217

Description:

· Researches, designs, develops operates and maintains support services for existing and new business applications and/or information systems solutions through integration of technical and business requirements per standard IT process methodology (such as ITIL and ITSM).

· Includes identification, development and prioritization of support services according to business criticality.

· Applications and information systems solutions include both 3rd party software and internally developed applications and infrastructure.

· Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, analysis of business requirements, configuration of 3rd party software implementation of infrastructure solutions, creation of documentation, testing and maintenance of applications, and support and maintenance of infrastructure and information systems.

· Works within the Information Technology function, obtaining resources and working in support of objectives and strategies.

· Participates in architecture reviews to ensure that solutions comply with standards and uses approved technologies.

· Typical customers are end users and various functional areas such as Supply Chain, Research and Development, Marketing, Finance, a business, or the company.

· Intermediate: Ability to apply intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems/projects of moderately complex scope. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action.

· Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input.

· Follows established guidelines and interprets policies.

· Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

· Experience with infrastructure environments (e.g. operating system, hardware, data center, security, network, voice, end user and server / web related applications).

· Experience with business IT applications (e.g. supply chain, customer relationship mgmt., HR, finance) .

· Basic skills in scripting and / or programming language.

· Knowledge and experience with Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) reference model.

Education: Associates Degree or equivalent experience.

Experience: 2 to 4 years.

Job Title: Data Analyst- Metrics and Reporting Analyst
Job Description:
JOB DUTIES:
SQL-equivalent Reporting and Metrics Analyst to leverage their business and technical knowledge to assist the Project Lead in understanding business strategy and objectives, gather information, and ensure business requirements are being fulfilled throughout the entire data & analytics life cycle.
The Reporting and Metrics Analyst should be passionate about diving into data as a mechanism to deeply understand a business, be customer-service oriented, be skilled in delivering insights to others, and be able to envision the informational needs of different audiences and design reports that deliver empirically and visually.
A successful candidate will:
Be motivated to understand, identify, and analyze data from multiple sources.
Have excellent communication skills, statistical, and organizational skills.
Be able to translate data into visually pleasing, easy to use charts that can be presented to senior leadership in presentation materials.
Be able to create charts with easy to follow drill down detail.
Be able to adapt quickly in handling multiple and re-prioritized deadlines and project goals.
MUST HAVE SKILLS:
Ability to navigate and write SQL statements against a transactional schema.
Ability to write SQL statements with moderately complex calculations, joins, grouping.
Experience using data visualization and dashboard tools like Chart.io, Tableau.
Preferably already proficient in Power BI and Microsoft Excel, as well as familiar with standard basic operational business concepts.
Experience with custom report creation and reporting analytics.
Ability to slice and dice data to provide insight across multiple dimensions for varying operational teams.
Ability to use advanced Excel features like pivot tables and lookups.
Experience in data visualization & using data to tell a story.
Knowledge of how to clean and link complicated data sets from various sources.
Strong attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment.
Self-motivated with ability to manage multiple competing priorities.
Ability to interpret customer questions into actionable analytics.
Google Suites, particularly Google Sheets & Google Forms.
Ability to establish and maintain strong working relationships.
EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree with a focus on finance, economics, statistics, analytics, information systems, business management, program management, or another related field.
Ability to manage multiple assignments. Superior written and oral communication skills. 6-10+ years of experience.
