You will leverage your strong geospatial skills and collaborate with experts in various disciplines\. If you're up for the challenge, we've been looking for someone just like you\. * Strong understanding of map projections and data transformationsExperience setting up field teams for mobile data collection using Collector, Survey123 and GPS equipment\.





* Experience creating, publishing, and managing map services\.





* Experience with Python a plus\.





* Travel - 25%

Job Description
Our client is seeking a SharePoint Analyst to work at their location in Morrisville, NC. This is a contract to hire position.

The SharePoint Analyst is responsible for supporting SharePoint on premise system – including business user support, business analysis for new functionality and maintaining existing farms (Development, Testing and Production). In addition, this role is responsible for full development life cycle for new SharePoint functionality – including gathering requirements, documenting solution, developing and testing solution, assisting business users with testing, installation, user support and ongoing maintenance. The SharePoint Analyst will also support the future analysis of content management and collaboration in the cloud.

Position Responsibilities / Accountabilities:
Analyze needs of functions and departments with respect to systems initiatives and issues
Gather, compile, and interpret information regarding business changes, summarize and recommend appropriate course of action, then implement approved solutions
Translate business requirements into appropriate system development form and write supporting technical documentation
Assist with installation, configuration, and maintenance of SharePoint software applications
Provide technical support, training, and documentation as needed for end users
Requirements:
Ability to interface with senior business decision-makers in a professional manner to understand their requirements and analyze these requirements in order to plan, execute, and manage the delivery of SharePoint solutions.
Support business users at all levels of the organization using existing SharePoint content/solutions.
Excellent written, verbal, interpersonal and collaboration skills
Well organized and detail oriented with strong customer service focus
Ability to manage many concurrent projects and user requests.
Understanding of best practices and practical experience of SharePoint architecture, content management, business processes, collaboration and security.
Develop and maintain LVB SharePoint content taxonomy – site columns, content types, libraries/lists.
Develop and maintain custom business process workflows and forms, preferably Nintex
Develop and maintain business system integrations using External Content Types, custom C# web services to SQL Server databases.
Install, configure and maintain 3rd Party SharePoint Add-Ons.
Develop and maintain client-side development utilizing JQuery, JavaScript, XML, CSS, HTML, AJAX, CAML.
Manage SharePoint security through farm, site and list permissions
Analyze, troubleshoot and solve SharePoint issues using Central Administration, IIS, ULS logs and PowerShell for SharePoint.
Knowledge of SharePoint features such as Excel Services, User Profile Service, BCS, eDiscovery, Search management, Information Retention Policies
Five (5) years of experience in SharePoint administration and/or SharePoint development
Three (3) years of experience working with end users, providing technical information, support, and customer service
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business, or equivalent business experience required
SharePoint certification a plus
Unusual working conditions / hours – Occasional after-hours installations of new solutions.

Job Title: Senior Project Analyst / Sr. Business Analyst
Job Description:
The IT Quality Assurance & Analysis Team of Laboratory Corporation of America (Labcorp) has an opportunity for a talented Project Analyst to join a motivated and productive team in delivering enterprise-level solutions. The ideal candidate has successful experience defining software systems and supporting teams throughout the project lifecycle. Our team is dynamic and growing so there is opportunity to be involved in all areas of the system development life cycle and have exposure to full project lifecycle including development methods.
*Responsibilities:**
+ Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions

+ Develop clear, concise and testable User Stories, Use Cases, and workflow analysis

+ Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs

+ Proactively communicate and collaborate with internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver functional requirements, use cases, user stories, and user interface designs.

+ Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans

+ Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow

+ Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams, support teams, and business partners/vendors

+ Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs

+ Proactively communicate and collaborate with external customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver functional requirements

+ Provide input into Test Plan creation and support test plan validation as required for QA.

+ Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
*Expected Background**
+ Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a technical, business, or healthcare discipline

+ 5-10 years practical experience in a Business or Systems Analyst role supporting both Waterfall and Agile SDLC.

+ In-depth knowledge of Agile techniques, theory and practices.

+ Ability to write, clear, concise and testable User Stories, Use Cases, and workflow analysis

+ Experience with JIRA and Confluence

+ Experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies required

+ Understanding of enterprise application development, from understanding underlying database design to developing for multi-tier Web applications

+ Ability to analyze complex administrative processes and computer systems, identify problems, develop logical conclusions, and implement effective solutions

+ Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists

+ Ability to reduce abstract ideas to easily understood procedures

+ Must be able to work independently in the absence of supervision

+ Ability to be highly organized, motivated, flexible, and a team player
*Requirements**
License/Certification/Education: Normally requires a B.S. Degree in Computer Science w/7+ years of experience.
*Shift**
1
*Schedule**
8am-5pm

At Collins Aerospace, we're dedicated to relentlessly tackle the toughest challenges in our industry - all to redefine aerospace.

Created in 2018 through the combination of two leading companies- Rockwell Collins and United Technologies Aerospace Systems - we're driving the industry forward through technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for global aerospace and defense. Every day we imagine ways to make the skies and the spaces we touch smarter, safer and more amazing than ever. Together we chart new journeys, reunite families, protect nations and save lives. And we do it all with some of the greatest talent this industry has to offer.

We are Collins Aerospace and we hope you join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE.

The next chapter of our future as an aerospace company is here, and we are excited about what this means for our employees and customers! Get onboard the Collins Aerospace Operations team and play a part in managing our innovative products from inception to delivery. The Operations team continues to grow and aims to strengthen the connection of Manufacturing Operations, Supply Chain and Environment, Health & Safety (EH&S) across Collins Aerospace. In this dynamic environment , you will have the opportunity to network across our businesses and functions, all while improving the productivity, quality and efficiency of our operations worldwide.

Role Overview

This position is for an experienced professional with deep knowledge and highly developed technical expertise who leads in the supply and demand planning process, and is responsible for making significant improvements of processes, systems, and products to enhance performance of work area and team. Works with internal and external team leaders to develop financial forecasts.

Primary Responsibilities:

+ Leads in the development of strategies for materials planning and SIOP.

+ Spearheads the development of standardized processes within materials planning and SIOP in order to optimize the utilization of business resources and meet customer expectations for delivery.

+ Leads in the development of indicators that enable visibility to short and long-term market trends and demand.

+ Analyzes identified demand streams and leads in the establishment of data relationship linkages.

+ Collaborates with product development leaders and sales and marketing team leaders to develop demand forecasts.

+ Leads in the planning of capacity and fulfillment demand with plant manufacturing operations.

+ Facilitates with manufacturing team leaders andleads in the development of monthly production volume planning using the business forecast, inventory position, actual customer orders, and the defined capacity parameters.

+ Analyzes and leads in the development of new technologies to improve materials planning and SIOP capability, sustainability, and reliability.

+ Spearheads tracking of appropriate metrics to drive results and continuous improvement.

+ Leads in the development of processes and plans to improve supply capabilities.

+ Guides in establishing clear and robust metrics to measure progress through process improvements for SIOP.

+ Creates and executes plan for every part and maintain master data for purchased parts, sub-assemblies, end items and other parts as required.

+ Facilitates the capacity management process, including identification and escalation of long term capacity gaps to ensure successful execution of customer demands in support of SI&OP.

+ Executescontinuous management of the master demand schedule, including adherence to all required validations using the best information available, in order to provide long range OE and aftermarket demand visibility in support of financial planning, internal and external capacity management, and the overall SI&OP process.

+ Monitors the transportation and delivery of inter/intraplant parts and outbound finished products.

+ Tracks and manages inter/intraplant work in process (WIP), promise dating, expedite orders to ensure on-time delivery and flow.

+ May oversee command center and drive part shortage resolution.

+ Monitors tracking and shipping.

+ Performs escalated expediting when required to ensure on time delivery of material.

+ Mitigates risks for short term shortages with internal suppliers to ensure successful customer delivery.

Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications:

+ Bachelor's in Computer Science, Information Management, or other technical degree

+ Experience participating in the SIOP process for a large (Fortune 500) global industrial manufacturer

+ APICS Certification (CPIM, CSCP)

+ Experience with Kinaxis and/or Tableau

Basic Qualifications:

+ This position requires a Bachelor's degree in the appropriate discipline and 7 years of relevant experience or an Advanced degree in the appropriate discipline and 5 years of relevant experience. In the absence of a degree, 11 years of relevant experience is required.

+ Experience with SAP, either with the ERP system and/or Business Intelligence

+ Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

At Collins, the paths we pave together lead to limitless possibility. And the bonds we form - with our customers and with each other -- propel us all higher, again and again.

Some of our competitive benefits package includes:

+ Medical, dental, and vision insurance

+ Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employees

+ Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution

+ Tuition reimbursement

+ Life insurance and disability coverage

+ And more

Apply now and be part of the team that's redefining aerospace, every day.

Job Description:

WHY CONSTELLIS?

Are you ready for your next adventure? From down range to corporate positions around the world, we provide you with opportunities to grow your career while helping to make the world more secure.

Constellis provides opportunities across every major continent for individuals who want to build successful careers in a fast-paced, growing industry. Legal, moral and ethical business practices remain at the cornerstone of our culture and Constellis continues to be recognized for our emphasis on quality and compliance. This strong track-record of performance is supported by our deep relationships with our government and commercial customers. Our employees worldwide, the majority of whom are military or law enforcement veterans, have ambition and passion for creating a safer world. Join us to Secure Success!

RESPONSIBILITIES

Provides administrative and technical support in the development, implementation, and maintenance of the global company's benefits programs. Processes and administers the company's benefits programs including: medical, dental, vision, EAP, spending accounts, life and disability insurance programs and retirement plans. Ensures programs are current with regard to trends, practices and costs. Resolves employee issues with regard to benefits matters. Works on system between HRIS solution and insurance providers and carriers. Administers and communicates the company's benefits programs in regards to the plan options, policy features and other requirements.
Administers benefits programs including fulfillment of reporting requirements, monitoring and coordination of contracts and documents and coordination of general day-to-day administration of retirement and other health and welfare insurance plans.
Suggests and implements claims control techniques to ensure maximum effectiveness; coordinates and follows-up on all data preparation, record keeping, recording, reporting and filing of claims applicable to employees.
Audits data records to ensure accuracy of reports and invoices; arranges for timely flow of benefits payments.
Coordinates and administers the retirement 401k saving plan including annual audit and reporting requirements.
Consults with representatives of various insurance companies relative to interpretation of insurance contracts.
Recommends changes to benefits programs which are beneficial to employees; develops cost information applicable to changes.
Assists in the preparation and analysis of benefits surveys.
Performs required insurance-related reports.
Performs ongoing administration of the benefits portion of the global Human Resources Information System to support short- and long-range Human Resources goals.
Establishes data tables, structures, files, interface requirements and data integrity protocols for ongoing administration.
Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources or related field preferred.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in a benefits administration role.
Knowledge of benefit structures and applicable laws required.
Must be proficient in MS Office.
ADP Vantage experience preferred.
Ability to handle multiple priorities, work independently, with good organizational, communication and interpersonal skills.
Self-motivation, eagerness to grow professionally, and commitment to self-development.
ABOUT CONSTELLIS

Constellis protects critical priorities safely and efficiently around the world. Operating in 40 countries and based in the Washington D.C. area, our 22,000 Constellis employees bring unparalleled dedication and passion for creating a safer world and upholding the highest standards of compliance, quality and integrity. As a leading global provider of risk management, security, humanitarian, training and operational support services to government and commercial customers worldwide, Constellis' forward thinking solutions include a range of synergistic services, including background investigations, social intelligence tools, advanced training, logistics and life support, UAV and K9 services, and crisis response mitigation. At Constellis, our number one priority is to secure success for our customers. For more information, visit www.constellis.com

BENEFITS

Constellis offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefits package that reflect its commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace.
Medical, Vision & Dental Insurance
Paid Time-Off Program & Company Paid Holidays
401(k) Retirement Plan
Insurance: Basic Life & Supplemental Life
Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Personal Development & Learning Opportunities
On-the-job Training, Skills Development & Certifications
Employee Referral Program
Corporate Sponsored Events & Community Outreach
WORKING CONDITIONS

Work is typically based in a busy office environment and subject to frequent interruptions. Business work hours are Monday-Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, however some extended or weekend hours may be required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

May be required to lift and carry awkward items weighing up to 25 lbs. Requires intermittent standing, walking, sitting, squatting, stretching and bending throughout the workday.

#constellis

#LI-MS1

About:
With operations across every major continent and an annual revenue of $1.7 billion dollars, Constellis provides a wide array of opportunities for individuals looking to build successful careers in a fast-paced, growing industry. Legal, moral and ethical business practices remain at the cornerstone of our culture and Constellis continues to be recognized for our emphasis on quality and compliance. About Us:


Transportation Impact is a supply chain spend-management firm headquartered in Emerald Isle, N.C. Founded in 2008, the company offers a portfolio of supply chain services and technologies that help large companies reduce the costs associated with small package and freight shipping.

To date, Transportation Impact has been honored to have achieved multiple awards, to include the following:
2018 and 2019 Business North Carolina's #1 Best Employer in North Carolina
Inc. Magazine Best Workplaces Three Year Honoree
Inc. Magazine Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Companies in America Seven Year Honoree
North Carolina Top 100 Private Companies Three Year Honoree
NC Mid-Market Fast 40 Three Year Honoree
Eastern NC Better Business Bureau Torch Award for Marketplace Ethics Three Year Honoree
2018 CAI Ovation Award for Corporate Social Responsibility
Our amazing benefits package includes company insurance with a generous company contribution, PTO, employee birthdays off, paid holidays, 401(k) with company match and discretionary profit sharing, discretionary company bonus incentive, quarterly employee events, relaxed dress code, and a beautiful corporate office just steps from the beach just to name a few!

We are also very proud of our corporate culture and commitment to giving back to the community. To learn more about our company, go to https://transportationimpact.com/about-us/.

About the Position

The Senior Business Analyst is the most senior non-manager role in the Analytics Department. The Senior Business Analyst gathers and analyzes supply chain data for prospects and clients, improves accuracy and monitoring measurements, and assists with establishing effective analytical skill sets.

Responsibilities:

Collect and analyzing supply-chain data
Data mine and convey key insights & findings to team
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions; make recommendations to product team
Constantly seek ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
Support sales team in customer service
Plan and conduct training sessions for employees and sales
Maintain timely project commitments in a team atmosphere
Effectively communicate complex data patterns internally and externally
Assist Business Analysts in research methods and daily requests
Plan and monitor day-to-day resources to ensure departmental projects are progressed daily
Work with technology resources for departmental improvements
Coach team members on effective reporting and research methods
Monitor the revenue stream of flagship customers
Required/Preferred Education and Experience:

Bachelors Degree with a concentration in Business Management/Supply-Chain, Mathematics, Statistics, or other related degree, or equivalent combination of education and work experience
Prior experience in Analytics or related area is required
Detail-oriented with a strong disposition for accuracy
Strong critical thinking abilities as well as problem identification and solving skills
Prior experience within logistics environment preferred
Intermediate to advanced mathematical aptitude
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office with intermediate to advanced skills in Excel
High level of communication and presentation skills
Must be a self-starter and be able to work independently and autonomously
Ability to read and evaluate template legal agreements
How to Apply:


Candidates must submit resume with a cover letter detailing salary range requirements. Salary will be competitive and commensurate with experience. This position is located in Emerald Isle, so applicants must be local or be willing to relocate. This is a full-time, hourly position.

For more information, visit www.transportationimpact.com. Transportation Impact is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

COMMERCIAL ACCOUNT ANALYST

With 150 years experience, Scott Insurance is a leader in developing smart strategies and innovative programs customized to the needs of mid-market companies. We offer property & casualty, employee benefits, captive insurance and surety bonds solutions, as well as personal risk services. An employee-owned company, we are one of the largest independent agencies in the Southeast and have Captive Insurance operations in Grand Cayman and Vermont. For 21 years, we have earned the distinction of a Best Practices Agency and have consistently been ranked among the top 30 agencies in the country by Reagan & Associates. Scott has nine offices across North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee and Virginia. Our employee owners enjoy a strong, team-centric culture, excellent benefits and retirement programs. As an employee-owned company, our associates are more than employees; they are owners. This ownership creates a unique company culture and provides significant opportunities for our employee owners. We are driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and guided by out-of-the box thinking to deliver world-class service to our clients, primarily mid-market companies.

We currently have an opening for a Commercial Account Analyst in our Greensboro, NC office. If you enjoy working in a dynamic environment that rewards excellence and encourages entrepreneurial thinking, we like to hear from you!

PRINCIPAL OBJECTIVE OF THE POSITION

This position will provide assistance to the Producer in the handling and processing of commercial business.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

Four year college degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Property & Casualty license or the ability to obtain within 90 days is required.
CISR and/or CIC designations preferred.
Proficient in Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Superior organizational skills, ability to handle multiple tasks and effectively prioritize.
Excellent relationship building skills.
Strong math and analytical skills.
Exceptional time management skills.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Managing accounts in accordance with agency standards and workflows.
Binding and issuing policies, endorsements and audits.
Preparing Premium/Loss Analysis and Modification Analysis.
Determining appropriate marketing strategy for placement of business.
Processing new business/renewal applications, endorsements, certificates, cancellations, audits, check policies and preparing proposals.
Preparing binders, certificates, account summaries (to include premium and loss experience as well as coverage), endorsements, policies, lost policy releases and account balance status when requested. Ensuring items are delivered and/or mailed to client. Initiating correspondence with companies and clients. Maintaining expiration control log.
Reviewing and interpreting coverage for new and renewal policies per guidelines, endorsements and handling audits for accuracy in rating, typing coverage and signatures.
Responding to client questions regarding insurance coverage and exposures.
Establishing strong working relationships with clients, underwriters and carriers.
Researching for unique coverage situations and new coverages in the industry.
Performing other duties as assigned.

Job Description
A-Line Staffing is seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Systems Support Analyst located in Durham, NC

Please review the desired qualifications listed below and apply or contact Nate Namiotka with questions.

Responsibilities include:

· We are looking for a Systems Services and Support Analyst with strong customer and social skills to provide operational expertise on our Global Support team’s Level 2 practice. This team manages the stability and business continuity for a number of development frameworks, application components, infrastructure/hosting and enterprise-level services. Our support practice serves as a main contact for business partners and is comprised of “operationally-minded and technically oriented” engineers that provide assistance, triage and resolution of platform-related issues.

· You will be responsible for bringing together multiple technologies to deliver a cohesive platform-as-a-service product. You have a passion for technology tempered by a level-headed, ITIL-oriented approach to problem solving, and can take knowledge gained from triaging issues and foster it back into product design and support, making the end-to-end delivery more robust. An opportunity for growth and the potential to join in a full-time role is possible as your career advances.

· In this role, you will work on one of two morning/evening US-based shifts (which will include either a Saturday or Sunday). The successful candidate is adept at pinpointing root cause and is motivated to learn low level technical details to tackle issues both immediately via workarounds and permanently by identifying defects to be fixed. A sense of urgency, responsiveness and strong desire to meet partners’ expectations are all necessary attributes of a successful candidate for this role.

· Provide Level 1 and Level 2 Application support for production and non-production environments

· Investigate then resolve system generated alerts and user raised incidents

· Handle Service Requests raised by users

· Coordinate with different teams for incident resolution

· Call out issues to Engineering team if issues are beyond scope

Requirements:

· BS or higher education in Computer Science, Software Engineering or Information Technology degree program.

· 5+ years technical Systems Operations experience, preferably in an ITIL-oriented support capacity, Help Desk or similar role.

· Should have experience in UNIX

· Should have Apache Tomcat web server administration & support experience

· Experience using and supporting any of the monitoring and alerting tools like Splunk, Dynatrace, Hyperic HQ, SiteScope

· AWS Cloud migrations

· Scheduling tool working experience preferably Autosys

· Nice to have Informatica 9.x Admin experience

· Desirable Qualifications

· Good co-ordination skills

· Demonstrable experience in supporting production environments for application built on technology components Java, Tomcat, Oracle & Informatica

· Multi task and being able to prioritize effectively

· Should have good analytical skills

· Tackle and problem solve during Major or Minor incident call

This role is shift specific: This candidate will be working the Tuesday thru Saturday shift and they will swap back and forth between the morning and afternoon shift.

Sun-Thur 08:00-16:30 Morning Shift

Tues-Sat 08:00-16:30 Morning Shift

Sun-Thu 13:30-22:00 Afternoon Shift

Tues-Sat 13:30-22:00 Afternoon Shift

Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 Weekday Shift

I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Nate Namiotka – A-Line Staffing

CBM Analyst

Description

This position is accountable for providing lead technical direction and philosophy throughout SPC for the condition based maintenance technology(ies) in their area of expertise (examples of the recognized technical areas of expertise include: vibration, infrared, lubrication, motor diagnostics, etc.). The incumbent in this position provides strategic direction for equipment condition assessments and for making the resulting maintenance and operational recommendations. The incumbent in this position is recognized as a technical expert in more than one area of expertise and in the overall CBM process. The incumbent in this position will communicate closely with plants, leadership, operating review boards and corporate to share best practices, communicate issues, and to ensure consistency across Southern Power. The incumbent will be expected to support multiple plants and is responsible for knowledge transfer in the applicable CBM technologies and processes to plant personnel.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Experience in more than one CBM technology area (Required)
Working experience in gas and renewables (Preferred)
Knowledge gained by working at, or supporting, multiple plants on different systems and equipment.
Knowledge gained through internal, EPRI, and Vendor Training.
Ability to learn and stay up to date in technological advances.
Experience in integrating all pertinent information to make equipment maintenance and operational recommendations.
Experience in organizing and managing multiple projects at the same time. Proven ability to plan; ability to discern problems that need immediate attention versus those that allow more time to resolve.
Experience in directing others is desired.
Extensive knowledge or experience in plant maintenance and/or operations.
Self Starter that can work independently
Proven interpersonal and communication skills.
Experience in Maximo.
Frequent and extensive travel throughout the country supporting our wind, solar, and gas plants (75% or more)
Experience in drone technology (preferred)
JOB RESPONSIBILITIE
Support SRCM Maintenance Strategy and provide Operational Guidance in the expertise area.
Establish an ongoing relationship with key vendors; gather and analyze acceptance data on new/rebuilt equipment.
Communicate with Plant Management; Corporate Management; Peer Groups and Utility Experts concerning operation, maintenance repairs, replacement, modifications, improvements, and schedules.
Research to stay informed of current technologies.
Provide lead direction and support in setting the Southern Power equipment condition assessment/technology strategy. Support set-up and direction of new plants in relation to CBM strategy.
Ensure appropriate consistency in areas of expertise for all supported plants.
The incumbent may provide ownership and accountability.This includes managing and maintaining a budget for system expenditures, prioritizing expenses, providing expertise when problems arise, seeking improvements in the equipment operation, reviewing alternative equipment, and providing budgetary input.
Interpret CBM data, analyze results, and recommend course of action to the respective plants

At Collins Aerospace, we're dedicated to relentlessly tackle the toughest challenges in our industry - all to redefine aerospace.

Created in 2018 through the combination of two leading companies- Rockwell Collins and United Technologies Aerospace Systems - we're driving the industry forward through technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for global aerospace and defense. Every day we imagine ways to make the skies and the spaces we touch smarter, safer and more amazing than ever. Together we chart new journeys, reunite families, protect nations and save lives. And we do it all with some of the greatest talent this industry has to offer.

We are Collins Aerospace and we hope you join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE.

At Collins Aerospace, our Interiors team is focused on innovation, safety and cost efficiency. But we don't just get people from point A to point B. We're committed to making air travel more comfortable, connected and secure. As a leader in aviation interior products and services, we're helping airlines and original equipment manufacturers create a positive experience for their customers. With offices and manufacturing facilities in more than 12 states across the U.S. and more than 10 countries around the globe, we're changing the game of aircraft interiors. Are you ready to join our team?When you join our finance team, you're joining a team whose impact stretches across the world, and even beyond. Our team supports 70,000 employees across the U.S. and around the globe. As a United Technologies Corp. subsidiary, we operate with our own business reporting structure, financial dashboards and earnings metrics. This reporting relationship allows finance team members to implement innovative tools for the aerospace market in a stand-alone business environment. At Collins Aerospace, you'll be not only be advancing your career, you'll be leaving your mark on the future of advanced technologies.
*Role Overview**
The internal control review is an important part of the continuous improvement process and should be used to evaluate the effectiveness of the current control environment and compliance with regulations. Internal accounting controls, which are a subset of internal controls, include policies, procedures and practices required to provide reasonable assurance that the Corporation's assets are safeguarded; that transactions are executed in accordance with management's authorizations; and, that the financial records are reliable for the purpose of preparing financial statements. The Controls function works closely with the Site Finance leaders and the Interiors Controls function to:

+ Support the establishment and maintenance of an effective system of internal controls for their designated entities

+ Conduct an annual risk assessment

+ Review of internal controls and provide written representation of that review

+ Ensure documentation exists to adequately describe both the key financial controls and the testing of those controls
*Responsibilities**
The Sr. SOX Controls Analyst will be supporting the Winston Salem Aircraft Seating sites (Winston Seating New Equipment, Super First Class / Engineered Components, and the Seating Administration area). The role will be based out of Oak Plaza, Winston Salem building, but require travel to the support sites located in Winston Salem.

Specific job responsibilities include:

+ Lead and oversee appropriate risk assessments, and recommend mitigation plans

+ Lead and oversee the development and maintenance of internal controls to safeguard financial assets of the organization

+ Drive financial compliance efforts including Sarbanes Oxley Act (eSOX & Control Gap Assessments) and Accounting Controls Assessments (ACA reviews) including policy updates and testing.

+ Oversee internal control initiatives in order to achieve favorable financial and compliance audit results while leading and overseeing corrective action plans on control issues and performance improvement observations

+ Lead the development of / updating existing documentation for Winston Salem Aircraft Seating sites for standardized control documentation

+ Represent site with Interiors Controls department on special cross-entity teams and working groups

+ Support the deployment of new and current accounting policies, procedures and controls

+ Serve as key liaison on control and compliance issues with Interiors Controls, Regional Controls team, site Finance Management, and process owners for control related matters

+ Represent the Winston Salem Aircraft Seating sites with Interiors Controls department on special cross-entity teams and working groups

+ Lead and oversee the Winston Salem Aircraft Seating sites towards a Level 1 "mega site" controls framework

+ Individual must be able to manage tasks in an environment with changing priorities and be able to support the strategic directions of the team

+ Ad-hoc tasks as assigned

Preferred Qualifications:

+ Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting or related business disciplines

+ CPA, MBA will be considered a strong plus, however not required

+ 5+ years of responsible experience with a multinational company, internal audit, or government accounting with exposure to a manufacturing environment. Comparable UTC Finance and/or Accounting experience will also be considered. Experience with Big 4 / regional public accounting firms a plus

+ Travel requirements
+ Demonstrated leadership competencies with the ability to work effectively across all levels and functions within the business and can easily manage a co-source relationship with third party audit firm when applicable.

+ Demonstrate excellent teamwork, interpersonal, analytical, and problem solving skills.

+ Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to facilitate diverse teams toward operational efficiencies, controls, and policies

+ Strong analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills. Knowledge / experience in project management is a plus

+ Strong oral and written communication skills and proven presentation skills

+ Proactive and results / metrics driven

Basic Qualifications:

This position requires a Bachelor's degree in the appropriate discipline and 7 years of relevant experience or an Advanced degree in the appropriate discipline and 5 years of relevant experience. In the absence of a degree, 11 years of relevant experience is required.

The Opportunity


CO-OP Financial Services is bringing digital transformation to the credit union movement. We’re creating innovative technology solutions that help not-for-profit credit unions best serve their members and compete with the big banks. As a result, our world-class team is growing faster than ever! If you’re passionate about technology and want to be part of a purpose-driven organization, this is an exciting opportunity to provide real value and help shape the future of human-centered financial services.

We are seeking a talented Senior Data Quality Control Analyst to lead strategic projects, actively analyzes, improves and manages controls within the Data Management Organization (DMO) and plays the role of advisor to our Data Management teammates and business partners in matters of data controls, quality and remediation. This position advises on control standards, tools, and practices as well as design and implement best practices for the Data Quality & Governance team within the DMO. This role works closely with business and technical partners across CO-OP.

What You Can Look Forward to
Serves as a key point of contact for managing operational elements of Data Governance/Data Management Risk within the Data Management Organization.
Works directly with audit, risk, legal and executives to determine best practices and standards as it relates to data management and controls.
Provides thought leadership on industry trends and provides action plans for CO-OP regarding new ideas and challenges within data management.
Uses data quality trends and root cause analysis to provide recommendations and solutions to management (process/system improvement, gaps in controls, etc.).
Documents end-to-end processes within each functional data element, highlighting controls, potential weaknesses, metrics and procedural differences by lines of business.
Prepares documentation for the tracking, monitoring, and escalation of risk related issues to management related to control ineffectiveness.
Identifies and defines data system/reporting requirements as part of the control environment.
Serves as team liaison to technical partners including data analysts, report analysts, and technical writers in daily operations and data related projects, including data triage and remediation efforts.
Acts as Data Quality representative on a variety of initiatives.
Acts as an ambassador of Data Quality and Risk Management.
Participates in various research/remediation efforts as needed by department.
Acts as a champion for enterprise wide operational excellence program for data management including setting strategy, training, and communication.
Mentor other less tenured data control analysts.
Responsible for reporting risks that are identified to the appropriate team and/or management. Additionally, responsible for managing, monitoring and reporting risks within the scope of your work area, to include, but not limited to Information Security risks.
Actively supports our CO-OP culture and embraces our core values of Work as Partners, Communicate Openly and Honestly, Demonstrate Excellence and Champion Change in all interactions.
What You’ll Need to Succeed
Bachelor’s degree in related field plus minimum of five years’ experience in data quality, data management or risk management.
Proven history of successful risk and control management and/or Operations management and process improvement.
A detailed understanding of data from a regulatory, policy, and standards related perspective.
Ability to coach, mentor and lead others in data governance, risk and quality areas of improvement.
Ability to communicate at an Executive level including oral and written skills.
Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally across different areas including Operations, Technology, and Risk.
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Able to work independently and make sound, fact-based decisions.
Ability to convey information to all levels of the organization in a clear, focused, and concise manner.
Ability to clearly and effectively understand and teach complex concepts to a variety of audiences.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects and responsibilities.
Self-starter with strong work ethic, enthusiasm and ability to energize others.
Ability to implement new ideas and influence others.
MS Office including Visio.
Why Join CO-OP?


You will be part of an organization that focuses on a strong culture and embodies the credit union movement philosophy of People Helping People. CO-OP’s commitment to reflecting our own core values and purpose extends beyond how we serve our clients and the products that we deliver. We are committed to understanding, attracting and engaging a diverse workforce where every employee can live up to their value; ensuring that our employee base reflects the consumers we serve. The result of this effort is an inclusive environment where diverse talent thrives.

With more than 35 years of industry leadership, CO-OP Financial Services is the largest, most comprehensive credit union service organization in the nation. CO-OP serves as THE credit union technology engine, bringing payments solutions, engagement services and strategic counsel to help credit unions optimize member experiences to consistently provide seamless, personalized multi-channel offerings, while delivering secure, sophisticated fraud mitigation service.

CO-OP serves more than 3,000 client credit unions, with 60 million debit and credit cardholders, nearly 30,000 surcharge-free ATMs and more than 5,600 shared branches nationwide. Our vast technological ecosystem facilitates more than 6.5 billion transactions every year and equips credit unions of all sizes to deepen member engagement and prosper in the fast-paced world of fintech.

The Perks
Fun, challenging and, collaborative work environment with passionate colleagues that care deeply about the intersection of technology and human-centered financial services.
Great Work/Life Benefits – Paid Time Off (PTO), Maternity, Parental, Family Care, Adoption Leave Programs, Community Volunteer Time Off, and 10 Paid Holidays.
Health benefits – medical, dental, & vision plus wellness programs and gym reimbursements.
401K with generous company match.
Tuition reimbursement.

Some of the largest Commercial, Manufacturing and Life Sciences companies in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. Additionally, JAGGAER is the leading procure-to-pay provider in the Higher Education and Government sectors. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

The Financial Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Finance & Treasury, will be an integral part of the FP&A team and will be responsible to shape, drive, and deliver management reporting/dashboards, variance analysis, and forecasting and planning activities to support decision making, maximize access to capital, safeguard assets, and minimize risks.

Develop and prepare insightful and meaningful management reporting package with analysis for Senior Management including explanations of variances to forecast/plan, and prior periods and other ad hoc analysis as requested

Identify, quantify, and communicate risks and opportunities to plan
Assist with global cash management and forecasting, including daily cash positioning, determine funding needs, as well as forecast and monitor short and long term cash position

Collaborate with the team members to develop process improvements within the Finance Department, including but not limited to internal controls, report generation, process automation, improved use of technology, and documentation processes & procedures, etc.
Perform adhoc analysis and/or projects with respect to Finance and Treasury as assigned

Please review the following job description:
Complete and interpret a variety of complex financial, regulatory and/or business analyses of financial information, trend analyses, revenue performance and expense management. Coordinate with other departments in the preparation of such analyses. Bring inconsistencies and problems to the attention of management. Act as team lead for more junior staff, as assigned. Provide project financial analysis for initiatives with potential financial reporting impact.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Coordinate financial analysis and reporting process workflow within team. Provide leadership and mentoring for less experienced team members; review and approve work of other team members. Ensure that changes to reporting process workflow and/or source data are documented and communicated to downstream reporting groups.
Respond to inquiries and provide thorough analysis of financial information for assigned area of responsibility. Confer with Accounting Policy or Regulatory Reporting on requests related to external audits or regulatory examinations.
Compile and submit timely and accurate reports related to complex aspects of the Bank’s financial performance or strategy. These may include: pro-forma projections for transaction, products, market segmentation strategies or acquisitions; income/expense or cash flow forecasts; regulatory interpretations, variance analyses and explanations for financial statement line items; or summaries, charts and graphs of data to highlight key results. Ensure that source data is reliable and complete and documentation is maintained to support data integrity initiatives. Interpret and summarize results and trends for Executive Management. Build/maintain specialized product/technical expertise for assigned area.
Monitor financial performance to detect unusual or significant transactions or trend development. Conduct or assist in root-cause analysis, as assigned.
Become familiar with products, fees and fee codes, regulatory reporting requirements, business cycles, origination channels and accounting flow for assigned area of responsibility.
Understand cost allocation methods for assigned area of responsibility.
Maintain financial information via the use of simple spreadsheets to more complex databases. Assist in the development and testing of economic models. Maintain necessary documentation of source data, ensuring adequate support of data integrity.
Review and update policies and procedures for compliance with governmental regulations and corporate policies and standards. Coordinate development of new accounting processes and procedures, as needed.
Analyze business and accounting processes for control and efficiency improvements.
Maintain a working knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles; build expertise related to assigned area of responsibility.
Maintain a working knowledge of regulatory reporting requirements; build expertise related to area of responsibility.
Provide line of business (LOB) personnel with the monthly performance review package by preparing and providing explanation of changes and identification of trends for use in discussions with the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and other members of Executive Management.
Review and interpret more complex contracts or agreements for proper accounting treatment, as required.
Coordinate internal or external audits and examinations (responses to External and Regulatory requests are to be made in collaboration with Accounting Policy).

Required Skills and Competencies:
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, or equivalent education and related training
Eight years of relevant accounting experience that includes complex financial analysis

3. Lease accounting experience preferred

Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills
Demonstrated sound and logical decision-making abilities
Demonstrated leadership ability and skills
Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications, such as Microsoft Office software products
Ability to travel, occasionally overnight

Are you searching for an opportunity to take your career to the next level with a growing global company? Join XPO Logistics, a company named among the most admired in the world by Fortune magazine and one of America’s best employers by Forbes. As the Senior Analyst, Financial Analysis, you will support the continued financial health of the organization by providing critical analyses to identify cost-saving opportunities and streamline processes. You’ll oversee operating overhead expense (leases, rentals, equipment repairs and maintenance, etc.), while providing insight into the market, products/services, operational execution and other key drivers within the department. You’ll partner with various team members around the world to ensure our finance team is able to provide support to meet the growing needs of the business. Become a part of our dynamic team, and we'll help you develop to a level that will exceed your expectations.

Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.

What you’ll do on a typical day:
Perform operating expense analysis each month and provide reports to site leadership to evaluate appropriateness of monthly expense; adjust as necessary
Address questions from the leadership team and site-level management and resolve any uncertainties regarding expense
Assist with internal and external audit requests and perform any SOX-related controls
Ensure all operating expense is recorded in a timely manner through coordination with shared services (Accounts Payable, etc.)
Apply an analytical approach to support strategic decisions, new product/system introductions and other data-driven analysis
Work independently across functions, including local/corporate HR, the corporate Contingent Labor team, Operations, etc., to manage complex projects and serve as the subject matter expert
Focus on automation and the creation of self-help reporting for nonfinance users, including expense analysis, budgeting and forecasting for temporary labor expenses/hours
Understand and transition transaction tasks and analysis to the team in Mumbai, to build a 24-hour finance team to meet the growing needs of our global business; serve as the main point of contact for questions
What you need to succeed at XPO:

At a minimum, you’ll need:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or a related field
4 years of experience in audit, accounting or Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), including financial analysis in a large corporate environment
Experience with Microsoft Office (Word and PowerPoint); advanced Excel skills
It’d be great if you also have:
Master’s degree in Finance/Accounting or Business Administration
MBA, CPA, CMA, CFA or applicable professional designation
5 years of experience in audit, accounting or FP&A, including financial analysis in a large corporate environment
Experience with Lean/Six Sigma management concepts and/or certifications
Availability to work a flexible schedule, including planned and unplanned overtime, which may include weekends
Experience with large databases, including the ability to utilize data from various BI systems
Ability to multitask and work under pressure in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with tight deadlines
Excellent time management, organizational and interpersonal skills
Be part of something big.

XPO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make XPO a great place to work.

Job Description
Company Profile:
A multinational manufacturing organization with years of growth and success and leadership within its end-markets
Strong finance organization which values the entrepreneurial spirit, personal drive and initiative, and a development of its team members to be prepare for internal growth opportunities
Finance team actively responds to the evolving needs of the Company, which can vary from analysis of monthly financial results to M&A deal support or operational support via analysis

The Role You Will Play:

1-2 years of related Finance experience

Ability to follow-up independently and critically think through analyses
Ability to summarize and present information to Senior Management
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work with multiple levels within the organization
Experience in a manufacturing environment, preferred but not required

As a people-centric organization, we attribute the success of our Distribution Centers to the individuals who come to work each day. We foster a diverse supply chain team where your work will meaningfully impact the wellbeing and productivity of our entire squad. We believe that problems are best solved when backgrounds are mixed, perspectives are shifted, and boundaries are pushed. So—wherever you’re from—come join our crew!
The Global Supply Chain Team is responsible for the operations and strategic direction of transportation and distribution of merchandise through J.Crew’s multi-channel supply chain. The International Logistics Analyst will be responsible for planning, analyzing, and optimizing imported cargo from overseas; from booking to delivery to the US deconsolidation points and International 3PL warehouses. Partnering with Planning, DC Operations, Inventory Management, PO Fulfillment, Domestic Transportation team, Merchandise Manager’s and Assistants, and other internal groups will be required. This role works externally with Global Logistics Provider, ocean carriers, airfreight forwarders, Customs broker, draymen, FTL and LTL truckers, and 3rd-party warehouses. This Analyst will track-and-trace purchase order and shipments, reconciliation, and exception reporting related to the movement of our goods throughout the International portions supply chain.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Proactive exception management of all import activities to ensure on-time delivery
Coordinate with overseas vendors to manage import activities in order to meet service level expectations.
Work with vendors to identify and eliminate logistics obstacles to ensure safe and timely shipping of products.
Effectively monitor and track non-compliances, initiate Corrective Action Plan to resolve Root Cause
Maintain good relationship with vendors and service providers to improve overall business performance
Establish and define vendor routing guide, logistics procedures, carrier’s service level agreement and SOPs, review routinely to ensure they are continuously maintained and updated
Develop standard operating procedures and scheduling/shipping practices for efficiently carrying out logistics activities
Ensure that logistics system is operated in accordance with local, state and federal customs laws.
Ensure that logistics activities are in compliance with United States Customs and Border Protection regulations.
Develop Metrics and KPIs to measure vendors, carriers and 3PL’s performance
Create and maintain detailed financial reporting on all import activities including order management, logistics and shipping.
Inform cost changes, shipment issues, supply concerns to respective personnel and team in timely manner
Identify opportunities to streamline and standardize processes
Identify opportunities for cost reduction, material flow improvement, and business development
Research, analyze, develop and manage import programs, including reporting and presenting results, devising recommendations for change in processes and procedures.
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree required (or equivalent work experience)
3+ years of relevant industry experience with focus on analytics and logistics
Supply chain and retail, especially fashion/soft lines, experience a plus
Microsoft Office skills required with strong Excel and/or Access skills preferred
Skills & Abilities
Self-starter with good judgment and can proactively manage up where appropriate
Accountable for results, strives to meet and exceed expectations
Time management/prioritization and follow-up skills
Highly organized, detail and process oriented
Strong critical and analytical thinking
Strong written, verbal and presentation skills
Effective communication across all functions and levels
Visual analytics (Tableau, Qlik, etc.)

An office position which requires minimum lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, reaching, grasping, bending, walking, climbing stairs, standing and stooping
Sit in a chair at a desk most of the time
Ability to type and read computer screen
Working Conditions
Office environment within a Distribution Center / Warehouse environment

You will interface with cross-functional peers and managers and have an opportunity to contribute across various business challenges.

The Financial Analyst’s role has responsibility for a wide range of financial support and analysis tasks. Provide Business Partnership, Decision Support and Fiduciary guidance
Prepare and drive operational and financial metrics in support of key decision making

Gather, analyze, prepare and summarize recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts

Forecasting
Budgeting
Variance analysis
Cost analysis
Product pricing
Management Reporting
Organization and Cost Center Structure
Revenue and Operational Policy review
SOX and Audit testing
Participate in Close Cycle – prepare and post JEs for areas of responsibility
Integrate financial processes and operations of the business

Ability to work in a project based environment.

Strong working knowledge of Oracle G/L Applications.

Responsibility:
The tasks this individual is responsible for are often non-routine and unstructured, requiring creative solutions.

Are you looking for an opportunity to turn your ambition and your people skills into a rewarding career with an industry leader? Join our team at American Tire Distributors! As the nation's premier tire distributor, ATD’s coast-to-coast distribution network provides approximately 80,000 customers across the U.S. and Canada with rapid and frequent delivery of high quality tires, custom wheels and shop supplies.

Position Description:

Our Margin Analyst team is a critical piece of the Revenue Management operations. You will partner with a Regional Margin Manager to support two ATD regions. Together, in partnership with the Field Sales organization, you will help those regions achieve their revenue and margin targets. You will look at products, brands and customers to determine what is going right and wrong. Analyze pricing requests and decisions to determine the financial impact. Track the performance of past decisions so we can learn from them. Some of the work will be ‘in the weeds’ looking at a SKU (item) for one customer to understand how the pricing got set or how our price compares to a competitor. Other assignments will be broader in scope. You will be called upon to work on many margin growth special projects. We need you to be able to build models and employ advanced analytic techniques (e.g., elasticities, regression and other deep-dive analysis).

We want this role to be an analytical talent pipeline into ATD. There are places within Revenue Management that you can grow but there are also other teams across the company that can use your skills. We will help you develop and contribute in your current role while preparing you for whatever lies ahead for you at ATD.

Primary Responsibilities:
Own essential elements of pricing analytics. Lead the collection of pricing data, create frameworks for pricing decisions, and identify opportunities to optimize sales.
Apply advanced statistical and analytic techniques to large amounts of data with the goal of driving business decisions and providing the primary input in evolving the company’s pricing strategies.
Develop detailed pricing and demand models (incl. cannibalization), elasticity analyses, and measure the effectiveness of pricing strategy shifts.
Suggest and implement enhancements to existing pricing processes and systems
Models the impact of pricing strategy revisions by conducting what-if analysis on pricing actions. Shares insights and develops the analytics and RevMan-related skills of the broader organization.
Act as the subject matter expert on complex pricing analyses and executive requests, from data acquisition using SQL to formulation of pricing strategy and presentation to executive audiences
Key Partners (Positions):
Revenue management team members
Advanced Analytics COE
Category management
Field Sales leadership
Experience(s) that Best Prepares You:
Education: Degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Methods, Finance, Business, related fields, or equivalent years’ experience. Advanced degree preferred: MS in Business Analytics / Data Science, MBA with a specialization in Analytics or Revenue Management.
Experience: Pricing or Revenue Management experience is desirable but not required; likely candidate will have a ~5 year experience in a highly analytical and technical role.
Key Competencies:
Productive – former managers frequently marveled at the volume of high quality work you could produce
Advanced analytics expertise
Ability to effectively and efficiently convey complex data/findings
Strong business acumen and judgement
Demonstrate organizational empathy while delivering results. You will be coming in from the outside. Build relationships, demonstrate your value and earn respect.
Ability to tackle a project in a new area by employing problem structuring, analytics and problem solving approach
Project management
Team/people management
Expert level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel, intermediate or higher PowerPoint skills
Strong data manipulation, modeling and data visualization skillsets using Excel, R, SQL and Tableau
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Excellent leadership capabilities and communication and documentation skills
Proactive and works effectively under tight timelines
Be accountable
Build a challenging and rewarding career with us!

Job Title: Technical System Analyst
Location: Charlotte, NC

Job Description:

The Technical Analyst is primarily responsible for interpreting the functional requirements of a project into high/mid-level technical designs that will be consumed by the development teams. A major focus of the Technical Analyst is working with vendors and company developers to create technical specifications for system integrations at the web service level. The Technical Analyst participates in projects from the discovery phase throughout development and testing phases of the project.

Primary responsibilities and deliverables:
Create mid-level technical designs (ex: System Integration Diagrams, System Process Flows, Sequence Diagrams, web service level Data Maps)
Lead technical impact analysis for change requests, new applications, and enhancements
Facilitate JAD sessions to define vendor system integrations, and facilitate clear understanding between vendor and company development teams
Work with Architecture, Security, Business, and other Technology groups as needed to define solutions
Ensure consistent standards, processes, quality, and efficiency in Technical Analyst deliverables.
Ensure right level of detail and rigor in Technical Analyst deliverables
Ensure Technical Analyst deliverables conform to all compliance and security policies and procedures.
Ensure all necessary participants are included in work stream
Responsible for ensuring appropriate approvals, version control, and publication of Technical Analyst design deliverables
Review and provide input to Systems Requirements Document (SRS) to ensure clear, consistent, comprehensive and feasible
Review and provide input to Detailed Functional Requirements for screen functionality (UI Specs) to ensure clear, consistent, comprehensive and feasible
Review and provide input to Architectural Design Document (ADD)
Review and provide input to Test Plans
Support Functional Testing
Support development teams in understanding requirements and Technical Analyst design deliverables
Provide input to project planning, estimates and schedules
Identify dependencies, risks/issues, mitigation plans, and escalate as needed.
Proactive, regular communications with business and technology partners to keep informed of status, changes, or issues
Ensure Technical Analyst deliverables are completed according to defined schedules and requirements
Manage and mentor other Technical Analysts
The primary constituents for the Technical Analyst role are the company development teams, architecture and the Systems Analysts.

Qualifications:
Experience with web services and middleware integrations
Experience with SOA, SOAP, JSON, REST, XML
Experience creating high level designs, low level designs, process flows
Experience creating system integration diagrams
Experience creating sequence diagrams, web service level data mapping
Proficient at facilitating JAD sessions
Experience as Systems Analyst
Experience with Online Banking, Login Authentication, RSA is desired
Programming background is beneficial
Ability to explain technical issues and present proposed solutions clearly in both technical and non-technical terms
Experience with large scale development projects, including data migrations and 3rd party vendor integrations
Experience working with onshore/offshore staffing model
Flexible and comfortable in a fast-changing environment
Able to work independently in a leadership role to facilitate solutions from a variety of highly competent opinions
Highly organized and detail oriented, Excellent communication skills
Effective at managing team with many tasks and stakeholders, setting priorities, creating schedules, managing expectations and delivering on schedule.
Ability to create and implement processes to facilitate quality technical analyst deliverables

The Genesys Cloud Security & Compliance organization ensures the security and compliance of Genesys Cloud from initial design to Production by way of security policy, processes, and procedure standards including the definition, assessment/audit and certification, operation and continuous monitoring of cloud-based security infrastructure. This is a very dynamic high growth environment and requires great flexibility.

Successful candidates for this role must be very comfortable with evaluating, documenting, and creating remediation plans for multiple compliance requirements in a fast-paced organization.

Candidates will be expected to obtain an understanding of our Cloud SaaS technical environment and determine how our leading edge technologies and controls provide satisfaction, compensation, or mitigation for sometimes outdated compliance standard language. This will also involve translating the requirements into language Developers, DevOps, and Leadership can apply to our environments Candidates will be expected to participate in new compliance efforts, as well as maintain existing compliance obligations. A background in owning, and managing the day-to-day compliance operations, including auditing, risk assessment policy/procedure review, and maintaining status of controls is required.

The individual in this role is also expected to participate in and support various department activities which may include: the development and maintenance of information security policies, procedures, and standards; training, and awareness activities; review and respond to security requirements and inquiries regarding existing or proposed solutions.

Major Responsibilities/Activities:
Conduct and lead comprehensive assessments of information security and privacy policies and procedures against applicable regulations, laws, policies and standards. Assessments may include GAP analysis, recommendations and prioritize enhancements to the security and privacy infrastructure to remove or mitigate risk.
Perform Compliance Risk Assessments for vendors, products, services or processes
Work with Information Security, Engineering and Operations teams to define and document security standards and controls required to meet various regulatory and compliance guidelines and directives.
Evaluate and audit security control systems to address requirements.
Identify control deficiencies and make appropriate recommendations.
Provide guidance to Development & Operations on the appropriate selection, design, implementation, and configuration of security controls.
Provide expert guidance on implementation and operation of Change Management.
Revise and maintain a library of information security and privacy policies, standards and guidelines covering all areas within the environment.
Engage with Infrastructure and/or Architect Teams to assess the security risk of proposed projects and system/application modifications.
Collaborate with management, the legal department, facilities staff, and applicable law enforcement agencies to manage and remediate security vulnerabilities and incidents.
Understand & comply with all applicable security and privacy laws globally.
Adhere to Genesys’ Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.
Required Qualifications:
Experience in compliance auditing in Public Cloud environments (Amazon Web Services preferred).
A firm grasp of technical security in the Amazon AWS environment.
Experience auditing domestic and international information security standards (e.g., ISO 27001/27002, SSAE18/ ISAE 3402, PCI DSS, HIPAA, HITRUST, FEDRAMP, etc.) preferred.
Strong knowledge of security technologies and architecture, including encryption, cloud network security design, security group configuration, intrusion detection, data loss prevention and application security.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Good balance of technical competence and people skills.
